comment: Seger's grading on exams was so slow to the point where we did not receive grades from our third midterm prior to taking the final, leaving us guessing at our grades before taking this exam. He created a hostile environment for the asking and answering of questions. He is passionate about the material, but teaches the class ineffectively.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Msrk Seger is a real gem. He makes lectures fun and explains in a way that makes concepts easy. I loved taking thermo with him, although he did take a long time to return our exams. He always helped students whenever he could and it seemed like he was passionate in teaching. I wish all professors could be more like him.

Dr. Seger is a great professor for Intro to Chemical Thermodynamics. He is lecture centered, and has fun demos. He is a tough grader but he is very accessible for any questions you may have. Great Guy!

I wouldn't be surprised if Dr. Seger was a wizard in a past life. A really interesting character. His lectures can be fun, but will sometimes go off on tangents, which don't get me wrong, is still interesting. Love the in class experiments/demonstrations too. You can catch him in the classroom, office hours, or outside smoking a dart.
This man knows everything.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Seger is a bit disorganized but is very knowledgeable. He does a good job of doing exam reviews and explaining concepts that you are confused about. His exams can be a mixed bag of easy and "What even was that exam?" so it can be hard to predict how you will do, but if you go to class/do all the homework you will be fine in any of his classes.
Can tend to drift away from the point which I struggled with. However, his demos were helpful and he had plenty of review sessions. Just sometimes difficult to focus during the lectures.

Unfocused or unclear at times, but overall solid. Explicitly states what's necessary to know for exams and final and gives you resources to succeed. Probably need to grab a textbook to supplement lectures, though, as he doesnt always explain things terrifically. Has neat in-class demos of concepts and experiments that are interesting

Fantastic professor. His lectures can be a bit dull and scattered, but he's very invested in ensuring that his students have the ability to succeed. He holds about 3 review sessions before each exam, which is extremely helpful, and is great at answering questions. Very student oriented. The textbook was not required, but I found it helpful.

Seger is a really nice guy and is passionate about what he is teaching. I'm glad I took him. One piece of advice is don't buy a textbook unless you really think it will help. We don't use them at all in class

Seger is a really fun teacher that often spices up lecture with fun little demos. I did not find the tests hard but is common to struggle if you didn't do well in AP chem or Chem 1. Showing up to supplemental review sessions is definitely worth while if you don't understand the material. Don't get the fancy new textbook, and old chem book works.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: mark loves chemistry and he is great to learn from because he is so excited about his subject as long as you show up you can pass but some participation is necessary

Professor Seger is one of those professors that I feel sorry for those who never had a class with him. If you go to his office hours, he is amazing at strategizing with you for the exams and can explain difficult concepts in a concise and understandable way. I highly recommend him.
Seger is a very smart man but is a terrible teacher. Loses focus very easy and never finishes the lecture on time. Would not recommend taking his class.

Mark is an amazing guy who genuinely cares about every single one of his students. He can be incredibly scatter brained and pretty slow at grading, but his quality of teaching completely makes up for it. You HAVE to attend class, he doesn't post any lectures, ever. Also his exams can be very difficult. 10/10 would recommend taking his class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very passionate about thermo. It's hard not to like it at least a little when he's teaching it.
Dr Seger loves his subject, and if you reach out is always willing to help
He's a great professor. Very animated and you can tell he loves teaching chemistry topics.
GREAT Professor

Mark Seger is absolutely hilarious! His lectures are awesome. Lots of demonstrations. He knows his stuff and is good at explaining things in a way that you will remember. However, tests are really difficult so make sure you write down every single thing he puts on the board in lecture.
How could you not want Seger?
Mark is a mad scientist! he does weekly trivia and demos. His class is very interesting

I had him for chem 1 and thermo. Hands down, one of my favorite professors at Mine! I disagree with those who say his tests are hard. They are reasonable - if you study his lecture notes, you will do just fine. His lectures are interesting, and overall he is a sweet guy (and reminds me of Dumbledore)

The professor tests on what he discusses in lecture, so do not miss or have a friend who takes notes well, if you must miss.  Your notes will be key in passing the exams.  The homework is not bad and provides good samples for the type of questions you will see on the exams.   The professor was very slow to post grades, but go see him if needed.
Do the practice sets and go to the optional recitations, and everything should go fine. He basically grades the in class participation clicker quizzes as pass or fail, so show up.
His lectures are very interesting but the tests are quite tough

Seger is a crazy and amazing professor who just wants his students to learn and succeed. His tests are very difficult, studying is necessary. Attend his lectures because all of the test is based of those which aren't posted. Loved him so much.

Seger posted the final studying materials hours before exam 1 and the day before the final. He never followed thru on anything he said. I still have no clue what I got on the final. We never knew when we'd have homework. His testsassigned problems were full of errors. Not worth the money.
Great class. I hated chemistry before had Mark for a teacher.
Wow! Best Chemistry teacher I have had! Attend lectures and studying lecture notes would get you an A.

If you are unclear about anything, go to his office hours and you will leave knowing almost too much. He teaches in a simple manner, and covers most topics thoroughly. With his help I was able to turn two 64% test grades into a B in the class.

He is the best professor I've had so far ! I thought I couldn't understand Chem, but Dr. Seger changed my mind. His recitations and office hours are the most helpful tool. He explains well enough and his practice sets really prepares you for the exams. I highly recommend him !

Seger is an awesome teacher who really makes you interested in class and chemistry. He isn't the easiest professor at Mines so if your looking for the easy A you may want to look elsewhere but his class was much more exciting than the other professors.

He makes the class interesting with demos and jokes in class but he takes a really long time to get grades in. He also has had many technical issues and it was quite irritating that we had to buy the online mastering chem service when we never used it....

Seger is so enthusiastic about his job and his students. If you feel the need to have an organized class structure then his class might frustrate you, but if you're just here for the learning then he is a great professor. He is extremely knowledgeable, to a level far beyond Chem 1 and 2, so go talk to him if you're interested in the subject matter.

Lots of demos and trivia about random facts. He either goes very quickly or very slow, not much in between. He knows what he's talking about and is a pretty good teacher. The demos keep class interesting too, especially with lots of explosions!
Seger did a good job at keeping lectures engaging and presented all material that would be on the test. However he is very unmotivated and has an excuse for everything.

You will either like him or hate him.  I liked him.  Glad I had him for Chem I and II. I found his class very interesting and straightforward.  If you go to class and take notes on whatever he writes down on the board, you will do just fine. He literally gives you everything you need to know. Trivia and demos were fun too.
Okay

He is lazy and does not care about the students. He cancels recitations all the time and still hasn't given us our exam 1 score.... the semester is almost over. He also tries to trick you on the tests.

Seger is the best chemistry teacher I've ever had. He is very good at explaining  complicated material that didn't make sense in high school. However, when it comes to getting grades posted promptly, he needs some work.

Chem I and II with him. Good teacher in my opinion - had no trouble getting A+ in both. He's very into the subject and really tries hard to pass all relevant info to the students. Only problem is he's not real clear - so that'll be good prep for the rest of college ;) He's helpful if you ask, but he often has too many lectures taking up his time.

Dr. Seger is the most unorganized teacher you will ever have. He posted our final studying materials less than 24 hours before the final, canceled recitation before the final and postponed office hours till an hour an a half before out final. How's that for a professor?
Terrible teacher. Lazy and unmotivated.  Does not know the material and does not get grading completed. Cancels almost every scheduled office hours or help sessions.  Terrible in every way.
Mark Seger is the absolute worst Prof I have had at Mines. Isn't held accountable for his grading timeline. Took three weeks to get 2nd exam handed back.

Teaches directly from the text, if you miss lecture just read the section covered. Explains conceptual material very well but never does an in class example. The exams are difficult & require review of all of the material b/c the practice test & homework do not help. Take this teacher if you are interested in the topic, otherwise pick someone else

His class made me hate chemistry and I thought that would never happen because I loved chemistry. His tests are an absolute, incomprehensible nightmare!  Even if you study, there is a great chance that you will fail miserably. He makes the class much more difficult and harder to understand than it should be. I learned more in high school chemistry.

He is a great professor, and his office hours are extremely useful. He might seem intimidating at first but he is a really nice guy. He really cares about your success, and he is very passionate about chemistry. It is totally possible to do well on his exams if you study enough.
He is the second worst professor at the school. Avoid him at all costs. His tests are ridiculous, and he made me hate chemistry with a burning passion.
Weird guy. His lectures are alright, but the tests are incomprehensible. Read all of the questions at least twice before you answer them.

He's a cool prof, his tests are just annoying because he tries to be so tricky. I changed from ChemE to Mining Engineering just because I felt like Seger didn't give me a good enough base to continue in Chem

Just so you know, I'm not bad at chemistry, I just hate it, if I liked it, maybe my opinion of Seger would be different.  I personally hate his teaching style, he wastes a lot of time doing announcements, trivia, and lots of redundant examples.  The math involved in CHGN121 & 122 is pathetically simple, and the tests are easy, just terribly worded.
Tough class, but one of the most helpful professors I've ever had. The amount of effort he put into helping students outside of lecture was admirable.
loved
Awesome proff!
Class is fun and the stuff is taught :)
His tests are killer, but he is really helpful if you have a question.  His optional recitations ate useful, so use them

I did the homework and attended lecture and recitation and I had no problem getting a 100% on the lecture portion. If you give him a chance to explain the material he's a quite brilliant instructor. In lab, redo the experiments and you should be able to get an A. I do, however question the many "instructor illnesses" that occurred this semester.
He is a decent teacher, but his tests are wack! Even if you study, he will wreck you with trick questions.

he is a very goofy teacher, he always has something interesting to talk about and he usually relates it to chemistry. his tests are very hard, but if you do the practice quizes and homeworks you will be OK
Fucking awesome at teaching

Seger is a fairly clear teacher. He likes to smoke a TON! He is a very slow grader but he curves every test and the class each by around 4% (unless you have a D) He offers a ton of recitations that are helpful, and his sense of humor is pleasant. He won't get the tests back quickly but makes up for it with helpful assistance and generous curving.
Too much "trivia"
Amazing teacher!

He is very passionate about the subject and extremely willing to help you understand the material. I would highly recommend attending the optional recitations whenever possible, as well as his office hours. He is a little random at times but is very good at explaining things. His occassional demos are fun too!!!

He was a decent professor, definitely enthusiastic about chemistry, however he can be very unreliable at times.  Also, the tests should be a breeze for anybody who has taken A.P. chemistry. His lectures are very clear, but sometimes he waters down the material too much.

Professor Seger is an incredible professor. His passion for Chemistry is apparent at all times. His lectures are well organized, his demos are fun, and his practice quizzes are great for exam preparation. He is always willing to go the extra mile in order to make certain that students understand the material. I strongly recommend professor Seger.
He is pretty good but his tests are hard
Great teacher, gives great notes and is intersting

Loves chemistry, particularly if it makes loud noises, bright flashes, or preferably both. Demos reflect this when they appear. The class has "optional" recitations: GO TO THEM AT LEAST WEEKLY (or at very least go to office hours); he is likely to try out future test questions on you. Great teacher, lots of energy.
He is awesome
He's a really interesting professor, and he does lots of demos.
Most random chem class I have ever taken- terrible preparation for tests and talks in a circle... notes are relatively hard to take in comparison to similar classes because of the lecture style.
Very interesting.  For once, class is worth going to!  If he doesn't cover a lot of material in class, he welcomes you to office hours at all times.
With so many demos and trivia sessions there was little time to learn what was on the test! He wasn't re hired. Several friends at CSU said he teaches there now...

The demos were really fun, but that was about it. Very random, unclear on most points, as he would jump around and give out his "trivia". Did not like him at all. Reading the book was more helpful than going to class
He is really fun and spastic. Lots of demo's and lots of fun. He is also really helpful if you don't understand something.
Can explain things is an understandable way, such as through examples.
Since it was his first semester teaching p.chem, I didn't expect it to be great, and his teaching skills were not great.  I think he might become better if allowed to teach this course more often.
He does tell a lot of stories and leads you off on a tangent sometimes.  However, very knowledgable and helpful.
I really enjoyed his class, he has a sense of humor and makes chemistry easy to understand.  I would definately recommend!
No Comments
No Comments

Fantastic Prof. Made Chemistry, something I'm not terribly interested in, very interesting. His stories are fantastic and his love of his profession is clear. If you don't like Seger, the problem is probably on your end, not his.

Awesome teacher, especially for people not interested in chemistry. His crazy stories will keep anyone paying attention and he's an overall cooky guy. His Seger quotes include," Guinea pigs get scurvy too!".
awesome, funny and easy understanding
tells too many stories in class
Professor cares a lot about his students. Is enthusiastic about chemistry and likes to share that with students. Learned a lot of neat chemistry trivia from him.
No Comments
Taught Chemistry 2 Spring 04.  Better than Pavelich.  Exams very well correlated to classroom and practice problems.
didn't really know what he was doing in lab. was never around.
Ok lecturer, but does not seem to correlate lectures to tests well

Dr. Shorey was an amazing professor. The class is lecture heavy with minimal homework. He takes attendance but uses it as a grade booster. The tests were multiple choice and based on the note objectives. The lab field trips were quite interesting and enjoyable. Dr. Shorey is very passionate and well knowledgeable. Extra credit is offered many times
His grading scheme is so confusing to me, I literally have no clue how it works, but I got an A in the class so it all worked out. He is super nice and gives awesome lectures.

Shorey is one of the best professors on campus, you'll be glad to have him for at least GEGN 101. While the class itself is formatted oddly, with no real HW's and quiz style 53 question exams, Shorey does an amazing job making these parts of the class since he clearly notes what will be on the Exams with "objectives". Be sure to do the extra credit
Amazing professor! Great lectures, very funny and passionate. Coursework is easy and effective. Very clear objectives. Highly recommend.
Great sense of humor and very passionate about his subject matter

Incredibly knowledgeable and entertaining. Lab attendance is mandatory. Learning objectives from lectures constitute the exams and quizzes. The "political" comments others mentioned are opinion polls on evolution, climate change, etc. IMO he's respectful of different viewpoints but has a dry/sarcastic humor that people may take offense to.

He is knowledgeable and really expects you to think. While many others have posted how he "talks down to you", I believe that he wants you to question things but wants to guide you to approach it in a logical way.

Honestly amazing!

If you're passionate about geology, Shorey is the professor to take. He's knowledgeable and progressive, especially about the climate crisis and evolution, and is very entertaining during lecture and field trips. A bit intimidating in person, but wants the best possible course he can provide.

Dr. Shorey has the least clear grading policy I have ever seen in a class. He adds his personal political opinions in class and denounces Christianity every chance he gets. He has an attitude as if he could never be wrong and he is extremely unhelpful when asked questions. He does not seem to care at all about his students.

Shorey is a brilliant guy who really knows his stuff, but he does not communicate well, including to his TAs. He inserts personal political viewpoints in class and belittles students who challenge him. He has an unclear and abnormal grading scheme with a holier-than-thou attitude when confronted about it. He does not make useful information clear.

Super cool guy. Very friendly and very very passionate about what he is teaching. He does go off on tangents that have little to nothing to do with the actual required material, but besides that he is great. Also, there's an opportunity for extra credit on all the labs and the final is optional. Tests are also pretty easy,

Although you may learn a lot in his class, he isn't very nice to students. On multiple occasions he was very passive aggressive towards me when I was asking for help. He once told me, "If you knew how to do math, you could easily calculate your grade." His grading policy was never clearly in the syllabus. Take any other prof that teaches this class

Ignore all the negative reviews of Shorey, it looks like almost all of them were during the online span of covid. Shorey is very engaging in his lectures and the tests are pretty easy since he tells you exactly what you need to remember. As long as you go to class and somewhat pay attention, it's an easy A.

I took Dr. Shorey's class a year ago and still remember it very fondly. He is an amazing professor with super engaging lectures. The only class I actually wanted to go to. You also very much need to go to class, his exams are over a list of objectives that he talks about in class but may not be on the posted slides.
I liked Dr. Shorey a lot. He made the content interesting. He obviously cared about the content and my understanding of it. I would've liked to have taken a course from him again.

This man was my favorite professor at Mines during my Freshman Year. He's very lecture heavy, yes, but he's not nearly as tough or hard-to-please as others have stated. Maybe he was different in the past, but almost all of his information could be found in the lecture slides, and his notes ask the questions that will most likely be on exams.

Shorey is a really good professor; he's funny, passionate about his job, and somewhat entertaining. His GEGN101 class is really all about memorization for the exams, so getting a decent grade in that class isn't super challenging. Make sure to pay attention to what he say's though, because he may call you out for asking a  "stupid" question.

Shorey is an amazing teacher and person as he literally gives you a sheet with all the questions you need to answer during lecture and as long as you study those, you’ll do great in the exams, just so you know the only grades come from the exams

Professor Shorey is so passionate about what he does and it's definitely contagious. He's a great teacher and offers very clear criteria for grading and tests. The class was lecture heavy, but he always kept my attention. Lab was fun as well and I feel like I learned a lot about the world.

his example exams are super close to the real ones, the problem is he doesn't make it clear that the ONLY official grade you get for lecture ( which is 75% of your grade) is from exams. On the syllabus, it says quizzes are also taken into account... but surprise they are not so you have to ace the exams to get a good grade in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I emailed him asking where the final exam room was, and he told me to go to class. I couldn't go to class that day.
If you don't write something down the one, single time he says it, you'll miss an important part of class. His grading policy makes no sense, and the way he treats his students is absolutely awful.
This class makes me so angry. The way he treats his students is unacceptable, and rude.

Shorey is a fine teacher when you're in his lectures. it takes a day or two to get used to and then you get it from there. The reason he gets a 1 star is for how he doesn't represent mines at all. he's inaccessible, unhelpful, rude, and doesn't care about his students. his grading makes no sense, and he doesn't tell you about it til finals week.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: no clear grading criteria. his syllabus doesn't have anything helpful in it.

All of his teachings are verbal. If you're an auditory learner, this is good so long as you write everything down, because it's not on his slides or syllabus. If you don't, you're screwed, and if you ask him a question, he talks at you like you're the dumbest person in the entire world. Very rude.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Rude, condescending, doesn't care about his students at all. If you miss a lecture, there is no way to find what you missed other than finding unofficial quizlets or asking friends. The grading criteria aren't clear either. IF YOU TAKE THIS CLASS, GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS AND ASK HIM ABOUT THE GRADING CRITERIA ASAP. Else, you'll be sorely surprised
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Shorey is awesome, he's so passionate about what he does and his lectures are fascinating, honestly I would attend just for fun. Tests and quizzes are easy. Only downside are the labs, they are very meticulous and take forever. But he is such an interesting lecturer that it's definitely worth it. Would take again.

SHOREY IS AMAZING! Easily one of the most knowledgeable individuals I've ever met in the field of environmentalism and geology. He is beyond passionate about the Earth and is absolutely hilarious both in his written assignments, workbooks, and in person. I would absolutely recommend taking one of his classes if possible.

Shorey is epic. He made my first semester at Mines *loads* better. He's super knowledgeable, very enjoyable, and an all around cool dude. Make sure you attend lectures and bring your clicker (and answer all the questions as best you can). Would take him again in a heartbeat.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Asked to attend the Colorado Scientific Society lecture on the Snowmastodon site by my professor. I cannot believe how bad the talk was. No science was discussed and it was so boring watching the poor quality video and discussion of the dig day- by-day. He is a narcissist and should not be giving scientific talks on such amazing paleo findings.
Professor Shorey was an amazing professor. You can tell he loves geology. makes his lectures fun and educational.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Just a solid passionate teacher, he expects respect and it is totally justified.
Dr. Shorey was awesome and the labs are the only thing that you'll really have for hw.
If there are two words that can be combined into a singular description for the brief interaction with this arrogant jerk itd be arrogantjerk

Dr. Shorey is a respectable teacher. He's one of the more outgoing and personable professors at Mines, which is refreshing. He clearly knows his stuff and sometimes comes off as a "know it all", but it's honestly not problem when it comes to his effectiveness as a professor. His lectures are straightforward, and is an easy A if you read his slides.

I have to be honest I was expecting Shorey to be a better professor than I experienced. He's not terrible and definitely more likeable by some people more than others. He comes across with a very big head and if you are looking for help, he was good at not giving the best explanation. Was harder than I thought to get the grade I wanted.

Shorey is by far the best professor for Earth and Environmental Systems. He is very passionate about geology, and the objectives he creates to go alongside the lectures make it very clear what will be on exams. If you attend lecture, you will have a great understanding of what is expected on tests. Don't forget your iClicker!

Classes were very repetitive and hard to pay attention in. Shorey is very intelligent and knowledgeable. Don't forget your iClicker. Could've gotten an A if it wasn't for lab. My section magnaged to get the hardest grader for a TA. Had friends who tried less than me on lab reports and did better. You get an incomplete in the class if you miss lab.

Shorey is a very enthusiastic professor! He is excited to teach and help students learn. His passion what he does is very evident in his lectures. Outdoor field trips and labs give students a chance to be hands-on and interact with the environment. He is also hilarious!
Having some trouble? His podcasts and videos are enough to get you the grade you want. Tests are mostly questions from the old exams that he posts and the objectives.

Dr. Shorey is AMAZING. That's really all there is to it. All you have to do is go to his lectures and you will understand how incredible his class is. He's passionate about the material and knows almost everything and anything related to Earth Science. Everyone has there moments, but overall Shorey is the best professor I have ever had.
Has clear objectives, must go to class to get the information, but once you have it the class is easy. He makes a few politically charged comments here and there.

He gives great lectures and is very nice and passionate about what he's talking about. The tests and objectives are all online, but going to lectures is definitely worth it as he will make you see the world differently.
Shorey loves his job and really has a passion for what he does. He is very knowledgeable on the content he teaches, and every lecture is interesting and new.

Shorey is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about all of the subjects he teaches. Earth and Environmental Systems encompasses a variety of sciences from geology and hydrology to meteorology and ecology. I wish this class was mandatory for every student. It will expand your worldview and change your perspective on various societal issues.
Shorey is a great lecturer who tells great and captivating stories that he teaches by.
Professor Shorey's passion for what he does is contagious. I look forward to his lectures every morning.

Its rumored that if you chant "Geology" three times Shorey will appear to help you in times of academic need. Joking aside, Shorey's extensive background knowledge and amazing lectures made Earth and Environmental an extraordinary class.

Dr. Shorey is easily one of the most knowledgeable professors at Mines. His lectures are crystal clear, very interesting, and inspiring. If you show up to class, you won't be disappointed as he uses clicker questions to your advantage and gives hints about exams. Overall, his classes are very rewarding and he is a great educator
Worst Professor I have ever had.

He's a well knowledgeable professor you will learn a lot from him. I didn't like geology at first but after I had a course with him it became my favorite. You're lucky if he is your professor. He has enough experience to make you a great geologist, you just need to focus on lectures.

Shorey makes this class pretty easy. He actually responds to student emails. You can tell he's really into what he does. He pretty much tells you what's gonna be on the fill-in-the-blank and he tells you exactly what you'll be tested over, although you get tested on a small fraction of what you're expected to know. Great class!

As long as you show up and pay attention you will pass. He's very clear about what will be on tests and he makes them pretty easy. He really knows how to make a lecture interesting, and he will reward you if you pay attention with hints about what free-response questions will be on the test. His lectures are my favorite lectures.
Great Professor. Highly reccomended. Expert on the material and provides a very student-friendly class. Objectives are tested directly
Great teacher! helpful, knowledgeable, makes material I have otherwise no interest in interesting.
Shorey is the best!!!!

His lectures are very helpful and pertinent to what is on the test. He tells you exactly what you need to know by handing out Objectives, or the major points of each lecture. He responds quickly to e-mails and is easy to work with because he wants his students to understand the material, succeed, and have fun in his class.

What a great professor! Coming to class regularly can be difficult with no mandatory attendance, but it is well worth it. He has a genuine interest in the class and it definitely shows. The class itself is easy if you study the objectives given out. Wouldn't recommend anyone else to teach this class!

Dr. Shorey is an awesome teacher.  You can tell he really loves teaching and loves earth science.  He gives you all the answers to the tests in class and his tests are super easy if you study the practice exam.

Dr. Shorey is a great teacher.  He has objectives and tells you all of the answers to them in class and then tests you on them directly.  It is an easy course if you study the objectives well, and he's a very helpful teacher in his lectures and after class.

Very passionate, if not a little biased.  Sets you up to succeed with all his lectures available as podcasts and online slides.  He even gives you 'objectives' that are essentially test questions.  The labs are a bit confusing, especially with a bad TA, but an easy A class!
Awesome professor, very enthusiastic about material and helping students learn.

Great teacher in class & out. Willing to thoroughly answer any crazy ? I thought up during OH. VERY biased in his views, though, & makes it clear that he thinks those who don't agree with him are stupid. That said, he doesn't bias his grading on whether you agree with him, and he's definitely willing to respectfully discuss other views in OH.
He is very helpful
Great teacher who is passionate and innovative(podcasts all his lectures)
This man loves what he teaches and the passion is contagious. In my stressful hell known as a day at the school of Mines, his lectures were my favorite part. You rock, Shorey! (no pun intended)
Awesome teach.  All claims were backed by hard science and he's very enthusiastic about what he teaches
Cool dude.

Shorey was a bit biased in a few lectures but presented sound science. Tests directly form notes. Lab a bit irritating and taught by grad students. However, my TA was helpful. Study the old tests and get help from the TA on the big point projects and this will be a pretty easy A.
Fun teacher, easy to listen to.  Tests extremely easy, as they're based directly off notes he practically gives you throughout semester
Great lecturer. Test material was clearly presented. Addressed relevant topics in lecture and kept it interesting.
All tests are copied from a list of questions he gives you throughout the semester.
A good professor, kept class entertaining and knowing what he was talking about.
Great teacher.  Always chimes in on the discussion board and the podcasts are extremely helpful, but not a substitute for going to class.
easy class
Interesting, seems to really like the class, explained things well
Pretty cool guy.  Very helpful and interesting.
He really does try to help you understand the material, his Earth and Environmental Systems Podcast is a big help.

Bridgman is an excellent Calc 3 teacher and did a good job of communicating the material with his well paced lectures. He is quite skilled at making difficult concepts easier to understand and at making you see their applications and uses.

I loved Terry. Calc 3 HNRS was really hard for me but I honestly couldn't have done it without him. If you are willing to put in the work when you struggle then you will do fine. My only feedback is the grade is so exam heavy which sucks if you mess up but i still loved it.
Bridgman is great and really wants you to understand what he is teaching.
This guy doesn't need sentences to describe him. He is simply amazing.
Great guy, great class, great teacher, can't beat him.

If you want to actually understand Calc II, this is definitely the best prof out there. He doesn't teach anything extra and will give you exactly what you need to know to do exceptionally well on test. He is also very funny in class and knows how to keep kids engaged.

Definitely the best calc 2 professor out there, I always enjoyed going to his lectures as he was very engaging. He is very good about going over any homework questions we have, and you can tell he loves teaching. Calc 2 can be hard but taking Bridgman helps!

I can confidently say that he deserves an excellent rating of 6/5 for his exceptional teaching skills. Professor Bridgman has an extraordinary ability to simplify complicated mathematical ideas with unparalleled clarity, making even the most difficult subjects in Calculus II accessible and comprehensible.

Took him for discrete. Absolutely hysterical professor, probably the funniest at Mines. His lectures were decent too, but very skippable due to the nature of the class. When I would show up he would give some pretty good examples on the work we were doing. Really hope I get to have him for another class at some point.

I had a not-so-great Calc II teacher, but then I started going to the Terry Bridgman section of the class; and OH BOY DID IT HELP!!!!!! This guy is great, although you probably won't get into his class because he is so high in demand. 5 / 5 stars.

Professor Bridgman is really good at teaching the content. He constantly checked in with us to make sure we were understanding everything and always made class fun. If you went to class, payed attention, and did the homework, you'll be fine.
Would be very inconsistent with how fast he would go through lessons and would often fall behind the rest of the course, but when he was in a rush to catch up he was a very good teacher.
Was pretty good at teaching the content and was fairly engaging in lectures. Also a pretty funny guy. Would absolutely recommend taking Bridgman.

Bridgman is a silly little man, and seems to genuinely care about your learning in a way that unfortunately few professors do. He makes lectures interesting, and is always willing to help if you aren't understanding something or you have a problem with how an assignment was graded. I would gladly take a class taught by him again.

Dr. Bridgman is easily my favorite professor I've had at Mines. His lectures are interesting and he seems to genuinely care about his students. If you have the opportunity to take him for any class I definitely would.
Good teacher, great guy. Definitely recommend Bridgman.
One of the best professors at mines.

Funny guy and nice to be around, but wow are his field session lectures horrifically useless. We listen for 30 minutes about some unfortunate soul that gets called on about their day then spend 40 minutes about the assignments we need to do for the week, then we leave. Absolutely no content is covered whatsoever. Like him as a person, prof... ehhhh

Bridgman is an excellent professor! He explains the material clearly, with lots of jokes to make it interesting, and is always available in office hours to chat about the material and the class. He also care about the students and their success, and overall is a very nice person
Hands down the best professor I have ever had. He was understanding, nice, made constant jokes in class, and, above all, explained the material in a way that made it almost trivial. 10/10

Terry is awesome. His lectures are always very entertaining, and his humor makes it easy to stay engaged. He is great at explaining things and he doesn't carry the pretentious air that a lot of professors seem to have. You are given ample study resources for exams and the homework load is pretty light.
If you have to take Calc 3, take it with Bridgman. He makes every class so fun and is still knowledgeable and helpful in all things math and life.
Bridgman is a great teacher who uses funny scenarios to help everyone learn the new concepts in Calc III. Very approachable and respectful and I would highly recommend him.

Bridgman is a fantastic professor who makes lectures understandable and fun! Definitely see him outside of class for office hours and he will walk you through anything you dont understand. 10/10 would take again.

Bridgeman is amazing. He is very open to helping outside of class with any amount that you need. In class he is funny and keeps everyone in a good mood while staying on topic so you actually learn what you need to.
Bridgman is great. He explains things very well and is hilarious. He appreciates student involvement but it is not strictly required.
Terry did a great job and made coming to class enjoyable.
Bridgman is an amazing teacher. His lectures are really good and he's also just a fun guy.

Super nice guy. Always asks the class how our weekend was and has a great sense of humor. The class isn't too hard but maybe that is because he explains exactly what you need to know for the worksheets and exams. I love this guy and definitely recommend him.
Terry has been the best math teacher I have had by far. He is great at explaining things and using analogies so you understand. He also jokes around with the class a ton so you're not ever bored.

Mr. Bridgman is one of the funniest teachers I have ever had. I go to his office hours weekly, and he always explains the question I have. He cracks about 10 really funny jokes every class, and finds really odd but helpful analogies to compare shapes or other equations to real life objects in order to help visualize. Amazing teacher. 10/10
He's my favorite teacher ever
Terry made calculus my favorite class

Hands down my favorite professor at Mines. I'm not saying that he's the best or easiest teacher, but he's on your side and will make sure nobody gets left behind during his lectures. Plus, he actually cares about you as a real person-- something that most professors are too distant for me to feel.

Terry is the only reason I continued with honors and I have not been disappointed. His lectures are sometimes hard to follow in the middle but when he gets to the most important information, he makes sure you understand it. He's fun, easygoing, and always offering to help.

I AM ABSOLUTLY IN LOVE WITH BRIDGEMAN.  I put A LOT of work into both his classes (I took Calc 2 & 3 with him) and definitely only technically earned a C in his class but by working hard with him and the AMS he bumped me up.  A lot.  He always says hi to me on campus and I still visit him sometimes.
Awesome teacher for diff eq over the summer, makes it really easy to get a B and keeps lecture fairly interesting.

Nice guy, wants his students to succeed. The class is hard though, be ready to put in some serious work. He is also willing to write letters of recommendation and will bend over backwards to help you.

Bridgman is an awesome guy. He cares about how his students do, and not just in his class, but outside as well. He is engaging and explains things thoroughly while keeping the classroom upbeat. I had him for both Calc II and III honors, and he was great. Glad I had him.

Bridgman is a funny guy and is helpful in office hours. But honors is really hard , at some point the average for an exam was 56. If u want to boost your gpa with an a in this 4 credit course , I suggest taking normal class.

Dr. Bridgman is really funny but if you want to get an a and boost your gpa with this 4 credit course, I suggest taking a normal calc class. Honors is horrible, at some point the average of an exam was 56.

A great teacher. He explains things well and usually comes up with good comparisons that make things easy to visualize/think about. He is also very funny and makes class interesting. I would highly recommend him.

Super funny guy. Was a little hard to understand at first, but then I adjusted to how college professors teach and his class became super easy. He's really helpful as well. Overall a really entertaining and great professor to have. Highly recommend. I took his Calc 2 Honors class and will take his Calc 3 Honors class next semester.
Great teacher, I had him for several classes including my summer course.  He was always willing to help out and hold extra office hours for struggling students.

Took him for Calc II and also Linear Algebra because he was so good. Definitely the most fun math prof here and very good at covering all of the material in an understandable way. His classes were never boring, and the work-load is not bad, but don't expect to breeze through all the tests.
Interesting in class. Very helpful during office hours.
Awesome and hilarious.
Terry makes class both fun and interesting.  He's very straightforward with his teaching method.
He's very linear when teaching and is easy to take notes from.  Also, he's helpful in office hours.
Proves once again that math professors are the most hilarious people on the planet.
Positively hilarious and fantastic at explaining complex ideas. Excellent help after class too!
Most Awesome teacher ever!! very funny man

bridgman is such a G! i've only had him in a few classes but had makes boring material fun and explains interesting material well. if you get the chance take any class with him and it will be the highlight of your (academic) day, every day.
Really good. Very clear and funny.
Knows his stuff - class and topics are easy, tests are in general more difficult. Classic Bridgman vocabulary includes a heavy dose of "elms."
Cool guy, not a great teacher.
Funny and laid back but talks fast
Generally stupid, got his degree from a liberal arts school, no wonder he can't figure out any of the math problems he puts up.
Real Layed back guy, which is a change from profs who think there damn classes are the most important one in the school
He was a good Fortran teacher, always willing to help, but can be unclear, i would recommend him though.
No Comments
No Comments

He really seemed to have trouble both explaining and understanding the material (there seemed to be a lot of times where he just didn't know what the answer to a problem he put on the board was or even on a homework assignment). Also the final included ter
No Comments
Not the best teacher, but hilarious and almost always in a good mood.  If you talk to him during office hours, you'll most likely get a good laugh--something Mines students seem to do less and less.
I love Bridgeman, greatest guy ever and a great prof

Has to teach boring material (algebraic structures), but has a good time doing it and engages the class well. Also put up with fatty mcfatfat kid's annoying comments very well and only yelled at him once the entire semester. Good prof, bad class.
No Comments
Avoid this teacher at all costs.
GOSH, he's like the greatest teacher EVER.

I believe that Dr. Strong is one of the best professors I have ever had and because of his teaching, Differential Equations was my favorite math class I've ever taken and was the highlight of the Fall 2024 semester for me. His lectures are interesting, informative, and very well paced. He truly cares for your learning and answers any question.

If you miss class he always posts the notes he took on the board in class, and that is very helpful. Overall, diffeq was great with Scott he cares about his students and even color codes his notes on the board which is a big plus.

An amazing lecturer who cares deeply about the subject matter and the student he teaches. I recommend taking his honors class for Diffi Q if you're not planning to take linear algebra, as it covers different subjects from the original diffi q course.
Simply amazing. You will have no regrets taking any class with Strong.
Best teacher on campus it's illegal to disagree.
Dr Strong is a super chill guy but i found his class to be too lecture heavy.

Dr. Strong is my favorite professor at Mines without question. His explanations are incredibly thorough and all the theory and derivation behind each equation made the equations easier to apply on homeworks/exams. Dr. Strong also will go over homework questions in class before they're due if you ask. Also tells great stories!

Best diff eq honors professor. Not super traditional or easy to follow but his grading criteria in the honors class made high grades more attainable. Funny and uses interesting real life applications.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I LOVE SCOTT

Dr. Strong is easily the best professor I have ever had, he knows the content, he is absolutely hilarious, and he makes lecture fun. I looked forward to his lectures every time. He is understanding, flexible, and caring. Seriously top tier.
Would highly recommend taking Diff Eq with Scott if you have the option. Very funny guy and good professor.

This professor does an excellent job in lectures. He emphasizes why we are learning what we are learning. When teaching concepts, he often breaks complex methods down into actionable steps. He uses these actionable steps over and over again in class, which makes them easy to learn. This professor is excellent. 1000/10.
Amazing professor, seriously one of the best educators I have ever had. His lectures are easy to understand and his teaching style is great. Would highly recommend to anyone taking DiffEQ

This man is an absolute legend. While Diffeq certainly isn't the easiest course, Scott Strong will always find a way to make it entertaining. On top of that, I've never met someone who both understands and expresses a love for the subject as much as he does. Please take Dr. Strong's section if you have the chance, you certainly won't regret it
Amazing. Favorite professor for math ever!
He explained topics well and was very engaging. He is also nice in person. I don't have anything negative to about him.

Best professor I've had at Mines so far. Lectures are immaculate. He is funny and entertaining and has OH like 4 times a week. He answers all questions during lecture and is super friendly. Could not recommend a better professor for this class. Have yet to take a midterm in this class, but so far this class is hard, but prof. Strongs is the savior.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Scott is an amazing person and every single one of his lectures is enjoyable. His worksheets in this class were very confusing at times, but going to office hours always cleared it up (definitely recommend going to his office hours!). Only aspect of the class I didn't enjoy was the fact that we had to write a paper to get above a C.
Fantastic professor and human being. 11/10

Scott was an Amazing professor for differential equations. He went into depth on everything and made it really clear to understand all the concepts making the class seem really easy. Also, he was funny and joyful thought-out all his lectures. Homework and exams are pretty easy. Grading is a little weird but he walks you through it.
He is one of the best math teachers I have ever had, he will have excellent examples and demonstrate simple real life applications of his subjects
Would highly recommend! Never seen a professor be so put together, especially in an online environment. Actually made my chem-major self enjoy a math class!

Scott is an amazing professor and goes above and beyond to make sure students understand the material. He posts all lectures on YouTube along with class notes and sometimes extra explanatory videos. Highly recommend.

Scott Strong really cares about the quality of education every student receives. Especially during the pandemic Scott has made online learning a breeze, providing not only a zoom link but additionally a high definition youtube stream. He's well versed and easily one of the most intelligent professors I've ever had. Highly recommend for DiffEq.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Scott is insanely smart and could not be a better lecturer. I learn best when I can see an application for what I'm learning--he makes sure to always explain why we're learning any given concept. Beyond that, he's a fun guy and his lectures are casual enough to be easy to listen to and understand. Can't recommend the guy enough.

Scott made MAT225 so much fun and he is very easy to understand. He teaches in a way where it is very easy to learn and he goes slow enough to where you can learn at a comfortable pace, but not too slow where the class is boring. His notes from the lectures are very organized and formatted in a way that is easy to understand and look at.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: His grading is a bit confusing, but his lectures are fantastic and gave me the motivation to actually learn what was happening. He also recorded them and posted them on Canvas, so if I needed help on the homework, I could go back through his lecture to figure it out. 10/10

I really enjoyed taking DiffEq with Strong. (It was all online, as I was a remote student.) But this man single-handedly made me enjoy math enough that I changed my major to math. He's honestly one of, if not the, best professors I've had at Mines.

Scott is a great professor. The grading for DifQ this semester was based more on doing the work since they knew that online is hard. Scott is a great lecturer. He makes the content make sense and is always welcoming to questions. He also knows his way around tech and made the transition to online super easy and actually made it an advantage.

This class is graded like the professor wanted to be quirky. The requirements to attain various grades are ludicrous and contradictory. You could get an A on every single assignment, quiz, and final, but if you had <65% on the midterm, you fail. How does that make sense? There's no late work either, so missing an assignment almost guarantees a fail

One of the best math professors I had at Mines! I thought diffeq would be horrible but Professor Strong made it very easy to understand. When we switched to online classes in March, he was able to deliver material in the same quality of in-class lectures which was phenomenal.
This dude is a champ. Love him and would take his class again any day.

Scott is a great professor, he lectures in a way that teaches you the material, but is also interesting and tends to go off on little tangents that greatly add to the class. He made the class interesting and fun, I would definitely take him for DiffEQ
Eccentric and awesome. Clearly a genius in his field, but class can easily go over your head if you stop paying attention for a minute. I took Honors so there were no tests/quizzes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: He is seriously awesome. I took the 4 pm section and was hesitant but it ended up being the best class of the semester. The second exam is usually pretty tough but it's set by all the professors not just him so..

This man is the best math teacher ever. Has great lectures that are organized on the white boards, is always ready to answer questions you have regardless what they might be. Is enthusiastic about the topic. Highly recommend this professor and taking as many practice exams on canvas before the exams as possible to prepare.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Scott is hilarious and makes a pretty difficult course enjoyable and makes everyone laugh. Most of the time attendance is like 65% but that doesn't really matter. His wife also teaches this course and they kind of have this competition for which students get the best grades but it's mostly funny. 10/10 professor.
Best professor in the world! The dude is super smart and is always willing to help out!

Is not organized or informative about your grade in the class. Constantly behind on grading. Does not stay on topic nor does he communicate the topic well enough to understand it. Assignments are confusing and filled with gramatical errors. I don't believe he actually graded half of my work. He is funny though.

Scott's lectures are entertaining however he tends to get side tracked quite easily.  I found that he jumped around too much form me and did not provide good examples.  I got most of the details from my tutors and TA, which may have been his goal.  Math does not come easy to me, so I would suggest taking his wife, who is more structured.

Scott is super funny and is clearly passionate about teaching. His lectures are funny and keep me focused. I have heard from others that they get distracted by his rabbit trails, but I found his lectures to be well structured and easy to follow.

So funny! Like other's said, lots of tangents. Which can be good or bad depending on your learning style. I never had a problem with doing math outside of class. Plenty of youtube videos to help supplement lectures. Recitations are helpful too. He posts old midterm exams. Practice those and you'll do fine.

If you go to class to learn and be ready for the exams, them you're better off not attending class. The professor's explanations are not clear, he goes of on so many tangents you may be left wondering if he is talking about the topic or his personal like. Hard to follow, fast paced explanations, and doesn't post slides or lecture notes. Take Jen
Scott is kind of a goof in lecture but he also teaches clearly without a lot of fluff. Be warned, when he teaches it is balls to the walls fast.

Scott is absolutely hilarious with his tangents and his stories. However, this does not detract from learning. It simply makes class more bearable. It isn't the hardest math class (probably the easiest), but scott makes it the best. 10/10 would recommend
I love Scott's enthusiasm and real world examples. The content can get confusing at times but he is always available during his office hours. Very lenient on dead lines

I had DiffEq for the last class of the day, just when I was feeling exhausted, but he made the lectures entertaining and easy to get through.  The material itself was somewhat hard for me, but the professor provided many examples and great analogies to help remember (like poke with a stick and bucket of goo).
Scott was very amusing to watch teach. Provides plenty of examples, but sometimes it's really hard to follow. Still, makes math amusing and interesting, class isn't too hard to do.

Don't expect to like his class if you learn by seeing examples.  He is very theory based and complicates things if you think about math like I do.  I understand that he's entertaining, but if you're like me and want the examples, take the class with Collis who is also entertaining but gives you quality examples and helps you prepare for the tests.

Scott Strong is great. He makes the class a pleasure to be in. Would recommend him 100% to anyone. Not only will you enjoy his class, but you will come out of it having learned a lot as well. Scott  Strong <3

Excellent teacher. Highly recommend. He made me want to get a math minor. You don't need the book for AEM at all. Just pay attention during lectures so you can understand the conceptual questions on the exams. He gives you everything you need for homework. Study old exams and you will score well on your exam.

He knows his stuff. He is very helpful and gets you thinking about many tangents in math through his lectures and worksheets. He is very funny also. Thank you for an awesome semester professor Strong!!

He was phenomenal for DiffEq honors, but it was a tough class.  I've never seen worksheets with so much detail. He required strange cheap textbooks off Amazon, but I doubt he'd do that for nonhonors classes.  Overall, you'll definitely wanna go for this guy's classes.

Deeply knows all undergrad math topics enthusiastic concise prof only 7 mistakes all term very helpful email response always within hours. Courteous and encouraging in office, excited and engaging in lectures. Challenging but not overwhelming course, highly recommended. He almost made me change majors :D. Thanks for a great semester Prof Strong!

My mind gets blown every day in this class. He is passionate about math, and if you can see bigger than the lengthy derivations, this class is really cool. Also, he is the funniest professors I have had.
Fractals/Chaos lecture extremely interesting.
His examples really helped me to grasp the concepts taught in the class.  Homework isn't due till 5pm on due date and he is usually available to help you through the worksheets.

Took his diffyQ class for Field.  He really went out of his way to make sure the class understood the material.  And yes his jokes were corny, but it kept you up and alert and into the material.  Never saw the guy NOT wearing his sandals.  If you have a problem with him, it's probably on your side of the desk.
fun to be in class with
corniest jokes ever
Scott rocks. Favorite math teacher at the school, by far.
Young, Funny , Crazy
Awesome guy, did a very good job teaching C++.  Strange but interesting sense of humor.  Always willing to answer questions.  If he doesn't know something, he will find it out.
Good notes, good lectures, good teacher.
Looking back, wish he would have talked about pointers a little more.
Excellent teacher
he's cool
great lectures
This class sucks, and i though was not well taught

Kinzli is one of the best professors ive had. He cares so much about each student. For instance, by the second day of class he knew everyones name by heart. He is passionate about what he teaches and wants the best for his students.

Super passionate about hydro & teaching students. Similar color-coding method to Panos, makes note taking easier. Lectures are efficient & entertaining, usually allots time to do worksheets in class. Manageable homework, a few group projects. Exams are split into conceptual and calculations (note sheet allowed for this portion). Cool guy.
Great professor who is super passionate about the topic. Very engaging lessons and great demonstrations. Homework assignments can be long and there are several large group projects.
Very considerate. Uses past student feedback to make the class better for future students.

Kinzli was a great professor at Mines. Very experienced and knowledgeable in CEEN 381 concepts. The demos from previous students are extremely helpful and there are numerous resources to help understand more difficult concepts.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Literally the best teacher I've had at Mines! He clearly wants to see his students succeed and goes above and beyond to make sure we feel prepared and comfortable in class. Lots of awesome demos and silly ways to remember things, overall incredible class and teacher!

Dr. Kinzli has been one of my favorite professors during my time here at Mines. I cannot speak more highly of him and his incredible lecturing style. His demos have proven very helpful and the photos and graphics he shares are very helpful to understanding the content. I would highly recommend taking courses taught by him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: This dude is by far the best professor I've had here at Mines. You can tell he loves what he does, and that translates to well-put-together and interesting lectures. The tests are easy; he tells you exactly what will be on them. I would hang out with this guy outside of class, that's how good of a guy he is. Take his class, you will not regret it.

Kinzli covers a lot of content in a well paced and informative way. Exams are grades rather leniently and the material to be covered is explained thoroughly beforehand. The course is frontloaded and gets easier as time goes on.

Dr. Kinzli really cares about his students. He is always trying to improve the class lectures by adding hydrologic models and videos. He is very accepting of feedback and answering questions about material. I look forward to having Dr. Kinzli instructor field session!
Was super nice, fair grader, and cares about the subject. Will take another one of his classes.

Kinzli cares about the work he does and the students he teaches and it shows through his lectures. He is an expert in his field and his lectures are engaging and worth attending. He is accessible through emails (during work hours) and is happy to help in office hours. His exams are memorization but pretty chill and nothing catches you off guard.
Kinzli cares about his students and their learning

Tests are easy, the problems are all given to you beforehand and you just need to make sure you know how to do them. Takes a bit of time to study but super easy to get a good grade. Lectures are mandatory but very useful and there are videos if you miss class so you won't fall behind.
This was a very enjoyable class that has inspired me to work in water resources. His energy is great and it is clear he cares about his students and teaching.

Kinzli is a great professor who really cares about his students. Lectures are very engaging and the worksheets/homeworks prepare you for the exams. Only complaint is that he uses a teaching model from ASCE which can make some of the content hard to follow and there isn't a lot of time for examples in class.

Excellent teacher, makes the class very fun and interesting. Coming to class is important and if you miss class it can be easy to fall behind. He is available to meet regularly to offer help outside of office hours.
It was great
very interactive lessons, asks question to students to stay engaged during class. Overall great teacher.
Professor Kinzli was always in a fantastic mood and eager to help us learn. His lectures were engaging and his exams and course work were both fair and valuable.

The class is well put together, and you can tell that the professor cares about what he is teaching. The class is front-loaded for the work load but it is not too bad. Kinzli's tests do a good job of testing your knowledge without trying to catch you on niche questions. Very similar questions on tests to homework and assignments.
Professor Kinzli was a teacher dedicated to making students learn. He was professonal in the classroom with leactures whil always keeping it light and fun. Highly suggest! You will learn a lot.
Dr. Kinzli is a great professor who gives engaging and fun lectures. It is easy to learn the material in his class due to his teaching s
Kinzli was a great professor and I enjoyed his class. It was not too difficult and it was very easy to do well in his class

Homework assignments are a little long but you have weeks to do them and he's super helpful in office hours. Tests ("celebrations of knowledge")  are broken into two class days, one for concepts and one for calculations. For calculations, he gives you what problems are on it. Great professor and a really cool guy!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Thoroughly enjoyed this class and this professor, 10/10 would recommend.
Great professor and great guy, attendance is mandatory as he doesn't upload his board notes anywhere. But his lectures are very informative and clear about what material will be on the exams.

Kinzli is a fantastic professor. He has taken the time to craft this course to perfection and it is clearly reflected in his students learning. As long as you show up and pay attention, it is easy to learn the information and do well on the homework's and exams. I wish all professors were like him. Definitely take this class if given the choice.

Professor Kinzli genuinely cares about each one of his students in his class. There is a lot of course work, but its manageable and if you're struggling he is willing to give extensions. His teaching style is extremely engaging and he really enjoys flooding the classroom during presentations with models. My favorite professor ever!
His class was a wonderful experience.
Very professional and knowledgeable on the subject. Loved his teaching method and would take another class with him.
Kinzli is super helpful and great for Hydrology.

Dr. Kinzli is easily one of my favorite professors at Mines. If you have the pleasure of having a class with him, he is more than worth it. He is extremely passionate about the topics he teaches, and he cares for his students greatly!
Kinzli is super helpful and makes everything you need to know for tests very clear! Always helpful and encouraging :)
Good guy
Enthusiastic about whatever is being taught, very approachable, straight forward homework and in class worksheets
Super caring teacher who engages his students in learning. Love the models.

Kinzli is great at what he does and his real world experience makes for a lot of interesting stories in class, which are always super engaging and helpful. He is very supportive and shows great care for his students and his teaching style.

Dr. Kinzli did a great job running the class. The class was very structured and straightforward as long as you went to lecture and completed problem sets. Dr. Kinzli had lots of energy in each of his lectures and made coming to class a true pleasure. I'm happy I decided to take this class and learn more about water resource engineering!
10/10 Professor. Would recommend him to any student.

Dr. Kinzli makes hydrology interesting. He is passionate about the subject and cares about student learning. I would take his hydrology class and would definitly enjoy having him as a senior design advisor.

I would 100% take Kinzli again. Lesson plans are easy to understand and he gives you the important equations in another color to make them pop out. He's also really available outside of class and he's willing to explain confusing things in office hours. While he used a textbook I never read it. He tells you what problems will be on the exams. :)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory, but it greatly helps if you want to understand the concepts. Does a really good job of teaching the concepts that are applicable to the field, helps a lot in preparation for the FE and PE.

Kinzli has a super organized class and a really helpful way of presenting his notes and lectures. There is an organized lecture for each day and you can really get by easy just attending class and doing assignments. If you're struggling with a topic, there is always supplemental materials (extra worksheets, readings, office hours, etc) to get help!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Passionate about the subject, overall a fun teacher to have!
Kinzli is a great professor and he truly loves teaching and getting to know his students

Professor Kinzli has his lectures set up in a really easy to follow manner and has worksheets to help with reinforcing important concepts for the exams. The homework and exams are straight forward and he is very available outside of class to answer questions.
Amazing Teacher
Great class and a really enthusiastic professor!
Dr. Kinzli is the best professor that I've had at Mines. His teaching style makes a huge difference; he makes hydrology easy and exciting to learn.

Professor Kinzli is absolutely awesome! He is honestly the best professor Ive ever had. His lectures are very engaging, he give very helpful feedback on work, and hes incredibly nice. He really cares about the students in his class.
This class was so enjoyable!!! Dr. Kinzli is the best

Professor Kinzli really cares about his students' learning. He posts previous lectures and board notes and they all help the students learn a lot. On top of that, he makes lecture entertaining and he obviously has a lot of passion for the material he teaches.
Great energy! Clear and concise for content. Good format.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Enjoyed going to class every day. Made content easy to understand, good examples and demonstrations in class. Probably my best professor at mines so far.
Great class! I really enjoyed everything I learned and all the hands on demos there are in the class. Some challenging projects but you get to work in teams.

I would take any class of Kinzlis again! Hes super accessible outside of class and through email, cares about if you actually learn the material, has an amazing note taking system and makes the class fun. He makes it easy to succeed in his class if you show up and study his objectives. One of my favorite professors at Mines!!!
Great professor! Learned a lot! One of the most engaging and interesting classes I have taken.
As someone who was not from this department and knew virtually nothing about hydrology, Dr. Kinzli helped me to learn a lot. Class structure was great. Probably the best class I have taken at Mines.
Lots of demos to help understand concepts

Very energetic and knowledgeable professor. Prof. Kinzli makes the course interesting by providing a variety of learning materials, such as videos, demonstrations, and in-class practice problems. (They help, trust me.) You do have to put in a bit of work, but it's well worth it.

Easily one of the best professors at Mines. He keeps workload and HW focused on key concepts, so the class doesn't drain your time. Teaching is enthusiastic, he makes extra efforts to bring demos to class for visual support, and even describes past common mistakes to ensure student success. Expectations for HW, projects, exams laid out clearly.

I love Kinzli's energy and his lectures are informative and interesting. He really cares about his students and the material he is teaching! It is clear that he knows the strategies for what makes a good teacher. Also, pretty easy grader and has physical models that help cement concepts in class. Would 100% recommend him!
Professor Kinzli really cares about his students! One of the best classes I have taken at Mines

(EBGN563) I did not like this professor at all. He is living in his world. Most students in the class paid little to no attention to what he was teaching. He struggled to capture students' attention and became upset and frustrated when asking questions. I would never have taken this course if it weren't a core requirement.

Tough grader and kind of scary as an individual but always willing to put in effort if you're willing to do the same. Doesn't expect an unreasonable amount from you, but he does expect you to actually do your work and have an understanding of the topics.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Professor Houser is a good guy, but I don't think he knows how to talk to students in a respectful and encouraging way. The class is way too lecture heavy and not helpful. Readings are too advanced for what is expected in the class. Talking to him or participating in class discussions is intimidating because he can be passive aggressive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Maybe it was better this semester but doing three research projects for this class is excessive and time expectations were unrealistic. Also, he changed the last weekly discussion to something completely unrelated to economics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: I took Econ online over the summer and I would highly recommend it if you can. There wasnt any group projects and you could work on your own time since there wasnt any class meetings. Houser seemed nice and would give good feedback on the discussion boards. Take Online!!

People are unnecessarily harsh to Houser because this is a mandatory freshman course, he's a fine/good professor. If you have a reliable group for assignments and you do the admittedly stupid online homework, you can easily ace every test.
Exams worth 5% and shouts at his TAs during a lecture while helping students with his in-class activity. The class really easy so I would take it at Mines, just may not be particularly enjoyable

I've never met a more condescending man in my life. Take this class ANYWHERE else, it's not worth the loss of sanity. Three projects consist of your ENTIRE grade. Homework makes no difference. What a waste. -7/10, lost brain cells taking this class. The class is practically entirely online, and feedback is copy/pasted. Save yourself from this.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Avoid taking Scott Houser if at all possible. He terribly rude to students, makes fun of people for not knowing something that has not been taught, and publicly ridicules them for having different opinions.

I failed every test, never ever paid attention in lecture, and got an 88 in the class LOL. This was 2 years ago, but I'm sure y'all will be fine. Don't have too much to say about Houser... I never interacted with him and avoided him like the plague, so what more can I say.

Just don't do it. I have heard he gets better after EBGN 201 but I don't know if I want to test it. Everything is done by TAs and if you are unlucky with your TA you are VERY unlucky. He gets political in class and tries to shame students for not agreeing with what he believes in. It is easy to pass because there are so many grades. Take it online.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Hybrid class of half online half in class was absolutely frustrating. Online homework was tedious and incredibly basic. Then once you go to class, you are so incredibly under prepared to answer and understand what he is asking. He is an off putting professor to say the least. If you need help, go to the TA's, they're your best bet.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: So rude. He is not helpful.

The class setup is awful. It is a "hybrid" course that is partially done through an online textbook and partially done in lecture. Beyond that, Prof. Houser is exceptionally unhelpful in most cases. He often refuses to answer questions in class or belittles you for not knowing the answer. His communication skills need work on Canvas and in-person.

Everyone has to take Dr. Houser at some point. Suck it up and get through it. Trust me, he is the least of your problems when it comes to the School of Mines. You've either already seen that or you will soon enough. Homework is easy if you go to class, and the exams are difficult but won't bring down your grade if you try at least a little.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Really, you should be taking Econ through a community college.. Same knowledge is available without the endless toil of online homework. This class technically is a "hybrid" class, where you only have to go to one lecture a week, in exchange for giving up your sanity by learning everything through a sub-par online program. Not hard but not worth it
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Online homework doesnt match what's being "taught" in class. Unnecessarily political. Classmates dont know what's going on because the whole thing is so disjointed. So much busywork. Changed the grade weighting two days before final. Doesnt have important very grades submitted night before final. Take it somewhere else if you can. Honestly.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Absolutely sucks tons of homework then you get to class where the professor just repeats everything the homework taught.
Doesnt like to actually help students
If I could give a zero I would. Easy class but just a terrible, just absolute trash professor
Condescending and there is a ton of busy work in this class.

For the head of the Econ department, he's really bad at teaching it. He differs most the work to an online program that doesn't actually teach you any economics. He tries to make the class participate but no one cares so the room is full of uncomfortable silence preceded by bad jokes. He put me to sleep most lectures and I learned very little.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS
Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Extremely politically biased in class, though the class is an economics course. Condescending man, not a fan of his lecture and teaching style at all. You will learn nothing from him. If you want to actually learn, take econonics elsewhere.

One of the worst professors I have ever met.
