He is not much help in office hours, the TA's do whatever he says, there is no accessible textbook, passing the homework is dependent upon people talking at you through the videos, and the lectures are dependent upon the videos. If you don't understand the videos, you don't understand the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Online homework is the most important thing in this class, and once you understand the questions on the online homework you will easily get an A. You might not talk to the Dr. Houser so often because you probably would not need to.

Take economics online or at Red Rocks. Houser is very condescending and the TAs were not helpful at all. Plus, the class isn't very interesting. I am pretty sure that the only concept I really understood were supply and demand graphs.

If you watch the weekly videos and assignments and do well on the group research project you'll get an A. I recommend taking notes on the videos, it makes the homework assignments and online quizzes go faster. Lectures weren't very helpful and I rarely learned anything in recitation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The structure of the class makes it extremely easy to pass, so long as you pass the group project. Only two grades are given for the project across all sections. 110 percent which is great, but if you miss even one thing you get a 30 which ranks your grade since its weighted more than all the tests and the final combined.

One time my group asked him if a problem we did was correct. He laughed, said no, and walked away. Not invested in students at all I feel like. Lectures are so boring and pointless. Learned my way thru this class using my own youtube videos. Recitation is fine... but lecture and the videos are of no use to me in my opinion.

Houser cares about this class just about as little as we do. You can tell from day 1 that he wants to be in a class that cares about economics and will sometimes hint at how little you mean to him. He's made attendance mandatory and has some group exercise due during every class. He will answer questions though, which is nice.
If I gave you a dollar for every time this fool would rant about Trump or some policy he disagrees with you'd have enough money to buy this man a thorough textbook on how economic actually work.
I really didn't enjoy this class, I did not appreciate his obvious political slant in class, it was unnecessary. Be prepared to do in-class little group projects during each lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Houser only spends the first 15 minutes or so of lecture teaching, the rest is spent doing a group assignment which is graded hard. And its the same every week. He does not answer questions well, and he talks down to students a lot.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is the only econ 1 professor we have. There's no choice.
The most useless and passive aggressive professor you'll ever find here at Mines (all other professors are great!)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Not bad at explaining the material, but he was a complete jerk to me when I went to talk to him during his office hours.

Not a great teacher by any means. He is very passive aggressive and doesn't teach to a good extent. Also, you should look forward to him ranting about his political views whenever he gets a chance, good times...

Not an econ buff, but took this class for my 400-level LAIS and enjoyed it. It was a lot of writing, but that snuck up on me due to my own negligence. He gave very honest feedback on papers, which worked great with the multiple-revision system he uses. Lectures were interesting and geared towards understanding concepts not mechanics.
he did not explain anything well. Lectures are terrible.  TAs are the reason I learned.
He's pretty clear on his expectations for the class. As long as you pay attention in lecture and understand the written homework and pop quizzes, you will be fine :)

This man should never teach again. He is the most passive aggressive person you have ever met. Also, he fails to clearly convey almost all of the topics that he aims to teach throughout the whole course. Unfortunately, econ at Colorado School of Mines is required. So either way, you will have to deal with him for an entire semester. Good luck.
Not very helpful. Extremely condescending. Expect to read the textbook a lot if you haven't had economics ever.

Houser is a very nice guy and is always willing to help. Just go to his office hours if you dont understand the material because he wants you  really learn it. He can be confusing sometimes but as long as you do the readings and the homework you will be fine.
Avoid.

A really annoying teacher, but an easy class. He doesn't teach anything, so maybe giving your clicker to a friend for participation would be a wise choice. He confuses students and wants them to learn entirely on their own. Don't worry about the class though, super easy.

Seems to know the material, just doesn't have any idea how to properly teach or explain it. Claims the class has the same average grades at Phys 2, which is clearly an issue. Puts too many 'all these answers are right but pick the one that Houser believes is most correct" questions on tests. Mines needs to upgrade their only economics professor.

Houser is clear that expectations for effort and understanding are high. Grades hard and expects excellence. He was very candid with feedback when my research paper was subpar, and accordingly helpful with suggestions for improvements. Among the most intellectually satisfying classes I've taken. Nice prof who cares about students and subject matter

Worst teacher and course I've had at Mines. Seems like he is out to lower GPA's.  Uses poor examples in class. Lecture material is irrelevant to what you see on homework and tests. Test questions trick students and are not always right in certain cases. I don't know why simple concepts and terms are re-written to be difficult
Houser is boring and uninteresting.  He was unable to explain anything, do not look to him for any sort of clarification, but rather read the chapters and do the graded work.

If you go to his lectures, you will be confused. He can't explain stuff well at all. If you read the chapters and go to recitation you should be fine. Just don't count on Houser for any clarification in class. If you go to class, bring other homework or something to do... or you will be bored

I had Dr Houser at Fresno State as an undergrad. Now after graduate school I can say he has been the single best instructor I've ever had. I never touched a book, but learned to truely love economics, appreciate its role, and envision its potential from him. Plus he's an incredibly good person.
his classes were interesting and personally I learned a lot from him. However, the material is so long and we had to read a lot in order to prepare for the exams.

This is actually an extension of the comment below me.  There were 5 A's, 10 B's, and 8 C's in a class of 27.  His grading policies were 60% tests, 10% homework, 10% quizzes and 20% classwork.  For all the online hw, you can retake them several times to get the 100.  Quizzes you can take 2x.  Attendance isn't mandatory; don't miss classwork days.

I took it in the summer and he literally went over all of macro in 3 days, and had a test on it the week after.  That was the last test.  And it was not curved.  He's not a boring guy, but the class is boring.  He can explain things well, but the textbook is what you study from; the tests, hw, and quizzes are based on it.

Some of the material covered in EGBN201 is interesting, the lectures, however, are always a half-baked rehash of the book. If you take the time to REALLY read the textbook and work on the online homework the lectures are completely optional (I slept through half of them and still got an A easily, I did did all the reading assignments)

This teacher is extremely hard to focus with, he does not explain the material well and the only reason I did well in the class was because I read the book many times over and because I had friends that understood econ.  If you can avoid this teacher please do.  You will be better off not taking him.
Honestly, I played scrabble during lecture.  It's not a hard class and the grading policies/ tests are easy.  If you want to continue in econ, then learn the stuff for real.

Just read the chapters! I know it's a pain in the ass but if you do the class will be painless, if not you're in for a world of hurt. Houser's lectures are good but the majority of the content you will learn will be self taught from the readings or course compass. Don't rely on lecture to get the A. The last test and final are curved so don't worry

Eklund is very great a teaching and creates a great learning environment for her students. She is super helpful when it comes to absences and other health-related things. Would highly recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: She teaches all of her notes in class on the whiteboards which is really helpful and easy for notes besides if you miss class. Whenever you miss class, for any reason, you do not have notes and can easily get behind. She is good at helping on worksheets and we have time in class for worksheet help.

Would highly recommend, learns all of her student's names, gives extra time in class for checking homework, and very accessible for office hours. Her lectures are pretty great as she was the course coordinator for this sem so I would highly recommend going. Also super easy to talk to if you have questions and really cares about her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Example heavy lectures! This could be good or bad depending on the person, but many days she would just jump right into an example of a new topic and teach us through that.
Best teacher I have had at Mines so far. Takes the time to learn everyones name in her sections and gives time in class for us to work on homework. If you have the opportunity please take her class!

Prof Eklunds lectures were so easy to follow - long complicated problems were broken down into a few steps, making them easier to understand and remember for exams. Before worksheets are due, she gives time in class to answer any questions or help you. Examples done in class and on worksheets are exactly what is on the exams - felt very prepared!

Went to her office hours to discuss a zero I got in one of the exam questions, she said she wasn't going to discuss it with and literally kicked me out of the office. Extremely rude and unprofessional. Doesn't send emails or announcements even if she cancels the class. If you miss class, good luck knowing important announcements

Holly is an amazing professor. She makes difficult concepts easy to understand and is great at answering questions. She definitely cares a lot about the success of her students. Would recommend her class to anyone.

Prof. Eklund comes to lecture prepared and is very organized which makes following her lectures very doable. She also gives reminders about due dates at the beginning of class. She does write super fast, so be ready to take notes when class starts! Tests do make up most of your grade but Prof. Eklund makes sure that you are well prepared for them.

Show up to class and make sure not to fall behind and you should be fine. Holly explains the material well and will answer questions effectively. 80% of your grade is determined by testing but there is plenty of resources to help you pass. Lecture attendance is not mandatory but you save yourself a lot of work if you show up.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Holly is super kind and a really great lecturer. She also has really nice handwriting :)

Holly is a wonderful and inspiring professor. Most people I know who are taking differential equations with her have a solid understanding of the concepts and are getting great scores on the tests (class median 90%). Her lectures are some of the most organized I've ever had and the out of class activities are relevant and helpful.

Professor Eklund had great lectures, holding attention of hundreds of kids effortlessly and introducing new topics at the perfect pace. Outside of class, she was very nice and helpful. Great professor who I have no complaints about.

This is the teacher that made me hate math. My completely subjective experience is that she just goes way too fast, skipping steps that are definitely not obvious. For a quick demonstration, that's great, but when that's your only exposure to difficult concepts, it's kinda tough.

Nice person, but always went very fast through things. She would also go over the random equations you'd need, with no context or if you need to right them down, or if they're a random derivation to get to the useful stuff. Solid meh

Not sure if it's because of Covid, but DiffEq with Prof. Eklund has been incredibly easy. Her lectures are clear and her grading is lenient, which has been such a nice break from my other profs who haven't been very accommodating with the whole pandemic situation. You still need to work, but she does everything she can to make your life easier.

DiffEq with Holly was by far my favorite class this semester. The lectures were very fun, and went at the pace that I learn at. She was able to respond to questions in the chat despite our best efforts, and she never had issues showing the right thing over zoom. I would definitely rate 10/10 light bulbs

Professor Eklund is amazing. I took her DiffEQ class and it was smooth sailing learning math despite the remote learning environment. Lectures are easy to understand thanks to her teaching style, and she stops to ask if anyone has any question after each problem. She's also easy to reach outside of class and flexible with office hours!

Good Golly Holly, I had such a good time in DIffQ. Lectures were clear and well prepared. Homework and exams were manageable. The magic came from the zoom chat that she let run wild. I had a real connection to my class mates because she allowed us the freedom to cut loose in class and make friends. Such a wonderful lady, 10/10 light bulbs.
Holly is a very efficient lecturer and and answers questions very well. She is very accessible outside of class and is amazing in and out of the classroom.
Holly is a fantastic teacher. She is very well-structured and thorough in lectures, and she's also a very kind individual. She cares about her students succeeding, 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Eklund is the best math instructor I've had so far, hands down. The highlight is how organized and knowledgeable she is. Classes are structured in such a way that she makes sure everyone can apply the concepts after the lecture. The lectures are an orderly and efficient dream. She's very approachable and sympathetic, too.

Holly is the best Calculus professor at Mines, I like her teaching style and how she tries her best to help outside class. She gives lots of examples to make sure that we understand the content, and always answers our questions with clarity. She goes fast during lecture, but try to write everything because it will help you understand later.

Holly is very clear in her lectures, and is happy to answer any questions directed toward her. Always accessible during office hours and is also happy to set up a time to meet outside of class! The worksheets for the class can be lengthy, but well-geared toward test content!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her for a summer session, and she is one of my favorite professors at Mines. Her lectures were so clear, and she taught with such grace and clarity. She lots of the time walks around the room asking if anyone needs help. I got to know her really well, and she always says hi to me around campus. Fantastic person and professor!

Professor Eklund is one of the good profs. She does lecture pretty quickly, but take good notes, and you will be fine. Do your homework and understand the examples. The tests for this semester were a little rough, but that's life. You can't expect to be spoon fed at Mines. They're not just going to test on the examples that they give you.

She teaches the material well and you will have a strong understanding of the material, she does go fast in lecture and skip many algebra steps so it is easy to get lost. The review helps, but the test from 2017 have gotten more difficult and you see new questions on them. This is the calc II class with the LEAST homework which is a plus.

Her lectures are extremely fast; write quickly and go over them later. Start HW early and go to office hours for help. She will tell you if you're right or not and help you with any problems you're having. Class gets progressively harder, make sure you know the earlier material or you're in trouble. She bumped me from an 89 to an A :D
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures are clear, easy to follow, but be ready to write quickly, she writes faster than any other professor I'd ever had.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Eklund delivers the material clearly and outlines her lectures well. She presents the material in a manner that is easy to learn, and she prepares her students well for the exams.
She's amazing!!!!!
Incredibly thorough, gives plenty of examples, great review before tests. Definitely plan to enroll in her class again!

Holly is amazing - best math teacher I've ever had. I had her for Calc II and III Honors. The classes were challenging, but if you're willing to try and ask for help, you will learn the material extremely well. Go to lectures because the examples she gives are super helpful for studying for tests. Get in her class if at all possible!!
She's the best! Hands down, favorite teacher.
Holly is such a great teacher. Her teaching style is very uniform, interesting, and easy to follow along. I had her for CalcII and this semester for CalcIII honors. Wonderful teacher
Calc 2 is hard but Eklund is a great teacher. If you're having difficulties, go up and talk to her and she will be very helpful.

She was a good teacher. She knew the material, taught it well and was very helpful. However she was a bit of a whirlwind when it came to notes so if you write slow you may have some trouble, and she certainly wasn't an easy teacher to have.
Loved her sooooooo much... TAKE TAKE TAKE!!! <3
Very hot and helpful

Had her for Calc II and III. Best calculus teacher I have ever had.  Very good pace, so expect to write the whole period; the examples you'll go through in class are really helpful when preparing for exams.
Good professor. Very willing to help and very organized with class materials
She is a very great teacher and really cares about your learning. Her office hours are also very useful.
She is an amazing professor, by far the best one I have had at the school! Take her class if you can.

Holly is an amazing teacher. I was an average at best math student in high school, but Holly helped me learn calculus inside and out. She is extremely nice and is willing to help students individually. I would HIGHLY recommend her! You won't regret it!
Holly is awesome! Such a great teacher and nice person!
My favorite teacher at mines so far!
By far THE best Calculus teacher I have ever had. Take good notes and make use of her office hours and you should have no problems at all :)
she was the best teacher at mines i've had so far!
Really good notes and always available to help!
pretty good overall
No Comments
Great teacher.

Despite Ammerman no longer being at Mines, I'm still giving him a 5 for teaching. I found his youtube lecture series for circuits, and despite a few lectures having bad audio, I learned so much more from his online lectures than I did in class.

I actually don't think it's possible to be better at teaching than professor Ammerman. I've had several really, really good teachers in my lifetime. They've each had their small flaws, but Ammerman has no flaws. Ammerman demonstrates that great professors can make a traditionally difficult class easy

Ammerman is by far one of the best professors I've had at mines. Very knowledgeable and super clear in his explanations. I had his class at 8 am and I honestly made my day. I learned a lot and I'm even more passionate now of my degree then I was when I started.

Amazing professor. His lectures are amazingly concise and intuitive, he is clear and methodical, and best of all: everything is online on youtube. Truly one of the best professors I've ever had. Great guy.

Dr Ammerman is the best professor I have ever had. He taught me everything I could possibly need for the exam, and I entirely owe my success to his amazing lectures and dedication. You wont find a better prof anywhere.

Dr. Ammerman was my favorite professor at mines and one of the reasons why I switched my major to EE.  I'm glad to see he is still teaching.  He cares and was good to me even though I was not his best student.

Dr. Ammerman presents a very clear process oriented approach to circuit analysis. He describes the concepts in a very concise fashion and is always willing to help students with homework problems or other academic issues.
Bomb dot com know the fundamentals, get good grades. No trick questions ever.

Dr. Ammerman is hands down my favorite professor at Mines. From Circuits 1 to Power systems analysis, he presents the information in a very intuitive way. I wish that everybody had the chance to take a class with Ammerman. Very Very highly recommended.

Ammerman is one of the best professors at Mines.  He is a very good lecturer and is super helpful.  Circuits can be hard for some students but he makes it very easy and interesting to learn.  I would definitely recommend him!

Dr. Ravel Ammerman is one of the best professors i have ever had at colorado school of mines. His lectures are so clear, he is always there to help and ask questions. He made me love circuits. And the best part is that he uploaded all of his lectures on youtube so if you missed a lecture or you needed to go over it again.
He is a good teacher who does his best. I did really poorly on the tests but most of it was my fault.

Ammerman is definitely one of the best instructors at Mines(if not the best). His lectures are clear and enjoyable, tests are fairly easy as long as you pay attention in class and do all the hw by yourself. He is a great person too! So if you are taking circuits try your best to get in his class.
Really good guy.
Great prof! Best I've had at mines, made the course understandable and grading was fair.

Awesome teach, always willing to help you step through a problem and figure out where you're going wrong, then makes sure you understand the concepts involve so you can solve problems like it in the future. Tests are super easy as long as you pay attention in class. Definitely recommended.

Amazing Professor. The best Mines has to offer. If you have a chance, get Ammerman. Never uses notes, but doesn't make mistakes either. Drawings and handwriting are amazing. Super easy to understand even if you are not the least bit electrical.
Gives a concise method to solve all circuitry problems. Asks students for answers to keep us on our toes. Kind.
Best Professor in the Electrical Engineering Department.
nifty guy but seemed to have a hard time answering questions other than the ones straight off of his notes.
Take his class at all costs!

His down to earth demeanor is inviting and its hard not to benefit from his well crafted teaching style. RPN user indicates he's all about finding the most systematically reasonable way to solve problems. If I wasn't an EE he would have convinced me to be one. Super nice patient guy who's encouraging and helpful in office hours and elsewhere.
Great Guy. Very Knowledgeable
Ammerman is a straight-shootin' son of a gun. But really though, best prof at the school.
Very helpful and very friendly. Explains the material VERY clearly
Yay Ammerman the Hammerman! Pretty circuits.

The best teacher in the world, hands down. Very organized notes that are extremely easy to follow. Explanations are very clear and methodical. Take him and you will want to be a power electrical engineer.
Really, really good teacher.  Good examples, clear teaching, very organized and knowledgeable.

Great use of examples and easy to comprehend.  Will explain in simple terms.  I am an EE major, has no issue helping non-EE majors understand material.  Tests are fair and homework is applicable to tests.  Responds to emails and is available in office hours.  Highly recomend this professor.
If you take circuits, get Ammerman, his method of teaching is unrivaled by any of the other circuits teachers
Ammerman is absolutely a stud.  If you take circuits, take it from him.  Most methodical professor I've ever had.  Hope to take other classes from him.
Ammerman is awsome
Great prof.
Great teacher with a logical approach...a must for Circuits I
Do not even think about getting another teacher for circuits, wait until the class is open and only take it with Ammerman!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Great teacher
No Comments
Excellent instructor; knows names of all students.  Very helpful in and out of class.
His cowboy boots are sooo sexy.
Clear, concise, smart.
He knows his stuff and he is good at presenting it
Deserves a raise so he can teach more classes at Mines.  He has the entire class notes memorized - neat handwriting and makes the majority of the other professors look inexperienced.
Great Teacher
Excellent teacher, it's too bad he doesn't teach more classes! If you need this class or have an interest, he makes it worthwhile.
Awesome! If you have the chance to get him for ANY class, DO IT.
No Comments
good professor, does a good job of making a sometimes boring and difficult subject halfway interesting
Great Teacher

Not good for teaching any class & not good person to communicate with. She would respond your emails making you feel bad. If you go to her office hours she might say "of, you should know this and that..." then why are we going to her office hours if we already know things.
Going to lectures are waste of time.
I won't recommend to take her class.

Read's lectures mostly consisted of slides but they were quality slides that helped me learn. Often brought up genuinely interesting topics. Is lenient about mistakes and helps students when they have problems. Appreciates genuine effort.

I had her for Comp Org and Data Base. Comp Org was a lot harder and not my favorite, but she was really nice in Data Base. She seems to be putting effort to make the class nice and I think that during my second semester having her she was pretty chill.
Read is not nearly as bad as people make her out to be when it comes to database. She was very knowledgeable and made the class nice.
Professor Read is a good prof and a good person. I have had her for 2 classes now. Don't be scared of the low ratings. Someone clearly has a vendetta against her.
Very nice professor and answers pretty much all questions. Honestly wasn't expecting much from databases but it was pretty fun.

As someone who took 341 and 403 with her, Read is a completely different teacher when it comes to Databases. It is clear she is very passionate about the topic and really wants students to succeed. I learned a lot and I'm thankful for the extra effort she put into the class content.
She gives you time to work on the worksheets during class. If you do this, you will master the material. Don't know why everyone on this site hates Amelia. She is a good teacher and a good person.

The low ratings for Prof. Read are unwarranted. I didn't want to take her class after reading RMP, but was forced to take her because I needed to graduate. She's great. I have no idea what all these bad reviews are about. She knows her material, is straightforward, will help outside of class, is fair, and no BS. Don't be scared to take her.

Ameilia plain and simply should not be teaching comp org. On the very first day of class, she said that she would "not be very helpful teaching the material" and would rather spend the lecture time doing example problems. Throughout the semester, I also heard her say things like "I am not a hardware person" and "I shouldn't be teaching this class."
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Lectures are videos watched before class(snooze). Class time is a speedrun with convoluted and complicated examples. only half of topics covered are seen in hw before exam day, so make sure to remember every topic forgot! exams are so unnecessarily difficult and hard. Have a question? Dont ask her, just put it in the terminal or the slides dummy.

Hope she graduates soon so future generations of Mines students don't need to take her. I physically cringed multiple times per lecture due to her unfunny jokes. Extreme danger to your learning. Avoid at all costs.
She is the worst, unable to talk to normal humans. Will go out of her way to make sure you get zeros on projects
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: As someone who took Read for 341, her 403 class is SUBSTANTIALLY better. She actually cares about the content and seems content to answer any questions students have. I still have a sour taste from her 341 class but the 403 class was fine. Do not be afraid to take 403 with her if you are basing it off of 341. It almost as if she is a new professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm ngl, she was given a bad rep in prev classes but has currently changed and is fantastic to learn from. She is super accessible outside of class and is knowledgeable in database management and how to work with cmd. I went to her office hours and she was amazing to talk to. Her attitude is meh but her knowledge and skills in CS are unmatched.
Not good :(

Read receives a lot of undeserved hate. Talk to her, ask about her day, sit in the front row, and participate.  She is a very kind person, especially if you take initiative. Also, she cares about student's learning and is excited when you understand the concept. And, she will spend hours trying to help in office hours. 

Prof's are people, too.

The reviews on here are manipulated - multiple bad reviews on one day. Also, clearly being submitted by one person because the tone of the reviews is the same. My experience with Read was good. Was kind & helpful at OH. Read's not the course lead for 341. That falls on Prof.Han. Didn't love 341 as a class, but Read is a good teacher & solid person.
I had her for 2 classes. She cried in both those classes. Her slides have full paragraphs in them, so it's really hard to take notes.

Dull yes, but the material may not be relevant: not her fault. Her office hours were helpful and frequent. From what I understand, she has been given orders to be hard and unforgiving, and to not teach outside of the zybooks. I think the department needs to re-evaluate themselves. I had her before she was told off: was fun and educational
She should not teach compOrg

I was one of those students that absolutely hated CSCI 341 with Professor Read. With that said, she is actually quite good at teaching Databases. She helped come up with the SQL standard way back in the day and it shows. She knows more about databases than most people should probably know and she can explain it very well. Take it for the easyish A

Excellently conveyed course content, textbook reading was redundant and slightly annoying, but she was generous with grading. The worksheet time during class really helped me digest the content, it was interesting content to me and the bugbowl wasn't too stressful. I took this course in the fall of 2021. The assignments were fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Not happy at all, she is simply not a good professor there really isnt more to say here.

This is my 2nd time taking a class w/ Prof. Reed. She is a great and chill professor, lectures are enjoyable and interesting, and feedback is super helpful. She is very understanding and lenient with deadlines. Prof was available for office hours on many occasions. She communicated everything clearly which made the class even easier

Well, I would first like to start out by saying that all of these ratings are absolutely inaccurate and do a poor job depicting Professor Read. I understand everyone is entitled to their own opinion but I encourage you to give her a chance. Professor Read's lectures are very technical and detailed. She's also kinda funny and has a sunny demeanor :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Read does not know how to communicate effectively or work with students when they are struggling and simply asks them questions instead of answering the students and leaves before ever getting to a correct answer.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Better cover your nose with that mask or you'll get the wrath. This was the most disappointing and difficult course I've ever taken. My specific section was taught by a 1st year educationally inept grad student, which was ridiculous, so I switched to Read's section about half way through and it was no better. Absolutely atrocious. Good luck.

Professor Read's distinct lack of empathy for her students in all aspects makes her classes quite a chore. She is unwilling to make compromises with her students and she makes the material and tests much harder than they need to be. She is willing to help students out of class, but this does not make up for the other parts of her teaching.

Amelia Read knows her stuff but she is not good at teaching. Her lectures are unhelpful and her slide annotation is often an incoherent mess. She locked the class recordings because students were supposedly using them as a replacement for class. The exams were inapplicable and the homework had many mistakes. Unhelpful in office hours as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Worst professor in the entire CS department. I should have known I was in for a wild ride after she yelled at us to shut up on the first day of class. Lectures are useless unless you copy every single thing she writes on the slides. Grading was inconsistent. Mines would be helping everyone by giving her the PhD and sending her somewhere far away.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Hope you enjoy unreasonable amounts of homework, unfair exams, unhelpful TAs, an unstructured class with a lack of direction, and a rude teacher that refuses to improve any of the classes she's teaching.

If you see the name Amelia Read scripted for one of your CS classes, run the other way. It's brutal. Comp Org has been a nightmare. Terribly formatted classes, difficult to take notes on, the exams are hilariously stupid and unrelated to anything taught in class. Just don't. Save yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had. Entire teaching method involves writing questions on slides, then annotating the answers. Something confusing? Want to go back and look at the slides for further clarification? TOO BAD. The posted slides only contain the question.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: At any cost don't take her. She is so bad at teaching and her slides are so useless.
Rude professor, does not seem to care about her students and does not seem to enjoy teaching. Unpleasant to deal with.

Amelia is nice, and I feel like she cares about her students. She gives good feedback and has lots of office hours. Perhaps it was the online format, but her lectures were a little difficult to sit through. I had a hard time paying attention and would often space out on the content. Besides that, I thought she was a good teacher.

There were 65 students enrolled in the class, only 20 showed up on a regular basis. Out of the 20, only 3 people actively participated and knew what was happening in the class. This should be enough to tell you what class was like. She regularly skips examples due to lack of time, but also assigns homework that is based on the examples. Don't take.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Amelia Read tries to emphasize with her students by complaining about her classes in the same manner that she pictures us complaining, but does so the entire lecture. She gives out unreasonable amounts of homework with completely inadequate lectures help. I genuinely thought the other reviews couldn't be true. Somehow, they could not be truer.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Please do yourself a favor and don't come within 50 feet of this woman. She is by far the worst CS professor I have had at this school. She does nothing but complain about school work and then bombards you with inordinate amounts of work. She is unnecessarily strict with deadlines and does not make this class enjoyable whatsoever. Save yourself.

Made me reconsider every life decision that has brought me up to this point. Never has a professor ruined a topic that was once so dear to my heart. She spends each class complaining about her grad school and obsessing over her pets. If only she spent that much commitment teacher her students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I've heard so many people rave about taking CSCI262, but I ended up struggling so much in the class. Expect to constantly lose points on projects (even if you think it's perfect). The first midterm seemed to be very easy, but there was no such thing as partial credit and questions were worth 5-20 points. Second midterm was death. Impossible.
Amelia Read is a extreme threat to your learning. Avoid at all costs.

Look at the three tags above, if you take a class with Read, expect none of these to be accurate. This was the most embarrassing, phoned-in attempt at teaching a fundamental computer science class I have ever witnessed. As said by others, if you study for the final in this class, you actually aren't. I wish the scale went below zero.

Similar and opposite words bad adjective 1. substandard poor inferior second-rate second-class unsatisfactory inadequate unacceptable not up to scratch not up to par deficient imperfect defective faulty shoddy amateurish careless negligent dreadful awful terrible abominable frightful atrocious disgraceful deplorable hopeless worthless laughable lam
If you study the practice final you may be prepared for a final in a different class, but not this one.

Professor Read is out of touch with students at Mines and should not be allowed to teach such a fundamental course to undergraduates. She spends too much time in lecture sharing about her personal life and does a poor job of understanding the challenges students face learning remotely.
Funniest guy on campus by far, but be ready to learn the content in the studio.

I never watched the online video lectures before class, and chuck still got my mind thinking about the content enough before studio, which is really all I wanted to get out of lecture anyway. I'll agree his lectures have some flaws, but they're still okay and he truly is hilarious and just a gem to be around.

was never around for office hours (no one in the phys department was) and when approached in studio (if he stayed the entire time) he would deflect or diverge from answering. The TA's were also extremely unhelpful in studio.

Professor Stone is a nice guy, and he is hilarious, but his lectures are not useful. It's hard to follow his train of thought. He moves all around the room which makes it hard to focus. We don't go over important concepts in class and mostly focus on surface level things. By the end of the semester, half the class stopped attending his lectures.
very kind professor

I struggled with Stone's lectures.
He's funny and goes on tangents so that helps, but I frequently left lecture without much more understanding than when I went in. In-class example problems often made me more confused. I think a lot of this was on the department level though.

He has tons of office hours to help with the tricky subject of phys 2. He goes tangents in lectures but that is what makes lectures fun. Overall good professor if you go to office hours with him to really understand the material.

Chuck is quite a gem. If you can get past the hour of time he wastes in class talking about unrelated subjects, the class is really quite good. I would attribute most of my ability in technical writing to his feedback in this class.

Physics lecture is pretty awful no matter who you take, but Chuck Stone makes class incredibly fun. He brought the entire lecture hall to tears with laughter a couple of times. 10/10 would recommend. As for class, DO NOT fall behind. Make sure you take advantage of the resources before you fall behind because it is almost impossible to catch up.
Dr. Stone is a nice guy, but if you're interested in learning physics I suggest trying a different professor.

Chuck Stone is a hilarious guy! He's very energetic in lecture and truly cares about the material he's teaching. However, he didn't have control over grading. His lectures were great and something I looked forward to. The examples he gave definitely helped me understand the material, which was tough.
Difficult to approach. Lectures are drawn out and fail to teach anything that sticks. Horrible studio prof, failed to answer questions, best to just wait for a TA to pass by.

I definitely reccomend taking Intro to Renewable Energy with Chuck. He is generally a funny guy, and he really cares about the well being of his students. He was super flexible with scheduling amid the COVID19 pandemic . Overall, very enjoyable class. Easy A, mostly group projects, you are graded on your participation only. 10/10.

Im very confused about all of the high ratings for Chuck. He was one of the worst professors I've taken. You're told to do a pre-lecture which consists of reading slides, then in class he just goes over the same slides you read the night before.. He never works examples during class or shows you ANYTHING that would correlate to HW or exams. Awful

No one is more enthusiastic about physics than Chuck Stone. He comes to class everyday excited about the material that we are to learn in studio. He sometimes goes on long tangents about stuff that is unrelated but ends with a joke. He has never personally helped me but he seems like a great guy who is well liked. He is definitely not boring.

Chuck Stone will just makes the day better. Great prof to take if you do better at reading material and learning on your own then learning from a lecture. Play along with class, read the pre lecture notes, do ALL of the Lon Capa studio-and homework and your studying for a test will consist of figuring out what room ur in.
Really tall
Really funny dude, not the best teacher but the class is a joke. Also he is really caring!

Chuck Stone was a friendly and approachable professor. He held many study sessions for finals and was always happy to answer questions to help you prepare for the tests. Phys 2 had some abstract concepts but he brought it down to earth. Always read the lecture slides and ask questions.

Chuck is a great professor for certain learning styles. Packed lectures for those who like to be taught, and detailed slides for those who like to read. He has a great sense of humor and makes complicated things seem simple. He doesn't dish out exam hints, but will help you prepare super well if you ask questions.

Chuck Stone is a genius and a child. He may not always explain everything you need to know for the test but he does give great lectures and is a fantastic teacher. He is oddly funny and makes you want to be his friend. Beware the "Stone Zone," the areas where he calls on students the most. This is along the sides, the front row, and the back row.
Chucks lectures are horrible and teach you almost nothing about physics 2. We would go to other professors and trade off with classmates to see who had to go to his lectures.
He takes a bit getting used to, but he's an amazing professor. He clearly loves to teach, and that shines through in his lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: He takes a while to get to his point but he really explains things thoroughly. Just don't ask him questions in studio.

Chuck Stone is a national treasure. He is the most entertaining prof at Mines. He is not the best lecturer of material, but honestly, the majority of the learning in phys 2 is in studio, not lecture. What you'll get out of Stone's lectures are good slides and some of the best entertainment you'll ever get from a prof.

Chuck was one of my favorite freshman teachers. He's funny and engaging with students, and he somehow made it easy to stay awake at 8:30am. I had taken physics 2 in high school so I recommend not taking him if you're uncomfortable with physics, but he taught the material,& his powerpoints were superb. Not best teacher but you will learn if you want

Stone is not really good explaining anything. Without fail he wastes the first 10-15 minutes of class blabbering about things that don't even relate to physics. He doesn't work through examples very well. He often tells jokes that aren't funny and calls on people who don't raise their hand. If you want to learn physics, do NOT get Stone.

I didn't care for his constant jokes and drawn out explanations. By the time he actually finished one cohesive thought, I already forgot what the beginning was about because of the number of tangents he went on.

Chuck can go off on crazy stories as he's lecturing so if you have trouble discerning what to pay attention to normally in a lecture don't take him. If you have him for studio ask the TAs questions not him because he will go over it with you in too much depth and you'll run out of time. I however enjoyed his personality and it kept me engaged.

Chuck gets a bad rap but he's actually a really fun guy who understands the material very well. If you ask for help during office hours or studio don't expect a quick answer that will only help you answer one question. His answers are long-winded and circuitous, but once he finally gets around to the answer it'll be extremely helpful.
Very funny! Made the subject pretty fun and easy.

He is really crazy in lecture, as well as disrespectful to students much of the time. His PowerPoint slides are always really busy and he just reads them off, you don't really learn anything extra by listening to him. If you ask him for help in studio he either isn't helpful or takes twice as much time as it would take any TA to explain it.

Stone spends a lot of time trying to be funny and the students suffer for it. He's unnecessarily harsh and his presentations are paragraphs cut straight from the textbook that he reads verbatim and are often over 30 slides. Unless you're ready to teach yourself the material it's better to go to Kohl's lecture for more concise, helpful teaching.

Awesome professor.  Really cares about his students and physics.  Makes a challenging, boring class ad fun as possible. The tests are hard, but there is enough extra credit/other points to keep a good grade.
Super funny guy! Easiest class to pay attention in. He's a great professor but most people find the class challenging. Definitely recommend.

Chuck Stone was very good about keeping my attention in class due to his sporadic personality. He gives the same essential information as the other teachers, as far as equations, plus the only way to learn physics is to practice. He is a very out there guy, but I thoroughly enjoyed him. You have to be able to deal with a spontaneous teacher though.
Charismatic and funny.  Don't expect to learn everything from lecture (in physics, you need to practice to really learn).  Will help you outside of class.

The only positive I have for Stone is that never fell asleep in lecture. But abrasive doesn't begin to describe his personality; he often strayed from lecture to tell the class that we were all lazy idiots, and we were letting our parents down. And I can't tell if he's constantly under the influence, or just a little nutty.

He is one of the best proff's I ever met.. He likes his job.. he keeps you awake.. you gotta work hard in his class.. He is very helpful but only if you ask for help! What makes him special is that he is down to Earth even if he is the smartest ! I highly recommend him :D
Stone is a funny dude, but definitely an awful teacher. I had Stone all semester and then went to one of Ruskell's lectures and learned a lot more. And even Ruskell kinda sucks.

Being at Mines, the class should be difficult. He may be quirky but he does keep me interested in Physics as he teaches what you will need to know for the test and also how it is applicable to the modern world.

Not the best lecturer and often comes off as abrasive. He, along with Dr. Flournoy, are very strict graders and not lenient on grades. Dr. Stone, however, is very helpful to individuals inside and out of the classroom and is very charismatic about the material. He encourages students to live a safe and smart life.
Kind of a jerk sometimes, but he kept me awake in class
He doesn't actually teach you anything, none of the physics teachers do. You have to learn it on your own or from the T.A.s
No Comments
Very difficult to work with overall, not accessible outside of class. Grades on assignments were graded months late and

The only thing keeping me from giving a 5 here is that it took 2 months for an assignment to be graded. However this is an isolated incident (I think). CPW is a really smart guy and genuinely wants his students to do well. Lots of help and resources available and was always willing to answer questions. Timely replies to emails, just a great prof.
Great Prof
My king, he is very helpful in and outside of class even though the grading scale can be a pain at some points

CPW is a gem among educators, radiating warmth, flexibility, and kindness. His approachability and willingness to adapt make learning a joy. Whether through thoughtful emails or accommodating assignments, CPW ensures every student feels supported.  Without hesitation, I recommend CPW for an enriching academic experience.

CPW is top-notch! Their zeal for Database Management is captivating. They're accommodating, extend deadlines, and transform tough concepts into enjoyable learning experiences. Don't pass up the chance to take any course with them!"
CPW is exceptional! Their passion for Data Structures and Algorithms is contagious. They're understanding, grant tons of extensions, and make complex topics engaging. A must-take teacher!

CPW made the learning material digestible with well-written and engaging lectures that encouraged me to ask questions and truly understand the course content. He placed an emphasis on making sure students learned the content, while also being available to help on an individual basis and adjust deadlines to ensure our success as students.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I loved the way CPW taught and the extension policy is very generous, however I have beef with the grading scale.  The class is graded on a custom ESNU scale that is really confusing to learn.  Beyond that the exams are graded harshly.  To get an S required little to no errors.  The retake policy is generous, and I had to use it to get an A.

CPW's unique grading scheme can be confusing at first (many students excessively complained about it), but it is designed to encourage learning and understanding of the material. The retake/redo policy coupled with graceful extensions allows students to easily fit all of the work in a busy schedule.
GOAT

King. CPW is your granddad at Mines. He always gives extensions. He will sit and walk you through every step of your homework to help you find bugs. Genuinely cares about your interest and engagement with the material. I found the flipped classroom to be somewhat unhelpful, but idk if that's totally in his control.

CPW is the GOAT. He reignited my love for CSCI after taking 200. I broke my ankle during the semester and he was very accommodating (more so than other prof). I think some people give him bad cred during lectures but I see his lectures as educational and informative. Do be prepared for a flipped classroom and new grading scheme.

This is probably the weirdest structure you will have for a Mines CS course, but play along with the game and you'll find it's is incredibly easy. All assignments have no penalty extensions and class time consists of group work/discussion and instructor feedback. CPW and all the TA's are more than willing to help your learning every chance they get

While CPW is a very nice professor and is always willing to help, he does not teach well. The flipped classroom does not work and it affected my interest in this class greatly. He expected us to watch 30-50 min lectures outside of class only to come to class for 50 minutes where we did not learn a single thing. Wish the class was laid out better.
Very helpful in office hours and through email. Also very generous with deadlines and grading. Seems like he actually cares about you learning the material.
If there is one prof to take, it would be CPW. Hands down the best person every who actually cares about your learning.
easy!

CPW is my favorite professor. He's a very kind and genuine person and you can tell he cares about his students. He doesn't make deadlines for arbitrary reasons and is a very reasonable individual. He often gauged how the class was feeling about certain projects/deadlines and made adjustments based on that feedback. Definitely a king

CPW is such a great professor and it's clear that he really cares about student learning. I personally loved this class even though it was a bit of a challenge as it was my first college CS course. Really engaging lectures, always there to help during and outside of class. In general a really great professor!
easiest CS class I've taken at Mines, CPW is awesome
Amazing teacher. Take him.

CPW is by far my favorite CS professor at Mines. He genuinely cares about all of his students and is extremely understanding during this pandemic, unlike most all of my other professors. Wish he taught more CS electives, I'd love to have him as a professor again.

Rare example of a Mines professor who has a good class policies and is effective at teaching online. You can easily cover weeks of material in a short amount of time because the way he teaches is straight to the point.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: CPW is super cool and cares a lot about his students. He gives interactive homework and is a very fair grader.
I have had two classes with CPW and both were not challenging and learning a lot! I would 10/10 recommend him and would love to take another course with him :-)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: CPW is really awesome. He is probably the best CS professors at Mines. He actually cares about students and knows how difficult it can be at times. He allowed me to turn in assignments late when I had personal issues going on with near zero deductions.

Database was laid back but still required a good amount of work to get an A on quizzes, midterms, and projects. The biggest mistake I saw in his class was people taking it too relaxed. CPW has interesting things to say so show up to lectures!

He is the nicest professor I think I've ever had. He is incredibly helpful, enthusiastic, and is overall an absolute gem. Database management is an incredibly boring class but CPW is the best, so it balances out.

He is human, unlike most professors. There are times when he makes mistakes and he is up front about them. He wants all of his students to receive an A in his classes, but you still have to work for it. The best of both worlds.

CPW is one of the best CS professors in my opinion. His lectures are straightforward and easy to understand. He has a very dorky sense of humor, so be prepared for some bad jokes (that still might make you laugh). Overall, CPW is extremely effective, and made Data Structures a fairly interesting class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: CPW is a phenomenal professor. He's extremely knowledgable and a very good writer and articulator. If you want to know about the depth or nuances of a particular topic, CPW is your guy. Data Structures is a fairly straightforward class. I highly, highly recommend taking it with CPW.
Awesome dude.

CPW's the best teacher at Mines that I've had! His lectures can be a bit dull, but he wants to make sure you understand the content. He's approachable and helpful during office hours and I never felt embarrassed to ask questions. Some days he asks questions during class where you answer for patricipation points so be sure to attend his lectures.

CPW is a great professor who is really helpful during office hours. Some of the assignments for the class are difficult, but he makes sure to have clear criteria for the assignments and includes hints/instructions. The exams were in class, and they weren't too difficult as long as you understood the concepts.

CPW will always be my favorite prof at Mines. He clearly cares about his students' learning and will spend extra time explaining concepts to anyone who is truly trying to learn. He is also lenient on due dates and understands that other school/life things happen. I honestly don't think enough good things can be said about CPW's teaching.

Took data structures with CPW. He often moved the dates for homework and projects and gave extra credit on almost all assignments. He's a caring professor and was always present for office hours, often times staying longer to help students. Lectures are a little dull at times, but that's often the problem with basic coding lectures.
CPw is the best prof I've ever had. He cares about how you do in the class and will go out of his way to make sure his students are successful. I would take him for any class if you get the chance.
CPW is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. He is always willing to scheduled individual office hours, and you always leave feeling like you have actually learned the material.
A lot of professors at this school could learn something from CPW.
CPW goes above and beyond to help all students. I've taken him for Elements of Computing Systems, and am currently in Database Management, and he's an excellent professor for both.

The best professor at this school, and nobody else even comes close. CPW will take every minute possible to help you succeed. He loves his subject matter and he and his students have a large mutual respect for one another. I rated this for CSCI262 but it applies to any of his classes.
Dr. CPW is a tremendous asset to the Mines community; his enthusiasm is contagious and he genuinely cares about teaching the material. Best teacher I've had at mines!

CPW must be one of the best professor at Mines. I am not a CS major, but I do enjoy his class a whole lot. He is patient with explaining, not much tests. Just do hw and you will get good grades. He is always will to schedule office hours for individuals.

CPW is able to make everthing easy to be understood, and he is always there when you need help.  A great person worth getting to know. Participation never matters. Only one exam which is final. You will get an A if you finish homeworks with high quality.
CPW is one of my favorite professors at Mines. He really makes it all about the students and what is best for them.

Sower was such a kind professor and cares so much about her students. She constantly offered encouragement to students, was always available (both in and out of lecture) to ensure people understood class content, and even did fun things like bring in candy bins to be passed around the lecture hall every so often. 100/10 recommend her for Chem 1!

Moves very slowly and goes over many examples in lecture. Encourages questions. Is overall a very kind and friendly professor. If you have good attendance in class and keep up with homework and extra credit you will get a decent grade.
She is an amazing chem 1 professor, always encouraging students and has great attitude! I would definitely recommend choosing her as your chem 1 professor if you can.

Sower was great for Chem 1. She always makes sure that students understand the material and encourages questions heavily. She used clickers for participation grades in class but is very lenient on the grading. She offers plenty of extra credit and is very clear on scheduling, logistics, etc. 100% recommend her for Chem 1.

Professor Sower was awesome for Chem 1! She lectures at a good pace and covers stuff in a way that makes sense (and answers questions well in-class), she also gives good timelines for the homework. She sometimes leaves clickers open by accident which is kind of nice :). SHe does give acitvities and pre-class clickers.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Probably one of the best teachers on campus!!! She is so sweet, you can tell she loves chemistry and wants all her students to succeed in her class. She is super easy to talk to. If you have any problems at all, go to her office hours.
Prof Sower is an extremely sweet and kind professor who truly cares about each and every student. She goes the extra mile for any student.
Dr. Sower is one of the nicest professors you'll ever meet. She really cares about students learning and is always available to answer questions outside of class.

Dr. Sower is the most kind and caring teacher I've ever had. She knows everybody's names, and tries SO hard to make class fun. She puts lots of time and thought into her presentations and makes sure everybody knows the content before moving on. You can tell she loves teaching and loves her job. I HIGHLY recommend taking her class!
Caring teacher but was not good at explaining content

While I despised Chem 2, this was largely due to the overall class structure, which is punishment based on the homework, labs, participation, etc. However, Sower does her best to make her lectures engaging. She is probably the kindest professor I've had at mines, and while I absolutely hated the class, she did her best to make it bearable.

Dr. Sower is one of the nicest professors you will find at Mines. Dr. Sower does her best to have very meaningful lecture time and tries to make it enjoyable for everyone.  It is worth it to take the 8AM sections for chem to get her as your professor.  She is also very helpful with course reminders.

Dr. Sower is one of the sweetest, kindest professors I've ever had. She genuinely cares about the students and making sure that everyone is understanding the material. She is worth taking the 8 am sections for both Chem I and II.

Dr. Sower was one of the best lecturers I've had so far at Mines! She is engaging in lecture and covers the course material in a way that makes it make sense. She is always available for help outside of class, manages to know pretty much everyone in her 100 person lecture by name, and truly wants her students to succeed. Take her class if you can!

Literally one of the best teachers for gen chem. She's the sweetest person and she cares for her students and their learning. Super accessible and approachable outside of class and her lectures are super engaging. You can tell she knows what she's talking about and is super intelligent and kind. 10/10 my fave prof at Mines so far.
She is so helpful and a kind soul and reviews and explains the material well. 10/10

Dr. Sower is AMAZING. I organized my entire course schedule around taking her class. She really cares about her students and goes out of her way to make sure we are doing well. She explains content clearly. Every lecture has a lot of clicker questions though, so don't miss class.
She is very good at teaching Chem 2 as if we have never taken it before. A lot of professors teach it less descriptively while she makes sure we know how stuff works and why.

Sower is an amazing prof all around. Every morning she would bring a positive attitude to class and she would go out of her way to make sure people understood the material. Probably the sweetest prof you could ask for
Great lectures and helpful. Is open to questions and extra help despite it being the largest class size on campus
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Sower is a very clear lecturer, always responds to emails very fast, is excited when you come into office hours, and is a gem of a person, quite frankly the opposite of sour. Take her class if you can!
Prof Sower is really nice and her lectures are super easy to follow. She made an 8am Chem class worth it! :)

Dr. Sower is very kind, knowledgeable, and approachable. I was quarantined for part of this semester, and she made sure that I was given the resources and attention I need. Go to her office hours! She will be very helpful and fun to talk to!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Sower genuinely cares about every one of her students. Even when she has 100+ students in a single class, she is always willing to sit down one on one with you to help. She is always positive and is very understanding. I highly recommend her!

Absolutely an amazing prof. She clearly teaches because she is good at it and wants to be there. I found office hours super helpful. She never shamed me for knowing things that I should have. She helped me work through problems and always wanted me to grow.

Sower is my favorite teacher I have had at Mines. She explains material clearly and thoroughly, but more importantly, she really cares about her students. She knows almost all of her students in 200+ seat lecture halls by name, is incredibly easy to access outside of class and by email, and has a contagiously positive attitude. 10/10!!

Dr. Sower is incredibly kind, caring, approachable, and literally is always smiling! She is very professional and intelligent on all topics of chemistry. She is always willing to meet with you one on one outside of class and never makes you feel like your questions are dumb. I would absolutely recommend!

Sower is wonderful and caring. She is always willing to take time out of her day to help any of her students . She is very encouraging and always makes an effort to say things like "What a great questions" and "Did I answer?" to encourage learning and make sure everyone understands.

Sower is wonderful. Very approachable outside of class and willing to help. She seems like she actually cares about her students and what shes teaching which makes the world of difference. Class is tough and moves rather fast but it helps having a prof that you can talk to.

She is super nice and is willing to explain things in depth. However, sometimes when you talk to her she completely forgets to do what you ask. I was waiting for her to load in my iclicker points all semester and had to remind her multiple times. If you do not show up for one day it is automatically two points off of your participation grade:(
Professor Sower does a really great job teaching. Definitely knowledgeable and a good lecturer but all really enjoys helping out students.
This professor should be rated higher in my opinion. Her lectures are very well laid out, and she's very good at explaining things. She really cares about her students.

Dr. Sower is an excellent Professor. She explains the material well with lots of slides that makes it easy to take notes. She normally works through a range of example problems. She is also always open to questions and does a good job answering them.

Angela Sower is very approachable and caring. Chem 2 was the first chem class I took at Mines after taking AP Chem in highschool and she made it very easy to pick up where I had left off without taking chem 1.
Sower is a great teacher who inspires her students. Chem isn't really my thing but I still enjoyed her lectures.
Sower is adorable and really wants to help everyone! Did I answer?

Hardest class I have taken. I am not good at chemistry but I didn't realize I was this bad. Barely passed the class even though I worked extremely hard. Prof Sower is an excellent teacher and very nice. Nothing against her, Chem 112 is just a really hard class. The online homework is extremely challenging as well as the tests.

She's such a nice teacher everyone loves her 3 sometimes lectures can be boring and you might fall asleep, but she will always be there for you to help you in her office hours which she always shows up on. Overall, she's a great professor I'd give her 4.7/5.
Sower is an adorable woman with catchphrases like "Great question!" and "Did I answer?" The lectures can be on the dry side but she is always willing to help you understand the material.
Tough Exam and confusing lectures

She teaches in a lecture hall, so lessons are unpersonalized. However, she is very available during her office hours and extremely  helpful then. Also has a great personality. Would take again. Would date.
Overall she was a great professor. The only problem I had was at times I couldn't read her handwriting at all. I also really hate chemistry and she made it bearable.

She is a great professor who is always there for the students and wants to make sure everyone understands the material. Sometimes she may do it too much and can go off-course, but she stays on track with everyone understanding chemistry. I recommend taking her course if you don't like chemistry.
Easy homework and tests. Easy to understand.

Sower is really nice and her lectures may seem repetitive but you leave feeling good about the material. I found her easy to understand. She really wants to help if you aren't understanding any material.
Great professor who truly cares about his students. Had to go to office hours and he made sure I understood the content before I left.
He is a very good professor that lectures at a good pace and provides all of the information in a simple manner (Calc 1). He's great!
A great professor cares about students and their well being.

Westhof is a gem in the math department. Notes and lecture recordings are always posted after class in case you were absent or missed something during lecture. He truly cares about his students and puts a big emphasis on mental health. His dedication to building a good rapport and being available makes it easy to ask for help as well :)

I loved taking Westhof for DiffEq. He always made the concepts easy to understand, and he was always super approachable for help when I needed it. He also posts notes after class which were always super helpful for our homework and exams.

I had taken a Calc 1 class with Professor Westhof. He is a nice person. The issue is that he does not care much about the class and our education. He would fail to show up to class on multiple occasions. Sometimes they were valid, but the majority of the time was due to him not wanting to teach in-person. Don't waste your time, money, and effort.

I liked Westhof. His teaching style was slow for me, making lecture somewhat boring, but I believe that's more the course than the professor. He really cares about students, both in words and in action. He was willing to move a test for me when I was going through some life stuff.

Christian Westhof is BY FAR the best professor I've had at mines. He deeply cares about student's mental health. He is super approachable, whether you want to talk to him about something school related or not. I wouldn't hesitate to say he works to jobs. He's a full time professor and a full time therapist for students. 100/10, would take again.
Westhof is super caring and accessible outside of class. He posts lectures and extra material which was super helpful.

Professor Westhof is one of the most caring human beings I've ever met. Unfortunately, he just doesn't have a very good teaching style. His lectures are not very linear and are often confusing and hard to follow. I relied on recitations from the TA to catch up my understanding. But he is super accessible outside of class and very flexible.

Christian Westhof cares deeply about his students' health - both mentally and physically. His lectures are also easy to follow. He's easy to talk to as well as gives good individual feedback. He's also easy to talk to if you have troubles outside of lectures. Its refreshing to have a professor that cares a lot about his students.
He is very caring about his students and is understanding. He teaches material so that it doesn't overwhelm students but explains thoroughly and answers questions. Great teacher, 10/10 recommend.

First things first. This man is one of the best people at Mines. He is so caring and kind. However, he needs a few more years before he really has the material down. Respect him in class for the love of god. Do not ask questions every five seconds and disrupt class. Let him speak. I would take him for calc 1 and 2, just not diff eq yet.

This was Prof Westhof's first semester teaching DiffEq, so there was some hiccups at times. He is very understanding of the struggle that students go through and offers inspirational advice at the beginning of class. I could tell as the semester went on he spent a lot of time outside of class studying the material himself to improve teaching it.

If you are looking for a math professor, Professor Westhof should be your go-to choice. He constantly emphasizes the importance of mental health to students and does his best to know many students on a first-name basis. He is very understanding about the workload of calc and is accomodating in as many ways he is able to be.

This is my first rating of a professor and I would like to say that this is the best professor at Mines in the Mathematics department. If you get him for Calc 1/Calc 2 like me, you will not regret it but instead be blessed with a hardworking professor that wants you to actually succeed. He is super helpful and is very knowledgeable in his teachings

One of the best professors I have had. He truly cares about student success and will go above and beyond to help you understand the material. He was able to find time out of his schedule for office hours since I could not make any other times.

He does not seem like he knows what he is talking about when it comes to Diff eq. He will go backwards in lectures to fix mistakes he made in previous lectures. Does not explain why things in DIff eq. happen and does not seem to know the material well.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had him for calc 1 and really liked him, but as a differential equations teacher he is awful. He continually solved problems incorrectly and makes it pretty obvious he has no idea what hes doing. He doesn't use the correct terminology in class so the hw looks like a different language.
I love Westhof, he's a really great professor and takes time out of the class to make sure you are doing ok. All around a great professor

Westhof really cares about his students and is a phenomenal teacher and person, I am so going to get him for calc II. He also skips class quite often and suggests that you do as well to keep yourself healthy.
Prof Westhof is nice but he probably skips class more than we do lol. Other than that hes a great choice!

Christian is a genuine leader as well as a great teacher. He is extremely personable and always willing to work with you. Calc 2 isn't an easy course, but it is made much easier with Christian! You won't regret taking a class with him, guaranteed!
Christian is caring and an amazing professor

I've never met a teacher who cares quite as much as him about the emotional well-being of his students. He will make time for you even if it's inconvenient for him. Class is rarely manditory and he is lenient on tests and homework. I will definitely opt. to have him again next year.
I took all my math courses with him, except for one which I got a B on. He is an amazing professor, he may be the best I have ever had in mines. I took 10 credits worth of courses with him.
Had him for calculus 2. Overall, a genuine and nice guy. Explains material clearly, doesn't waste your time, and always willing to explain further and make sure you understand what you're doing.

Westhof is all around one of the most caring professors I have ever met. He really makes a point to make sure that you know that youre more than just a grade. Hes a very personable person and is willing to admit when he makes a mistake. Hes also willing to always help.

Westhof knows calculus very well while being a super chill professor. Do the pre-class, then the rest of the class is him trying to make you understand the lesson further (which is very helpful). Very caring and will try to get to know his students. He listens to suggestions on the class!

Christian is by far one of my favorite professors I've had at Mines. He has a very laid back personality, and explains the material clearly and in a relatable way. He is also very personable, and knows his students on a personal level. It's too bad more professors here aren't like him.

The teaching style of a introduction video the night before followed by further explanation and practice problems was very helpful, as was mymathlab. He knew the names of every student in the class and seems overall to be a very cool guy who knows his content.

At first I was a little wary of his teaching style, but it proved very effective when exams rolled around. He really helped me understand where the equations came from without exhausting us with boring proofs. He's also just a really great guy
Made calc 2 extremely easy to learn for me and always answered my questions. Extremely good at explaining complex concepts too..

I never really had a Professor stick out to me before taking Christian's class. From the start, he was laid back, relatable and completely understanding. Christian was the only professor who made it clear that he genuinely cared about my wellbeing when I dealt with family losses. Calc 2 is hard overall with the little lecture, but he helped a ton.

Christian knows his stuff. He is always willing to help with worksheets or even just check over them with you to make sure notation looks good before turning them in, and is one of the best math teachers I have ever had. I will recommend to anyone who asks.

Christian is a good teacher but I am in the active learning class which means he doesn't lecture in class. Not the biggest fan of it, but Christian seems like a good teacher in a normal class setting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I've taken christians class for 2 semesters for calc 1 and calc 2 and he's given me an A both times.
