Calc 1 I just thought was easy in general but Calc 2 I struggled to get the grades I needed and was really close between an A and a B and he really helped me out since I went to class everyday and did well on the homework.  He grades easily on ws's
Really chill and cool, but might not be the best math prof. You don't have to show up, but its recommended. Really liked him, and had him for both calc 1 and 2.

Loved him. I had a grad student for Calc 1 and ended up withdrawing and taking Calc 1 again. He would start class with an example from the last class and then teach the new material. After a short lecture, he would help apply the lessons to actual problems. I did way better in his class.
Helpful and tries to make it learning the material easier for the students.
Awesome guy! Very helpful and nice. He likes to get the class involved in lessons, which I liked a lot. I would highly recommend him!
He's Dope!!
Did not seem to know the material himself.
He was terrible at explaining topics in class and was not available often outside of class. He has a funny personality but does not do well as a teacher.

Gus Grievel is by far one of the best math professors I have had. Not only does he possess exceptional knowledge in mathematics, but he also excels at relating topics to everyday situations, which greatly helps his students conceptualize what they are learning.

Gus is without a doubt the best math teacher I've ever had. Every lecture was engaging, funny, and informative. Lectures could be dense, but in return we got one day a week to work on homework in class and I never found the pacing too fast. His explanations for abstract concepts were great and he made me want to show up to lecture each day. 10/10

Professor Grievel was seriously a great professor. I unfortunately failed CALC3 once previously, and while some of that blame goes on me, a big part of it was that my previous professor didn't lecture in a remotely effective way. Gus Grievel was a complete switch from that, providing engaging and useful lectures consistently.

Gus made me interested to learn the content in calc III. Every single day, he comes in with the same energy and MOVES through content without it being too confusing. He also gives us in class work time for the worksheets. Would definitely recommend.

taking math223 with prof. grievel was an awesome. even though the class was an 8am, he always made lectures interesting and i was actually invested in learning. homework sets were certainly useful for topic mastery and preparing for midterms and the final, which were reasonably difficult but easy to study for. 10/10 would take again.

Professor Grievel is one of the best math teachers I have ever had. He did a wonderful job explaining concepts, and did plenty of examples in class. Homework and studios make up a large portion of the grade, so tests aren't quite as important as some classes. Overall great person and great math professor.

For Calc 3 honors, Gus ran the class really well. Lectures had a lot of information but had witty jokes as well. The studio component of the class had you and a group work on a problem set together, which actually helped a lot. Overall, Gus coordinated this class really well. Also he grades stuff FAST.

I had Gus for honors Calc II & III and he gave the best lectures. He is not super human so there were a few boring lectures, but it's Calc and that's gonna happen. He created a super lax environment in his class and was focused heavily on student growth. He was a fair grader, but that doesn't mean easy. All in all, my favorite prof at this school.

Professor Grieval is amazing. He teaches very well, and you can tell he cares about you and the material. The only reason I gave him a 4 was because he assigns pre-lectures that are 2+ hours long and in class we do worksheets. Don't know how they fit all this material in the normal online classes. Worksheets are pretty hard, have biweekly quizzes.

Prof. Grievel is not only a great professor, but also just a kind, real, and honest guy overall. Though his class takes work (and sometimes a lot with the number of online lectures), he commits to his students if they are committed, and really helps them to succeed. In this class, you will work, but the work will be worth it. 11/10 recommendation.

He was a great teacher, even for an 8 am class. Explained things very well, always answered question. Only complaint I have that drug the score down a lot was that before each class there were 3 hour lecture videos. Im not sure how that got fit in in a normal class (I took online) but with everything in my schedule it was too much.

He was the best teacher I had this semester! Super funny and very good at lecturing. I learned so much and thoroughly enjoyed his class. Tests were super reasonable as well. Always included problems similar to the examples in lecture, and I wasn't sure about the math studio at first, but ended up really enjoying it.

I had Professor Grievel for Calculus II short form at 7am in the morning. This class could have been terrible with a boring teacher, but he did a great job of keeping lectures fun and having high energy even so early in the morning which infected the lecture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: Gus was very enthusiastic during lecture and it made it easier to pay attention. He was very thorough in explaining things. His tests were very fair and entirely based off the notes and homework examples. I felt like I learned the course material well enough.

A real great professor. Not only does he teach clearly, does plenty of examples, pretty funny, but his tests are FAIR. Doesn't throw any curveballs unless it's an extra credit problem. The tests literally are on what he teaches and the homeworks. How it should be! Well done.

One of the best professors I have had and probably will ever have. Definitely won't fall asleep in his lectures as they are engaging and most of the time quite funny. Office hours are also super helpful. Class comes with a two hour studio which is super helpful and actually kind of fun.

Gus was a phenomenal calculus teacher, and it is very clear by the first day that he is both experienced and very capable of teaching the material. In the class, there is only optional homework and almost every assessment or studio can be redone for half to full credit. He also has office hours where he is glad to walk you through the material.

If you are in his Honors class there is a lab which sucks but all labs do so it's not him. He is a really funny guy with really clear technique, so listen and show up to class even though it's not mandatory. Makes math even more fun. 10/10 I would take his class again. Just put in the work because hell its Mines.
Gus is pretty funny and really good at teaching math. Usually pretty understanding and generally a cool guy.

Guss is an American hero. His lectures are incredible and interesting enough to keep your attention throughout calc 3. Also, he does lots of geometric proofs so if you are a visual thinker or enjoy learning conceptual applications, then I would be sure to get Guss. He is an invested teacher that is very helpful and understanding.
Can highly recommend Gus, he is one of the best professors I've ever had.
Honestly he changed my college career. He has a great growth mindset and is easy to talk to so if you are ever struggling he's easy to approach for if you want to improve your grade.

Grievel's Calc 3 lectures are LONG. His proofs are long and if you aren't motivated to stay engaged throughout you won't learn much. If you do pay good attention he explains things very clearly and makes Calc 3 seem simple. He's a fun guy who makes plenty of jokes that no one laughs about. And he didn't really assign homework ;).
Worst professor I have ever had in math
Great professor, great sense of humour, and teaches statistics very well. Knows how to push a class that isn't putting in quite enough effort, too.
He makes complicated ideas seem simple by going through the rationale behind each new concept. Also, he's hilarious.
Had him for Calc 3 Honors after taking Calc 3 in high school.  Best math teacher I've ever had. Clear explanations, easy to talk to, fun quips.  Definitely go for him if you have the chance.
His explanations are very clear, and there is class time for doing worksheets with your classmates. Great teacher, not a snob.

He's an amazing calc teacher. Always very helpful and tries to cater to every possible learning style. He really knows how to explain complex and abstract calc topics and proves the need to make good math choices.
Teaches you to make good math choices that save time and effort
The most helpful and fun math teacher I've ever had
Greatest Teacher Ever!!!!!!!
Must have!
He was the best math teacher I have ever had.  Very easy to talk to, great help.  He still remembers me and I'm a senior now.
No Comments
He was a great teacher to start off my Mines career with.  Concise and to the point with plenty of humor to keep people interested.  One of the best.
Best Math Teacher I have had at Mines.
Gus is concise and clear.
Awesome teahcer in all ways. He teaches in a way that makes you actually pay attention and laugh and went to Mines too, so he knows what it like to go here.
my friend wants to marry him

I had him for the make-up CalcIII course. He helped me in every way possible short of cheating for me so that I passed and wouldn't have to take CalcII and CalcIII for CalcIII credit.   He went above and beyond for me not to mention being a great professor.
Very clear, alot of notes, but explains things very well. Fun guy that cares about what he does.
Good guy, good teacher
very clear and well organized, also has a sense of humor
Good lectures, presents information so it can be easily digested.

Dr Ruskell was hilarious. Lecture was a joke in terms of learning I only showed up for credit. But if you had questions or went to office hours he was at least good at answering them. Most of my problems are with the department as a whole.

When it comes to a physics course, none of the professors are going to be very easy. However, Ruskel is probably on the better side of teachers. He explains himself pretty well, and keeps the lectures interesting. Physics is just hard though.
He is a good guy and a good lecturer. Physics just kinda sucks tho.
Todd was a great lecturer, he clearly has passion for the subject and he wants to see his students succeed.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Lots to not like about Todd. Not only did he blatantly state that he was not the most qualified for the job, but he proved it courtesy of his horrible lectures and unwillingness to explain the content in a simple manner. Todd once canceled an exam review session and told the class, "Womp womp." followed up by his ever-so-smug grin.
Professor Ruskell is an amazing human and professor. Unfortunately, the PHGN100 course is absolutely unbearable and it ruined how I feel about physics. He does the best with what he can.

Tod was amazing for PHGN 100, and most (almost all) of his lectures were great and helped me with the class. Of all the PHGN 100 prof's I would say he's widely regarded as one of the best for lecturing especially. His office hours were also great and he makes an effort to get to know your name. Definitely go to him for help!

Some of the best and most engaging lectures I've had at Mines! I had to withdraw due to the way the course is structured (exams stress accuracy, practice and homework assignments do not teach accuracy) but if I retook the course, I would take it with prof. Ruskell!

Ruskell is a great physics lecturer. He's engaging, speaks loudly, and always welcomes questions. He has a passion for physics and loves to share physics news. He uses clicker questions in class, but they are not graded for accuracy.
Funny and made physics seem less daunting. Lecture style relies heavily on his in class example problems opposed to information on the slides.
Dr. Ruskell's class was not only very informative and easy to understand, but also highly entertaining with his constant joking around. would highly recommend taking his class

Ruskell does his best with how PHGN100 lectures are set up. He's funny and attempts to engage you, but the lectures are formatted poorly by the department so it is difficult to learn. Still, he's by far the best pick of the bunch. Try to sit up close

George Luc.. I mean Todd Ruskell had great lectures and framed them well. I always felt mostly prepared for the studio, but my previous background in physics helped also. Great professor and engaging class, he will not dissapoint.

Great prof for Phys 1. Engaging lectures, explains concepts well, and answers any questions offered. He speaks loud enough that you can hear clearly from the back of the 200+ person lecture hall. Preps you well for studio. The course overall is well organized and there are a few extra credit homework / studio / clicker opportunities.
Ruskell does his best to prepare you for studio. Entertaining in his occasional demonstrations and jokes. Overall a good choice for lecture in phys 100.
While PHGN100 lectures are not super important, I felt like Ruskell did a good job of making things interesting and was always willing to answer questions during and after class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Took Physics 2. You got about 7 quizzes (45%), pre/post discussion(5%), studios(25%), webwork HW(10%), final Exam (15%). t Dr. Todd is a good professor. He makes the concepts pretty clear and tries his best, taking into consideration how tough phys concepts are. And he also makes a few jokes that make you laugh at 9 in the morning.

Ruskell is an interesting character. Fantastic and engaging lectures (and funny) and genuinely knowledgeable and approachable prof. Homework/exams are very hard but fair. He responds to emails but gets lazy assigning homework etc. This means you must self-study book to test well, but he cares and will work with you. He wants to see students succeed

Phgn 100 lectures at Mines themselves are not that helpful. Ruskell however makes them as effective as possible, and he is a very intelligent teacher. If you personally ask him about a topic, he explains it well and is an overall good lecturer. Would take again.

I took Prof Ruskell's class online in the summer. Even though it was a change for everyone, and much of the software was different (no lon-capa), he excelled in being available and helpful. I must've sent him 40 emails asking for help on specific problems, and he answered and followed up on every one. I couldn't recommend him more!

Dr. Ruskell is very underrated; he is the best physics teacher I've had. He makes discussion as fun as physics lectures can be, and he does a great job explaining concepts in studio. Not to mention, he is very understanding and easy to talk to in office hours. He really loves what he is doing, and I think it shows.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Ruskell is an AMAZING prof. He was helpful in studio, but where he really shines is in office hours. He is accessible outside of class, and is happy to help work out LonCapa problems. His office hours are never crowded, and he is more than willing to give the individual attention needed for you to succeed. Don't miss out on this resource!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Todd Ruskell makes every concept too complicated. I began going to other lectures and studios just to get away from him. It was a shame too because I really enjoyed the TAs in my studio. Super strict and gives you no wiggle room. Overall terrible person in general because he does not even seem to want to help students in a impossible subject. Awful
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ruskell is fun in lecture and good at explaining the material. No complaints.

Ruskell is a super awesome lecturer for Phys 2. He explains all concepts really clearly and is open to questions throughout class. He's kinda funny, which makes lectures interesting. In office hours, he is super helpful and willing to sit down ad discuss the material with you.
Very detailed lectures with an enthusiasm to help you learn. A great Physics teacher.

Dr. Ruskell is a high-quality, kind, and fair professor.  He has helped me plan much of my schedule and answered my various physics questions from homework and personal interest.  His lectures can often be discussion-type and interesting.  I suppose the best characteristic is that he is always willing to help you with questions.
not my fav

For the content covered, Ruskell did it perfectly. If I had taken this class anywhere else I probably would have gotten an A easily, but not have learned anything. Although I had to sacrifice my A, I would have to say that I learned a ton and he did a great job preparing me for the "Mine's lifestyle" and Phys 2.
Just go to lecture, clickers are kinda fun.  Learning happens in studio and on capa.
He's not a good teacher at all. His lectures are mandatory but useless. He doesn't help very much. Definitely go to homework help if you get him because that's where you'll be learning the most.

You learn more from the TA's in the homework help than you do from his lectures. Highly recommend attending the homework help sessions. The lectures are not very helpful at all. The course is hard but passable. He does know his stuff, but is somewhat condescending. Overall a mediocre professor. DO NOT BUY A TEXTBOOK, YOU WILL NOT USE IT EVER.

He's a very good teacher teaching material that is EXTREMELY hard....much harder than it needs to be.  "How much more can we cram into this class?"  "Eh, let's throw in another chapter."  Ugh...  Use his office as he's around all the time.  He's VERY willing to help.  I think that's where I got the most help and the only reason I passed.

Hardest class that didn't have to be that hard. I might have learned somthing but ruskell can't teach. I learned more in kappa help then anywhere else. also thank god for Dr. Hawk i never would have made it.
He does notes and calulations on power point and speed clicks through them...just horrible, but better than Korn
No Comments
Capa sucks!

The only reason I had a damn clue what was going on was recitation which was done with another Teacher.  He was better than corn but overall I got a High B in the class cause be and and friends worked our asses off, don't expect a techer to get you through
No Comments
Very good teacher, I wish I had gone to lectures more often. Material is hard though
Decent lecturer.  Lectures helped, though material was really hard in general.
Worst professor I've ever had.  His lectures were so boring I don't think I stayed awake for a single one.  Lectures serve no purpose, there is no gain by going to class.
No Comments
superb lecturer and very helpful outside of class, my best prof yet
The TA's and Bourne really made the class so much easier than it could have been without them. As long as you are in the shop and working on your knife consistently, you will do fine in the class.

Dr. Bourne is a very knowledgeable professor who explains the concepts in a way that is easy to understand. The lectures for the class are posted videos that makes it very easy to go back and rewatch sections as needed. He is available to take questions outside of class. The time commitment is real, lots of lab time!

Material is basically on a by your way basis. Treat the class like a hobby and you'll have an easier time scheduling hours for the work. It is a lot of hands-on and there is always more work to be done, but overall rewarding and enjoyable.

Dr. Bourne presents very good, clear content on the fundamentals of ferrous metallurgy, and how it applies to bladesmithing. Incredibly rewarding and satisfying, albeit time consuming, to make a blade.
This is a really fun class, but requires lots of outside lab time. It's a really good intro to ferrous metallurgy!
I really liked the format of this class with the online quizzes and the in person bladesmithing lab. The teaching method was pre-recored videos which were informative and convenient.
This course was mostly delivered using pre-recorded videos. The videos were easy to follow and very informative. I do like this teaching style.

This class is very much go at your pace cause you are making 2 knives. There are deadlines every week so you can't be slacking, FAIR WARNING do not take with a lot of credits. This class doesn't even feel like a class cause you are making 2 knives but it does take up a lot of your time outside of school so be prepared to work
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Bourne always knows what he is talking about. He is the expert on any form of material science or metallurgy. The lectures for MTGN333 reflect that, and are always packed with in-depth information. If you don't understand a topic, Prof Bourne will explain it or provide extra resources to ensure you can grasp the material.
great class, just have to be prepared to put in the work! its a lot of scheduling your own lab time but very rewarding!
Class was awesome, definitely a lot of learning and hours but worth it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Awesome class. Up to you how much time you want to put into the blades you make. Super enjoyable, fully recommend.
Great Professor running a really unique MTGN333!

You get out of this class what you put into it. The bladeshop is almost always open so I was able to put in the time I needed to make a great pair of knives. It's important to plan ahead because the shop does get busy as deadlines approach, but if you put in the time, you will love this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This class is one of the coolest classes at Mines! You definitely have to spend a lot of lab time to get the knives done, but it is very much dependent on what you want to do. All of lab time happens outside of lecture and there is only homework for the first half of the semester.

I took bladesmithing just because it sounded fun. I'm a mechanical so it doesn't count for any credit. I learned so much in this class and I got to make 2 knives! All the lecture material was done halfway through the course and the rest was just lab time working in the shop. Would strongly recommend it. Great professor, fantastic class!

Dr. Bourne is a great professor- he really understands the material and will work to help you as well. More than that, he cares about the course and the department as a whole. Materials engineering is made categorically better by his presence, and bladesmithing is a flagship example of that.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: The lecture content for Bladesmithing provides a solid foundational understanding of ferrous metallurgy while not overloading on assignments. The real highlight of the class is the lab, as by the second blade students are able to critically think about heat treating processes and explore metallurgy through a unique creative outlet.

This was one of my favorite classes that I have taken here at Mines. If you are in a Metallurgical and Materials engineer and need another elective class, take this one! The work load is primarily the knife making process, which takes only as long as the effort you're willing to put in to make something you will be proud of.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: This is one of the most useful classes I have taken, it taught me how to apply the lecture content to real world applications. Be prepared to read the textbook to supplement the lectures. The lectures are mostly good, but do not go into enough detail. The only real grades are the knives, but you pass by completing both.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: MTGN 333 is one of the coolest classes I've ever taken and Dr. Bourne is one of the best profs in the department. As long as you watch the lecture content and take pride in your work on your knife you should have no issue acing the class.
Great course! Allows you to use the knowledge you learn in lecture to further your understanding and to design/create better blades. Bourne is awesome and always willing to help!

Awesome professor! He really cares about you learning and will help you out if you are having trouble. The quizzes were very easy, but I still learned a lot from them. He also gives you a lot of freedom with the design of your final knife and how often you go into lab.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: This is my third consecutive semester with Professor Bourne. As a senior within the department, I managed to get by without watching a single lecture or doing any readings. The good news is that if you don't already have a strong understanding of basic ferrous metallurgy, he puts a lot of time into making and editing the lecture videos.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Specifically for MTGN333, Dr. Bourne's efforts to make this class possible is awesome. The opportunity to learn to make knives and then become a TA has been a lot of fun and has turned into a hobby. I learned a lot about ferrous metallurgy from this class that will be directly applicable to my job upon graduation. I highly recommend the class.

This is a great class. Dr. Bourne and the TAs are always ready to help you out. The lectures and quizzes are pretty easy. Just stay on top of your work and dont skip out on lab time and this will be one of the best classes you take at Mines.

Bladesmithing was such a fun class. You learn a lot about different steels and how they can be made into knives. You even get to apply that knowledge and make 2 knives of your own. Highly recommend this class.
A great professor. He is clear about expectations and responds very quickly
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: This course has a great balance between manageable weekly quizzes and regular laboratory times that are available to fit to your schedule. The course has a ton of hands on application and implementation, making it an essential course for an MME student!

Probably one of the coolest classes at Mines. Dr. Bourne does a great job explaining the necessary metallurgy behind the knives, and the lecture content finishes before the end of the semester which is really nice. Expect to spend a significant amount of time in lab (more than 3 credit hours), but it's more than worth it.

Really great class. Expect to put in a decent amount of time outside of class but good instructional videos and helpful TAs so should always be clear what you are or need to be doing in lab. I think the lectures are really good for fundamental steel knowledge. I have referred back to them a number of times for other upper division MTGN classes.

This class is one of the most rewarding experiences I have had. You learn the metallurgy behind bladesmithing but more importantly you make your own knives. If you enjoy the idea of making beautiful, functional, bladed objects this class is for you.

Bladesmithing is an awesome class and I hope other majors can take it more easily in the future! You'll learn a lot of interesting things about steel while also getting to make really cool blades. If you put in the time, you can end up with really high quality and pretty knives!

This class is one of the most fun at Mines, at least in my opinion. I took it in Fall 2020 and had a whole lot of fun doing so. It takes quite a bit of outside-of-class work for getting a finished product, but you'll be proud of yourself for doing so, and of course, you'll have two sweet knives to show off for it!

This class was a blast. It requires a lot of outside of class work, but at the end of it you end up with blades that you can be proud of. I learned a lot of ferrous metallurgy as well that I wouldn't have from other classes. If you get the chance, make sure to take this class before you graduate!

Dr. Bourne is a great professor. I've had him for a couple different classes and he's consistently one of my favorites. MTGN333, bladesmithing, is an awesome class. You learn lots of interesting metallurgy but don't get bogged down by it. I've learned lots of theory and practical skills this semester and would recommend it to anyone thinking of it
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: 100% if you have the preqs take this class! My favorite class I took at Mines period. Dr. Bourne is really passionate about this class and it shows. At Mines we dont get enough choices to meld art and science but bladesmithing does just that! Im addicted to bladesmithing now and the only downside is I cant afford to start my own shop.

Dr. Bourne, and the bladesmithing class in general was awesome. I honestly felt like I learned more about metallurgy in this class than some of my required courses. The lectures were not difficult to follow, and the quizzes were almost always taken directly from lecture material. The actual bladesmithing requires you to schedule your own lab time.

One of the best professors in the school for a fantastic class. Extremely hands off compared to his other classes as you need to sign up for lab time for the actual knife making entirely on your own, meaning you work at your own pace. The lectures can sometimes feel long, but the information is directly relevant to knife making and the quizzes.

Dr. Bourne is an awesome professor! The lab portion of the class is great, and you learn how to make two knives. The lecture parts teach very in-depth ferrous metallurgy. You will learn a ton of you read the book and attend the lectures, but you will likely still be able to do fine without the book, you just wont get as much from the class.
Dr. Bourne is tough on lab reports, but his Guide to Report Writing is useful and straightforward. As long as you can read and follow directions, you're on the road to success.

Out of all the professors for materials, Bourne is probably the best. But honestly, lectures are pretty weak sauce and I don't really understand materials much better than I did coming in. He posts practice exams that are like the exact replica of the actual which is nice, so it's not crazy hard to get a good grade in the class with him.

Really loved going to this class! I found the material interesting and found Bourne's lectures pretty good. The tests are the only thing that you really have to worry about, quizzes are all really easy and homework is barely worth anything. He curves the class to a B average as well which helps. Great Professor and would definitely recommend!!!

I took Prof. Bourne for Engineering Materials in 2016 and he is by far the best Professor to have for this course. His lectures are kinda boring but he actually cares about your grade and will make sure you get at least a 'B'.  I'm not the smartest person and I'm on track to get an 'A-'.  DEFINITELY GET HIM AS YOUR PROFESSOR
I took Prof. Strong for Calc 2. She was a great lecturer, was very considerate of students, was always happy to answer questions, and made sure students understood the material. Would take again.

Great professor. She had good lectures with descriptions of the topics followed by examples. Additionally she gave us hints for tricky parts of the homework. I would've loved to see her post her notes online, she posts very brief parts. Normally I just ended up looking at Sean Farrell's notes.

Prof. Strong was an incredible professor for MATH225. Her lectures were very well thought-out and easily understandable, and she was always willing to present extra examples or especially challenging examples that could help us with the required homework and worksheets. She definitely was invested in helping her classes understand and succeed.

Strong is a perfect professor. When she lectures, she writes on the board which makes it very easy to follow along and take notes. Her lectures follow a very organized structure with definitions, then examples and applications which make it very easy to go back later and read. DiffEq is easy when you have her as your professor.

Diff Eq is a difficult class but Prof Strong makes up for it by caring about her students and using lectures in a helpful way, getting around to several examples and taking several questions throughout. She also has office hours that she is available for and will help you with your work quickly and help you understand it

DiffyQ is not an easy class, but Professor Strong makes it very doable. She is a very good lecturer and is caring and actually seems like a human outside of class. She makes sure to go over confusing parts of the weekly worksheets. I would definitely recommend taking her as your DiffyQ professor.
Goat of a teacher. Does homework examples and problems that will show up on the test and walk through one every day at class. Best teacher ever!!

Jennifer took my horrible experience with math in calc 2 and helped me to enjoy calc 3. She is very supportive and loves helping her students. Her lectures are very well set up/understandable and easier to learn from than others. Absolutely recommended
Doesn't seem to care about her students at all!
Mrs. Strong is an excellent teacher. She is really encouraging, and she is very willing to give help wherever necessary.

I really appreciate how much work she put into making sure we understood even with it being completely online. She was always available during her posted office hours and was always patient with questions during class and during her office hours.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Even though Dr. Strong's lectures aren't always the most fun, she gets to the point quickly and simplifies tough concepts very well.

Jen does a great job teaching differential equations. She is an excellent lecturer and takes care to thoroughly explain everything that will show up on the exams. Homework assignments reflect test material. Highly recommend taking diffeq with Dr. Strong.
Dr. Strong does a really good job of teaching and giving resources for you to go back to. She is really knowledgeable and good with examples. TAs are also very helpful.

Jennifer Strong is a great lecture professor. She clearly articulates concepts from the class in a way that make a lot of sense while leaving out things that aren't necessary. As we transitioned to distance learning during Covid-19, she clearly put in a lot of effort into her students, making sure that our learning wasn't negatively affected.

The best for diff eq. She's taught it for many years, so she knows what she's doing. Lectures are structured just right; be sure to go to them. You get just enough theory that you need, and plenty of helpful examples to know what's going on. The pacing of the class is spot on too. Pay attention, and you'll be fine in her class

Her lectures will prepare you incredibly well for the homework and exams. Her pacing is great; she always explains mathematical concepts just enough to not be confusing or boring, and then applies them with plenty of examples. If you take good notes, you will succeed in the class.

It is clear that Professor J. Strong is very good at teaching Differential Equations. While she does lecture a lot, she is very good at explaining the material, and will get students engaged. I loved having her as my DiffEq prof and I would definitely recommend her. I also think her grading policies were very fair and clearly stated.

Strong is a good professor. Her lectures are clear, and the examples she does in class really help with the homework. Her lectures aren't particularly entertaining but they were definitely worth going to for this class.

She's a solid lecturer, but all the hype on this website confuses me. She's not the best professor I've ever had--lectures can be a little boring, but that could just be due to how easy the concepts in this class are. Overall a good choice, just not as great as this site thinks.
he is good

I love Jennifer Strong. She knows the material like the back of her hand. She is not one of those teachers who says "this works just because." She actually proved and showed why in her lecture slides or on Canvas. She does many examples, including the tricky ones in class, which is beyond helpful. Great teacher, highly recommend for diffeq!

Dr. Strong is a good lecturer, but her style put myself and many others I know to sleep due to her monotone and example-heavy teaching style. I would have preferred to have a professor who spent more time explaining concepts instead of just giving me a massive number of examples to learn from.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Good teacher. Her lectures are very clear and organized. Take good notes, do the homework and you'll get an A.
She was great! I didn't go to lecture a lot but she was great when I did go!
BEST PROFESSOR AT MINES! MUST TAKE
Took her for Diffeq. Great professor! Super nice and made sure that everyone understood the content. Always willing to help and one of the best AMS profs at Mines.

Jennifer Strong makes everything super easy to learn in Differential Equations. If you take this course it'll be an easy A with Jennifer Strong. She teaches from the basics and everything that's on her tests are in the lectures and in the homework assignments. Take her class! It's worth it!

Strong was great. I never wanted to miss lecture because I knew I would learn something that day. She explains things very clearly and does lots of examples. When I missed points on anything I knew I had been taught it and that it was my fault.

I took Pf. Strong's Differential Equations course in F2016. She gives extremely clear lectures, does plenty of examples, and makes sure you know exactly what is expected of you. The textbook is optional, the homework is pretty easy, and the tests have absolutely no curveballs on them. She is also very accessible in her office hours. Truly great.

She was great both in and out of class. The lectures were easy to follow and to learn from. Also, during her office hours, she did a fantastic job of helping me improve my understanding of the material.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Strong is one of the smartest people I have ever seen teach a class. What is special about her class is that the pace is perfect. She teaches with no notes so she never stops to read and integrates, derives, and manipulates algebraic expressions in her head with dumbfounding speed, accuracy, and dare I say elegance. This prof is spot on.
Jen is great. She explains material well. All of the examples she does really helps learning. She is well prepared and knows what she's talking about. Really nice lady!
She explains Differential Equations really logically and methodically.

Dr. Strong is amazing.  She's one of the best teachers I've ever had.  If you are willing to put the effort in (and it's not a terribly large effort) to doing homework on your own, listening in class and taking notes, then you are likely to pass with flying colors.  If you just rely on recitation to get all the homework answers then you'll get a C.
Best math teacher I have encountered at mines so far!!!!!  Class is very easy, I did not purchase the text book I just looked over the worksheets before each exam and did we in her class.
She was really easy, very clear and helpful. I wish I could take more classes with her.
Jen Strong makes things super easy to understand. She's really on top of her stuff.
Jennifer Strong is an amazing teacher.  She explains everything very well with lots of examples.  Also has several extra credit opportunities.
Highly recommended!

She is an absolutely wonderful teacher! Crystal clear! She is very intimidating at office hours, but very helpful! Definitely take her for Diff EQ. Her examples and lecture and worksheets completely reflect the exams! (and I think she writes the exams anyway!)

Jennifer is a great teacher, I took differential equations with her over the summer session. The lectures were spot on and clear, the homework a good reflection of the lecture, and the tests were a good reflection of the lectures and homework.  I'd take her again if I needed any other math classes.

I really appreciated how much effort Mona put in to help each and every one of us individually, whether it was in/after class, during labs, or while we were working on assignments and quizzes. I don't think I've ever had a professor that dedicated to helping out their students. I am grateful for all of that and for all the time she put in there.

Great great job! Learned a lot from the class! Professor Mona is very kind and passionate to students. She also helps students a lot and makes sure everyone understands the concept. Excellent at teaching and she is a really good professor.
I feel like I learned applicable skills to real life. The class was structured where learning was the main priority. Overall, a solid class.

The review below is clearly fraudulent. There is no EE211 course offering at Colorado School of Mines. Professor Mona is the best professor I have ever had in my entire college career. She is an all-around great person who is so selfless in her efforts to help students inside and outside the classroom achieve their goals.

Professor Mona offered us a very unique opportunity to fabricate our own transistors on silicon wafers and test it as part of this elective VLSI course. The LTspice and Electric simulations of CMOS gates helped in the learning. I can tell that she genuinely cared about our success and I consider myself very fortunate to have been her student.

Professor El Helbawy was an overall great teacher that genuinely cared about students wellbeing and success. I enjoyed that she listened to students' feedback and implemented it into her teaching and grading. She made several accommodations and took all steps necessary to ensure that students do well in the course and stay safe amidst the pandemic.

Mona truly wanted us to understand the material instead of just worrying about our grades. She had a grader yet she read our early HW submissions, gave us feedback before the deadline and encouraged us to resubmit. For the most part, exam problems were very similar to in-class examples and a lot of partial credit was given. A fair and kind teacher.

Professor El Helbawy is an absolutely amazing, down-to-earth and friendly professor. She helped me get through this math-intensive class, was readily available for questions, and well after class ended continued to patiently answer my questions and explain concepts. She is incredibly selfless in her efforts to support and help students succeed.

Mona is very nice and accessible so definitely take advantage of office hours. I didn't need the textbook. What helped me the most was paying attention in lectures, redoing the examples and HW problems multiple times. Overall, she is a good teacher who deeply understands the concepts of the course and does a great job relating that to applications

An awesome professor! She cares a lot about her students and truly wants to see them succeed. She would come into her office on the weekends and holidays to help students out, and even gave us her phone number so we can reach out to her anytime we needed help. I have never seen anyone as dedicated as she is during my entire college career.

Dr. Mona was always willing to help, answered all questions asked in class and during office hours clearly and thoroughly, took the time to ensure that we digested the material, gave us several opportunities to provide feedback on teaching. Overall, she was an excellent professor who taught course content at a good pace and deeply valued our input.

Dr. Mona is an all-around great person! She is so sweet and caring. I had some difficult circumstances during the semester and could not complete assigned work on time, she was so understanding and helped me complete everything before finals. She truly cares about our success and if you pay attention and do the work you will do well in her courses.

Overall, Dr. Mona was an enthusiastic pleasant professor who encouraged, supported and inspired me to succeed at Mines as a transfer student from Community College. She is the most empathetic and caring professor I've ever had. Her selfless efforts do not go unappreciated or unnoticed. I am a better student because of her constant care and support.

Professor Mona presented the material clearly and went out of her way to make sure we're doing well in the course. Simulation assignments, homework problems and in-class examples were invaluable to my learning. Prof. Mona was always supportive and available whenever I needed help. I am forever grateful for her kindness and everything she taught me.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Mona is very smart and it was obvious that she knew the material very well. This course required strong foundation in calculus and circuits which was lacking for me especially after nearly two years of online classes. Overall, Dr. Mona was a wonderful and understanding professor, and despite the challenges, I learned a great deal in her class.

Professor Mona is one of the nicest professors at Mines. It was her first semester at Mines when I took the course and it was clear that she was giving it her all to help students successed. I think she did an outstanding job teaching this course. I think she got some haters, which explains the unjustified negative comments posted on this account.

She was always ready to go the extra mile to help her students learn and grow in the course and in EE. I appreciated her accessibility outside class, granting extensions of time to complete assigned work, giving detailed feedback on graded exams, her positive attitude and openness to making adjustments based on students' feedback. Great professor!

Material was presented clearly and Dr. Mona went out of her way to make sure students were doing well. Simulations helped solidify my understanding complex topics. Dr. Mona was always willing and available to help when we needed help. Overall, the class was enjoyable and Dr. Mona fostered a great learning environment for all of us.

I loved having Dr. El Helbawy as a professor. She did an excellent job in teaching the content and was always willing to help and make appointments outside of her scheduled office hours. I learned so much with her teaching style and felt supported inside and outside the classroom.

Professor Mona is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is approachable, knowledgeable, and caring. She truly wants all of her students to succeed and will work extensively towards that end. All you really need to do well in class is a good attention span as a lot of the lectures are very dense, and a solid work ethic.

Overall, amazing professor and did a great job both in class and out of class making it clear as to what needed to be done in order to succeed in the class. Exams were similar to examples worked out in class and HW which allowed us to actually feel confident. I have never had a professor or teacher that has cared this much about their students.

Professor Monas lectures are clear, well-paced, and organized. The lecture notes posted on Canvas were super helpful for homework and revision. She is a generous grader, and as long as you put the work into the class, you will likely get the grade you aim for. She is also very approachable and welcomes questions inside and outside class.

For the most part, the homework was congruent with whatever has been covered in class, and the pacing of the class was very manageable. The labs were very useful in providing more practical examples of the processes/designs we go over in class. Overall, the professor and her TAs had positive attitudes, and the class environment was very pleasant.

I took three courses with Dr. Mona when she was a lecturer at Cal Poly, and I can confidently say that she is the best professor I have ever had. Dr. Mona teaches clearly and with enthusiasm, but more importantly, she cares deeply about each and every one of her students. It is so easy to connect with her, which makes lectures really enjoyable.

Lectures were great for understanding the main concepts of each topic. I feel that Professor Mona did a fantastic job getting the concepts across. Slides were the most helpful when it came to solving homework and exam problems. Some problems were a little different than examples worked out in class, but the slides always had the right information.

My favorite aspect of the course was doing a lot of in-class examples. Seeing the techniques used to solve these problems, helped me ingrain the learning and develop mental muscle memory to tackle other problems. I felt that the professor respected the different approaches suggested by students to solve some problems and that my input was valued.

Professor Mona is absolutely amazing, down-to-earth and friendly professor. She helped me get through this class, was readily available for questions, and well after class ended continued to patiently answer my questions and clarify concepts I had trouble understanding. She is incredibly selfless in her efforts to support and help students succeed.
I thought she did an excellent job. I am looking forward to taking another class taught by Professor Mona.

Mona truly wanted us to learn and understand the material rather than only worry about our grade in the course. Eventhough she had a grader, she read all of our submissions, gave detailed feedback before the due date, and encouraged resubmissions. Final exam problems were similar to class examples and HW. Grades will reflect on the work you put in

This professor taught me more in one semester than I learned in my entire college career. She genuinely cares and teaches topics that students can use in real life such as filters, power supplies, and communication systems to name a few. I highly recommend this class to anyone looking to not only learn but better themselves as well! She is amazing!

Dr. Mona is so sweet and caring. During the semester my mom and other relatives got sick, and I had to help out, she was so understanding and helped me complete the work before the end of the semester. She truly cares about your success and if you pay attention and do the work you will do well in the course. She is an all-around great person!

Mona learned everyones name and pronouns within the first month of the semester. It made me feel respected and appreciated that she cared enough and made the effort to remember my name, and use it on occasion after the Dr. prefix :)

Mona was a great professor; especially given she is new to the school. She takes the time to make sure students understand the content and encourages questions. The online midterm exams were great. I was able to complete them relatively quickly at times that fit my schedule.

One of the nicest professors I've ever had. She helped me troubleshoot many problems with the Simulink assignments. Happened a lot but she was nice and helpful every single time. She is a good teacher who deeply understands the concepts of the course and does a great job relating that to real applications.

Professor El Helbawy was an overall great teacher that worked with every single student such that they would have the tools they need to succeed. I enjoyed that she listened to students' feedback and implemented it into her teaching and grading. She took several steps to ensure that students do well in this class and stay safe amidst the pandemic.

Mona is a pretty cool person and professor. She can be disorganized on the whiteboard at times but she knows what she is teaching, and is engaging. She is super helpful in office hours. Her multiple choice multiple attempts quizzes were a breeze. Midterms were TAKE HOME! How much can you ask for? She gave a lot of partial credit on them too.

She is a very intelligent lady and it is obvious that she knows her material very well. My only issue was that the class seemed to move quite fast with the material, but she was really accommodating and understanding for all of us. She is very helpful when approached about problems and 1-on-1 sessions and was overall an effective instructor.

Always willing to help, answers any questions asked in class or office hours thoroughly, takes the time to ensure students understand the material. Gives us an opportunity for input (eg. what would be more helpful for us to understand the concepts better). Overall great professor who teaches material at a good pace and will always value your input.

Professor El Helbawy is always ready to go the extra mile to help her students learn. I appreciate the extra efforts she put into our class; scheduling extra office hours, allowing extensions of time to complete assigned work, dropping the lowest test score, giving detailed feedback on graded exams, responding to emails quickly and efficiently.

Material was presented clearly and Mona went out of her way to make sure students were doing well. Simulations helped in understanding more complex topics such as modulation and sampling. She was always willing and available to help when we needed help. Overall, the class was enjoyable and Mona made great accommodations for all of us
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: The lectures felt very hard to follow. She often skips the explanation and goes straight to examples. Making it hard to do the work on your own when you have no conceptual idea of what is going on. I had to watch videos outside of class to understand the material. The concepts aren't that hard really. She is a very nice grader though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Doesn't know how to run a classroom successfully or manage time efficiently. Takes forever to grade and doesn't know the answers to some of her own exam questions. Is super smart, but not that best at teaching the topics she knows so well.

Extremely helpful, caring, and funny professor. Great depth of lectures without feeling overbearing, and lots of amazing knowledge and experiences to throw into lectures. While perfection is impossible, Pat comes very close, incredible professor, and I would happily go to his lectures again even well beyond taking the class.
Although the material in this class is hard and there are lots of exams, Pat is a great professor who explains things very well and gives students help when they need.
Best teacher. Relatable, funny, and helpful
Pat is very sweet and extremely good at breaking down problems to a level I can understand. Sadly I only had him for studio.
Kohl is amazing! I don't think PHGN200 is a hard as it's hiped up to be.
Pat Kohl is the glue that held me together during phys 2
What can I say? Pat is a gem. EM isn't easy but its nothing to worry about with Pat
Quite possibly the best prof I have ever had
Pat is very good at teaching, incredibly reasonable and understanding. Lectures are great, very organized and meaningful. Learned the content well.

Pat Kohl is awesome - I'm so glad I switched to an online format so I could take him. He's cool, funny, and gives amazing lectures. He isn't one of those profs that tries to make things more complicated than they need to be to give himself an ego boost, so he's able to explain things in a way that actually make sense to students. Super great dude.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Kohl is very nice and funny, and he is the best physics instructor that I've ever had. He explains the material very well and gives his students the opportunity to ask questions after each part of the lecture. His lectures are well structured and organized.
Honestly one of the nicest professor I have ever met. Makes great jokes too and is an amazing lecturer. Also he's sups hot

Pat Kohl is just a really nice dude, and it makes you want to try in his class. He is a great lecturer and does a good job of logically guiding you through the concepts, although sometimes he makes some cheesy jokes. You can also attend his lectures even if you're enrolled with a different professor.

Kohl is a phenomenal physics professor and I would try to get him whatever you have to do. He helps you out with whatever you need-no question. Has incredible lectures and explains concepts very clearly. Gets right to the points that you need for tests and homework. Highly recommend getting Kohl for lecture regardless of who you get for studio.

Pat Kohl is an angel sent from above. My friends and I call him Atticus Finch because of his Southern drawl and kindhearted nature. He's super passionate about physics (and bunnies), but doesn't mess around when it comes to actually teaching you. He is incredibly easy to talk to and is fantastic at answering questions.

Physics 2 is easily one of the hardest core-curriculum classes required at Mines, so if you have to take it, take it under Pat Kohl. He is fun and not strict, but still gets done what he needs to get done every class. In studio, my notes were always more clear and better than my partners with other professors.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Easy A if you are good at Calc. He explains the material clearly. His lecture notes are simple and easy to follow. If you want to do great in the exams you only have to study a little bit of the homework, a little bit of the studio, and concentrate on the practice exams that he uploads on lon-capa, because most of the Qs come from it.

Do whatever you can to take phys 2 with Kohl! his lectures are amazing! the way he explains the material is so clear and useful compared to the other professors that teach this course! Your doing yourself a favor when you take the class with kohl, he is great at clarifying and explaining content clearly, most of all very willing to help students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I didn't have him as my prof, he was my studio instructor, and I so wish he was my professor. With his brief lectures in studio he's given it's so clear. But I think my favorite thing with him is he is so kind and down to earth. ALWAYS willing to help with a smile and makes you feel like you can actually do stuff. So encouraging.
Dr. Kohl is one of the best professors at Mines!

Things were definitely hard at times.  Professor Kohl's obvious attentiveness and care for how we were doing truly made the best of those hard things. The experiments were easily my favorite part, especially with Kohl's easy going nature.  Overall... 10/10 would go again.
Patrick is a great professor, teaches very well
Overall, a pretty good professor. Clear in his explanations.  His southern accent is pretty sweet too.

Kohl presents information really well. He  tries to make sure everyone understands the material. He tries to make physics as easy as it can be. Sometimes he makes jokes. They're kind of corny, but his personality really adds to the lecture. Plus, his accent is awesome.

I wake up at 8am by choice to go to Kohl's lectures rather than try to sit through Stone's. Here is a teacher who knows how to get to the point and convey information. His jokes are deadpan but always amusing and he has a kind personality. He's super helpful and is there for ANY physics student.
One of the best professors I ever had. Great guy to talk to also.

Pat is an awesome professor. He knows his stuff very well, and he also is very humorous and has a great accent. He explains things thoroughly and takes the time to help those with difficulty understand the concepts. He is also very available during office hours and after class if you have a quick question. Great guy, I would highly recommend him.
Awesome professor! He made Physics 2 the easiest class I've taken yet at this school.
I love Kohl! Much better than stone in my opinion. Class is challenging, but his lecture slides are good, he's entertaining in lecture, and the tests are based completely off of homework and studios.
I highly recommend him
He makes me actually enjoy Physics!

An awesome guy and really funny teacher. He is very helpful and cool. Honestly, it really doesn't matter what teacher you get for Phys 1 & 2 because they are all the same course material and you only learn anything in studio.
Kohl has a great sense of humor and always interacts with the class. He makes class fun and enjoyable.
Best professor I've had at Mines so far. Great in class and one on one. Also, he has a keen sense of humor.
He is one of the really good professors! and plus he is SUPER funny! don't hesitate to be in his section :D

First, don't waste your money on a Physics 100/200 textbook.  Second, either Pat Kohl or Vincent Kuo will do, they're both incredible professors.  Pat Kohl wins only because he seems to be more of a nerd and he has an awesome accent.  Class is fairly tough, but as long as you attend regularly and do all your work you'll be good.
Best professor I have ever had
Kohl and Kuo are the bomb - best Physics duo ever.  Phys I could take a lot of lessons from Phys II! Very clear, takes time in lecture, very honest with what to expect.  Won't regret getting Kohl!

Didn't have his class but went to his office hours and talked with him on forums. Very cool guy, knows his physics well, and willing to talk about material beyond the course. Posted internet memes and funny pictures on lon capa. Far better than phys1 you really can't go wrong with the phys2 instructors as long as Kuo and Kohl still teach the class.
Pretty good lecturer, his lectures are entertaining at times. However, he forgets to tell the class about pre-studios quite a bit so you'll have to check lon-capa after lecture on a regular basis.
It's amusing to watch him turn on the demos; especially the can crusher.
Great attitude, passionate about chemistry, made it easy to learn & follow along. 10/10
Very caring. Very nice. Went to her office hours and she was very easy to talk to. 10/10
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Very test heavy, but the tests aren't very hard if you do the homework and reread the slides.

Prof. Falconer is enthusiastic about what she does! She gives multiple extra credit assignments and the exams are not overly difficult. Overall, her class was interesting and she was good at explaining concepts in easy-to-understand terms.
Her voice can be a little loud and high pitched but her lectures are good and keep the students engaged.

I hate chemistry, but Dr. Falconer is actually passionate about her job and is supportive, no matter what your understanding of chemistry is. I have asked incredibly irrelevant questions (concepts already taught in class ages ago) but she's accepted them like any other question she'd receive from a more knowledgeable student.

She explains concepts and how to solve problems very well and clear. She has us do problems on iClickr that are counted for a grade, which I like because it makes sure we understand what we are doing. She is incredibly nice and is always ready to answer any questions we have even though the lecture hall has over 200 students.
Supper bad experience did not feel like I was respected as a student, everything relying on test, class lectures and homework do not reflect what the test was like.

Overall Chem 121 is designed to weed you out, which means lectures are long and heavy with material. 
 Attendance is not only mandatory but graded. Falconer is available for office hours but is difficult to get quality time with, so a lot of the class relies on teaching yourself and study groups. Overall, not a bad choice for lecturer.

I loved Falconer.
She's kind and super willing to talk to students to make things work. You can tell she loves her field and wants to make the content reach students. 
Her lectures were a bit fast for me, but once I got access to the slides (accommodation) I could keep up comfortably.
She's really awesome about working with you on coursework. Sometimes you can get lost in her lectures, but if you go to office hours and ask questions she will clairfy.
Professor Falconer showed me that Chem wasn't unachievable for me and really sparked my passion in the field!

Shes the best. Super easy going, really good at teaching, and genuinely wants you to succeed. Shes like that one mom who brings a gatorade cooler full of capri suns and a box of fruit snacks to soccer practice and answers all of your dumb questions without making you feel bad (but for a college chemistry department instead).
Had her for Chem 1 and she is amazing at giving information during lectures while also keeping your attention by making it not so boring

I took chem 1 in fall 2021 with Falconer. I struggled in chemistry in highschool and was not looking forward to this course. However, Falconer is incredible. Definitely one of the best professors Ive ever had. Shes funny, available, and understands the content well. Cant recommend her highly enough.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Hilarious

comment: Very nice and accessible.

Falconer is an amazing lecturer and is obviously very passionate about chemistry. Get ready to come to class engaged and taking notes because she goes through concepts quickly and there is a lot to learn. She has lots of Reef questions during class so be ready with a calculator and scratch paper at all times.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Once you get past the voice, she is great! She does a good job explaining the material, and an even better job at communicating what will be important on the test, and common mistakes that get made.

I loved having her as my professor. I did it remotely, and I feel she did a great job of being engaging online and teaching the subjects. She is super nice and is always willing to help out if you need. If you pay attention to the lectures and attend, you should be able to do well in this course.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Falconer seems to have good ratings so it could be that the online version of her class is just different. I find the lectures to be long, aren't interactive, and techniques she offers for learning are unhelpful. She teaches through failure which doesn't work for me. Attitude can sometimes come off condescending. Makes us feel like children.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I very much disliked this teacher I can't understand how others on here have great reviews of her, they must just like chemistry but this teacher does not teach until you get questions wrong and lose credit.
Supportive and enthusiastic
Sweet and caring of her students and her lectures are amazing. Only hate the clicker questions testing you on things you don't know about, but they're a small fraction of your score

Shes an amazing professor! You can tell that she really cares about her students and she always made lectures interesting. She makes lectures somewhat interactive with worksheets and clicker questions.

Falconer really cares about the success of her students. She is very knowledgeable and is helpful in office hours. I really liked her and her teaching style, though from talking with other people it seems as though you either love her or really don't like her as a teacher.

As a previous Chem 1 student and eventually her lecture TA, Dr. F is amazing! She genuinely cares about her students and is very approachable. Her lectures and slide examples are both relatable, engaging, and informative. She genuinely wants you to succeed and love chemistry as much as she does!

Professor Falconer does a phenomenal job in teaching Chemistry. For CHGN121 I would highly recommend trying to get her for lecture. Does a great job making the material interesting and engaging the students. Explains concepts clearly and does a great job being available for students to answer questions, help, etc.

Falconer is the BEST! She has many office hours in CASA, and she is very approachable and explains concepts very well. Her lectures are also fantastic, and she is really entertaining overall. I would certainly recommend her to anyone taking chemistry!
Great professor who genuinely knows what she's talking about, and cares about her students. All 200+ of them.

Dr. Falconer's Chem 1 class is the best, hands down. She gives out the least amount of homework out of all the chem teachers, and her lectures are always interesting in some way. She is excellent at explaining concepts and can always be reached by e-mail. When you take Chem 1, sign up for her class, you will not regret it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Falconer is amazing! The class does require work, but she knows well how to explain things. I would recommend to attend class because there are many free participation points and in-class activities. Overall, she's a great professor and gives some major bonus points on exams.
Very helpful and understanding when you have emergency things pop up outside of school.
Awesome professor
Renee Falconer is a good professor I have ever met.
Awesome professor, get to know her!

I didn't understand chemistry at all when I took AP in hs, but Falconer made it one of my all time favorite subjects, and made it incredibly easy to understand. Definitely my favorite first semester class, wouldn't change anything.
Awesome teacher. helpful and kind
She is very enthusiastic about teaching and helping students. She describes problems very clearly and loves it when students come to her office hours. Highly recommended!! :)

She is wonderful and treats students like her kids. She loves and willing to help every student. She even emails those who really need help to come for the office hours. She is fun in classes and work through helpful examples! Highly recommended!! :)
Very fun teacher! Definitely won't put you to sleep. Very clear in lecture and helpful in lab
She was so amazing and extremely helpful!! She is always willing to help her students. Her class is very fun! :)
By far the worst experience I've ever had at this school. A dismissive, uncaring, and not at all understanding professor. Known for doing the absolute bare minimum!

I've never left a review before, but Neil's incompetence and disdain for teaching prompted me to. Neil is extremely condescending, delays grading until after exams, is bad at communication, and provides wholy inadequate practice materials. Furthermore, he's arbitrary accused several others of academic misconduct and censored feedback on Ed.

The practice exams are much easier than the real thing and don't include an answer for each problem. He arrives for class late most days. Every class has a quiz which must be taken in class. He won't respond to Ed posts or emails. His exams have tougher questions than the homeworks or lectures. Homeworks don't get graded until several weeks later.

Neil does not like teaching, nor does he seem to care about his students. Do not rely on Ed to get help from him or the TA's, it takes them days to respond (if they do). Do not expect HW or Lab grades to be posted in a timely manner (despite some labs building on each other). This class is graded on a curve so do not expect to know your final grade

He tries to make this a flipped classroom, but none of the prelectures explain the material at all, and the in class lecturing isn't any better. There is no clear grading criteria, horrible communication, he doesn't care about student success at all, and the TAs are useless. Worst professor I've had at mines.

Neil is the worst professor I have ever had at Mines. It is clear that he has no regard for students' success and he genuinely does not value their learning as well. When many students ask for resources they would find helpful, Neil has shut them down claiming that it is a waste of time, and then completely ignores posts on the discussion board.

He takes the most minimal effort to teaching ever. He refuses to record review sessions, barely gives solutions to practice exams, and tells students they should've gone to the review session. He let questions fill up all final's week, only responding the day before the exam. But when a student raises a criticism, he takes the post down in no time.

One of the most uncaring and unprofessional humans in the CS department; and that says a lot knowing how sour things are already. He's very intelligent, but: he teaches you to walk and expects you to swim on your own, ignores emails/ed posts unless pressured, incredibly high ego, and never seems content. Edit: He banned me on Ed (I had an opinion).

I thought that I would be different. I thought that I was smart and good enough that I could deal with Dantam, regardless of what everyone said. 
DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE I DID. 
Dantam is knowledgable about his field, but that's it. He clearly and actively resents teaching, students, and anyone who asks questions. Avoid at all costs.

After taking PL in Spring '24 I can confirm that negative reviews are spot on. A few days ago numerous students repeatedly asked he record a review of the practice final. He completely refused even as we practically begged him to post any kind of help. Doesn't care about students and is actively working against their education, avoid at all costs

A small, insecure man. He oozes pent-up middle school bullying aggression and regularly quotes Donald Trump in his half-baked lessons. Frankly, his unprofessional demeanor make him a liability to the school.

5.5 years at mines and time for my first RMP review!

Neil is a smart person. Neil is a knowledgeable person. Neil is not a nice person. The content is challenging, but he artificially inflates the difficulty of the course. He will make as little effort to work with you as he possibly can unless forced to by the university.

Dantam is the worst teacher I have ever had the misfortune of experiencing. It's clear he doesn't care about his students or their success. If you ask a question, his response drips with condescension, so much so that I'm shocked anybody would choose to ask a question at all. He's required, though I wish he would quit like he so clearly wants to do
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: One of the worst classes I've ever had to take.I'm sure he would take that as a compliment, but it's not. Avoid at all costs if you can.

"I can tell that Neil is a smart guy. I can tell that he's qualified. I can tell that he knows what he's talking about. I can also tell that Neil hates teaching. His behavior in class is mostly dismissive, and he answers questions in a condescending way that makes me not want to ask them." SECONDED.

Awful teacher. Teaches you the most basic intro to a concept and then expects you to be able to do much more difficult problems. Imagine being taught a bit of addition and then expected to know multiplication with no context for example. HW/Tests are very hard. I'd say stay away but he teaches mandatory classes so you have no choice. Good luck :)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Mr. Dantam was an alright professor. The labs were really hard but the exams weren't too bad. He's kinda sassy too.

Neil is not here for the students, that is very obvious. His "flipped" classroom style isn't effective at teaching any of the content that students need to know. The recorded lectures are the driest things I have ever had to sit through, and he just reads through examples without explaining anything. Hands down one of the worst professors at Mines.

First a positive I took him for 400 and he seems to have improvedTo the negatives His lectures are difficult to follow He takes pride that his class is difficult and chooses to make it more difficult The notation and content is made more complex than needed I dont care that I got a C unlike every other class Im just happy I passed.

I can tell that Neil is a smart guy. I can tell that he's qualified. I can tell that he knows what he's talking about. I can also tell that Neil hates teaching. His behavior in class is mostly dismissive, and he answers questions in a condescending way that makes me not want to ask them. Also his recorded lectures are remarkably dry and unhelpful.

I had Dantam for PL in Spring 2022, and I had a great time. It was *very* challenging at first, but he is willing to answer all of your questions and help you struggle with the content until you get it. But, don't expect to just show up and be spoon fed the information. This class was hard, but Dantam is not as bad as everyone says

The class is honestly not that bad. His lecture videos are dry, but they're not that difficult to understand. The worksheets and quizzes are easy if you watch the videos and he spends time going over them in class. He is a nice guy and is always willing to answer questions. The exams are difficult, but not impossible.

Dantam's lectures are very dry. It sounds like he writes out what he is going to say in his lecture videos and then reads it as he goes along in his slides. Perhaps he is used to writing in academic language for his research, although can't seem to break things down into everyday language which is essential for new eyes to the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It baffles me how Neil Dantam is still a professor. He clearly does not seem to enjoy lecturing, his students, or even other faculty. Your grade will remain a mystery until the end of the semester, his lectures do not seek to teach concepts but instead read as a long review of concepts we should be learning, and he has an ego to boot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Honestly, the worst professor I have ever had in my life. I have had him twice, and both times, I haven't had the slightest clue what my grade is until after the class is over. He grades on a curve that he just makes up at the end of the semester. We have assignments that were turned in over 3 months ago that still aren't graded.

I have no taken Neil twice for different courses. Once in an undergrad course and now as a graduate level course. Each time was a terrible experience. Very little usable feedback, left office hours or piazza questions with more questions than answers. No idea of the grade until after the final grades are submitted because of a curve. Do not take!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I have had Dantam for multiple courses and he is notorious for difficult exams, lots of homework, and a tense classroom environment
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader
