comment: Not a good teacher at all. Looking at the Rate My Professors profile before starting the class, I was optimistic that it wouldn't be that bad but the rating is well deserved. He is very unhelpful whether during office hours or Piazza. If it is possible to take a section without him, do it, no matter the sacrifice.

Nearly 0 materials to study off. Material wasn't hard, but the vagueness of the assignments with nearly nothing to study off of was. Uses a useless coding language that will never be useful. Waste of time and energy.

The topic is already complicated and hard to understand but adding in Dantam's teaching style and mannerisms complicates the subject more. Asking questions beyond the initial one implies you are dumb and he often can't explain things simply. His online lectures were very difficult to follow and explained in an overly complex manner.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't take him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He is only teaching to do research I suspect. Gives condescending answers to your questions, tests are needlessly difficult, and clearly does not care about creating an environment conducive to learning.

Awful teacher. Doesn't know what is on his own tests until days before they are given. Unable to be leniant with assignment due dates. Multiple projects every week all semester long. 4-5 day turnaround time for emails. Avoid at all costs.

This class was not only the worst class I've ever taken at Mines, it was taught by a professor who is clearly more concerned with research then he is teaching.. His tests are INSANE... The class is curved and due to his ridiculous expectations and extremely challenging projects and homework an A was a 60% for our first exam. Everyone is lost.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: This is by far the worst class I have taken at Mines with the worst professor. He does not teach the material effectively, if at all, and makes extremely difficult projects and homework over material that is only tangentially related to what is "learned" in class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Worst experience Ive ever had with a Mines professor. He never answers questions and makes you feel stupid for asking them. Refuses to make a course schedule. Ineffective lectures. He is condescending. If I wasnt a senior, Id drop and take this course with literally anyone else teaching it. I do NOT recommend having him as a professor. Run.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Neil's the worst professor. He's unhelpful even if you go to office hours. He assumes that if you're confused by the course content, you don't know basic concepts. He is a very quiet lecturer and he usually doesn't wear a mic, so you can't hear him in class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: CSCI561 is a very difficult class, but being one of only two required Master's classes, that should be a given. The setup of the class is very logical and his lectures follow very closely to his slides. The only downside to taking a class with Neil is he is a very quiet person. Sit close or prepare to listen very carefully. Also he dresses well.

I have taken Professor Liu for the past four semesters straight in Mech Mat, Structural Analysis, Steel, and Concrete Design. I Cannot recommend her enough. If you want to genuinely learn the subject matter rather than just receive a good grade, she's your teacher.

Among the amazing professors here, Professor Liu is my favorite. She is  difficult, but you will learn the content and the value of it. Her classes have consistently been the hardest I have taken, yet I have also learned more in her classes than perhaps any other. To everyone who has the opportunity, I encourage them to take a class with Liu.

Professor Liu's classes can be so challenging but also very rewarding. She cares a lot and is almost always available in her office. The homework assignments are really challenging but helpful for understanding the content. The exams are a little agitating because they are sort of unfairly challenging sometimes. No curving either.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Liu's classes are not easy, but they are do-able. While she expects a lot from her students, she is readily available to offer support, accommodation, and extra assistance to help students succeed. Though she can come off as intimidating in class, she is one of the most caring and genuine professors I have met during my time at Mines.

One of the best professors I have had at Mines. Lectures are great, organized, easy to follow, and she posts notes. She knows what she's talking about and cares about her students. Examples correlate with exams and homework. Gives a good amount of partial credit on exams (and sometimes gives a little extra time on exams as well).

The biggest issue was her expectation that you had taken her classes for the prereqs, or at least thought you would understand how she would go through something even if you had a different professor who taught a different method.

Answers to questions weren't always answers to the questions.

Otherwise, she is pleasant to talk with out of class.

Dr. Liu is a great professor, and one of the most caring and dedicated I've had at mines. The content of CEEN 311 and 314 was not my favorite, and I've struggled in her classes, but that is more a preference thing on my end, not a flaw with her teaching. She is very available to help students, and hires good TAs as well. Definitely would recommend.

Liu is my favorite professor in the Civil Department. She provides notes packets with tons of examples and does a great job of covering exam materials. Be prepared to attend every lecture because she moves very fast through topics. I would recommend her for this course, and every other Civil class at Mines (Statics, MoM, Concrete, ST, etc)

This is now my third time having Liu, and structural is definitely the hardest class I have taken with her. She moves very fast through lecture and there is so much homework. The exams are really rushed and it's hard to even finish. But you will learn so much more with her than other professors. She cares a lot and pushes you to do your best.

I've taken Liu for Mech Mat and Structural Theory and she is probably my favorite professor at Mines. She definitely is tough, but fair. you will have to work in her class and on her homework but at the end you will genuinely understand the content. If you want an easy class take another teacher, if you want to learn take Liu. don't skip lectures.

Liu is awesome. She goes very fast during her lectures which is great for people who are sick of slow professors. She is extremely engaging during her lectures as well and the material she covers is EXACTLY what you see on her exams. All her classes are very hard topics so they are never easy but Liu does a great job of keeping you on your toes.

This class was definitely challenging, but I love Professor Liu's teaching style. She moves really fast, but the examples are helpful. The tests are tough, but not bad if you study for them. Be prepared for LOTS of homework. Attendance isn't mandatory but it's impossible to keep up unless you attend. She's really funny though and a good professor!

There is a slight language barrier/accent. She often runs out of time and has to skip major portions of examples, doesn't thoroughly explain concepts sometimes. Posts notes later.
Homework and Tests are tough!
Attendance is not required but uses iCicker quizzes for participation points. Be prepared to learn on your own and utilize TA/resources.

Professor Liu is AMAZING. I'm excited to have her again next semester. She starts with baby steps and really explains things in such a thorough and understandable way. I was so afraid of statics, and she made it so easy to keep up with. She's also so funny and quirky, and really cares about her students. Definitely a lot of homework though!

She is pretty funny and the other reviews calling her 'disrespectful' either don't get her sense of humor or don't have very thick skin. I got used to her accent after a few classes and although she moves fast, it's only because there is so much to cover.

Extremely hard professor who is terrible at explaining what we actually need to know. Exams are unpredictable and look nothing like the homework. She does everything on paper and grades harshly so it's impossible to get 100s on any of the homework. Barely passed with a C after working insanely hard all semester. Avoid!

She's a very good teacher. Goes a little fast sometimes but if you make her office hours and work on the homework with her you're sure to do well. She is very practice problem heavy which is good because those are the problems she puts on her tests. She's very blunt and doesn't accept laziness. I've taken her three times and would take again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: First semester at Mines as a transfer and I had Dr. Liu for Statics. As long as you show up to lecture and do the million homework assignments, you'll do fine on the exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really homework heavy class but Dr. Liu is a great professor and sometimes she just goes a little fast but it is only because there is so much material to get through. Other than that she explains everything pretty well and is able to answer any question.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: If you're looking for a prof who disrespects you and tells you to drop her course and take it next term and grades extra bad she is the one! Not cooperative AT ALL. The course is 4-weeks only; doesn't accept questions during Zoom meetings and tells you to watch her videos, which we already did but need further explanations! Bad experience overall.
Poor lecturer. Does not answer questions. Not respectful. Do not recommend.

Dr. Liu provides very specific and detailed lecture notes if you show up to class, so you don't need the textbook at all. In her lectures, she is straightforward and the material is taught very clearly. TA office hours are a must for the homework assignments, since the written HW can be pretty challenging. As a person, she is very kind and caring.

Dr. Liu was a really good professor! She passes out notes, so it is easy to follow along in class and they are really helpful to refer back to for homeworks. She is helpful in office hours and I always felt like she prepared us well for the exams.

She is the most disrespectful professor I have ever had. If you want to be treated poorly and be scared to ask questions, pick her class! I understand she wants her students to succeed, but I think she could use a less extreme way to push her students, at least give her students some respect.
Sweet lady who really knows her stuff. She goes fast because she has to but she really is interested in student's success.. yes she has an accent but that has never gotten in the way
I 'm glad that we (U.S.A) have Hongyen and not China.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The course was fun, the lecturer was not. Thick accent. Boring lectures. Not good enough teaching methods. No textbook. So basically it is a badly set up course, but the content is cool and somewhat important (depends on your major)

Hongyan is the best professor that I have had in academic career (Even though the class was not major specific for me). If you could ever get the chance to take one of Hongyan's classes absolutely jump on that opportunity. The class is easy enough if you pay attention and give effort. Hongyan is very caring and truly wants to see us succeed.

Many reviews on here complain about her heavy accent, but it almost never gets in the way of understanding the course material. Professor Liu explains the material very thoroughly and thoughtfully. It may not be the most engaging course, but she makes it enjoyable. Often she says "Any questions?" and then very quickly moves on without looking.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Liu has an accent that makes it difficult to understand what she is saying sometimes. Besides that she really is a caring person and she wants to see the class do well in her course. She prints out the lecture notes and will take the time to help you if you need it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her accent is very strong, but it's acceptable. You can definitely understand her lectures fully. I think she does too many examples in her class and I would appreciate more time dedicated to derivations and theory.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you write down all of her notes and worship her online notes, you'll be okay in Mechomat. She really explains things well, walks you through the steps, and cares about how you do on the test. Leading up to the tests, she'd always give us tips like "beware of these units" or "make sure you can do this problem quickly". Very nice and helpful.
Other than the strong accent, she's very kind and prints all of the notes for everybody. You can get the whole jist of what to do by listening to like 15 minutes and ignoring the rest.
Her lecture notes, which she posts online, are really easy to follow and understandable. Would definitely recommend.

Her teaching style is very organized and laid out. She provides printed notes so you can follow along with her which, being a more note dependent person, really helped me. You get the impression that she really wants to help her students by teaching them the easiest ways to solve a problem or by helping you out in office hours.

I personally found Liu's teaching style to be perfect for the course. She printed out material for each lecture so that you could take notes along with her PPT, and there was space to work out problems. Her explanations were very clear, and she wanted her students to be successful. I'm planning on taking her for a course next semester as well.

Sometimes unclear, but very helpful. Tough grader, but fair. I don't think I'd take class with her again, as her explanations often didn't work for me. She's very nice, and if you ask for help she will go out of her way to make sure you understand the material. Definitely cares about her students.

I got an A in this class. Dr. Liu is very helpful when you ask her a question, and I really like her teaching style. Professor Liu will show the easiest way to solve a problem. I highly recommend this professor if you're going to take statics. Note: Professor Liu has an accent & a soft voice.

Eberhart cares a lot for his student's understanding. His lectures are a bit scattered but by the end, I always felt like I learned something. The only negative was he didn't give a clear date for our first exam and the second exam was a "pop" exam.

Dr. E has terrible lectures and half of the class is him going on a tangent about something that does not matter. You also will not know your grade until the day you recieve it because he grades on curve but does not tell you what the curve is. The labs also consist of going to lab in proper PPE and doing a worksheet in pab, no actual expiriments.

He has been my favorite professor at this school. I rated difficulty at a 4 because you can't make quantum mechanics much less difficult, but he does a great job explaining, making it entertaining, and cares about the student's understanding. He may not be a traditional professor, but has shown he cares more than most. Thanks Profressor

Tests were open internet and notes, but they were still quite challenging. If you weren't happy with your score or were confused you could talk with Mark and potentially receive points back. Labs were a lot of our grade but they were terribly easy. There were 2 lab reports we had to write, informal, but they were a bummer to do.

Dr. Eberhart is my favorite science instructor ever! He always makes sure to help his students, and will always do what he can to help get your grade up. Go meet with him before and after each exam to make sure you understand everything. He will definitely help you do your best in his class.
Eberhart is a great guy. He has so much energy and his lectures are very captivating. He cares and knows a lot about the topics he teaches. He can get side tracked pretty easily however.

He has fun lectures that often get sidetracked but are fun to listen to. He really will give you a good grade if you work for it. If you are unhappy with your grade or are curious about any of the interesting things in the class, go to his office hours. He is very open and caring about teaching and will help you work for a better grade.

Dr. Eberhart is by far the best professor I've had. He is extremely passionate about teaching and always does it with a smile on his face. His lectures are always interesting and engaging, and he finds a way to make difficult concepts easier to understand. He really cares about his students and is always willing to help 1 on 1 outside of class.

Mark is probably the most interesting professor on campus. His lectures are incredibly enthusiastic and engaging. You can really tell he loves what he teaches. You will get a good grade is he can tell you put real effort into the material. Additionally, he cares if you learn and understand the material, not when.
Hes a great guy. The class is very difficult but interesting and rewarding.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Mark is the best professor I've had here at Mines- will always be there for his students, his content is incredibly insightful and he finds a way to make class better even when you're ready to go home at the end of a week. If you put in time outside of class to understand the material and pay attention, you will come out of the class with an A.
Putting in a little extra work got my overall grade raised by 10%. He really values the students who take an interest in learning. All the exams are taken in Canvas as well which is nice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Eberhart is awesome! Although the class can be extremely confusing at times because the textbook is written by Eberhart himself, he does his absolute best to make sure everyone understands the material. Exams can be difficult, he does often include random problems that we have never seen before. Overall, good class and great professor!
You can skip every class and get an A. Has a large Bepis

Dr. Eberhart was really great, except that there were no textbook as a reference for the material of his course. When it gets confusing it is hard to figure out what is going on. The readings that he posts are awesome, yet there are a lot of questions on the exams that you can't see them coming, so exams were puzzling.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Eberhart was a great professor and when students get confused, he really slows it down until everyone understands. The class was very subjective and it was encouraged to argue for your grade.

He is (and probably always will be) my favorite professor. Throughout the class, had plenty of "what are we supposed to be learning" moments, but everything came together at the end and it's remained one of the most educational classes I've had. Lots of reading outside class, but it's not just busywork; he ties it all into lecture.

I will easily admit that the grading in this class is so vague it's been driving me nuts. However, Professor Eberhart does it for a reason. By far one of the most caring about the students professors out there. Eberhart will absolutely work with you if you ask him for help, but you definitely have to try to do well in his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: HE'S AMAZING

He doesn't believe in grades so if you want you can easily get an A. He grades on a curve and you can use your notes and lab top on all tests! An awesome guy that makes it really clear what he wants you to learn. If you want an A, you can most certainly get it in this class.

Dr. Eberhart is one of the best teachers I have ever had. One of the first lines in his syllabus is "I hate grading", and it's true. His lectures are amazing and he is very energetic. Attendance is MANDATORY -- if you participate, he'll actually give you gold stars that boost your grade. He fully designed the course and all materials are free.
OOOOOHHHHHHH COOOOOL!!!!!!!!
he cool

He is hilarious. The curriculum was hard to understand at times but he did everything he could to make it fun and interesting. You have to be in class, otherwise you'll get left in the dust. Great professor and class, just make sure to get help when you need it during his office hours otherwise the next lecture won't make sense.

Brilliant guy that sometimes has a hard time teaching at a basic level. Easy to go into his office hours to understand you'll understand everything easy. If you participate in class he will be more likely to help your grade as much as possible.

Incredibly nice dude and obviously extremely intelligent. He may not seem like it at first, but he truly knows what he's talking about. The only problem with that is he can't seem to figure out how to dumb it down enough for us to understand it. He tries very hard but lectures are oftentimes all over the place and can be confusing. Love it, though!
Eberhart is a fantastic professor who has so much passion for his subject and his students.
Terrible professor, taught nothing understandable in class and tested on things he never taught.  Designed tests to have an average of 60%
Terrible at teaching basic chem.

His lectures are not connected with the book reading, and the homeworks are not connected to either reading or lectures.  He expects you to learn mathematica with no help and do complex calculations with it, and his tests are both unevenly weighted (80%) and unfair.
Very helpful office hours--completely changed the way I looked at chemistry.
He guest lectured in my class for a few days. I fell asleep. Every time.

Dr. Eberhart is very smart and is probably an excellent reseacher. However for teaching Chem 1 and 2 he is awful. He taught a lot of things that were non essential and difficult and did not cover the basics. The class and his tests were greatly disconnected. Taking his tests felt like educated gambling.
Not a good teacher for entry chem

Brilliant speaker -- he is very charismatic and has a way of speaking about the subject that will make you want to dedicate yourself to this very tiny insignificant subset of chemistry. But he can't teacher worth squat.
I passed the class I took with him. However, I almost died for that!
No Comments
She's super sweet and really wants you to succeed. She isn't much help outside of class but is a wonderful teacher. Her lectures go really fast and phys 1 as a whole can be a tough class.

Dr. Callan truly cares about her students' well-being and is passionate about the material she teaches. She often shares personal stories to encourage students to persevere in their physics education while also remembering to look after our non-academic lives.

I had Prof. Callan for lecture and she tends to go through the material very quickly and it feels like she assumes everyone already knows certain concepts. She was accessible outside of class and was pleasant.
Professor Callan is clearly passionate. Her lectures and studios were interesting and thoughtful. The Mines physics curriculum isn't great, but she makes the absolute best of it. Highly recommend!

She was a wonderful professor and quick to help. I enjoyed her lectures and would be excited to go. She was very open to questions and ensured she would answer your questions completely. Going to her office hours and easy and super helpful.

Dr. Callan worked hard to work with students to help them succeed whenever they needed it. I started physics with little understanding, and even a bad grade on the first exam. However, Callan worked to help me to succeed in the course overall and gave me the confidence I needed to succeed. She was an awesome teacher and person!

Callan herself is a great professor; she's funny, relatable, and empathetic. While her lectures don't really help you learn anything, people with other professors say the same thing, so that's more of a class structure failure, not necessarily her fault. Physics is a hard course in general so be prepared to buckle down, regardless of professor.

Callan's lectures are not helpful. I leave more confused than when I came to class. Callan doesn't respond to her emails, is passive aggressive and petty. I learned more from Chegg/Bartleby and my physics studio partner than I did her. She hires TA's to do all her work and takes credit for it... (1/2)
Kristine Callan is not only an amazing human but an energetic, and extremely helpful lecturer. If she told me to sell my house I would.

She does a really good job explaining things to students. Has a wonderful personality and willing to give thoughts on any part of physics. Physics is still a difficult subject though, so class is tough even with Dr. Callan.
Absolutely fails to run the physics department. Homework and practice exams are nothing like the real exams and it feels like the professors WANT you to fail. You rely entirely on TAs.

Dr. Callan is an amazing professor, mostly because she is extremally accommodating and understanding. Sometimes her lectures aren't the most thorough and for studio you are mostly interacting the the TAs, who are usually great. If you ever have any problems she does not hesitate to help you; excusing homework, extensions (homework and tests), etc.

Really fails to run the Phys. Dept. well. None of the material is really taught which may or may not be a problem for some students. You kinda get used to being taught by the TA's, but it still sucks to be forced to attend lecture when TA's are all that matter.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: She's a solid professor. The lectures are really technical and things don't really make sense until you put the concepts in practice during studio. She's kinda funny and has a sunny demeanor. She will clearly answer any questions you have. She doesn't put you down if you offer the wrong answer and instead helps you discover the right answer.
Shes a really nice prof and super helpful in office hours. Definitely take her if you have the chance.

Dr. Callan is a really great prof. Shes super good at explaining concepts, especially in office hours. She cares a lot about her students and is really kind and willing to help you understand a concept, even multiple times.

Dr. Callan was really helpful when I was not doing well in class and really cares about helping her students succeed. She is really knowledgeable and is very friendly and helpful if you come to office hours. It can be a tough class at times but if you work hard she will help you get through it.

I attended lecture nearly every time and I don't think I learned anything from it. The pre-class readings didn't help either. The most effective way to learn is to just go to the studios but go to lecture for credit. If you want a good grade in this course.

Friendly and helpful. Has lots of available time w/ office hours. Solid lecturer, though tends to only call on people from the front who raise their hands. Lots of homework that can be challenging, but there are many ways to get help on it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Callan is an American hero. I could not have gotten through physics without her help. She is very invested in student learning and has loads of office hours to make sure students are successful. Go to these office hours if you want to succeed in physics, it is the only key to success in my opinion.

Dr. Callan is very friendly, approachable, and very passionate about teaching. She is always available during office hours, and she makes sure that you understand a concept. During lecture, she makes sure to understand and answer student questions. However, the majority of the learning is in studio, and the lectures are mostly for concepts.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Literally the kindest woman I have ever. She is the best teacher I've had in a long time and she shows an enthusiasm that spreads. Even though the topics can be hard, if you go in she is willing to go through the fundamentals with you. She is a 10/10 lady and is absolutely the best.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Callan is definitely one of my favorite professors at Mines. She is so down to earth, invested in her students and their learning, and is knowledgable in a tough subject. She explains so clearly and will make sure you understand what's going on. A great, confident, strong professor that I would highly recommend for Physics 1 !
Very good teacher, physics is just a hard subject to learn

Dr. Callan's class is difficult, but she is a good teacher. She is friendly, funny, and approachable. I personally did not enjoy her teaching style -- which consists of lots of clicker questions and talking to the people next to you, with little actual lecture -- but I know that other people love it. Don't skip class even if you feel like you could
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was difficult, especially the tests. Do all of the practice test problems! It really helps. I had Dr. Callan for lecture/discussion, and she was funny and did a good job. Additionally, when I went into her office hours, she did a fantastic job of helping me to understand and comprehend the material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Callan is energetic about Physics and it is clear she loves teaching. Physics 100 is difficult but Callan prepares you very well for it.
Callan is an awesome teacher with a friendly personality. She clearly loves physics and takes time to be available to students to help them succeed.
Dr. Callan gives great lectures and clearly loves her subject. She tries to be as available as possible for students and always gets back to student emails as quickly as possible.
Incredibly nice and made lectures enjoyable. Truly loves her job and seems to want to help every student succeed. Very glad she was my professor.
Never skip physics studio or homework, sometimes the free responses are things you've done in studio or on homework before
Her lecture notes are very helpful. I know students in other classes would review her lecture notes to understand the material better.

Callan is awesome! I didn't even liked physics before, but her lectures made it enjoyable. She is very enthusiastic and passionate about physics. It was her first year teaching college and she handled it like a pro. Her office hours were super helpful! She was very clear and helped me understand the hardest parts, which were important for the final

She was somewhat confusing during lectures sometimes and her method of writing out everything for each lecture takes too much time. She is doing well for her first year but she is confusing because she tends to make mistakes and gloss over some things during lecture.
Callen did a good job of making complicated material more digestible.
Even though the class was difficult, Professor Callan was extremely helpful. Highly recommended!

Callan is one of the best teachers I have ever had. This is her first year teaching college, but she lectures with the clarity and fluidity of someone who has taught many times before. I highly recommend her as a teacher, because even though the class is one of the hardest ones a freshman can take, she will make it enjoyable and absolutely doable.
Loved him but unfortunately did not pass the class
Very good lecturer, also super helpful for homework and other out of class assignments. Very good at explaining things in an understandable way.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Truly cares about his students and wants you to pass. He'll do his best to learn names and will not hesitate to help you if you reach out, whether at office hours, email, or the DifEQ discord

Dr. Nick is a phenomenal professor. He genuinely cares about his students, takes the time to learn their names, learns where they are struggling, and adapts his teaching based on student feedback. He is available outside of class, meaning you can almost always get help or someone to check your work with. If you can, take his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Nick is one of if not the best professor I've had at Mines. He truly cares about all of his students, learns all of their names, and wants to know how they're doing. His notes on the board are more than sufficient and if you copy them down you will be successful.  He is very good at answering questions and wants all of his students to succeed.

For MATH334 but that wasn't a dropdown option. Dr. Nick is easily the best professor I've ever had. His lectures are thorough and clear, and he makes sure everyone understands what is going on throughout the lecture. He's also incredibly helpful inside and outside of office hours. I'm choosing him for any class he's teaching that I have to take.

Professor made several mistakes throughout the lectures, on HWs, and on exams. Professor spent the majority of the lecture time reiterating what can be found in the textbook instead of showing us how to apply it to real world problems. Dr. Nick is not an adjuct faculty, but a higher up in the math department so these mistakes are unjustifiable.
Dr. Nick clearly cares about students learning the material and is regularly available outside of class for questions. His lectures are very good and he provides ample time for you to take notes.

Dr. Nick is by far one of the best Professors I have had at Mines. He is very engaging in class and deeply cares about his students and the subject. He learned everyone's names and was super available for office hours and through Discord. I cannot recommend you take his class enough!

Dr. Nick is one of the best math teachers I've had. He cares so much about his students and takes the time to learn everybody's names. He is very accessible outside of class and knows exactly what to teach because he is the course coordinator, so I feel extremely prepared for the tests. He tries really hard to make class fun which is refreshing.

Dr. Nick truly cares about his students and is always willing to give extra help when needed. Although I had class during the office hours stated in the syllabus, he would always find a time that worked for both of us and hold extra office hours, which really helped me grasp concepts.
Writes essays on the board and does not provide enough examples, he also gets distracted very easily. However he is a very laid back dude and clearly loves math.

Dr. Nick is a great professor, he clearly cares about his students and gives a very interesting lecture. No tests, and the homework is easy if you pay attention in class and aren't afraid to go to office hours, where he's always willing to guide you through discovering the proofs.

Dr. Nick is an amazing lecturer so I always come out of class with great notes ready to do the hw. He is also highly accessible outside of class in the discord channel where he and other students will respond very quickly to any questions.

It's clear that Dr. Nick loves two things: math and his students. He lectures clearly in a logical way, and explains concepts very well. If you pay attention and study for the exams, it is easy to do really well in his class.

Dr. Nick is a very down to earth and knowledgable professor. He is both respectful and caring of his students, and his classes are not too difficult. If you ever need help, he quickly replies to his emails, and he readily gives students extensions. Sometimes his classes can go a little off topic, but overall, Dr. Nick is a great professor.

Dr. Nick is a great professor who has really well planned lectures. It is also very evident that he is passionate about mathematics and ensuring that students understand the material. I would strongly recommend that you take a section offered by him if you have the opportunity.
Great professor. Would highly recommend. I had him for calc 1 and it made the experience great overall
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Amazing lecturer and very helpful when you have questions as he guides you but doesn’t flat out give you the answer
Dr. Nick really cares about his students' learning. He is a good lecturer and easy to pay attention to. He was very good at explaining things in a way that was easy to understand.
My favorite class of my first semester and my favorite teacher. Great lectures and clear explanations. Always willing to show derivations and teach extra after class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Nick is a very clear lecturer, funny and caring (he knew our whole class's names by the end of the semester). Would take again!
He is a good guy, has a sense of humor, and is available outside of class

Dr. Nick is a great professor! He is a fair grader, accessible, and funny. My only complaint about his class is that since it was fully remote, the only way to ask for help was through Discord. He is still great at helping though even if it's online instead of in person.

Mike is great at giving lectures, and he makes class entertaining, even if the material is very dry. He is very understanding and treats his students with respect. Great professor, but make sure to study for the tests, as there are only two of them and they are 60% of your grade.

Dr. Nick is one of my favourite professors at the school. Great at explaining calculus but an even better person. Always does a good job in lecture and willing to help people out. A solid choice for any class.
Best professor on the entire campus. MATH307 is a very hard class, but he makes it understadnable as long as you pay attention in class and take notes
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Nick was a great professor. I actually enjoyed going to Calculus. He does a good job lecturing and interacting with the students and is a really nice person in general. Would love to take a class from him again if the opportunity arises

Dr Nick is a great professor, he is a genuine great guy and cares about his students and does his best to know each one of his students names. He makes sure everything is clear and he is very approachable and makes it a goal to make math as interesting and easy as he can. I HIGHLY recommend Dr Nick as he is a all around great teacher and great guy.
He is a great guy. Really adamant about having the students derive methods rather than him... or at least that what he makes it seem like.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Nick is great. Intro to SciComp is a PITA, but he makes it fun and his lectures are among perfection. He presents all of the material you need to know in a clear and concise manner and is willing to spend extra time with you to help you really get it. He is a tough grader though, so be ready for that. He also writes the exams, so yeah.

Dr. Nick is a wonderful professor.  He does all of his lectures straight from memory (impressive) so he isn't staring at a piece of paper and regurgitating information onto the board.  Very helpful and his explanations make sense. His course is very interesting, and the tests are reasonable. No textbook is used for 307. Bonus: he's super funny.

Professor Nick is an awesome guy. He seems enthusiastic about what he teaches. Math307 is a pretty difficult class but Mike is always there to help when you need him. He also gives extra credit to the whole class when his favorite basketball team wins; hilarious.

Dr. Nicholas was extremely helpful any time there were questions or anything needed to be more specifically described. Office hours are amazing and he is always available. Responds to emails very quickly and always happy to help. He is the type of professor that does not want to see you fail, but wants you to learn. You put in work and he does too.

Professor Nick is a great teacher and truly wants his students to learn, do well, and enjoy it. He explains the material very clearly, so much so that I didn't read the textbook for Diff Eq, only used it for the homework problems. Diff Eq is still a math course and requires practice with doing problems. He is extremely approachable and friendly.
Dr. Nick is an awesome professor. He knows what he's talking about and tries to make the concepts easy to understand and applicable. Very helpful and approachable.

Awesome professor! Dr. Nick is entertaining, dorky, and knowledgeable. Everything you want in a math professor. The TA in my class didn't really grade homework fairly but that is Dr. Nick's fault. Wish I could take him for Diff EQ next semester.

Rodney Switzer is one of the greatest math professors I've had. He made showing up to a late 4pm lecture everyday pretty easy, and even almost exciting. I feel bad for everyone taking Calc III in the future, as Switzer is retiring, and they won't have the opportunity to have him as their professor.

Rod the God Switzer is an awesome teacher. He has so much experience teaching calculus that he knows exactly how to explain it so it's easy to understand. Unfortunately, he's retiring so you guys are out of luck. #PleaseRodDontRetire
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a great professor! He enjoys the material, making lecture fun and interactive. He cares about his students and is aware we are taking other classes, moving due dates based on other exams and events. He explains the material clearly, and wants you to understand and succeed. Favorite professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Rod seems to confuse himself during class making it hard to determine what hes trying to say. Also he took attendance 8 times and I missed one day the whole semester and it was one he took attendance in so I got a 87 in participation
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I'd like to leave comments but this website keeps telling me to remove URLs even though there are none in my comment. So I'll just leave it at Rod Tod is the best.

Rod deserves a higher rating than this. He is a great professor who takes time to explain things to students and also not bog you down with more than you need to know. He is almost like if Mr. Rodgers was a professor. I really enjoyed his class and I think he is a great professor for anyone.

Rod is a breath of fresh air! He's one of the only Calc teachers that teaches the traditional way so forget about all the pre class assignments the other sections have. His lectures are normally clear and easy to understand, and he'll often spend time showing some of the more confusing homework problems. Best teacher I've had at Mines!

Rod is the man. He won't waste your time telling you anything other than what you absolutely need to know, and he'll explain exactly how to word your answers to statistics problems, which makes tests super easy to study for. Your grade in the class will be 80 percent tests, though, which may be stressful for some.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Complains the whole class and teaches irrelevant information

I took AB calc before taking this course, so taking it with Rodney was perfect. I did not have to attend although I did. If you just talk with him you would realize how easy it is to click with him too.

My boy Switzer is a 10/10 teacher. I took him for Calc 1,2, & 3, and did not get below a 93% on any test. He does make you work for it, but things that are worth it do not come easy. He does lots of examples and makes sure you are prepared for the test. Lowkey gives hints before hand. Highly recommend if you put in work!

Hot Rod here is awesome! He can be somewhat of a dry lecturer but if you learn from examples he is your man! Who's mans? Your mans! The lowest test grade that I had was for calc 1, 2, and 3 was an 84. He gives great feedback and best of all he has really great dad jokes even if they're not intentional. I highly suggest him!
Rod is an awesome professor, very caring and super nice. He does assign more work than most professors, but it's nothing too overwhelming, and it definitely reflects when exams come around.
Switzer is a very nice guy and is very effective in teaching. He does make you do additional work for the class, but it was helpful in doing well on the exams.
Rod seems like a really nice guy and I think he really cares about his students but he is just not a good professor. There is a ridiculous amount of homework that he doesn't even teach us how to do.

Rod is a super chill guy who cares about his students. He takes a more informal approach to teaching which made me feel more comfortable in class when asking questions. He gets off topic sometimes but eventually comes back around to the topic.

Mr. Switzer is an awesome Calc professor who is somewhat informal about his teaching.  However, he is very engaging with his students and never lets anyone fall behind.  The only thing against him is that he is a Vikings fan.

Switzer is not great at explaining topics. He does't give any sort of explanation or background for a given math concept before he jumps into doing examples. I was teaching myself from the textbook the entire class. He's a great person and is helpful in office hours, but he's not such a  great lecturer.

The homework grader is ridiculously strict. We were also the literal only class that had to do additional bookwork for homework along with the weekly worksheet. The homework is long and unnecessary. I'm going to end up getting a C in the class due to the HW and I got a 98 and 94 on the first two tests... Avoid at all costs
He knows his stuff, but he is a very soft spoken and awkward guy who is not very good at explaining.
If you learn by examples, Switzer is perfect for you. Very helpful if you go to office hours.

He's a nice guy, but not a good teacher. It seems like he comes to class unprepared. He only does examples in class, but never explains what he is doing. His office hours are worthless because he will only ask if you read Paul's online notes and then will say to just use other resources to figure problems out.
Boring and doesn't plan out material well. We did the same easy concept for 2 weeks then  a bunch of hard topics the week before the test.
Nice guy but not very helpful. He comes to class unprepared and wings his lectures so it's often disorganized and hard to follow.

Easy class, but such a boring teacher.  It's torture sitting through his lectures.  He's very dull and monotone.  He seems like a nice guy, but teaching is not a strong point for him.  His homework's are fine, but he puts a lot on them if a break is about to come up and expects it due before the break.

Seems like a nice guy but horrible teacher. Seems unprepared and the examples are rarely finished...they aren't even good examples. He does a good job at introducing the topic but  he doesn't teach it in depth. You have to read the book or get help from another person to figure it out. And there is a TON of graded book work and weekly quizes.
Good guy, explains the material well and doesn't include unnecessary material. Tells you what you need to know and how to figure it out. Strait forward

Switzer is extremely clear in his presentation of linear algebra over the summer. His exams are generally fairly easy, with the exception of the final (which still was fair, but more difficult). Switzer likes to teach by doing examples, and rarely does derivations.

Switzer is a great teacher, he just teaches by example and if you can't learn that way, then don't take him. But if you attend class and pay attention you will notice he is a very interesting guy and really cares about how well you know the material. His test grades are always the highest of any other classes.

Had him for Calc 3 my freshmen year. He teaches verbatim from Paul's Online Notes (search it) so I ended up not going to class except to turn in homework. Often spent an inordinate amount of time going over trivial details in class but then again that seems to happen in most of "core" classes I've taken.
Thought he was a great teacher and teaches you very well for the tests.
took him twice... I should have learned the first time

Not really a bad guy, just a terrible teacher.  Does not know how to teach Diff. EQ.  If you get stuck with him, make sure to sit in the front of the class so that you can actually hear him.  His 'teaching' is dominated by examples that he get's online, some of which are helpful, most of which are not.  Not a super hard class at least.
AVOID HIM!
He's not bad. I really hate the textbook (it sucks at explaining) so I always go to class to understand the material  and I guess he does a fine job in explaining.
Do not get this guy.

Had him during field session. He's a great resource and it was great that he would make rounds in the labs to be available.  Think things through and make sure you try it for yourself before asking questions. He's the first to call you out for being lazy, but also the first to congratulate you when you figure it out. Make sure to format graphs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment:
Barankin is a great teacher. He provides a fun learning environment which most other faculty can not replicate. The nature of his subject (being difficult) unfortunately results in upset students.

Good teacher, class, and a great chicken video as well ...

Barankin is accessible outside of class, but he needs to work on his grading and feedback. He grades based on impossible and nitpicky standards that do not align with other professors in this course, and often provides feedback that is simply not helpful. Some examples are "?!?!?" and "OMG....". How is that constructive?

I like how my exams replaced my homework and quizzes, made tests more valuable and less pressure across the board.  The damned flipped lectures are terrible, Barankin has a gift for lecturing and he squanders it by relying on screen casts to deliver material.  Have screen casts as a resources instead of mandatory portion of the content delivery! :3
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Barankin does care about students (he will come into Alderson on the weekends to help occasionally), but it does not feel that way. He is consistently rude and made me cry when I went to him for help. I do not recommend taking his classes and have since avoided him.

I've taken Barankin before, but chose not to take him for CBEN375. I now find myself going only to him for help on our projects or for course content - I wish I had taken him as my professor too. He is the only prof who cares about student success enough to be willing to help students at any hour. That help is the reason I succeeded in this class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Barankin genuinely is really accessible during office hours if you have questions and a friendly guy overall, but prepare to be overworked, graded harshly, and frustrated with your major.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I took professor Barankin for senior design & while the class itself was stressful due to all the hours of research for sizing, economics, etc., I can definitely say that he is a pretty great prof. He was like one of the only professors to be walking around 2nd and 4th floor labs asking if anybody needed help. Tough(ish) grading, but good feedback.

I really enjoy Barankin as a professor. Hes great at explaining and cares a lot about his students. Even has a discord for HW help. For Fluids, class time was spent on problems with video lectures to watch before class. I didnt overly like this cause there was so many videos so it was hard to keep up but just need to put the effort in to do good

Dr. Barankin was heavy on assignment loads and a bit of a nitpicky grader when comparing to the other professors. At times, certain comments in grading seemed a bit passive aggressive and not helpful. He was generally available to discuss and help when necessary, however.

Barankin is a really nice dude. That being said, his class has been the worst course structure I've ever experienced. Nearly impossible to keep track of all the assignments, and class expectations change nearly every other week. Tests were unfairly written (admitted by the prof) and a flipped classroom style made it worse. Such a stressful course.

Professor Barankin is a tough but caring professor who is more than willing to stay up well past established office hours to help students understand material. Genuinely enthusiastic about teaching material, but he will challenge your understanding of core topics in the class.

If you love learning from prerecorded videos and only doing practice problems in lectures then this is the professor for you! If it sounds like you could learn the same information from reading the textbook hate to waste Mines tuition then I don't recommend Barankin.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Michael Barankin ignored student needs and left rude comments on many student's assignments. He is occasionally friendly, but is quick to assert himself and make students feel dumb. He is extremely defensive of his teaching techniques despite repeated suggestions to better methods (as seen in his replies on this webpage).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Barankin gets too much hate. He always tried to help and he made that clear. He was always responsive and I liked his use of Discord. With that being said, I did not love his flipped lecture approach but that's more on me because I never watched the lectures and I didn't follow what happens in class. The videos were helpful when studying for exams.

Dr. Barankin was responsive to emails and held lots of office hours to help students. He definitely cares. However, his teaching style is not for everyone. Personally, I would have done better reading the book and paying attention only to examples in class. The lecture slides confused me more often than they helped. He put in a lot of effort though

I think people that leave bad reviews for Dr. Barankin are the ones that allow their sentiment to drive their review rather than facts. The fact is Dr. Barankin never tested or quizzed on something he hasn't explained, done an example problem or given a homework example about. He's always willing to help and even stayed past 11pm helping students.

Take it from a senior, kids. if the professor is using slides for the class you are paying hundreds of dollars for, get out of that class. This is the first sign that tells you that they will give you error-filled homework, solutions, lecture notes, and instructions as he did. Unless it's an elective class, using slides is a red flag.

The best professor. Genuinely cares about your learning and is always willing to teach you. You have to have thick skin because he will ask you follow up questions and challenge you, but it's not to make you feel dumb. It shows you don't know it well enough, and you learn it way better and remember after that.

Barankin is a great professor. He listens to feedback and tries to make his classes as best as they can be. Transitioning to online was hard for all of us and he made it pretty easy. Often I would ask questions about the homework around midnight the night before it was due and he would always answer. He cares about his students and their learning.

Barankin does not care about low level ChemE courses which is a shame as this is the first real ChemE class you take. His lectures were disorganized and messy with work for problems written all over the screen, making it hard to actually learn. He also prides himself on failing students and if you try to ask for help he is rude and of little help.
Didn't really make the extra effort during the lockdown with classes. It felt particularly scattered, compared to most courses during COVID
Class isn't hard but the professor lacks interest in his students
Run for the hills! He will come off as nice but will drive you nuts throughout the semester!

Dr. Barankin is an awesome professor, and crushed the online format. He always had time for office hours even out of schedule. He offered in person office hours for an online class and even reached out and offered me a tour of the unit operations lab, which was a blast. It's clear Dr B is going to perfect his teaching craft, as he cares a butt ton!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: I guess all the reviews that he cares about students only applies to upper level ChemE classes and not a 210. If you have questions, he will respond somewhat negatively/rudely. Also, he has terrible handwriting and will complete half of a 10 minute problem completely wrong the first time you learn it so that you'll always be confused!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Barankin is an excellent teacher. He cares about how his students are doing and pushes them to learn the content to the best of their abilities. His class is very structured and you have to work hard to get a good grade, but you learn a lot about the thermodynamics of systems and what it means to be a chemical engineer.
The worse professor in the Chemical Engineering department.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Best professor ive taken at mines so far. Material isnt easy, and tests are even harder. But he prepares you for everything you need to know to succeed. Just do the dang homework if you want a better grade than me

Professor Barankin is one of the few professors nowadays who genuinely cares about his students and their success; not only in the course but after college as well. He emphasizes portions of material which are used in industry and separates reality from ideality. As a transfer student at Mines, I feel he has arguably been the most impacting prof.

The people that HATE him are the type of people that need to blame someone for their mistakes. He genuinely cares for students and is great in office hours. ChemE isn't easy, so the material is a challenge. If you show that you are making a sincere effort, he will go out of his way to help you.

Super passionate about what he does. He'll tell you when you're wrong about something straight up (which may be taken as mean/rude by some) but at the same time, he also admits when he is wrong. He's not perfect but he does his best and that's something I can really respect about the dude.
Dr. Barankin gives good lectures, and is available to answer questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Barankin is a very caring and skilled professor. He shows up to class on time and is ready to share his knowledge to his students. A pro at what he does and teaches. Cannot recommend enough.
Really cares about student success! Would take again!
one of the best teachers I have ever seen and studied from
Alex is an amazing teacher: he simplified a lot of my difficulties in understanding the standard model, and sold me on String Theory. Amazing teacher.

I don't really get why people like this guy. He frequently deviates from phys. material in class and his teaching basically consists of doing niche problems without explaining the process. Nevermind that you still don't know the basic methods and rarely use whatever is taught anyway. Homework rarely reflects classwork.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: In my 6 years at CSM, undergrad and grad, I think I've only met 2 or 3 other Profs as fun and engaging a lecturer as Dr. Flournoy. The material he teaches is inherently very hard, but between his humor, lectures, and extensive open door policy, I found myself learning some of the most incredible things I've encountered in Physics.

I took his classes on youtube. His teaching made me improve my knowledge in General relativity. Anyone trying hard to figure out things in General relativity, I would recommend he/she starts by following Flournoy's GR classes.

The class is by far one of the hardest classes that I have ever taken. However, Flournoy is an incredible professor that is really great at teaching. If you are taking Phys 1, it should be with him. You need to work HARD for an A.

Alex is my favorite professor that I have had so far at mines. He is really good at teaching and he also is really funny. His class is one of the few classes I have had this year where I haven't had any issues paying attention. Physics 1 is definitely a hard class but he made it so much easier.

Alex will help you if you ask for it, and he will respect you if you respect him. Stay off your phone, do your pre-class readings, and participate during discussions (classes are discussions, not lectures) if you want to have the best experience in his physics 1 class. He also offers an easy extra credit opportunity at the end of each semester!

Flournoy tries his best to help his students. He is approachable and has lots of office hours, and he knows how to explain concepts in different ways if you don't understand it. The tests are difficult, and you really have to work for a grade, but that's for the class in general.
He is excellent at explaining the material, MAKE SURE YOU PAY ATTENTION!

He's an overall decent professor. His lectures are forced to be engaging because of the iClicker questions you have to participate in. He's definitely strict but makes the occasional jokes that are actually funny. Overall, I don't think I love him or hate him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Engaging lectures with plenty of quirk to keep your interest and plenty of questions to make sure that you know your content from reading, or learn from your mistakes and misunderstandings.
Really, your phys 1 lecture prof doesn't matter all that much. Most of the learning is done in studio. However, this professor is hilarious and makes the class interesting. I would recommend him.
I just had Dr. Flournoy for physics studio but he was always super helpful whenever we asked him questions
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Transfer student here. I didn't pass the Phys challenge exam and had to retake this class. Very glad I did. Alex is amazing.  Every lecture clarified topics that my previous prof never properly explained. There were many lectures that had me reconsidering my major. Plus he's pretty funny and not bad to look at.

I had Alex for the discussion (lecture) section of Physics 100. His lectures are very informative on the topic material. It does help to do the summary reading before coming to lecture. Alex's lectures can also be very entertaining, especially during his demonstrations. Alex definitely knows physics. He's very knowledgeable and very willing to help
Very funny, and not bad at explaining the material.

Funny in lecture, good at explaining things and makes the hard aspects of physics as simple as possible. The tests are tough because its physics, but if you study the way he tells you, it is very easy to get an A. If you don't understand some aspect of the lecture, he is always available after class to clarify. Physics studio helps more though.

Flournoy was always pretty entertaining during lectures. The demonstrations that he did were interesting to watch and also helped with learning, but most of the physics learning happens during studio where you can practice problems. He was a funny guy who I would have as my professor again given the option.

Alex is very informative and makes his lectures very entertaining. That being said, I found studio and homework more helpful when learning the material. I mainly attending lecture because we gain participation points using iClicker questions.

Flournoy was a great professor-he was fun and engaging with students while still being very serious about his teaching. He made sure to highlight tricky concepts/loopholes to prepare everyone as best as possible for the exams. He also had a thing for bunnies, like Pat Kohl. Gotta love the physics department, even if you are a comp sci major like me

Keep in mind in PHGN 100 & 200 that a team of profs and lead TA's make very consistent between sections. That said, I absolutely loved Alex. He is very interested in his students' success, and his lectures are clear, direct, and engaging. I feel that Alex a large reason why I chose to switch to a physics major and came back to TA PHGN 100.

Great professor! Definitely would recommend for others. Made the lectures interesting, while still explaining the material well. Also he pretty clearly outlines what is on the test if you pay attention in lecture!

Excellent Teacher.  Certainly one of the best options for a Physics I professor at Mines.  He can really explain stuff well.  Physics is hard, but it will be easier if you have Flournoy to help you understand it!

Flournoy is an amazing lecturer, one of the best I have had. Super clear, good at answering questions in lecture. Have not interacted a lot with him outside of lecture in person so cannot comment there.
Great teacher, and made the lectures a little more interesting.  Did review sessions before exams which I thought were helpful.
Very clear explanation.As my experience, you should choose him rather than the other professors.

Dr. Flournoy was, as others have said a great teacher and helpful when asked questions. He, along with Dr. Stone, were not willing to help my grade out a VERY small amount when I provided what I thought to be a plethora of legitimate reasons why it should have been higher. This is the first B I ever received in a course. Helpful but strict.
Great!
He's great!  I hate physics, to be honest.  He made it interesting.  He's WAY better than the alternatives.
One of the best professors I have ever had.  Very helpful in office hours.
Great lecturer but that is about it. He was quite rude to me in office hours and really did not seem that he wanted to help

OK at lecturing, but does tend to get a bit confusing and not make it through all of the material. Spends lots of time making sure the concepts are understood, not just memorized. Good examples given in class
Worst professor I've had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the only professors I have had that has been extremely clear, concise, and organized in his thoughts. Great at answering questions in a way that makes sense. Would definitely recommend to anyone.
Dr. Hadi moves through content at a steady pace. If you keep up with his lectures and genuinely do the homework, his tests are very straight forward.

I ended up passing the class with an A despite getting a 55% on the first exam. This is because the class average was so low that he had to curve the overall course grade almost 10% for enough people to pass. I originally wrote a paragraph about how bad his class was, but I'm only allowed 350 characters. Simply put, don't waste your time with him.

Worst class and professor experience I've had at Mines. Doesn't care about students' learning and tells us that he "expects us to do poorly". Not encouraging or helpful in office hours or in Q&A sessions. Incredibly demoralizing and just overall rude to students. Only good thing is he curves the class to an 80 avg at the end.

Worst experience in a class at Mines. Patronizing and blames students for bad test performance claiming "he knew we would do horribly" yet does nothing to change this. Received D on exam after missing one problem. Rude in office hours and does not encourage learning. Blames students for not attending class, but you're better off not attending.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Three tests, they are worth 75% of our grade, no partial except for like one problem, my semester avg on the first two where 25/40.... enough said. Homework was hard, usually not on a test was kind of pointlessly difficult... legit just read off the slides and sent out an email telling us all we did bad on exam one and it was all our fault...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Hadi made me lose my passion for engineering. He is not responsive to emails, belittles students for not understanding content, and doesn't offer any extra credit or opportunity to make up grades. There are three exams worth 75% of your grade, and each one consists primarily of multiple-choice questions with no partial credit. Run while you can.

This has been the hardest class that I have taken at Mines, period. Lectures are super dry - he just reads straight off of the slides and doesn't do ANY examples on the board, besides the few on the slides.

75% of your grade consists of 21 multiple choice questions and 3 free response questions. That is ~3% of your overall grade PER QUESTION.

I sat at the very front and could still barely hear him. Hadi "teaches" by reading off slides and talking down to students. Barely anyone attends class after the first few weeks because it is pointless.

The exams are worth 75% of your grade so if you don't pass them, you are doomed. He is very difficult to understand and lectures are pretty boring. He told us to try harder when the average for the first exam was low instead of rethinking his approach of teaching. Worst professor I ever had.
You will learn better by watching the provided YouTube lectures. Find a different professor!

The worst prof I have ever had, does not care about any of his students and blames low average test scores on the students intelligence. Doesn’t annotate ever and is extremely difficult to understand. Only prof of eeng281 that gives exams, or homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Does not put much effort into lectures. The exams and homework are very difficult, not a lot of support for students outside of class because his office hours are only immediately after class so if you can't make them it's difficult to get help. A very difficult class with not much preparation to succeed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Far and away the worst professor I have ever had. His lectures are horrible. He is incredibly soft-spoken and only reads off of a set of slides. Avoid at all costs.

I must say A good professor knows how to bring out the best from his student. This semester I took one of the toughest courses, Computational Electromagnetics. The way he taught this course and the effort I love this. I have never experienced such good teaching. Thank you, Professor Mohammed Hadi.
I felt like I was set up to fail. His lectures were poorly delivered summaries of the book, with no explanations but just reading slides. The homeworks were brutal and the tests were too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Pros: no final, 2 attempts on exams, lectures only on MW and Friday is an office hour, clear expectations and grading, lecture slides are posted in advance, very helpful in OH, learned a lot. Cons: 5 canvas exams throughout the semester worth 15% each, Mastering homework every week, seemed overall more difficult than the other sections.

Whoever thought it was a good idea to make tests 75% of the grade is insane. Not only that, 8 question tests make it extremely difficult to do well if you miss more than 2 questions. The lectures do not reflect the homework nor the tests. He doesnt really teach and because of how hes set up office hours, I cant attend them.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Worst class ever. Grade has 75% based on 5 mini-tests that are only 8 questions so if you miss even 2 you get a 75% for that test. Really really awful grading scheme and there is just no way to really do well in this class unless you are already an electrical engineer.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Hadi is the worst professor I've had yet. Not because he is bad at teaching, but because he doesn't teach. His lectures are too simple compared to the homework. It doesn't help that Hadi doesn't respond to emails, has no office hours, and ignores in-class questions. Maybe it's because we are online but that's no excuse for not being accessible.

Very content heavy lectures. Must read the book outside of class if you want a true understanding. Participation quizzes at the end of every class. The exams were very complex, but you were allowed a cheat sheet. When E-Learning began, lectures were done on your own with an audio file and a pdf. You were given multiple tries as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Hands down one of the worst profs I've ever had. After classes went online for COVID he essentially gave up on the class. He couldn't do Zoom lectures so instead he decided to post his already confusing lecture slides and a seperate audio file you had to play simultaneously which was absolutely no help. I HIGHLY recommend on switching profs.

Hadi is the only professor I've had that has responded to a situation that makes learning more difficult with more homework. In the face of mines turning to digital classes in response to COVID-19 he roughly doubled the homework workload in an already labor intensive class

No idea how this guy has so many good ratings. The first exam average was around 25% with the majority of students getting lower than that AND he blamed the students for not studying hard enough. On top of that he assigns in-class work that is graded on Accuracy so if you don't understand the material right away you're screwed.

Classic example of a professor who doesnt care about the lecture half of his job. Sits behind a podium and clicks through the lecture slides, which he provides online anyway. Difficult explanations, and rushed material that is weeks ahead of other sections with the same test date. Would not recommend, dont make the same mistake I did.
He explains every example from the ground up clear and concisely. At the end of his class, you will know what you are doing on the final. Just study like usual (alot)

Dr. Hadi was a fantastic teacher. He knows his stuff really well which means he can explain material very well. He is also always happy to answer questions after class and in office hours. As other reviews said, he can sometimes be hard to understand but other than that, I would highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: WARNING: Mohammed is very soft spoken. If you have hearing problems like me, it is absolutely essential to sit in the front of the classroom. Other than that PSA, Mohammed is a solid professor. His lectures are helpful and most importantly, his exams are easy... his circuits exams are so much easier than the exams from other professors. Easy A.
Not a strong circuits student. Second time taking Hadi's class. Horrible teacher & lecturer. Better off watching Ammerman's lectures on YouTube. You will learn more.

Circuits are not my best area to say the least. I feel like Hadi did a good job of teaching them though. He's good at answering questions and he does a lot of examples. Take notes! We had a Mastering assignment and a written assignment each week.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Hadi's lecture style is unique, to say the least. He does lots of examples and if you pre-read they are very helpful. Don't expect to be able to just go to lecture to pass the class. His accent is difficult to understand sometimes but if you sit near the front you'll be fine. Very helpful in office hours and is knowledgeable.

This was the worst class I've taken at the university level. Dr Hadi was horrendous as a lecturer. He provided little clarity for  very a difficult concept. Avoid this instructor at all costs. It should be noted that he was an adjunct so beware of him at other universities.
She takes care of all students and respects that people have different levels of understanding.

Hands down best professor at Mines. If you get the chance to take her classes, do it. She can answer any question because she knows so much detail about the material. Also, she is very inspirational during the hard times at Mines. Favorite professor I've had.
Jane Walker is very caring and everything you want from a professor. You can tell she enjoys her job and that she wants the best for her students.
Best math teacher I've ever had.
Great teacher 10/10

Dr. Walker explains material thoroughly, and the example problems she does in class reflect the homework and test material well. She is very available in office hours, and is very caring and approachable. Excellent Calc III prof.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Walker made Calc 3 a lot easier! Her class notes are the best, they very organized and neat. She is kind to everyone and optimistic. MML is optional in her class and instead, she does worksheet days that were helpful for me in understanding the material. She is always willing to help her students even outside her office hours.

Great teacher, very example heavy and I probably used more notebook pages than any math class before. She is great at repetition and emphasizing what is important, which is great for long calc 3 problems. She is really positive and was easy to ask for help. Plus she gave us full-size candy bars for Halloween.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Truly a gem of a professor. Such a night and day difference from a lot of professors I've had here at Mines. One of the sweetest and most helpful people you'll ever meet. You can tell she wants everyone to learn something, and cares about the students' well being. Perfect way to end my school day with her class at 4pm.

I absolutely loved this professor for CALC 3. She is such a great person and is an amazing teacher, her lecture are easy to understand. If not she is happy to meet you and explain it. She also has worksheet days to help work on homework. The class is not hard if you go to class and look over the worksheets for tests.
