If I hadn't had Jane Walker for Calc 3, I don't think I would have understood any of it. By far the best professor I have had at Mines so far and if you have the opportunity to take her class, do it. Only thing I would suggest is to REALLY not miss class because the lectures cover quite a bit of material and she does a lot of helpful examples.
Jane Walker is the best teacher I have had at Mines. You can tell she really loves what she does, and her methods keep me engaged and prepare me so well for tests.

Professor Walker is the best! I wont lie, calc 3 was FAR from easy and was very tough at times, but professor walker was always there to help! her office hours are equivalent to having a private tutor, I have never meet a professor who is so passionate about helping her students succeed!
One of he best profs at Mines. Really caring and will explain concepts in as much detail as you need. Get on her good side and treat her with respect. She is like the grandma I have never had lol

I did not enjoy Calculus 2, but Prof. Walker is hands-down one of the best professors here at Mines. The tests would throw some curveballs, but nothing that wasn't manageble. Worksheets were some work, but Walker dedicates a class purely for you to ask questions. Aced the final, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Jane is an amazing teacher. She is upfront and honest with students with the clear goal that she wants everyone to succeed. She is very friendly in office hours. She teaches you what you need to know and gives lots of examples. As a result of the more examples, her lectures are quickly paced, so be prepared for quick writing.

Take her NOW! She is amazing at what she does. She won't waste a second of your time and she teaches you perfectly for the exams. She's almost robotic in the way she lectures. Her handwriting is gorgeous and she moves quickly through the material so you can work on the worksheets in class on Fridays; she drops a worksheet too!
Professor Jane's lecture are super easy to understand. She explained everything very clearly, and worked out a lot of practice problems in class to ensure students understand the contents.

She is fantastic! Really knows her stuff and has an incredibly polished lecture style. Moves fast, but it's worth it for help on worksheets. She does lots of examples, each with a small twist or complication that makes each different. This is very helpful for doing homework and taking tests later on.

Incredible. If you ever have the privilege of being able to take her class - take it! She has all of the qualities of a perfect professor. Very clear and easy to understand. My only complaint is that she does a lot of examples in class.
She has been my favorite professor so far!

I absolutely love Jane Walker! She is so nice, and she does a good job explaining the material. You will feel very prepared when test time comes around. She gives you step by step instructions to solve the problems. Be prepared to take notes quickly during class though.
Excellent teacher. Makes very complicated subjects seem easy. Could teach calculus to anyone. She is very passionate about what she does and is my favorite teacher I've had at Mines so far

The best calculus teacher, hands down. She explains everything clearly with her slides and examples- also very approachable for help. Doing your homework will be more work of course, but it was really good for me to have  the quizzes for me to get it done. Overall, awesome.
By far the best teacher I've had at Mines. She loves what she does and explains complicated concepts in a simple way.
Probably the best calc teacher at mines. You can tell she loves to teach. The homwork quizzes she has really help you understand the material...even if it takes a while to complete everything!
She is one of the best teachers you'll ever meet! She is so clear in explaining things! Very helpful and most important part for me is that she always smile :D
Great teacher! She explains everything very clearly and with several examples. Be prepared to do the book work, she has lots of "homework quizzes."
Best math professor I've ever had. She could teach calculus to a 3rd grade class. Very clear and always willing to help.
Awesome teacher, always helpful and gives great examples/explanation
Best teacher ever
No Comments
No Comments

Becky is an awful teacher that fails to relate to any of the students. She does not understand that she is teaching business/economics to engineering student and has an unclear grading scheme. A lot of my work for the semester was just busy and utterly useless. Nonetheless, the class was not difficult just annoying and frustrating.

Becky at her core is a kind person, but it is completely rotted out by her incredible ego. Narsiccistic to the core, she will contantly flaunt herself and show off what she does with her "actual life" while always complaining how hard it is to grade. She assigns homework she rarely understands or does herself, and has no empathy for students
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor is disorganized and cannot teach. The quizzes were a waste of time, and the cases she assigned towards the end of the semester are an immense amount of work. Majority of learning was done through reading textbook and ignoring her. Save your time and energy and take someone else or switch majors.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor is incredibly disorganized with her coursework. She will slam multiple papers due within the same week along with an in-class quiz. This in-class quiz is under a 25-minute time limit and is written so poorly to accommodate for such a short period. One of the questions was a full-page word problem with absurd numbers for calculations.

I found her lectures pretty useless but she can be helpful outside of class. The homework is easy but basically an annoying online class. She also has a tendency to forget to post things on canvas and then not change the due date even if you can't access the assignment until right before the deadline.

Terrible teacher who fails to teach content properly and expects every student in the room to know exactly what she's talking about (which is often not related to the readings or any other info needed for the class).  The workload is extreme and she is not cognizant of other classes.(scheduled multiple quizzes for the same day as calc 1 exams)

I'd estimate that 90 percent of the learning is done outside of class in the bulk of busy work that you're assigned. As long as you stay on top of things and do the readings, you should be fine. Dr. L is a sweet person, but I can't say I'm a huge fan of her lectures. Unless youre minoring in business, I wouldn't reccomend taking this class.

This class will teach investment strategies way past what the average person not working in banking can pursue. What I learned is invest early in a mutual fund and let is sit, that's it. hardly anything from this class can be applied to personal investing unless you have tons of free time. Lectures are bad and lots of busy work you will learn excel

If you'd like to enjoy your first semester at CSM, don't bother taking this class. The homework load is insane, and she treats EBGN 201 as if it's the most important class you'll take at Mines. It's not required anymore, and it takes up a ridiculous amount of time outside of class. Good luck
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Lot of group projects, lectures were not helpful, quizzes were supper hard, but you can pass the class if you do well on the group and individual projects. TAs did not help.
People will say she is bad because of all of the homework but that is just intrinsically a part of the class.

Professor Lafrancois is a really sweet person. She teaches the concepts in an understandable way as long as you pay attention and are motivated to learn the concepts. Yes, the class has a lot of busy work, but I found that as long as you stayed on top of it, it wasn't a lot compared to other courses. She didn't give us a final which was nice too.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Absolutely terrible teacher. She gives an insane amount of homework all of which is busy work and the lectures are the worst part of my week. She assigned us some articles which were from Wikipedia and both were flagged by the website for not having any references or citations. The grading is so confusing and she is unnecessarily harsh. DO NOT TAKE

She is a horrible teacher. She doesn't teach content in class but rather makes you pay for a program to do your homework and teach yourself. She's a narcissist and only cares about talking about herself in class. The content she talks about is usually old and doesn't teach new content in class but rather reviews old material.
Not great,
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Crap teacher who doesn't know how to take criticism. The way she teaches the classes are generally pointless and she has an overinflated ego. Overall terrible teacher and I hope the worst for her.

Her lectures are unbelievably boring and gives a stupid amount of busy work (but some of her classes don't have tests). She tries to connect with students but really doesn't know how so her jokes and stuff are met with silence. At times she expects you to read her mind on what she wants you to do/submit for projects and grades like you should know.

Prof. Lafrancois is a great professor. She definitely wants you to learn. For EBGN 345, there is definitely a lot a homework, but what is being taught is very useful. Tip: If you take EBGN 321 along with this class, lots of topics overlap which is helpful!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: I took econ online so I didn't interact with Becky too much. With that being said, the few times I did interact were pleasant and she really did try to help you pass. She gave tons of feedback and tried her best to teach a course where you learn mostly from the textbook. She's always available when you need her and very understanding.

This course is 80% online work. Long hours of homework, discussions, and projects. Her classes are useless. With a class structure like this, you would expect the transition to online (due to COVID-19) to be smooth, but it is far from that. She makes a big fuss about her class! It's a non STEM class in an engineering school, it won't matter as muc

Her classes are extremely boring. She wants us to consider her subject important, so she kills us with a heavy workload. As we switched to online, her class became a heavy burden as she added even more work. Other departments have been far more understanding and helping. I really don't advise anyone to take a class with her.

frankly Becky is not a good professor, she doesnt engage with students properly, she doesnt add any material or understanding through her lectures. all of the material was learned through an online textbook. She managed to make the material more confusing and was wrong on many occasions. we are all surprised that the university has not fired her.

Becky is nice and makes a lot of jokes. She displays some political bias in the class room, which is a bit annoying. Also, she does not teach the material that well and the class is in general just bad.

This class is mostly online with one lecture per week. The online portion and the lecture portion don't fully cover the same material. There are hours of homework per week and also time consuming discussions and projects. Professor LaFrancois is unprepared for class and does not teach well. Get ready to have to learn a lot on your own.
math based, which is nice
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Flipped class style. You have to watch pre-lecture videos and take notes on those. After watching the videos, you have to take pre-lecture quizzes (80% of the questions can just be googled). In class, you are placed in groups and work on assignments. This class is heavily dependent on your group members. She does not explain topics well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Cranky, doesn't go over what will be on tests, book wasn't really needed but helped explain stuff she never talks about. Tests much harder than the homework and not on what she talks about in class

Good teacher, but don't expect her to lay everything out and hold your hand through the class. Took the class as an elective and enjoyed it. She runs out of time lecturing but she compensated for a cruddy textbook pretty well.
Average teacher, will have a hard time keeping your interest.

She can grade a little tough, but that's because it's a math-focused course and the math is VERY easy (Aside from the stupid switching of X and Y axes that economists have to do for some reason). Very disorganized (didn't know my grades till almost the end of the semester) but very helpful when e-mailed or visited. Great sense of humor.

Teaches you everything about the econ topics except what you need to know. Can't write clear test questions. Copies homework assignments from other universities. Often fails to cover lecture material in a timely manner. You need to use the textbook and teach yourself the material for this course because the processors don't.

Becky doesn't teach the stuff she puts on quizzes or tests, you might as well not even study.  She just likes to talk about herself in class then makes her tests super hard.  I would never take her again.

I've loved most of my classes with him. Really funny, nice, helpful professor. Useful lectures, useful homework, good resources, and totally fair exams. His classes convinced me to take on an EE minor.

Sager may not be the best at teaching conceptual classes like ISS(EENG310), but for a skills based class like circuits, sager may be one of the best. His ability to run through example, clearly noting his personal thinking and mistakes make him a great professor for this class, as the tests are way easier than either the lecture examples or HW.

Fine professor for Digital Logic, but is not the best at explaining the possible uses of building block components, and doesn't spend quite enough time exploring more interesting problems that cause trouble on the homework. Pop-quiz's are quite difficult to deal with in this class as it's quite fast paced.

Dr. Sager usually gets a rep that he reads off the slides and while that is true to an extent, he still covers the content well. In this class specfically, there is not as much material he has to cover in one class and this makes his lecture alot better compared to a content heavy course like EENG 310.

Lecture consists of Sager reading directly off slides. The exams like to focus on minute details rather than major topics. Be sure to spend too much time on your cheat sheet to have as many details as possible.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Reads off the slides. Lacks empathy.

Dr. Sager is a nice guy, but just reads off slides during lectures and does not explain topics in a good order. 
Quizzes and Exams are full of half-baked questions, some very easy, and some gotcha questions.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He simply read off of slides and made occasional jokes. I took the section with a lab. Between homework, exams, and the lab reports, I did well in the class. However, Dr. Sager lied about the final. He put out completely irrelevant review materials and assured everyone that it would be on the basics. The average for the final ended up being a 55%.
so hard

My favorite professor. His teaching style is very engaging, he cares about your learning, and his number one priority is making sure you understand the material. Other students tell me he's difficult to understand based on his accent, but he is aware of it and does his best to help you understand. One of the best professors in the department.

As I graduate now, I have to say Prof. Sager was my favorite. He is the nicest professor I've had. He is clearly interested in the topics that he teaches. He cares more about understanding than answering contrived questions. He never gives up on me nor anyone when stuck. He pays attention to our learning, making lectures super understandable.
A very nice person, but lectures are all over the place, hard to follow, and he constantly flip flops between what answers are supposed to be. Exams are usually fairly easy,

Sager is a great professor overall. He really cares about the material he teaches, always trying to connect why certain topics are important to upper division courses. Lectures are simple, exams are easy, and he is always accessible outside of class. He clearly loves his students and the subject. His accent takes a bit to get used to, however.
Sager is very kind and understanding. He has no problem giving extensions on homework and exams and it is easy to do well in his class if you put in the effort.
He is a very kind soul. Good balance of jokes and respectful learning environment

Sager is such a kind and understanding professor. He teaches the content in a way that is understandable. I appreciate all of the effort he puts into making sure students have access to the course content.

Sager is a good professor; he's a little all over the place but he stops about 10 times per lecture to make sure everyone is following him. He makes Digital Logic easy by taking the time to ask if everyone is with him every step of the way through a lecture.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: The class itself is very easy to follow and Professor Sager does a decent job explaining the content. Unfortunately at the beginning of the semester the Professor said there was no homework in the course but for the labs you are expected to complete a full coding project that takes at least 6 hours every week. Great class, bad homework.

Exams are super easy, takes minimal studying. He has a lot of extra credit and chances to make up points Sager is super nice and understanding. His lectures are quite boring and he just reads from the slides.
Lectures are scattered and very difficult to follow.

This professor is literally useless. He fails to answer the most basic questions, acts busy when he does not know the answer or keeps going in endless circles and ends up wasting your time and everyone else's time. I am deeply disappointed!

While very accessible outside of class in principle, as a professor he is near useless in class. Most of the concepts are briefly mentioned or gone into extreme depth with no in-between. There will be very long derivations that are ultimately useless to the class content. Even in office hours, the added instruction is not useful in the slightest
Great professor and respects students
Very enthusiastic in teaching! Gives a lot of real life example to help student understand better. Such an amazing lecturer
He is one of the best professors who taught the class

It is clear to me that Dr. Hisham Sager has a passion for the subject. He respects the person and potential of all students, without prejudice. Prof. Sager is really attentive to the needs of students, reasonable and fair. He is always seeking to be better and more effective.
Best prof I've ever had

He is such a good professor! His exams are by far the most reasonable exams Ive ever had here at mines. As long as you show up, do the homework, you will do well on exams and in the class. Although sometimes lecture can be a little boring he is very caring and really willing to work with students and the whole class so everyone can succeed.
I learned a lot from this class.

Very professional, organized, clear, and efficient. Gave proper insight into material and a good emphasis on the right topics. Excellent balance of theory/derivation to example/mechanics. Smart and formal while remaining clear and accessible. Generally likeable guy and helpful at office hours. One of the best professors I've had.

Literally reads word for word from his slides while underlining words as he goes as if that will help his teaching. The examples in class are basic & simpe then the homeworks will be difficult. I would never go to class if he didn't take attendance because it is a complete waste of time since i teach myself anyways.

This professor is really awful. He just flies through powerpoint slides, reading them word for word to the class and then moving on to the next slide. There's no time or opportunity for any learning during lecture, so in order to succeed you have to teach yourself.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Im actually blown away there are no reviews yet for this professor seeing as he is the worst i've had so far. i like to think he knows his stuff, but he is just so boring. take his class if you want a good nap

I had Kuo for PHGN100 studio and he was a wonderful studio coordinator. He would engage with the class briefly at the start, and then help students during the studio. He explains concepts clearly and is a sweet person to talk to. Despite seeming a little intimidating, he is kind to students and loves physics.
Professor Kuo is the reason I haven't transferred yet.

Dr. Kuo is by far the best professor I have had. I had him for Phys I and specifically took him again for Phys II. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He is very helpful in office hours and will walk you through every concept/ problem you don't understand. If you can take his class I highly recommend him!!

Haven't had many interactions with Dr. Kuo because of how physics studio works, but when my group asked him questions he always stuck around until we completely understood the concept and explained it in depth to us. Also a pretty funny guy, cracks a lot of jokes when talking to the entire class and to TAs.
Funny, straight forward, and helpful. Also cool sunglasses and dog

I have Kuo for studio, and he is absolutely amazing. Explains everything sooo clearly! Definitely helps me learn the material. Always has great energy, and you can tell he cares about the material and you as a student. Always answers every question!! I hate Physics and he made it tolerable. Still a hard class though (:
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Kuo is an awesome professor! He may come off a little intimidating at first, but hes really great at teaching and hes a great help in office hours. 10/10 would take this class with him again.

I had Dr. Kuo for lecture. This man is a phenomenal professor, has a great sense of humor, and is overall a very nice and genuine human being. He actually made physics bearable for me, and I don't think I would've passed without his lectures. Best physics professor at Mines hands down.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Kuo is a fantastic teacher for Phys 1. I did not have him for studio, but I had him for lecture, and he explains concepts clearly and effectively. If you attend his office hours, he is incredibly helpful and is willing to walk you through any of the LonCapa homework assignments to make sure you understand. Would definitely take with Kuo again!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the nicest people I've ever met. Super awesome guy

Had Kuo for lab. All around cool guy, pretty adamant about you coming to your own conclusions regarding physics, which is off-putting for some. For others, that helps solidify concepts and is a great way to teach. Keep it up Kuo! 10/10 cute dogs
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I totally disagree with the previous comment. I took PH200 a few semesters ago from Dr. Kuo and he was the boss! He was absolutely helpful in office hours and completely approachable during and outside of class and he really cares about students. He does have very cute dogs, and that's just one of the great things about him. Take his class!

I enjoyed Phys 2 because of Prof Kuo. He clearly explains the material in class and it's not super stressful because clicker questions don't go towards your grade. They are purely partcipation points. Expect the homeworks to take longer than in Phys 1, plus you have written homeworks which are kind of annoying, but they help your grade.

Dr. Kuo was one of the coolest professors I had. He is great at giving lectures and he makes them entertaining. I also had him for studio and he was really helpful. Kuo is a perfect professor you can't pass by during registration.
Kuo's lectures definitely helped me to learn physics. I also had him for studio, and he was always really helpful and friendly.
Kuo does a great job of explaining things thoroughly and is a solid professor overall.
Super cool, total gem, 10/10 would take again

Very, very good at explaining and lecturing difficult material. Slides are easy to follow. There's iClicker grading, but don't sweat it (seriously). You can look at the notes before the actual lecture too if you're that kind of person. The Physics department, in general, has tons of opportunities to get help outside of class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Kuo is funny and just teaches by going through some confusing examples. Its kind of hard to get used to his teaching method because he expects that you read the pre lecture readings and already understand it to  a certain extent.
Kuo is awesome he is clear and if you have a question he doesn't make you look stupid and ensures he understands what you are asking. Get to know him he'll help you more than just in the class.
Very friendly and helpful.
Super helpful, and never harsh on students. He clearly loves teaching, and seems to have the students' best interests in mind. I don't love physics, but Kuo is worth taking again.
Fantastic teacher, so funny and so excited to have him for Phys 2. He is super clear in class and is very helpful. He is happy to help and will always try to help while still learning it.
Great guy
Kuo is a great guy and very helpful 1-on-1. Funny too and wants to help students learn. Go talk to him. (I had Flournoy for lecture, can't comment on Kuo's lectures).

Kuo is a badass! His dominate pose demands the attention of the students and commanding tone instills knowledge during lecture. He is approachable, helpful, intelligent, and fair. He knows me decently well and always takes my concerns seriously in lab, lecture or office hours. He and his partner Dr. Kohl have got a really solid course put together.
Very clear when explaining material. Never made me feel lost.
Good teacher

Both physics 2 professors are really good, but Kuo is definitely better. Very, very helpful either in office hours or in studio; doesn't condescend to you when he's explaining something, no matter how basic. Has a contagious childlike joy in physics.
Coolest professor I've ever had. Extraordinarily helpful in office hours.
Kuo is really good at explaining things, especially one on one in studio, and he'll make sure you get it before leaving you on your own

I had him for 200 which is a pretty standardized course at mines. Most of the grading is done by TAs. When I went to lecture he would do good examples of material but if you're already familiar with CS stuff you can pretty much just as easily get the material from the required textbook activities and fill in the gaps with YouTube

CSCI 200 is the worst structured, taught and coordinated course at Mines. It is feared by the student body in and out of the department. This is mostly due to the structure and poor assignment layout. Some exams were curved north of 25% bc he forgot to rewrite them when the time was halved. Paone is fine but too unique to coordinate course.

I can see why people might not like Paone's teaching style, but I personally loved his class. CSCI 200 has been my favorite course at Mines due to his teaching. He talks very fast and absolutely plows through lecture slides, but he really knows his stuff and has a surprising sense of humor. Ask him any question and he will always have an answer.

Every class from Dr. Paone is extremely challenging, but worthwhile and satisfying. The projects you have to do in the upper-level courses are very demading, but the payoff is immense. From all my professors at Mines, I've probably learned the most from Paone. He's a super nice guy and extraordinarily smart. Definitely one of my favorite profs.

He is an ok teacher-there is a lot of EC. But the problem is his class has very little concern for people who have zero knowledge of programming. Try to meet him in person, he is helpful in person but when you ask questions online, he will answer with another question/some theory/reference when all he needs to say "you forgot putting 'int'."
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Graphics is hands-down the best class I've ever taken. Dr. Paone gives genuinely great lectures; he explains things so clearly and carefully that if you're paying attention and asking questions, it's basically impossible to get lost. The class is also super fun, it's like an RPG - you have a character and can find secrets and earn achievements!

People always criticize Paone for the wrong reasons. This is a foundational Computer Science course and there is a lot to cover. He will not tolerate bs and will know right away if you are not keeping up with the class. Yes, there is a lot of work, but there is also myriad opportunities for extra credit so it's easy to get an A if you're not lazy.

This professor made me want to drop out of Mines. He is not flexible or understanding when it comes to student's lives. He is knowledgeable in the field, but teaches the class as if it is a 300 or 400 level class instead of an intro class. Be prepared to do lots of studying and learning outside of the class in order to understand the material.
Knowledgeable professor, has informative lectures.  The class was very difficult though,  lots and lots of time spent on homework.

If you don't have friends in computer science, be prepared to really struggle. Dr. Paone is knowledgeable about computer science, however, he teaches the class as if you should already have a lot of coding experience, and that's not really possible if you're not a computer science major, so be ready to struggle and be in office hours all the time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Paone is a great professor. His lectures are always engaging, and he makes sure there are enough resources for you to finish the projects. If you take this class, DO NOT SKIP LECTURES if you are not very knowledgeable about programming, they are extremely information heavy. The projects can be big, but are easy with time management Tests are ez

Dr. Paone does a great job explaining topics and goes in depth on most of them, but does go pretty fast. He asks if there are questions a lot though, makes it clear that asking for help is okay and common, and sticks around after class. The workload can pile up quickly, but the TAs at help hours are insanely helpful and there is always Piazza.

Homework sets take progressively more time as the course progresses. Lectures help more as things get more difficult. Material isn't super difficult but the volume definitely can overwhelm you if not done diligently.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: CSCI 200 was a great class to take with Dr. Paone very helpful and very funny.

Dr. Paone was amazing when it came to teaching graphics. Don't get me wrong - the class is hard and a lot of work. But Dr. Paone makes his expectations clear, and he always gives you the resources you need to succeed. A quick tip though: make sure to use Piazza! Even with 261, getting in the habit of using Piazza will help a lot in the long run!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Paone is an awesome CS professor by all accounts. He's clear, careful, and explicit with everything he says and does, which any student should appreciate. He always made time for answering student questions fully (even staying after class), and really wanted to make sure we all understood every concept well. He's also passionate about CS!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Paone is very passionate about computer science, but this class was extraordinarily difficult. There are so many assignments along with Zybooks readings that this course can quickly become unmanageable. Lectures are very packed with information and Paone goes through many concepts very quickly.

Great if you just learning C++. If you know C++/Java, test out of it by showing them a project. The course is not too difficult and there is a large extra credit homework at the end to bump your grade as a nice lead into CSCI262. Hand-written code on exams and getting marked down on syntax is ridiculous though

Paone is typically not available during his office hours, and is difficult to communicate with over email. CSCI261 is a huge time commitment, and although it is doable to get an A, you have to work for it. The amount of homework is extensive, and the class becomes particularly demanding in the last bit of the semester.

I've had multiple classes with Dr. Paone. While he is a great professor who clearly loves what he does and knows his stuff, be ready to work hard to get a respectable grade. I was lucky enough to have some experience in coding before taking his classes, but I agree with those saying his class is even harder with no experience.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Cannot say enough great things about Dr. Paone. He is caring about every student he has, and remembers them far after 261 is over. He is the best lecturer I've ever experienced and makes the content more understandable. However, the assignments, quizzes, and exams are murderous in this class at times. This is the most stressful course I've taken.

Pretty nice, is not the clearest when asking for help. He teaches an intro to programming course but speaks to you in a much higher language than students that have never coded before can understand. The quizzes are next to impossible (avg grade around 65%). Decent class but be ready to put work in esp second half of semester
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Luckily, you can work with other people in this class, because Professor Paone certainly didnt provide help himself. When asked questions, he often became defensive that students didnt understand important concepts. The online textbook was more useful than him, as his lectures were at times tips and tricks rather than teaching foundations.

Anytime I speak to Paone, he acts very rude and critical of my work. He seems to expect everyone to have experience in coding, even though he teaches an introductory course. He is very pompous and I feel as though I cannot go to him to ask questions. If you have a solid background in coding to begin with, you will probably enjoy him better.

Professor Paone gives great lectures and clearly shows a deep understanding of the material. The lecture material is clearly seen on the homework, and even though the homework is challenging, you usually are not lost while doing it. The tests are not too hard, but the quizzes are very difficult.
Definitely one of the best CS profs. Not super easy, but fair and not ridiculous with work.

I think this class is amazing in general, but Dr. Paone makes it 10/10. If you are really confident in your CS ability, you don't need to keep up with zyBooks throughout the semester. Lectures are generally 15 - 30 minutes of lecture and the rest you work on the Labs or Assignments and can ask Dr. Paone for help if you need it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Paone is by far the best CS professor I have had yet. He clearly explains everything in class, and is easy to get into contact with; he cares a lot about your success in the course, and will make sure you understand what you're doing.
Dr. Paone is a great teacher and a very nice guy. He is the best Computer Science professor I have had here so far.
Best CS Professor

She was a really incredible professor. She speaks quickly but is always willing to help students work through tough problems. I really appreciate the fact that she goes into the 'why' of calculus: why certain theorems work the way they do, etc. Ask questions and follow the skeleton notes and you'll succeed. Super helpful during office hours, too.
Very kind and allows several attempts on class outcomes to receive a good grade.

I wish I could take all of my classes with Rebecca Swanson. Her passion for mathematics is inspiring, and her openness to learning through experimentation is so useful. I learned so much in her class, and I felt so welcomed. Group work is key, so make sure you're prepared for that! Regardless, I highly recommend her!

Dr. Swanson is a lovely professor and has a deep passion and love for math. She moves through topics rapidly so taking notes can be hard sometimes. The class has an amazing setup and her teaching supplements the learning really well. If you pay attention and attend office hours, Linear can be a great class.

Dr. Swanson was a great professor. You can tell that she is extremely passionate for math and that she wants to see all of her students succeed. She does talk/write notes pretty quick, so if you need to go a bit slower than she can be overwhelming at times. Overall great professor.

Professor Swanson is an amazing professor that explains things very well. She does tend to move through lecture content pretty quickly, but is very patient and helpful in office hours. She even hosted office hours during exam week, which helped me solidify the last few concepts I needed to get an A in the course.

This is a late review, as I had her in Fall 2022. She is a wonderful person and professor. Her lectures are amazing and detailed and all resources are online. She is very flexible and genuinely wants to help. Absolutely take her. Nothing you can do about the material: it's hard. Just go to OH and she'll explain HW problems on the board.

This course is graded based on a "mastery of outcomes" basis.  I found this a little more difficult because 70% of your final grade is tests, but you get to retake outcomes multiple times for credit.  Professor Swanson is a great professor and was very helpful in office hours.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Dr Swanson cares deeply about her students and how they learn. She is always ready to give constructive feedback and so dedicated to her work.

Dr. Swanson is one of few professors that really cares and gets to know her students. Her work can be hard but she is simply trying to prepare us for the tests. She is always around for feedback and usually grades homework and tests within 4 days. I also took her for MATH 332

Professor Swanson is my favorite professor I have had here so far. She's super passionate about the course content and puts in a lot of time outside of class into giving feedback. Overall, fantastic professor.

Took this class during COVID so not the best representation, but Prof Swanson really went out of her way to prepare us for exams and was always super helpful in office hours. Always wanted to chat with students before and after class. Not a fun class but not very difficult or stressful overall
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mrs. Swanson is an excellent professor. I recommend her to anybody.

She honestly did not teach. She had us watch preclass videos made by a different teacher/ university or read the textbook and take preclass quizzes and then would put us in breakout rooms during class where we would struggle through a worksheet with 3 other students. DO NOT RECCOMEND. It was actually like a teacher did not exist.

Amazing calc 2 professor. Explains the material well, is available outside of class to help students, and truly cares for students and their learning. Will work with you individually when struggling, gives lots of good practice assignments to work on with groupmates before the exam, and prepares you well for the exams. Did a nice job with remote.

Wow. Did not expect that much passion about math from Dr. Swanson. She clearly loves what she does, and really encourages students to learn as much as they can about the class material. Very spunky and friendly personality, and is very helpful if you have questions. Her class was challenging, but managable if you go to class.
She is VERY passionate about math. She is very nice about math and happy to answer any questions you have. The class is homework heavy, but it is my math lab and very easy to get good grades on.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Swanson was a good teacher for calc 2. She explains concepts clearly, and works out a lot of problems in class. Based on the activities she provides, there are really no surprises in regards to what shows up on the exams. This does not mean you will not have to work hard for an A, but she is a great resource that will really help you to succeed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Although the class does require a decent amount of work and honors is more difficult, Dr. Swanson is incredibly organized, efficient, and helpful. The format of the class is very effective and the grade you receive is the grade you deserve. She is also very intelligent and is willing to help explain difficult concepts in and out of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Swanson is a professor that truly cares to see her students succeed. Her class is a decent amount of work but you get so much from it! Her Linear Algebra section is the best of all of them in my opinion!

I really liked her, she was a good teacher. I had the flipped class so we watched videos and did activities in the classroom. Not the most ideal situation, but she made it enjoyable. The only thing is she talks really fast sometimes, and random selection on students she did pretty frequently lol

Dr. Swanson really emphasized how everything we learned in Calc 2 applied to both further math classes and "real life". She's so nice and understanding; the only reason I didn't hate that class was because of her.
Dr. Swanson teaches quickly but very thoroughly, and doesn't leave any details out. This class was one of my favorites and there are lots of good resources on Blackboard.
Sit near the front of the class and you will do well. Great Calculus II professor.

Dr. Swanson is very helpful when it comes to understanding the material and preparing for an exam. She encourages office hours, even when her office is overflowing with students, and is good at explaining the reasons behind the math. I took Calc II from her, and the biggest help was her review sessions the day before the test.

Swanson went through the material fast. It is a math class so i'm not sure if I should expect much more, but my biggest problem was the fact that she made us watch daily videos on the material before the lecture itself and expected us to almost instantly know the material. She wasn't to bad but was far from the best teacher i have had in math.

Swanson went through the material at a very quick pace, but Calc II has a lot of material to be covered so it's probably unavoidable. There were a lot of assignments, some weeks we had 3 webassigns and a worksheet. However Swanson was very nice and willing to help, and she also did a good job reviewing before tests. I would take her class again.

I took her class during the summer so maybe she was less motivated but she just wanted to go as fast as possible. She moved up exams and assignments multiple times and didn't cover things very thoroughly.
Professor Swanson comes across as very intelligent and mathematically enthusiastic. Rigorously detail=conscious, and expects students to think through problems as well.

I had Swanson for Linear Algebra, a class that I never really wanted to take.  If you have her for lin alg, be prepared to do a lot of proofs and less computation.  Overall very helpful and clear in her explanations, and is good if you can handle proofs.

Great experience learning practical systems engineering while working through a mock SBIR project. The assignments aren't always super clear and Duran takes forever to grade (he's involved with like a million things on campus and is always super busy), but he's always accessible and will meet with you to answer questions and help with MBSE.

Great course that really sets you up well for industry. I wish instructions and grading were clearer but I also understand Professor Duran's goal of making us ask questions and make assumptions when we don't always get all of he details.
Duran we love you!!! Shell Ecomarathon was one of my favorite times at Mines. Hard work, but so much fun out in Indy.

I had Duran for MEGN 455. I didn't really get systems engineering until the last few weeks of class when it all clicked. I just went to career day and employers loved that I had learned MBSE in his class. Make sure to ask questions. He will help you with anything, but you have to ask. I'd take more classes with him in a heartbeat.

One of the best ME profs. His lectures and projects are super open ended nd content heavy which can be frustrating. He expects you to put time in outside of class since he covers so much material. Still, if you go to office hours and do all of the assignments you won't get less than a B.

The difficulty of the class was increased by the vague instructions for nearly every assignment. The best way I could describe the class:
Imagine you're an uncontacted tribesman. You've never seen an automobile in your life. Someone briefly describes one to you for 10 minutes then says "ok now design your own".
Duran is an incredible professor. He cares that you actually understand what's going on. He makes you think and never gets upset or makes you feel dumb.
My man goated with the sauce. always knew how to ask the right questions at the right time. Thanks Duran!

High standards, slow grader. Super smart. will answer any question and help you when you get stuck. Pushed me hard to do my best but always available for office hours - go to them! Best 300 instructor at Mines.
I took Space Operations with Prof Duran. Best part of class was learning STK and modeling orbits. Not bad for a first time class. The first few homework were brutal but got easier.

I struggled with him in the beginning in understanding what was actually being looked for, but as the semester went on and now having more classes and projects with him. Its kinda clear that he makes his lectures super content heavy and you can use them on homework, but in general he wants you to understand the implications and uses more.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment:
My favorite Professor I've had at Mines. He brings his industry background and experience into his courses, helping to make abstract topics like orbital mechanics relatable. The homeworks are tough, but he's always available for office hours and questions. 

Considering a class of his? Just take it, you won't be disappointed.
Fun class, good professor. Class project was a lot of work outside of lecture. Make sure to take notes and study, be prepared to work for your grade.

Adams's CAD for LBD was some of the most challenging work of the semester. His expectations are super high, and he pushes you to learn SolidWorks on your own which was tough. I spent way more time than I should have working on my object, but I ended up learning a ton. On the plus side, he was always available during office hours and over teams.

I had Adam as my Professor for IDEAS. He's a genuinely nice guy, understanding and willing to work with you to succeed in his class.

I really enjoyed his module on ethical entrepreneurship and how much fun he made start ups and ethics. I'd take his class again in a heartbeat. 

Make sure to ask a lot of questions and he will help you out.

Prof Duran really knows his stuff, his lectures are super dense and filled with info. Make sure to go to his office hours as he doesn't always get to everything in class that is on the exam. Course project was super fun, but a lot of time working on the RC car outside of class. Overall my favorite ME class I have taken at Mines.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Adam makes lectures interesting and his course project was awesome. I loved building my climber robot this semester and learned a ton in the process. He was always available to answer questions and help me along the way including hosting a workshop on how to use the woodshop. He's also a legit hottie which never hurts.

I had Adam for IDEAS. Hands down my favorite professor so far at Mines. He can be a tough grader, but he is willing to give you feedback and help you improve. I also never had a problem finding a time to meet with him outside of class. He genuinely cares and you can tell. I can't wait to take the 2nd semester with him in the Spring.

I had Professor Duran for HNRS 105 and he did an excellent job. His grading is a little stricter compared to the other IDEAS professors, yet he is willing to adjust or regrade your assignments if you put in the work and make time to meet/engage with him. I would him for Thorson Students who are choosing their second IDEAS professor for semester 2

What can I say about Prof Duran? I took his 6 week short course (5 actually) and it was both extremely challenging and rewarding. His standards are quite high, but he was always there to answer any questions and help with assignments. He pushed us to succeed while also being supportive. I can't believe I learned so much is such a short time.

EDNS 151 that he teaches is basically a huge mess that asks for unreasonable design requirements and considerations. Apart from the heavy workload itself, Duran is an extremely hard grader who literally reads through everything you write and mercilessly docks points off by subjectively using the rubric. Expect hard work and low grades!
If you get a chance to take a design course with professor Duran do it. Best instructor I've had at Mines.

Professor Duran really know his stuff and it shows. He oftentimes cuts lecture short to give us more time to meet in class as a team to work on our project and to ask him questions. If you do the work, you will do fine. Not an easy A, but not the hardest course I've ever taken either. Just wish he could grade faster, but I get it with his schedule.

Good guy, makes class fun. Comes from industry and it shows, he has high standards but you will learn a lot. Left a ton of feedback on my assignments and pushed my team to hit our goal of winning our section. Might take a bit of time to get grades back as he works crazy hours, but also means he answers emails and will meet with students any time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Tells some of the worst dad jokes, but does his best to make design a fun course (which it's not). He can be pretty tough as a grader but if you do all of the assignments, participate in class, and make an effort you will do fine.
Good guy, lots of feedback. Crazy smart with high standards. If you do all of the assignments you will get at least a B. Would take again, he made design fun.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Prof. Duran really cares about his students and it shows. He is a tough grader but willing to provide extensive feedback and allows resubmissions of most assignments. While it meant more work for me to have to go back and revise my assignments, I feel like I earned the grade I got in his class.
Nothing personal but if i could go back in time i would most definitely choose to take this course with another instructor

Your effort does not mean anything to Adam, the guy will always give you low grades without explanations. Lectures were absolutely not of any help, he always seemed to manage to confuse us with whats required then gives bad grades.

Not fit to be an instructor at Mines... He provides unclear guidelines and has ridiculously unreasonable expectations. He also grades brutally and until this day I could not understand why. His feedback extremely superficial & unhelpful from day 1, couldnt improve or see my mistakes. Above all that, feedback and grades are returned really late..
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: In this course the aim was to please Prof. Duran, rather than learning. He doesnt give any useful feedback as how to improve. He needs to work on his communication skills. The lecture was rather useless in the course, as I often found that it is mostly consistent of examples without any point, he sometime gets lost on where he is going with it.

Mikucki is by far my favorite professor at mines. Had him for linear algebra my first year at mines and his lectures were always engaging and you could tell he had a genuine love for the subject. To this day even if im not in his section I always go to his office hours. Not just a incredibly smart guy but also an incredibly good teacher.

Mikucki was a great professor for Linear Algebra. I rarely walked out of any of his lectures feeling confused, and he was always excited to start class and teach another topic. Overall, he is a gem in the math department and I would heavily recommend taking any classes with him.

I took Math213 over this past Summer with Prof Mikucki and it has genuinely been my favorite Math class at Mines. He does not grade harshly for mistakes on homework or exams and his work is easy to follow on keys. He is always willing to answer questions and is willing to explain a topic multiple times to ensure you understand it. Fun and good guy.

Mike was one of the best profs I've had at Mines! His lectures are engaging and clearly communicate the course content, the homework prepares you well for exams, and he's super accessible outside of class. Would recommend taking his class!

Fantastic professor, did a great job teaching the course content and made it easy to pick up. The exams are fairly reasonable and the group portfolios are not difficult and are great grade boosters. Just go to class and pay attention and you won't have a ton of trouble. Very kind during class and office hours.

Professor Mikucki has been my favorite professor so far. If you have the chance, take his course. He is extremely helpful, can reach him anytime via email, very clear in the topics of his lectures, always positive and makes learning fun. He wants you to succeed and his online course is never boring. Matlab and group projects included in the course.

Mikucki is an amazing professor. You'd think Scientific Computing would be unbearably boring, and maybe it is, but he makes the content digestible and sometimes entertaining. This course has been online since COVID and he has really taken advantage of all the learning tools at his disposal to make the content interesting. I highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Great professor for calculus 1, really cares about students and their learning. Is always willing to help outside of class and holds a good amount of office hours. Explains material well and in a very fun and energetic way. Would highly recommend anyone who has never taken calculus before coming to Mines to sign up for his class.
He is really good at explaining things and is very available with office hours. He is always enthusiastic about helping students and is overall just a wonderful person. HIGHLY recommend
Very enthusiastic, always has good lectures, and cares about his job. Would recommend.

Fun guy, genuinely cares about everyone and consistently checks in with the class when approaching hard material to make sure everyone understands it. Explains himself well. Lecture notes are not posted online, and the lectures are detailed so go to class. Test/due dates not set in stone, he's willing to move them if asked.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Respectable, made calculus easy and understandable and went at a good pace. Nothing to complain about.
Good teacher what else can I say
Hes a really great teacher and always clear explains all material, even the complex concepts.
Mikucki did a great job of making the class more personal and enjoyable for a traditional calculus class. Get ready to enjoy some elephant jokes as well.
Best math professor ever! Clear lectures, great homework questions.

An intelligent and incredible teacher. His ability to break algorithms and proofs down into components for ease of understanding was phenomenal. If I could have taken him for every math class I've ever had, I would have.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Loved Dr. Mikucki! For the first time, I feel I finally understand the basics of Calculus. He truly cares about his students and is super funny!
Best teacher I have ever had, kindergarten to present. Fantastic at teaching the material, and he truly cares about your education and well-being.
Mikucki is a great professor and teaches the material well. As long as you show up to class and show you care he will ensure that you succeed. Enjoy!
Such a stand up guy. Really tries to get to know the students and is an amazing teacher!
Mike is the BEST! Always get him if you can.
Best calculus teacher ever! Very lenient on grading. He makes sure everybody understands each step before moving forward. His class was very enjoyable.

Thought Mikucki's lectures were good, though I prefer more example problems, and he was just more of a straight-up lecturer with almost zero class participation. He was a caring guy though, and really knows his math. Doesn't post his notes online, so hard to miss a class (though other MATH307 profs do post their notes for use).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Tells very funny elephant jokes and it is just fun to be in his class

Mike is a great professor. He not only explained the topics, but helped us understand why they existed and why we need to use them. You need to do the homework to do well in this class, but practice is essential is learning here. Also, his elephant jokes are stellar.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's very good at presenting the material in a logical and easy to understand manner. He also sprinkles some humor throughout his lectures for an overall very enjoyable experience.

Elephant jokes are on point. Definitely take him if you have some prior experience in calculus, even if you dont he is super helpful and he is amazing in his office hours. Helps with all the worksheets checks answers before you turn em in, gives points back on tests etc.

I think this professor would be better for students that have already taken calculus, and perhaps, even belong in the level 2 calculus class. I struggled to keep up in his class as he glazed over some crucial building blocks of calculus because they were assumed to be common knowledge. If you're new to calc, pick another professor!!

If you're looking at taking 300, Prof Nilsen will be just fine. I appreciated his help on some assignments and liked his humor (and I tend to be a sensitive person), and although he doesn't give long lectures they contain enough info to do the projects. He connects with students personally and gives good hints on the projects. Good enough for 300!

I'm gonna be honest, Nilsen is a great guy but should NOT be a professor. His lectures are extremely lackluster. He reads the lecture presentations from other professors and can't explain any questions students have. You WILL have to rely on yourself and the textbook to learn this class if you have Nilsen. At least he grades nicely...

As others have said, very inconsistent and disorganized. He reads off of the lecture slides (that I suspect he didn't create), and often skips over large portions of the lecture. Grading criteria is inconsistent and vague, project guidelines are updated on the fly as clarifying questions are asked. Labs scheduled last minute and changed day of.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This teacher will simply read off the slides, not teach how to do any of the homeworks,, and make the quizzes so hard the avg is a 50 so people are crying after the test. The very few examples he does work through he barely gets halfway and says well you guys can figure it out or you should know this. Lab days are not prescheduled and change day of

Had him for multiple classes and he is by far the worst professor I've ever had. He is not prepared and makes assignments up on the fly it seems. Project requirements have to be updated as people ask basic clarifying questions that he has overlooked. Lecture is very boring just going over slides and he draws a couple pictures. Quizzes are very hard

To say he is inconsistent and disorganized is putting it generously. He is a nice person but homework and lecture rarely reflects what is on the quizzes, yet this perplexes him as to why grades are low. You will either get an immediate response or nothing at all if you ask him a question. Assignments have unclear grading criteria.

Awful professor. Had him for 300 and 381. Unclear expectations, quiz averages in 381 were extremely low due to inconsistent material across lectures and homework. He was unhelpful, rude, and condescending. Left 300 class 45 minutes early every day. Canvas page was completely empty in 381. Almost no info on project expectations. Not a single rubric.

Awful at helping students, very disrespectful when asked questions. No clear expectations for assignments. Rely on the TA's for the class or the other professor's office hours. Partner projects and tests are most of the grade.

Having read the other reviews, I gotta say, I'm a bit confused. My experience with Dr. Nilsen has been anywhere from fine to great. I've had him for two classes now - both 212 and 300. His humor is somewhat blunt and he doesn't sugarcoat anything, but I never took issue with that. He has always been helpful, and presents material clearly. Good prof
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I took Nilsen's course during Summer I and I thought he was actually quite good. Straight forward lectures, gave us breaks during the grueling 2.5 hour lectures, gave us written homework which was really open-ended. Feedback was minimal, but he would give good AND bad feedback, which was helpful with open-ended prompts. Will be taking his MEGN300.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Unbelievably bad. Had giardia for much of the semester. If you want to know what to study for tests/quizzes, think about anything that could be related to the topics you are learning and has not been taught in class, then somehow find and memorize the equations he expects you to use to solve the problem.

Never provides rubric for projects or homework. Never says what he wants the projects to contain until hours before the due date. Worst prof I have ever had. Never learned anything from class besides what he has accomplished in his career.

Nilsen is terrible. I've had him in 2 different classes and I feel like I didn't learn anything in either. He makes you feel dumb when you ask a question, yet still expects you to know how to do everything. A friend had to threaten reporting him to the dean just to get an email response. I want to say more but there's a character limit. Avoid him.

I agree with some of the statements made in the other reviews, but I don't believe Oyvind is condescending or mean. He genuinely seems to care about his students, and he curves most of our quizzes. His assignments aren't clear at all and I don't think he plans very much, but I do have a B+ right now and have failed every quiz.

Do you like feeling disrespected, getting key project requirements changed at the last possible second, and a professor justifying a 50% quiz average? Then look no further, Dr. Nilsen is the prof for you! He is extremely inconsistent in his transition from lectures to assignments and does not give a rip about his students. Avoid at all costs!!

Unfortunately, there is little overlap between topics that are taught in lecture and those that are tested on quizzes/assigned in homework. When the class does poorly on quizzes or homework, the students are blamed. Overall, it is difficult to do well in this class because few resources are provided to support successful quizzes/homework.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, AVOID THIS PROFESSOR. The quizzes reflect very little work you do, and nothing that's lectured. Arrogant demeanor, loves to belittle student questions, deflects responsibility for poor class performance ON EVERY SINGLE QUIZ AND/OR ASSIGNMENT. No clear rubric for any assignment. You will never know what his expectations are.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: If I could give a 0, this would be the one professor I'd give it to.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS fellow Mines students. This man is hands down the worst professor I have ever had. Condescending, does not lecture well, gets distracted during lectures, doesn't respond to emails. Projects in this class are not well explained, and new details are given the day before the due date. Blames students when everyone fails quizzes

He doesn't teach so you teach yourself. When I inevitably found my own unique solution to the problem and asked for help debugging, he couldn't find out why what I was doing wasn't working so then he taught me. When I sent him an email, he never responded even after reminder emails. Unequal grading. I want to say more but there's a character limit.

What a terrible professor and person. Loves to mock students-as he said to the entire class, "Some groups believe they have been creating energy." No one would believe that in a 300 course. Would leave class early every day, later was found to be doing Spin (biking) at the gym. Stay very far away, extremely poor. Google is a better professor by far
Highly recommend avoiding Oyvind for MEGN300 and Fluids II. He is unwilling to help, very rude, and lacks teaching skills. Lectures are very underprepared and hard to follow
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: You seldom get any help and if you do he makes you feel stupid or unworthy. There are no lectures for his class and he expects you to know everything. The exams are unfair to say the least as with no lectures you have no idea what to expect. Overall you won't learn anything, won't get help and will get a bad grade to top it off.

Has no sympathy for his students, did not teach a single lesson but expected us to know how to use LabView. Sometimes doesn't answer questions or treats you like you're stupid. No help and does not care about well being of students.

I got an A and hated every second of it. Every single assignment you do in this class is confusing and under defined. The professor is rude and unwilling to answer questions about the material. Nilson was unable to help me with LabView a single time the entire semester. Every class, he would just leave half way through and not come back.

Rude & condescending. Didn't teach LabView (coding language of this class) at all ("there's too much to teach" even though other coding classes taught it more comprehensively without a problem). Never answered questions, just said to Google it (acting like he was making us resourceful). Few lectures, arrived late and left early while we worked.

Nilsen arrived about 30 min late and left 45 min early (2.5 hr class) almost every day. He didn't give daily lectures like the other two professors and when asked a question, told us to "google it" under the guise of making us more resourceful or was condescending about it. He grades fair but is kind of a jerk and the TAs are way more helpful.

It's hard to review this professor, mostly because there aren't many lectures in this course. When 1 on 1, this professor is very helpful, but he is also a bit of a jerk; just a rude overall demeanor and somewhat condescending. When he does get around to grading things, which takes a LONG time (several weeks usually), he usually grades pretty soft.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Dr. Nilsen is absolutely fantastic for fluids, but DO NOT take his class for thermo!

Statics is a difficult class, but Guerra definitely helped to make it easier. His lectures included very in-depth examples that definitely helped with understanding, and was very available outside of class for any questions students had. Definitely felt like the class could get boring and civil-focused at points, but overall had a good experience!
Very good at explaining concepts in class.

Dr. Guerra is a great professor. His lectures can get a little boring sometimes, but I think that's just the nature of Statics. He tries his best to make the class engaging. You can also get a 1.5% grade boost if you attend all the recitations, which makes it very attainable to receive an A!
I had a wonderful time in this class. Dr. Guerra made me love statics as he is very informative in lectures. He is also very considerate.

The only thing that really bothered me about him was that I had an emergency at the very end of the semester that made me miss one assignment. I had done very well on all tests and had an A. He gave me a 0 on the assignment that was weighted heavily which dropped me to a B. He didn't answer any of my emails regarding this leaving me frustrated.

This class sucks, but Dr. Guerra makes it bearable. He has fantastic lectures with physical examples of what we are learning so we can visualize in 3d space. You do have to show up to class for clicker points, but they are also free points. Overall this class sucks but if I had to choose any statics professor it would be Guerra.
The lectures were mostly example problems with the concepts woven in, which worked well for me. Statics is a very homework heavy class, but Guerra gives great feedback and has tons of office hours.

I loved this prof. Statics is a hard class with a lot of homework, but Prof. Guerra has really great and energetic lectures! He does little quizzes at the start of class (participation only) so attendance is sorta mandatory, but its not bad to attend because he makes lecture so awesome!
I honestly loved statics and would take it again! Guerra taught the material in a way that was easy to understand!

Dr Dre is friendly, helpful, and extremely smart. Unlike a lot of professors, he takes his obligation to educate seriously. His lectures are well prepared, and he works hard to help everyone understand, rather than just regurgitating the textbook.

Awesome lectures, accessible outside class, great guy, and if you ever meet one-on-one then he explains things super clearly and understandably. Would definitely recommend this professor as long as you don't have a problem actually completing the coursework. Ex: do your work, get an A. Don't do your work, get a C.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I took Statics with Guerra, and while I disliked the course, Guerra did the best he could with the dry material. This course has lots of homework and it can get very tedious. Guerra also takes attendance via clicker at the very beginning of class (like, a minute in) so you can't be tardy without missing all your points for the day.

Statics was an easy course and a fun one too. Dr. Guerra was kind of boring, but he is a really nice person and cares a lot for your grade. P.S. you can learn by yourself in this course without the help of the TAs or the instructor.

Andres gives you plenty of opportunity to succeed and provides good examples in class.  He lets you attend any recitation period, requests one on one meets if you are falling behind, and gives you chances for extra credit.  The HW load is a lot but he wants you to learn by repetition.  Solid professor.

Not fantastic, but not terrible either. He does examples all the time. Doesn't have much to say that's not already in the textbook. I could have passed just by reading the textbook. Make sure you go to class though to get the clicker quiz points.
Solid dude.
Very goofy guy, but he does an amazing job teaching statics. Would definitely recommend.

Dr. Dre is a great teacher. He's very helpful and there are clear expectations from day one. The daily quizzes are annoying but manageable if you're on top of the material. The tests are a brutal race against the clock, but he grades fairly and doesn't throw any curveballs... just 105 mph fastballs and change-ups.
He works with the students and brings real life things as demonstrations and explains everything quite clearly
One of the best professors at Mines ever!
Guerra is by far the best Statics professor at Mines. Made class really interesting, and cared about his students. I would recommend trying to get him for Statics class.

Absolute FANTASTIC professor, probably in the top 5 that I've ever had. Extremely interested in helping students and making sure that everything is clear. He could be better about meeting with students outside office hours (although my schedule just conflicted, wasn't his fault), but if you do go he will spend lots of time with you.
Super nice and helpful teacher. Tries to make class fun and interesting. The best statics teacher at Mines. Even though I hated statics, he made it a little more bearable.

Very cool teacher, you will enjoy him if you have him. He does have quizzes at the beginning of every class, so attendance is semi-mandatory. He has lots of office hours and really cares about teaching. Dislikes side chatter, cell phones, and laptops though. If you want a quality statics education, I would recommend him.

By far the best teacher for Statics. He has a lot of examples for class as well as visual representations. At least 5 hours for office hours 3x a week and will help you with anything. Very easy to understand and talk to. He is not a harsh grader, but is fair; only wants to see us do well. Would recommend to anyone!

His lectures were confusing and he spent most of his time wrestling with the Smart Board rather than lecturing. He wasn't willing to work around my schedule so I was never able to make office hours. I wouldn't recommend him for Statics.

Awesome teacher! Clear and easy to understand. Gives detailed steps/examples that are helpful towards homework and tests. Homework can be a bit more challenging. Test difficulty is similar to the homework. Office hour schedule is pretty tight, but definitely helpful if you visit or make an appointment.

Best professor at mines. Easily. He is so friendly in and out of class. His lectures are full of energy and he makes tough concepts feel easy. I cannot say there was a single moment in class where I didn't want to pay attention. Attendance is not mandatory but he lectures on a whiteboard so there are no slides to follow. Plan to show up.

You cannot find a better professor at Mines. He has the ability to explain things in multiple different ways, breaks down the complex concepts into small bite size chunks. I have Taken Feedback, Devices, Digital Logic, Embedded all with this professor. He may single handedly be responsible for my degree/passing mines.

Don't sleep on him.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I looked forward to his class every day and will legitimately miss it. Engaging class content and amazing lectures, perhaps the best at Mines. Funny yet taught so well, leaving very little room for confusion. Most of all, he seriously, genuinely cares about his students. The GOAT and it's not even close.

Dr. Coulston is hands down the legitimate best professor I've had during my time here at Mines. He knows how to engage the class, cares very deeply about your learning, and has the best lectures of all time. I can't name a single lecture where I didn't have a good laugh from his jokes nor left confused by the content. Thank you Dr. Coulston!!

Coulson is a really great lecturer and makes early morning classes engaging. He is a great teacher and knows a lot about how the content is used in industry. However, his office hours get super busy, and if you are sick or absent don't expect any emails back (ever).

Coulston is a great teacher. The lab is relevant to something you could build in the real world. The lecture gives context for it might help you solve a problem in your own designs, and is entertaining. The homeworks are harder than the exams, but you definitely need to prepare good notecards.

Far and away the best lecturer I've had at mines. I would literally listen to him read the phone book to a class, he's that good. 

Coulston really cares about his students, and is sure to be reasonable with his expectations. That's not to say it'll be an easy class, but what he teaches is very valuable.
Coulston makes me want to go to class. His lectures are entertaining and as he says: he teaches the bare minimum to do well in the course, i.e. there's no fluff or busy work.
Best professor I have had at Mines so far.

I am honored to rate Coulston. I have never met a teacher whom is liked by every student. he is knowledgeable, offers real advice, knows the industry well, and knows when to be serious. he is one of the most reliable men on campus and will do anything to help students find their true potential. 
His lectures are also very entertaining.

Coulston is the only professor I'll ever rate 5 for both quality and difficulty. He is such a talented lecturer and always speaks loudly and confidently to hold our interest even at 8am. But the labs he wrote are an ABSOLUTE GRIND with no step-by-step instructions, he makes you figure everything out yourself. Prepare to spend 12hrs/lab on average.

Coulston is the best professor I have ever had. He genuinely cares about the students and it shows in each lecture. Its hard to not pay attention in his classes and he is an inspiration to anyone in he teaches. Hands down the best professor you could ask for to teach such difficult classes.

Coulston is the best professor in the Electrical Engineering department at Mines. He always makes learning so engaging and fun. I feel like I learn so much more when Coulston is teaching. Not only is he extremely knowledgeable in the subjects he teaches but he also deeply cares about his student and their wellbeing.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor I've ever had.
