I had external reasons for struggling the semester I took Calculus 3, and I like Sparks so much that I wish I could have done better in her class.

Professor sparks has been one of my favorite teachers so far at my time at mines. In the best of ways she made the classroom almost feel like a high-school environment, in which the teacher is easily accessible and cares about you on a personal level. I also found it extremely valuable to show up to her class, her example walkthroughs were great!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Sparks cares about her students. She is very accessible outside of class and will give you the help you need if you ask for it. The homework is often challenging and the final project even more so, but she genuinely does give you the tools & time to succeed and is very clear with her grading criteria. I like how she structures the course.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Despite Covid making Calc 3 an even more difficult class to take (completely online format), Professor Sparks always comes to class enthusiastically and is always ready to help. Would highly recommend attending office hours.

The class is graded between mostly group activities and the quizzes every other week. The group activities are always graded harshly, but I think that's standard for MATH213. Prof. Sparks is always super nice and approachable during office hours and class.

Athena Sparks did not try and adjust to Covid at all. Every other week there is a midterm quiz that you have to do in 60 minutes and if your internet sucks and you can't get your written work on to your computer in time, too bad she does not care at all. She has no sympathy and does not care about circumstances outside of your control. DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Cares a lot about his students, but knows the material so well that his simplifications are typically above what we are able to grasp. Lectures rarely line up well with homework resulting in a lot of wheel spinning, and tests are not reflective of either. He also tends to rush through examples in class without explaining what he is doing or why.

Sometimes Tabares is hard to pay attention to during lecture because when he works through examples, he doesn't always explain why/how he's applying the new content. He's really fun and passionate though and cares for his students so if you need help, he will help you. Heat Transfer is tough, so buckle up and do work early so you can ask questions!

Professor Tabares is very passionate about teaching and is very approachable but in an online format falls flat when communicating information, He jumps into example problems without much explanation, and jumps around a lot so its very hard to follow the lectures.

Dr. Tabares is very passionate about teaching and helping students in general. He is a great resource to utilize not only for academics but for career advice. On Fridays he would try to mix it up by bringing in demos - a Rankine cycler, a FLIR camera, etc. Will be taking his classes in the future!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Helped me get a job after college and helped my get a lot of opportunites i wouldnt have had otherwise

He has a very thick accent and his lectures are very difficult to understand. When it came to the semester project he expected us to read is mind on every deliverable because he didn't post more than a sentence about what he expected, yet graded and gave feedback like we had what was expected spelled out for us.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Tabares knows his building energy systems inside and out.

Received many complaints from other students but shows great potential as an instructor. Knew all students' names, and responded well to constructive feedback and suggestions. Language barrier got better during term. Fair exams and likable guy. I'm really glad I had Paulo as an instructor despite not going as deeply as the other thermo sections.

Olivia provided a wonderful learning experience and did a great job facilitating classroom discussion. If you get a chance to take a class from Olivia do it! The assignments fairly graded and the subjects we covered were interesting.
Sparked very interesting classroom discussions. I looked forward to class everyday. All assignments were graded in a clear a fair manner.

Professor Burgess is a really kind and gets so interested in what her students have to say. The course I took with her is taught by two professors, and she always got so excited and invested in our class discussions that we would run out of time. A great professor, always available during office hours, gives an A if you show effort.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: I don't think I have ever had a professor who was more invested in the success of their students than Burgess. HIGHLY recommend.
She seems nice, but just doesn't know how to teach.
She is nice, and provides a comfortable learning environment. she is hot!

Probably one of the most passionate professors I have ever had. Consistently gives excellent feedback on papers, presentations, etc. Not a super hard grader but you still have to put in the time.  Very friendly and approachable. I feel like I really lucked out taking my 400-level LAIS with her as the prof.
Really approachable and friendly, not too hard of a grader, really good about encouraging students in discussion. Also she's a badass, she runs triathalons and is super awesome. Take her class!
She teaches a difficult class but does so poorly. Get ready to basically teach yourself most of the content. Good luck.

She makes a lot of mistakes when teaching and always seems confused when someone asks a question. Hardly teaches, by the end of the semester all she did was write a few equations on the board and just give us a worksheet

People hate her because she teaches a hard class, Calc II, but compared to the other professors you could get stuck with, Weiss is great!  You have to do the work though as with any math class.  She expects you to do the book problems weekly to do well. Office hours are very useful, got 100's on most worksheet because of them. Better than Lehman!
Worst teacher I've had in my life. By the end of the semester, half of my class dropped her class. Those of us remaining are barely passing.

Nice lady, horrible teacher. Makes many mistakes. Doesn't explain content, just writes pre-written examples on board. Our class average for tests was 10 points lower than another teachers. Very unhelpful teacher. Most of the time I leave lecture more confused.
Calc I
She gives a lot of examples in class and is extremely helpful with questions.  However, you must do all the optional homework to do well in her class!

Mim is a super nice woman and will help you whenever you need it. The problem is that she makes at least 15 mistakes per day during notes, which actually might be a good thing. It makes you pay attention and not just accept the notes, but think about it

Very knowledgeable guy. This class was really useful all thanks to Dr. Heilbrunn. I am actually sad to read through the comments and see hateful ones. He is really humble and he knows what to do. Tough grader, but still helps A LOT when you're having trouble. His exams were straightforward, but I wouldn't say "easy."

Corruption and Development is a fairly interesting class especially for a 400 level LAIS.  Be prepared to read a ton, about 3 papers per week (20-60 pages each). If you do the readings and pay attention in lecture the class is not very hard and is interesting.

The guy just absolutely hated being there. He told us on multiple occasions how bad our class was and how much more he enjoyed his other classes.  He said once "if i knew what this class was going to be like, i would have never signed up for this job."  Rambles on about meaningless garbage and gloats about how he worked for the World Bank. Jerk!
No Comments
terrible teacher, held grudges, liked acting smart, ****

He was a raging ****. He showed this many times in class by asking for the black opinion or Iranian opinion. He gave a better grade to someone just because they were a graduating senior, but when I asked for a better grade (which I deserved) he wouldn't budge until I mentioned that I heard him giving a better grade to a graduating senior.Bad prof

Hard but it is definately possible to do well in his class. His test questions are VERY predictable if you just write down what is on the board. Plus he is notorious for liking people who are there daily. It is sorta scary but he does notice.

Very hard to follow lectures, especially since he doesn't follow the outline that is on the board.  He doesn't believe in lecture notes, either hard copy or online, and doesn't provide study guides either.  Studying for tests is quite difficult.  He's pretty stuck up too.

Professor Mancus is great. She really cares about her students, and is super understanding. Classes are discussion-based and engaging, and students are really encouraged to speak their mind and talk about what's important to them regarding the discussion topic. The assignments are not just all essays and writing, and she gives good feedback.

Professor Mancus was great. She cares about her students and is extremely reasonable regarding homework deadlines, often moving things around to help students out. I enjoyed hearing her insights on films, and the coursework is very manageable. Highly recommend.

Dr. Mancus genuinely cares about her students and will learn your name. She challenges you and will push you, but not too hard. Her classes are not blow-offs, but they are truly enjoyable and have been my favorite at Mines.

Dr. Mancus made class interesting with casual group discussions and provides lots of feedback on assignments and never takes off points for no reason. Participation and attendance matters so just watch the films show up say something and it's an easy B, or put in more effort on the papers for an A. Hardest thing about this class is getting into it.

Mancus is hands down one of the best professors Ive had at Mines. I took her for Art and Environmentalism and really enjoyed the class. I learned so much w/o having to put much effort into it. Just keep up with the readings and participate some in class and its an easy A. She also cares about her students. She pushed deadlines back multiple times

Really great professor for seniors who are basically out the door. She made me learn without me realizing I was learning and if you show up to class, talk, put out effort, and follow the rubric on the papers/project you will definitely leave with an A. In a film studies class, ripe for political bias, she did a good job keeping it in the middle.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The best professor I've ever had. She made film studies really accessible and easy to understand but more importantly she made it really enjoyable! This is the one class where I'm excited to go every day. She is also very accommodating, which has been helpful during the pandemic.

Dr. Mancus is an amazing teacher to get for NHV. She makes you a better writer and does an awesome job of keeping the material fresh by showing interesting multimedia and current event applications to the material we are learning. Judging from what my friends said about taking NHV with other professors, I think I got very lucky getting Dr. Mancus.

Poole is bad. He takes points off for attendance, he is confusing in his lectures, he is extremely ticky-tacky in his grading. When calculating grades, he used the wrong denominator (a higher # than he should have) and never fixed anyones grade unles they tracked him down the next semester. I don't know how this guy keeps his job.

I got to agree with the previous comments on how he makes errors in problems.  Also, he takes off ridiculous points.  If you use sin(120) rather than the equivalent sin(60)in your calculations and get the right answer, you're losing points.

His examples are useless and he constantly adds incorrectly, or flips signs or messes up in some other way.  He is a jerk when you try to ask him questions and explains things in the most complicated way.  He grades a specific way that makes little to no sense.  If you get him, go to tutoring and find someone that knows his nuances.  Then you might get a good grade.
This prof cannot get through a problem without leaving something out, flipping signs, etc. He is not confident as a instructor and doesn't inspire confidence in others.

Uses a ton of examples... He can be a bit of a jerk when you ask questions.  Mumbles sometimes during his lectures.  But his examples are very beneficial... Usually exactly like the required homework.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

He gets a bad wrap for personality, but I learned a lot. He teaches thermo in a comp lab so we use a lot of excel to make problem calculators. GO TO CLASS. The excel you make in class is used on the hw and the hw is used for the quizzes. I love the excels because I could go back and see how the equations were used and refresh.
Sum gets a bad wrap but I really enjoyed his class. The quizzes and exams were fair and direct representation of the homework.

This professor seems to care about the students, but he is hard to approach. It feels as if he looks down on you when you have questions about the class. I also do not do well with a pure lecture class, and that is what this is. Example problems are helpful, but it is hard to learn.

Dr. Sum does a great job of keeping things succinct and applicable to our careers. He teaches the subject not just with the intention of passing an exam but knowing the material so that we can use it in our future careers.

Sum seems to really know what he's teaching and he seems to try to teach you what's important to know in your career rather than just academia. With that being said, I just didn't understand too much from his lectures and I always felt lost. Doing the homework really helped and I heard going to office hours would've also helped(I did not go myself)

Dr. Sum is very smart, and talks to you like he knows it. He is clearly at Mines for research and has no interest facilitating student learning and success. Extremely condescending to all students. His class was not extraordinarily difficult, although understanding him/his writing was a challenge...

Dr. Sum seems more dedicated to his research than to his undergraduate students, however he one of the smartest professors ive ever had the pleasure of taking. Take his class if you're up to the challenge  if you put in the effort youll learn more than with any other professor.

He is a very smart teacher. He also has a lot of credibility to his academic resume. However, he doesn't explain the material clearly, he has very poor writing , is never available and specifically told my project partner in person to stop writing him, because if he can't understand some of the material it is not worth his time to help. Detestable

He is teaching a new class this year called Fundamentals of Environmental Engineering; Water which is CEEN301. DO NOT DO IT. I REPEAT DON'T DO IT TO YOURSELF. This man doesn't understand anything about a student. He has a quiz every week. The Homework is on the textbook so he's not even making them. All he does is read off slides. There's more too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This class had a terrible setup. There were exams that would take anywhere from 6-12 hours that were mandatory on Saturdays. Pop quizzes violated DSS accommodations and could happen at anytime. The lectures were fine and they were recorded. Homework can take upward of 10 hours per assignment and there is no help because professor is unreachable.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Tzahi Cath is out of touch with teaching, for example, his lectures are fast and full of unnecessary information, he is unprepared for class most days (i.e. he does not follow through with his plans in past classes), tests take more time than he claims (6+ hrs), homework is unbalanced, and tests are worth most of the grade.
He was much more knowledgeable than my other professors, and although we had a lot of homeworks I know that it would be helpful for my career

Taking this class with Cath is a huge mistake. He reads off the slides and gives too much information each class. The homework sets take forever and are usually over things he did not teach. The worst part of this class are the take home exams which he assigns over the weekend. They take about 10 hours on average. Worst professor I have ever had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Genuinely the worst class Ive taken at Mines. Homework assignments and take home exams take absolutely forever and he seems to have a very unrealistic idea of how long the work actually takes his students to to do.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Took his wastewater class and while I got a B, Tzahi is not that helpful and super unorganized. Dont recommend

This professor probably means well but honestly shouldn't teach this class. He goes through 60 slides a lecture super-fast without explaining. He just reads from the slides. Too much material is covered in this course too fast. I bet he is very intelligent but is not a good teacher. I wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Tzahi cares about his students and wants them to succeed. At the same time, he is an EXTREMELY difficult professor. He goes through lectures very fast, the homeworks are long (8-12hr) and difficult, and the exams take on average 12 hours to complete. While he was a nice person in office hours and overall, I am glad to never have him as a prof again
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: I despise her with fiber in my being. Careful warning: She is the director of the writing center and will absolutely trash your writing, no matter how good you think it is. For a required 100 level class, it shouldn't be this harsh and stressful.
Her class discussions were actually moderately engaging and made the time pass quickly, but wow her expectations were tall (she is the writing center director...)

Proffessor Horan is super nice, but she grades incredibly hard, making a class that is supposed to be an easy A, much more time consuming than it should be. I found myself spending hours and hours on essay assignments because she will tear your essay apart if you don't write a Pulitzer Prize winning essay.

She teaches well and encourages discussions, which makes the class enjoyable. She assigns a decent amount of readings and video lectures, and they're relatively time consuming. The class has plenty of points, so if you do poorly on formal papers, you can succeed. That being said, her grading on formal papers is excessively harsh.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She's so nice. Overly nice, she never forces students to participate but actively encourages discussion. There are lots of homework but as long as you attempt to do everything and attend classes you will be fine. Also use the writing center, you will need it.

She's a nice person but is strict with phones and attendance. There is a lot of reading for this class along with a midterm, but if you do the reading and attend the lectures, it's a breeze. She's a tough grader but will give students the chance to ask for pts back if they deserve them. She's also approachable and wants to make sure you understand.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Allyce is very clear on her expectations for papers and is willing to help you out at office hours. The other class assignments help with the papers. There are a lot of readings for class, but they are all relevant and interesting. However, she's not very good at facilitating class discussions which makes class pretty boring.

Allyce assigns busywork like nobody's business. You'll read 20-30 pages per week and write completely useless responses to them. Then you get to go to class and "discuss" the readings, where she manages to overmoderate any interesting debate you might have. She means well, but doesn't teach well.

Awful teacher who doesn't know how to speak or assist students. Long lectures only vaguely relating to in class lab assignments, the TA's are much more helpful with these. Written reports have no rubrics or guidelines, very little help is given with these. Avoid this professor if possible, you will be teaching yourself.

A lot of people don't seem to like Dr. Thomas, but when I had him for my finite element analysis class he was honestly fine. I think he just really pushes people to think through the decisions they're making on homework and if they make sense when in office hours , which some people feel comes off as rude, but I felt it was very helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Condescending, plenty of ego, makes your life hard on purpose so "you'll be a better engineer". Don't go to office hours unless you want to be constantly berated and humiliated. Never gives straight answers in office hours either. Other than that great teacher!

Not great. Lectures are boring and he gets confused on things/messes up. The homework just gets longer and worse as the semester goes. It's vague and takes forever. Other assignments go up in difficulty through the semester too. He tries to help in office hours but doesn't always succeed. Don't take him if you can help it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: SUPER unclear. Does not grade easy on homework, but at least gives some feedback. The final project will grade you on things he did not teach. Bad at setting up quizzes on Canvas.
If U want to get a C or less this is your guy

Went to office hours for clarification/help on a graded quiz.  When I asked for clarification on one of the topics he said, "Oh, so you don't understand this topic?" at which point he took the quiz back and marked off even more points.  How we are supposed to learn from this I have NO idea. Terrible. Avoid. Nickel'd and dime'd every assignment. BAD
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Why would anyone hire this guy? He taught me nothing!
Worst instructor I have ever met, learning with slides by yourself is way more better than taking his class.

He rarely has a lesson plan and makes things up on the fly. You'll take notes for 45 minutes when he realizes he messed up step 2 and everything after is wrong. Show up for the quizzes then leave and attend another section to actually learn.

This solid mechanics class was the worst experience I have ever had at mines. Owen would continually get his examples wrong and wanted to have the class solve all the problems very different from how we were taught in statics. This made his class super hard to learn from and I managed to do ok in this class due to sitting in with other professors.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Has no teaching style whatsoever. Lectures on student's resources and learning abilities rather than the course material itself. DO NOT RECOMMEND! Waste of money.

In my 2 years after transferring to Mines, Owen was by far the worst teacher I've had. His handwriting is very hard to read, and can't seem to keep himself organized in lecture or appearance. Routinely gets his own examples wrong, as if he hasn't looked over his own notes. Could write over a page on how bad his class is, but I'm out of characters.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Terrible teacher. Lectures are very unorganized and homework is around 12 hours plus. You will have to self teach most of the course work. Belittles students as well.

She was very easy to get along with and clear on what she expected in each assignment. She was open to feedback and understood when things were messed up. I recommend her so much if you want a teacher that will actually help you in design and not leave you stranded. She was a decent grader as in, do your work.  But nothing too difficult at all.

I really enjoyed taking her class. When my group had an issue with equal contribution she handled it very well. Many of my friend hated this class but Juergensen gave us everything we needed to succeed in her class.

While Design 1 is a very boring class, Professor Juergensen is a great teacher. She grades faster than most professors I've had, and frequently gives good feedback on what to improve. She's also very forgiving with deadlines, and will likely give you an extra day for an assignment if you just ask.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Juergensen was my favorite professor this semester. She is flexible and understands that design is not a top priority class for most people. She extends deadlines without question and allows you to resubmit work. She understands that the class structure is outdated and works with you on fair grading. She also always has your back

she is a very nice person and very good at giving lecture. The HW just gets a little confusing, like when she wants what turned in. sometimes it was super clear and sometimes I felt like my group was missing things we didn't even know were due.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Juergensen is honestly a very awesome person who knows a lot about design engineering as a whole! She sometimes didn't know exactly what was going on curriculum-wise, but was very likely to extend deadlines when necessary. Lots of work but has specific rubrics. She gives lots of good feedback to groups and is a very kind and approachable professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is nit-picky when it comes to grading assignments. It seems like she is relcutant to give out good grades. However, if you choose she lets you resubmit any assignment to try and earn a better grade. Overall she is a good person and can be understanding as long as you communicate clearly with her. Not bad considering what we had to work with.

Dr.Worley is a very nice and will do his best to ensure you learn the material. The lectures can be a little difficult to sit through, but he is trying to incorporate more participation activities. Ensure you have a good understanding of micro concepts from 201, and Energy Econ will be straight forward.

The lectures were dry and not helpful but the in class activities were only available on the slides and not on canvas which made it difficult to double-check if you answered everything. The projects were long and the grading was harsh (not his fault though). There was a lot of busy work.

Worley is a super good dude, and you can tell that he's trying. But, the stuff he teaches is just super dull. It's hard to make econ interesting. The silver lining is that he grades super easy. You're almost guaranteed a 100 on the projects if you put in a little bit of effort. For a mid-level HASS, this is pretty much a guaranteed A.

Nice guy but lectures are boring. You teach yourself the week before your class all the material and then lecture simply reexplains them, making it useless. However, attendance is mandatory. Not a difficult class to pass but Worley assigns way too much busy work and does not make his lectures fun to attend.

Professor Worley is a nice person, but he doesn't how to make the class more interesting. Every lecture was just watching him read off his notes and copy them on the board. The topics were super interesting, but the teaching style was not. Most people wouldn't even show up to class because it wasn't very helpful. But, he was easy to talk to.

He is not the best lecture, and at some times, it can seem like he might not be going on. Although he very much cares about his students and learning, if you have problems with the work, he will help you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: If you have to take econ at mines, Worley is the best. I took the course online over the summer and it was a lot of busy work, but the material is very easy. He is always available outside of class and willing to help. From what I've heard I totally recommend summer with Worley over fall with Houser, easier to get through.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Awesome teacher as well as a snazzy dresser
Intelligent, with a sense of humor and enthusiastic
Very good professor, wish he was still the Department Head.  Well dressed, and one of the most professional people I've ever met.
Fantastic prof if there ever was one.  Great dresser and eloquent style.  A touch arrogant, though.
Dr J taught the best spectroscopy class I ever had.  I hope I can do as well when I teach it.  Also the best dressed prof I've ever had.
Great prof, but a bit inaccessable for his students at times in language and personality.
very well dressed.... and very kind and understanding

Hitt is super nice, super friendly, and is very passionate about NHV. I loved going to her class. Only problem is I would not recommend her for NHV because of the amount of work she makes the students put in to the class compared to other teachers. She isn't necessarily a hard grader, but other NHV teachers are easier A's

She gives a ton of HW (minimum of 8 one page papers + 3 'major' papers ) compared to the other LAIS teachers. Also very hard grader, you can redo 2 papers for 50% of what you missed though. She will want you to write and annotate in your textbook. also have random quizzes over stuff covered in the past.

Shes a really nice and helpful teacher. Sometimes the assignments are a little vague so make sure to check for what she really wants. You have to go to her class and she tends to grade papers a little harder than other professors. Good class overall, not very interesting, but none of the NHV classes are.

She was the nicest teacher I had. Very flexible, helpful and otherwise great. That being said she will expect you to actually do work. so she isn't a free A, but it was still an easy A. I wish she taught in my department so I could take her for other classes.
An intelligent, fun professor. Though I personally dislike literature writing, she did a great job connecting the assignments to necessary writing skills.
Dr. Hitt is one of the easiest graders for her NHV papers.

The professor loves to teach her class. She tries to encourage her students to be active in her class and her assignments. She is helpful during her office hours to some extent, though. It can be quite obvious that she sometimes doesn't want to help you.
Go to office hours.

Really does take time to help students when they ask for it, and shows true concern that the students are learning the material. When he took the time to walk through examples in class, it really helped bring clarity to the material. He graded work quickly which was nice to see what we did wrong and how we can change it in the future.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: good class activities
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the best at Mines! Always gives quizzes in class that help you understand the concepts. Good exam reviews.
Takes extra care to explain difficult concepts. Always eager to help outside class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: One of the worst instructors I've ever had. He is highly condescending in lecture, and does not convey information well. Spends the lecture writing equations without explaining them, and gives attendance quizzes at the start of class without giving enough time to solve them, or even knowing the correct answer. Do whatever you must to avoid him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Prof. Saqib all the way!

Just plain bad. Lectures are messy and full of mistakes. Confuses himself and isn't clear on anything. Lecture content doesn't match homework. Tried to get help at office hours, and he couldn't answer my questions (he tried, but clearly didn't understand his own homework questions). Homework solutions were full of mistakes as well. Avoid if you can

This is more a message to any administrators considering Charles Lewinsohn for a teaching job: take the textbook to a local day care and choose any toddler around. Congratulations, you have found a better professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Example test question: Reasons why Charles Lewinsohn is a terrible teacher a) he doesnt care about the class b) he has no idea what hes talking about c) he never prepares for lectures d) hes horrible at communicating information to other people e) all of the above (correct answer)

My experience has been consistent with every other review; Dr. Lewinsohn is by far the worst professor I have ever had. Not only does he often present incorrect information, but he also struggles to explain even the most simple concepts. This man should never again be allowed to teach a college level course.

Charles Lewinsohn is without a doubt the worst professor I have ever had. I took a similar class to this one the semester before it, and Dr. Lewinsohn consistently made factual errors during lecture. The TA's were pretty great, and I learned more during the few classes when a TA did the lecture than the rest of the semester when Lewinsohn taught.
All I can say is I am disappointed. This guy just doesn't have the ability to explain things.

As a Junior in college, I have had a ton of professors. Without a doubt, at the bottom of a long list of professors, is Charles Lewinsohn. I could give a monkey a textbook and end up with a better professor than this guy.

He's a relatively nice guy, but I don't understand why he's still a professor. He has ton's of experience in the field but doesn't know matlab, labview, or arduino very well. I've had him for 200 and 300 and I don't think he has ever answered my question without calling a TA or another instructor to help me. If you can avoid him, do, but he's ok.

LOVED this class but not the professor. Doesnt really know the content- mostly self guided learning and projects. Had no faith in my abilities and told me multiple parts of my project wouldnt work. Got points off for it despite me proving him wrong. Bad at responding to emails so very hard to fix grading issues.

He has clear favorites and from day 1 was already talking down to people in the class (specifically the girls). Barely teaches and doesn't really seem to understand the material very well. Did 80% of this class by myself because the lecture was usually just work time and him putting an example on the board. The class was fun but Prof sucked.
Seems to barely know the content himself, and his grading is subjective and unclear. There's a 50% chance he bothers to respond to your emails.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Loves to talk down to students, has clear favorites. I learned everything in this class from the TA's, who saved this experience! Often would leave class during work time to wander the halls for 20 minutes at a time. Disrespectful when helping female students. Take any other professor, seriously.

Professor Richardson is nice and can be helpful, but he's certainly not the best professor to take for this class. As mentioned in the other reviews, he doesn't really reply to emails, doesn't seem to know the material really well, and leaves all preparation up to the student to do on their own. Take Wheeler if you can.

Professor Richardson is easily the worst teacher I have ever had. Instructions are generally unclear, he does not reply to emails, and gives unfair advantages to some students. Beyond this, he is dismissive of any criticism given by students so he will not change any of these actions. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Not a hard class but Pei legitimately does not teach the class. Doing the homework is like trying to find a light switch in a dark room that happens to be the size of a football field

Pei should be fired. He shows up to class with no plan and just talks to you about random buildings he's seen. He doesn't, you know, teach the material we need to know. God forbid a professor would teach the class. The material isn't terribly hard but he is hands down the worst professor I've had at Mines. Overly frustrating class to be in.

If you read one sentence from the textbook every week you will learn more than you would by going to class.. He scribbles on the board like a toddler and can hardly form a coherent sentence when he talks. Don't even get me started on the homework. Depressing, miserable, and pointless is how I would describe this class.

No office hours. No TA office hours. Terrible, unorganized lectures. Extremely long homework assignments with questions we have never addressed in class. You will have to teach yourself absolutely everything in this class. Avoid taking 442 with Pei if you can.

Very unorganized during class. He has a heavy accent but the problem is that he just starts mumbling and ranting about unrelated things. He also stutters over himself constantly. Does one example and doesn't show any formulas, just fills in numbers like we know what they all mean, then gives us long homeworks with questions we've never seen.

Pei is extremely smart but a horrible professor. He doesn't write out any equations he uses. His examples terrible with arrows drawn all over the board. He fills numbers in so you have to guess what variable they are. Timber isnt hard but he makes it hard. If you take him get ready to take yourself literally everything with no help.

The way he teaches can be extremely confusing at times. His examples are okay but can be hard to follow at times. What he wants for homework isn't always clear either. Also, sometimes his homework takes several hours to finish so don't procrastinate. The homework isn't necessarily hard but can be confusing to start.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you have to put yourself through Econ at Mines, try to get Professor B. You may have to get up for an 8am, but it is well worth it. This class was only difficult because the EBGN dept. as a whole arbitrarily make it that way. However, Professor B is so chill and truly wants students to learn the material.

Econ at Mines just sucks. There is no way around it. But Leo is a great professor. He really cares about his students and what he teaches. He is understanding and empathetic. If you end up taking econ, Leo is the way to go. He makes the class a little more bearable.
I was not a huge fan of Econ, but he made the class a lot more tolerable and fun.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Leo is very nice and always willing to help. He does his best to ease the heavy courseload of the econ curriculum and cares a lot about his students.
He is my best friend and I love him

I loved Leo as a professor he made the class super interesting and had a lot of energy. He will work with you on late assignments, and is super caring. I didn't like the course over all because there is a lot of assignments regardless of your professor.

Very passionate about Econ. Hated the class but really liked the teacher. He was super understanding and nice, he gave out extensions freely no matter your reason. When you take Econ definitely try to get Leo. 10/10

Professor Blood's enthusiasm for the subject is evident, and I value his approachability for assistance beyond class. His straightforward communication style enhances my understanding and appreciation for the material. The project portions were really tough but are equally tough with all lecturers.
Professor Blood is passionate about the content. He is willing to help outside of class and is very straightforward which I appreciate.

He's a very tough grader but was always gave fair and detailed explanations why I lost points. The class is hard but if you participate and communicate with him when you're struggling, you'll be fine. Start the homework early, it always takes longer than you think.

If you have the opportunity to take Daniel Blood for any class, do it. He is a fantastic lecturer, gives plenty of time to do practice problems in class, and will put in the individual effort to make sure you succeed. Before EDays he gave basically a whole day of office hours on Thursday since his normal Friday Sunday times wouldn't be available.

Professor Blood is a good professor, however, he does incorporate lots of extra work. You will have daily quizzes for attendance and workshops that you can complete with a group of your choice. Professor Blood only teaches you what you will need to know for an exam, you will get lots of example problems and end class early quite often.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Blood is a great professor, he is really helpful and definitely knowledgeable about manufacturing. One of the best at Mines.

He used very specific vocabulary that he didn't explain. His lectures were long and didn't give enough time for notes. He did not give clear grading guidelines until after the assignment is due and would not give feedback on most assignments.

Pretty good professor; explains stuff well and cares about the students. She is reasonable when it comes to grading. One time I emailed her at 11pm because I was worried about my grade for a major assignment and she replied within 5 minutes. Would recommend her class.

A lot of 201 consists of you teaching yourself how to use Solidworks and other pieces of software. When asked, however, Prof. Blood was always helpful and knowledgable will to guide you through your mistakes so you actually learn the material.

Loved Prof Blood, a lot of this class was individual solid works assignments or group projects, meaning that lectures were brief, but she was accessible and helpful when you needed her. Gave a lot of time in class to do work and get help from her or others in the class
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Blood was a solid teacher. She was easy to ask questions to and gave good and helpful answers. She was also very accessible outside of class as she responded to emails quickly. The only downside is that she rarely granted extensions because assignments were technically posted for a couple weeks and there is a decent amount of work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Often asked question she couldn't answer on the spot, but often would come with the answer to the next lecture. Cares and takes time to find the right answer as to not lead you astray.

When learning how to CAM she told us to figure it out. After spending 5 hours on the CAM, the next class I was told to delete all of my work. This tended to be a constant in the class and made life much more difficult then necessary. Definitely did not need this kind of extra stress during midterms.
She does not clearly explain things. When she does try the information turns out to be incorrect or incomplete. Little to no help on homework.

Professor Blood is a really good professor if you are on good terms with her. She will seek you out and ask if you need any help with assignments. Lectures are relatively quick and it leaves you with plenty of time to get the homework done.

Dr. Carney is great. She genuinely cares and wants you to succeed. Any questions you have, she will dedicate time for you to understand it inside or outside of class. She's laid back, funny and her LinAlg class is outcome based, which means you have several chances to pass quizzes and once you are done you are done. You won't see the material again

Debra Carney has become one of my favorite professors at Mines. She is passionate about teaching and really looks out for her students. Once, she accidentally labeled an exam as a take-home exam, but instead of changing the label, she changed the schedule to ensure she kept her word. Her classroom is so inviting. I highly recommend her!
Taught Calculus 1 perfectly, in my opinion.
Very kind and very clear on what she is teaching and what she wants out of homework. I was rarely ever confused about anything in this class, content wise and assignment-logistics wise.
She has been one of my favorite professors. The class itself is fairly easy, but her teaching style and in-class feedback makes understanding the material much easier.

Carney's lectures are incredible and help you succeed on the homework, tests, finals, and overall concept of math. Frequently hosts office hours (that if you can make, you should!). VERY knowledgeable about the material taught (no matter the complexity of the actual topic) and cares about her students & their success a great deal.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: If you ever see a class with Dr. Carney as a professor, TAKE IT. She is clear, concise, helpful, and all of the above when explaining the material. Calc 2 is a hit or miss for some, but with Carney it is possible to enjoy the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Wow she was good. She was so fun, she had tons of cool stories, she made doing the readings actually fun, and she understood that we're not at Mines to write and provided options for one of the assignments (creative, research... what type of paper you wanted to write, you could write). It sucks that she left, but if she ever comes up again take her

Lacivita was my favorite teacher at mines. She cares about her students as actual people and that is extremely refreshing, since most professors here don't. I'm so sad that she is leaving because she made NHV a fun and bearable class. She is hilarious and one of the coolest people I know.  Take any class from her you will not be disappointed.
Looooooove her so much. Lucky I got in to her class. Mad brilliant, a badass, and hot.

Dr. Lacavita is sadly leaving after this semester (Spring 2016) to get another PhD. She is an amazing teacher, she understands fundamentals of engineering and ties that into her lectures to make it more interesting for us. She also understands that this class is utter horse**** and does her best to make it enjoyable. Very flexible with deadlines.

Understands that we all hate this class and actually made it fun and interesting. Knows some stuff about engineering, science, and math which seems to be rare with the NHV profs. We watched a Republican debate, read interesting things, and did some creative writing which I really enjoyed. If you can get into her class for NHV, definitely take her.
No one likes NHV but we have to take it and this professor is the one to take.
SO NICE

Singlehandedly inspired an interest in Numerical Computation. Fun guy, and gives fantastic lectures. He cares about student success and shows it. Very good at explaining difficult concepts. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Dr. Constantine is, without a doubt, the best teacher I have had not only here, but in my entire academic career. It feels very humbling to know and see how seriously Dr. Constantine takes his job as a teacher: he shows his students such deep respect that it is impossible not to return that respect.

I'm looking at the other ratings left here and I'm wondering what the heck happened. Other ratings say this guy is funny, but man I haven't seen him make a single joke. All he does is make faces and sing. It's really annoying. He's also kind of a bully. If you don't find him awesome, oh man he'll make it your problem.
Really a funny teacher, loved his jokes. Linear Algebra is hard, but Paul helps it suck a little bit less. Thanks Paul!
Paul is a really funny person and a helpful professor. Linear algebra is very hard for me though. Overall, would definitely recommend, because he helps an awful class be less awful.
Best instructor this semester! Very good at explaining what he is doing and helping students.
I have him for Linear Algebra.  Good teacher and funny jokes in class!  On the first day he makes you send him a selfie photo so that he knows who you are.  Overall fun class.

For a flipped class, Wakin does a good job creating a positive enviroment. You are responsible for your own learning which isn't always everyone's favorite but Wakin is there in person to help clarify questions and all. If you are willing to put in the work, this class should be fairly straightforward!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment:
Dr. Wakin is one of the only professors who teaches a flipped class well. The daily quizzes are directly applicable, and you have plenty of opportunities to make sure you get full credit on them. Exams are challenging but direct. 

He clearly cares about teaching and is easily one of the best professors at Mines.

This man was recording lectures and posting completed lecture slides even before the COVID19 pandemic. I believe his style of teaching is the future of classes. The homework and exams are hard, but there is no busy work. 6 difficult problems is better than 20 easy ones. Regardless, Wakin gives you all the tools you need to succeed.

You must be up for a challenge to take a class from Wakin, but in the end you will think its the best tuition credit money and time you've ever spent at Mines.  If you show initiative, he will return the effort and be very willing to help you outside of class. He is positive in lecture and his office - you won't get a talking down or scoffing.
Everything he says is so "right" and concise it sounds scripted.

Very professional, organized, clear, and efficient. Gave proper insight into material and a good emphasis on the right topics. Excellent balance of theory/derivation to example/mechanics. Smart and formal while remaining clear and accessible. Generally likeable guy and helpful at office hours. One of the best professors I've had.

Take Wakin if you want a challenge but ALSO a teacher that obviously spends a lot of time preparing for class. Fill-in-the-blank handouts ready 24 hrs before class, good pace, and homework that teaches instead of being redundant and useless. If you show him initiative to do well, he will be very helpful in making that happen.
Great professor had a strangle dll error on my final project. He took my code ran it found the error and gave three possible solutions. One of the best professors for csci200
Tough class but Clark is a great professor for it. He has a lot of knowledge and is great for office hours.

Professor Scholten was an amazing teacher for CSCI200. The lectures were informational and explained well, he is always kind, and answered everyone's questions if they had them. It is clear he knew the content well, and wanted everyone to succeed. I would absolutely recommend him as a CSCI200 professor to anyone.

I took the online summer course. Professor Scholten is amazing and was always able to answer my questions, even if we had to hop on a zoom call to figure out why my code wasn't working. He never judged me for having "easy" questions and he was just a genuinely great guy to talk to as well. He was also super flexible with me working full time.

If you are a CS major, there are going to be some less than stellar professors. Scholten is not one of them. Super wholesome guy who is very accessible outside of class and truly wants to help you learn assignments and do well. Highly recommend for 200.

After talking and seeing how my friend is learning in another professor's CSCI 200 class, I understand all the hype about Clark Scholten. He provides in-class coding to help us get more familiar, is knowledgeable, and is always open to help. This course is less difficult for me because of my experience with Java, but help is plentiful.

Scholten is super helpful outside of class and was key to finishing and understanding the coding assignments. The structure of the class is really difficult because of the homework but he was a great professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Scholten was a great teacher, he has been in the computer science industry essentially since its birth. He is doe shave to deal with extreme lectures given to him to present from the class head professor but he makes due. He is most helpful in office hours and is just overall a great, kind guy.
Super awsome, I think all proofs could learn a lesson from this man
Awesome professor. He explains the material so well, it is almost impossible to do bad in this class.
Lectures were interesting. Exams were straightforward. Super nice guy, and very helpful in office hours.

Genuinely cares about students, very easy to follow lectures. Everything on the homework and exams is exactly how it is presented in class. Opportunity for extra credit at the end of semester. Very reasonable workload and the final is a week before the end of the semester as to not overlap with the rest of your classes.

Really amazing lectures and just structured very well. I wish I could have him for some other classes because the lectures are so intriguing and he does so many great example problems and the tests are straightforward. He also has a lot of work experience that applies directly to the material so the problems and real life. Truly great professor.

Brian is an amazing professor. He cares about his students, both inside and out of the classroom. Great lectures, even through Zoom Brian got the content across while being engaging and funny. He gives assignments early, and sets realistic deadlines.

Hands down the most amazing professor Ive had at Mines. He puts mental health first, and makes all of his material so easy to understand. What you cover in class is exactly what you can expect on a test. He is overall a funny and genuine professor. His office hours are always worth attending because homework is graded very specifically.

intro to linux was 210 this semester, and tolga is awesome. i didn't find his lectures very useful but he was very responsive and helpful with quizzes and projects. one project of mine was a mess and he took me step by step to fix my code and get a 100%. one of my favorite professors so far in the CS department
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Tolga is one of the best professors in the CS department. He's intelligent and caring, and will work with you if you need extensions or extra help. He clearly delights in teaching and really cares about students "getting it". And if you're not getting it, he will work hard in office hours to make sure you do. Just a wonderful person and educator.

Dr. Can is the best professor I have had at Mines. His energy in the classroom makes dry topics interesting, he is excited about the content he teaches. He respond to email outside class promptly. His ability to break down the content for various courses has been consistent. Excellent professor! Cannot recommend enough.

Dr. Can is an amazing and probably the nicest professor I've ever had at Mines. He literally spent his evening helping me debug messy OCAML which is unheard of for a CS Professor, and is very knowledgeable on the topics he teaches.  He also lets you have a cheat sheet for the exam which is super nice.

Tolga Can was great for Intro to Linux. His lectures are often pretty dry, but underneath you can tell he loves the material and his students. 274 is already an easy class and Prof. Can makes it even more manageable. Go to his office hours or reach out to him on ED/Piazza and its almost always worth it.

I had him for CSCI 478. I absolutely loved him - he is the most knowledgeable professor I have ever had (I am a senior) and I love his teaching style. He mostly just talks and I didn't ever take notes. So, if you like class structures where its exam content heavy instead of just learning and listening, you may not like him as much as I did.

While his explanations can be somewhat muddled, he's very knowledgeable and clearly wants students to succeed. He's very good about answering questions in class and his lecturing is often informative.

Something about his voice makes it impossible to pay attention (I'm not trying to insult him, I just constantly find myself tuning out when he talks).
He over-explains code, making me confused when I understood it before the explanation.
His video lectures feel disjointed, and he gets ahead of himself and talks about things we haven't learned yet.

This was likely the worst class I've taken at Mines, and it's shameful that they charge for it. The mandatory lectures involved Dendy rambling about his personal life instead of neuroscience, often including racist or sexist remarks that singled out students. Dendy's behavior is unprofessional, and he does little to help students actually learn.

Professor Sloan was very interested in males and those in the McBride program. Anyone who received an 80% or lower in his class was told to "consider a different career." He was condescending, and I learned so much more from study groups - going to his class was almost pointless.

I would suggest avoiding this man at all costs. I found him very unhelpful and he found a way to make a simple subject difficult. By then end of the semester I found the key to success was sleeping through class and studying the topics on my own.

His comments regarding race are inappropriate. He has told people they weren't smart enough. In addition, to running his class in such a manner that the students a afraid. Afraid to not know an answer, afraid to voice an opinion. I would recommend avoiding Sloan.

Very thourough and rigourous.  Demanding but if you take the time and put forth the effort the dividends are well worth it in the real world.  If you are serious about learning your craft.  Learn from this man!!!

Sloan pretends he likes to get to know the students, but he is very ingenuine.  Mostly, he just wants to find out if you are in McBride.  He favors guys and McBriders, so if you are either of those and like things being handed to you, he's your man.
Sucked at kinetics, awesome for Mass Transfer and Field Session.  Hard, but you learn it
I initally thought I wasn't learning anything, but then after a month I saw that I had learned something useful.

She's caring, brilliant but feels unreachable as she is so protective of her time. Prepare to work at 200%. She approaches classes very passively but will grade strictly anyways. If you have a surplus of time, you will learn the material well. Otherwise you will suffer for frustrating reasons. Highly recommended if you want to push yourself.

I enjoyed this class and Dr. Diniz Behn as a professor. However, I do agree with the previous comment in that lectures contained information loosely related to homework. I really liked her as a prof though because she understood how foreign this material was to us, and made the class doable. Great lady, but please check your email more professor!

Lecture is irrelevant to assignments, I only show up for credit. Lecture is boring and difficult to follow even if you try to. Expectations and feedback are terribly confusing and you only go to office hours to just try to wiggle the answers out of her cryptic words. Not worth asking for help. Usually grades easy but was obscure this semester.

Professor Behn is a good professor. She gives out significantly more homework when compared to her peers in the department, but she gives good lectures and posts them for later referral. She is not too hard on grading, and if you try to understand the material you will most likely succeed in her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: I like her a lot. In math bio, I was confused almost all the time in lecture but was fantastic in office hours. The course has a lot of homework (labs, homework, final project, no final exam) so it is a lot of work, but very interesting material. You do need to know Matlab and that is background is somewhat assumed in the course

An incredibly kind professor. Her lectures move quickly, but she always makes her ppts available online and if you ask questions she'll explain what's going on. Start homework early, so you know what to ask in office hours.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr Diniz Behn is very open to helping students out if they visit her office hours.  Her lectures are full of examples and are well thought out.  She doesn't get off topic, so you will not get behind. No book is used for Linear Algebra.
HE'S GREAT
NEato

Vestal is a great professor. He clearly explains each topic and goes through all of his example problems clearly. What you see in class is what you see on the test, so there's no reason to be unprepared. He also has experience in the industry, so it's nice to hear one of his stories every once in a while.

Vestal is very nice person and genuinely wants to help students. However, he is horrible at teaching material before homework is assigned and therefore the homework takes hours longer than it should, due to the fact that we all have to teach ourselves. He teaches important things every now and then, but for the most part you're alone.

He is so funny and keeps everyone interested in learning thermodynamics. The test averages in his class are almost always higher than the other thermo teachers, so if you want a good grade take his class!
Very Helpful! Better than the other thermodyanmics teachers. The lectures are on the white board and the tests are exactly like the homework.

Good lecturer that likes to use jokes to keep students interested. Goes out of his way to help students who need it and gives lots of examples in class.  Subject is a bit dry, so Vestal does his best to make it interactive. Best thermo teacher of the bunch in my opinion
Dr. Eustes loves to tell stories of his experience and claim his own things as 'truth.' He consistently teaches 'rules of thumb' rather than teaching the real material. Quite an outdated professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Eustes is a lively lecturer, but very unfair and unforgiving in his grading. He dwells too much on his experiences from decades ago with little actual substance in his lectures. Every exam will be a disaster, unless you literally memorize every single word from the lecture slides. If you are an A+ student, you may get a B+ at most.

Dr. Eustes was very unacademic in his lectures, and exam content poorly reflected the core concepts taught in class. Exams focused on the trivial facts from the lecture slides verbatim and severely lacked mathematical and scientific principles. He talked heavily on his personal experience as justification for his claims on the slides.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Hard grader, but a good teacher. An ideal engineering professor.
He really loves what he does and knows what he's talking about. Easy to pay attention

He is an energetic teacher however he gets off on tangents and never really gets to the point. His lectures are mostly him sharing experiences and not teaching the material. He often assigns work that he has not taught.
Vary energetic teacher.  Although a little zany at times, he cares about students, and will help you when needed.  Recommended teacher (not that you have many choices in the PE department).

Very passionate and entertaining guy. Handwriting of board notes can be difficult to read but manageable. A background in bio is helpful but I hadn't taken it since high school and did fine. Go to class, like one discussion post a month, a midterm, and a final. Exams are a bit difficult to study for but he grades to accommodate that.

I love John as a person - he's FANTASTIC - but I would not take his class again. The class lacks major structure so it's always unclear what we're supposed to be learning. This class has no prerequisites, but it's impossible to do this class without background knowledge in microbio. Test questions are unpredictable. Board notes are illegible.

The class certainly added to my knowledge, but there are some serious problems with it! 1. A lot of background knowledge is required and he doesn't provide ypu with it in class. 2. Almost half of the class time is spent on copying from the board, which was ok if he didn't write all in capital letters! 3. Too many things to cover!....

Dr. Spear is an absolute legend who cares way more about teaching you the value of the content than every little detail of it. He tells some really cool stories and if you engage in the discussions, you'll learn a ton. Exams were unpredictable, but he's an easy grader as long as you show work. Would totally recommend his class just for the vibe.

He tells good stories that usually relate to the class. If you do the homework, you'll definitely get good grades on the exams. He is also a very easy grader on exams. I think I learned a lot from his class.

One of the coolest teachers on campus. Tell awesome stories and overall is just a fun person. Attendance is not mandatory but I highly recommend it because he is super funny. Super easy grader and a caring teacher. Flexible with deadlines which is always nice.

John is a great guy! He is really fun and is very relatable. I would take another class of his just to have him as a teacher. His tests are a bit unpredictable in terms of what will be on them but he is an easy grader and so as long as you try you will be fine. You have to read a lot, though, so be ready for that
This guy actually just sucks

Professor Sarazin has been by far the worst professor at Mines. He is difficult to understand and does not explain concepts clearly. He thinks that the students should know previous information that should really be taught in class. He tries to trick you on his tests and the test results are the worst averages I have seen at Mines.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Good prof fun and helpful
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Sarazin is passionate about some of his material (like nuclear physics) but his lectures are mostly useless, as he just recites what is on his slides and does exercises that can be found online. When going into office hours he can be helpful but is very condescending and rude at times. The grading scale is extremely unclear as well.
Not that great of a prof. Somewhat condescending and schedules test at Friday at 7pm. Like someone else said you'll learn more from reading the book.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Could have read a text book at home.

It's always a pleasure taking a non-mechanical engineering course and seeing the inarguable difference in quality between the professors. Professor Sarazin was a true pleasure to have as an instructor. He's passionate about the material, knowledgeable, well prepared, and makes you apply what you've learned to practical problems.

Overall a great professor. He  can really connect his experiences in college to that of his students. He wont hesitate to flat out give you the answer on a worksheet problem. He cares about your exam scores and knowledge more. He will even crack a good joke every now and then during lecture.
Lectures are easy to understand. He warns us with what will be on the exam and tells us exactly what to study. Very lenient with test corrections. Makes Diff EQ easy.
Great teacher. Goofy guy who really cares about his students. Go to class and you shouldn't have too much trouble.
Don't be a slacker and you will pass.
Great teacher, very willing to work with his student's busy schedules.
Just go to class and you'll be fine. He basically does the worksheets in class. The tests really aren't that hard and he basically tells you what to study for them.
santi is a great teacher and encourages learning and love for the material he teaches. would love to take another class with him
His lectures are awesome. He's a great geologist (or actually Geological Engineer). Exams were tough.

Bless this man. In a college full of horrible instructors at the freshman and sophomore level, this beautiful man is a glorius beacon of light. I enjoyed his class and he enioyed teaching it. Lots of information but he explains well and makes it easy. Genuinely caring guy who wants students to learn and will be your friend even after graduation.
great educator.  wants students to learn, not just pass a test
Funny, and a good teacher.  Get him if you can.
He's a very good teacher. The class was interesting, especially when Humphrey and Santi would get into discusssions about religion in geogic history. hee hee

Best lecturer for Statics at Mines. Common exams, so how you do depends on your effort level and the professor you have. Candi is very nice, makes handouts for lectures, and her clicker quizzes are much easier than other professors. If you have to take statics, she is the only choice. I would have failed without her.

She's much harder than other mechanic and material teachers (gives out harder tests).  She knows what she's talking about but she's grumpy at times, especially if you are "lost" in the material.  I didn't care for her on the whole.
Good teacher. Great example problems with real world applications. Easily understandable material presented in logical fashion.

She's a perennial favorite professor, but also does have a mean streak at times (and isn't especially sympathetic if you're having trouble grasping a concept). Likes you a lot if you're part of SWE/Steel Bridge/Concrete Canoe -- otherwise you feel disregarded. For older reviews, look up Candy Ammerman.
She makes you feel like an idiot if you ask her something that she thinks you should already know.
Excellent utilization of examples. Knows material and how to teach. Faculty lecturer of the year (2007). Calls students by name. Got to love the "Wuzzles!"

He is by far the worst professor I've had. His teaching doesn't help promote learning and you have to read the book to learn the material. You won't learn the material from Wu. Don't need to go to class to do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of the smartest people you will ever meet. Can find an application for every single concept, and has answers to every single question. He remembers his students and is clearly very passionate about education. If you the the chance, ask him about the times that science has given him chills.

Probably the worst professor I have had. His idea of a lecture is 45 minutes of deriving thermodynamic equations and a 10 minute example problem (he takes 55 minutes for a 50 minute lecture) that he doesn't explain and ends up messing up an early step so that everything he just wrote is incorrect. Also, the practice sets are nothing like the tests.
great teacher. Interesting class. Pchem II with someone else sucked but dwu made PCHEM I rock.
Dr. Wu is a fantastic professor.  He is the best lecturer I've had at Mines.  He does a great job of explaining the complex course materials and makes the subject fascinating.  Dr. Wu is the man!
Had him as a recitation professor, awesome.  I think he's a genius.  He made p.chem understandable which is quite a defeat.

Professor Navidi really knows his stuff. He wrote the textbook for the class, which really lends to an overall continuity in his teaching. His lectures are helpful, monotonous, and sometimes pretty funny. The textbook is super helpful though and makes the class much better.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Excellent teacher, made class enjoyable and really cares about his students.
I had Navidi for Applied Stats. He was so funny but what really surprised me was how caring he is about his students. Definitely visit him in office hours and just chat about "real data" sometimes :)

Navidi has a strong focus on mathematical rigor. He could sometimes give more examples to make the topics clearer, but overall he's an amazing lecturer and is always willing to answer questions. He makes lectures entertaining as well, which is always a plus.
Very entertaining in lecture and he really knows his stuff.
Great professor. Really knows his stuff and can clearly explain why it works.

Terrible professor, her lectures made no sense and were extremely hard to follow. I will say the actual material is not that hard, but you have to teach yourself. They are really generous with partial, just because everyone fails the exams. She was also really rude to students!
Shes really not useful

I would not recommend this professor. Students are required to pass the final with a 60% or higher to pass the class. Drop the class asap if you still can. She also cares more about herself than her students don't expect help during office hours or for her to be there.

Super disrespectful, Generally lacked an understanding of the class she was teaching, she also lacked an understanding of how to teach or speak publicly. If you ignore her lectures and just read the text book in class you will have a much better time. you need a 60% on the final or higher to pass the class regardless of grade >> KEEP THIS IN MIND<<
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Extremely disrespectful to her students, Does NOT speak English but will whisper what she thinks is English. However, she has no problem yelling at her students. If you take this class I would highly recommend reading the textbook watching the videos on Pearson and teaching yourself.

Awful professor. Every time I went to class her lectures were incredibly disorganized and she would repeatedly solve questions wrong. She is really generous with partial credit for the quizzes. There are 3 quizzes, each 15% and the final is 35% percent of our grade. She cannot take any feedback without getting mad at you/ the class.

quite honestly, most of this is personal beef with the guy. i could not stand his voice and did not show up to class because of it. i felt as if many of the lectures didn't help me with homework or other assignments, and found resources of my own to get through class. i can see how many people enjoy him as a professor. he was very kind and cared.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Prof. Hurt is a kind soul and genuinely cares about his students. I am so grateful for his feedback and support in getting through diff eq. His lectures were always very insightful, and he articulated the content to a stunning degree of precision. My biggest word of advice is to engage and get to know him; it makes the world a difference.

How I did in this class was a huge skill issue on my behalf. Hurt is a pretty good professor. Sometimes he seems a little underconfident in his teaching, but he's very sweet and obviously cares a lot about the content he's teaching. Provides a lot of real-world examples, so if you like that you'll like Hurt.

He goes through lecture material clearly and notifies students of important content to keep in mind for tests. Sometimes he goes too in-depth on derivations of certain solutions but that is not a bad thing by any means.
Todd Hurt is a great guy, he definitely cares a lot at making sure we all succeed in the class. He's not always the most engaging professor in lectures but he has a dry whit that is very funny
Super funny and nice guy. Occasionally his teaching didn't fully click for me and he'll go sort of slowly through examples. Would still highly recommend taking him.

Dr. Hurt is a really nice guy who helped directly with many difficult topics, he clearly cares about his students and sometimes gives us real world examples of how topics may be used such as in advanced Physics applications.

Professor Mooney is a master in his research field, but he does not really know how to teach. Lectures were not efficient. He didn't really understand what we did/did not know coming into the class. Office hours were not at convenient times. Homework was unnecessarily challenging, as well as exams. He travelled a lot and had random guest lectures.

I had Dr. Mooney for Introduction to Civil Infrastructure and let me just say, he does not care at all about that class. It is very apparent in his lack of enthusiasm. This class was an easy A, but there was so much unnecessary work, pretty much a paper due every week.

Intro to Civil Infrastructure is a pretty chill class with Dr. Mooney. His background in tunneling and showing examples of projects he's worked on are cool. Most lectures are guest speakers relevant to the topic area that week. Homework is about 2/3 short papers and 1/3 group/individual lecture quizzes. Some awesome field trips too.

Professor Mooney seems like a kind person, and I would probably like his other classes. Unfortunately, he didn't really teach our class and relied on guest speakers every week which were sometimes interesting. He maybe taught 3 of our classes the whole semester. He also only chose speakers who were white men. At least this class was super easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One paper every other week. No exams.

Awesome professor, just make sure you pay attention in class, be thorough on the homework, and don't be afraid to ask him for help, he's great in office hours! His lecture notes are the textbook and he is one of the best lecturers I've ever had. His NDE class is also incredibly interesting if you have any interest in it.

Dr. Posewitz is incredibly knowledgeable and caring and teaches in a way that truly promotes learning. His classes are test heavy but he gives you all the resources you need to succeed on exams. I highly recommend taking him for Biochem 1/2!

Possibly the best professor I've ever had. Dr. Posewitz cares about all his students and makes it clear what the learning objectives are, and lets you know what will be tested. Don't skip any of his lectures, do the homeworks, review the practice exams, and you will succeed in his class.

Dr. Posewitz is wonderful - the best chemistry professor at Mines in my opinion. He is kind, truly cares about his students, and has very clear expectations. His is passionate about Biochem so his lectures are interesting and he focuses on what is important. Even though he is the only Biochem professor at Mines, I wouldn't take it with anyone else!

If I could take every class with this
man I would

Dr. Posewitz is really great at breaking things down and is very clear what is gonna be on exams.
He is supper passionate about biochemistry and is big on key concepts and not memorization
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things
