comment: Dr. Posewitz is an absolute gem in the chemistry department! His lectures are clear & he emphasizes the most points important aspects of the course. Although the class is graded on 3 tests and a final & the lectures are not mandatory, you should absolutely attend them (but you can find the same success in the class by reading the textbook).

Best professor to ever set foot in the Mines chemistry department. The guy is a total genius but never condescending. Sit down, read the book, pay attention in class, do the practice exams. He will never steer you wrong and rewards hard work. By far my favorite professor of all time. His class was the reason I switched my major.
My guy helped me from a 55% to 88% the last week before finals. This guy is the most caring professor in the world.

Sadly he will never teach another class at mines, but a good comp org professor. Even though the course was put together horribly by the course coordinator, he helped it be a little less horrible by using canvas when none of the other professors did.

CSCI341 was a train wreck of a class, but Rion did the best he could with what he was given. I remember him coming up to me outside of a coffee shop to ask if I would come back to class, and that small gesture really meant a lot. I really wish I had him for a class that wasn't 341, as I can tell that hes a good prof. Thank you Rion.

Best computer science professor I've had so far. Lectures were given in a way that made the content make sense. They answer everybody's questions, knew students names, cared about the content they teach and explained the bigger picture of its importance. Applied lots of interesting real world examples. 10/10 would take again.
Really good adjunct professor, interesting and fun lectures, course coordinator really mismanaged course so i had to withdraw.
10/10 teachers, the class was ass in terms of structure and homework but Rion was awesome and made the class tolerable.

Though Dr Sharma is a studied academic, she is not a proficient professor. The classes she teaches are not only complex but confounding, she is unsympathetic to students troubles, her accent is hard to understand through, she is unwilling to work with students with different learning modalities and the grading feels tough, unfair and non-intuitive.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Sharma is the best professor I have ever had. She explains very concisely and expertly. By the end of the lecture, I felt prepared to tackle the homework. If the homework proves too challenging, she is available outside of class a lot. The exams were very fair. I left the class with a strong understanding of the control systems.

Not only did I feel like I understood lots about the course, but I'm retaining a lot of the knowledge we learned at the start of the course. Sharma is a professor you'll want to go to every lecture for, but not in a bad way! Plenty of examples and great explanations of how you should approach each problem! Be ready for really difficult HW though.

Sharma is a great professor, her lectures are very clear, well organized, and easy to follow, she's always willing to slow down and answer questions if someone is confused, and her office hours are great, would definitely recommend her for feedback
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Sharma is a great professor, while she covers content fairly quickly, her lectures are straightforward and she will clarify on any step if asked. Her office hours are very good as well, she cares for the student and answers any question no matter the size. She also provides handouts that help with both homework and exams.

Prof. Sharma is a great teacher. She's a little quick going through the content but her provided materials and outstanding office hours mean you'll learn the material if you put the time in.

She provides excellent feedback and really helps you get prepared for the exams. 

Great professor!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment:
Don't bother taking this class. The professor is polite but doesn't understand what it's like to be a student. The coursework is heavily skewed towarda the end of the semester and bombards you. Several students cried over how this effected their GPA. Don't bother with this class or professor.
She's not sympathetic to students needs.
He's a great professor that is willing to teach if you're willing to work. I feel like I learned a lot and he graded fairly, wish I could take him for all my engineering classes

Dr. Liberatore's style is to throw problems at you in class you haven't learned to solve yet and then give you 5 minutes to try to struggle with them. It makes for a hectic, sink-or-swim learning environment. However, the class notes provided are very clear and the tests are fair and over material you would expect. He helpful in office hours.

Very unhelpful. Very unwilling to listen to students during class and/or office hours. Material is easy, he makes it difficult. Will rip up your homework if more than five seconds late into class. Would not recommend.

His lectures are usually pretty clear.  A lot of in class group examples, will usually point out what you need to know for homeworks and quizzes.  His tests aren't easy, but are fair and usually pretty well related to quizzes and homeworks.

His lectures are usually pretty clear, and he will usually point out the overall topics you need to know for homeworks and quizzes.  His tests aren't easy, but they have been fair over several classes with him.

Good enough teacher, class is made harder than it needs to be. Instead of ramping up difficulty with assignments, the day after lecture you get hit with huge problems and get shut down. Uses Sapling learning, which is fairly helpful. WILL NOT give answers to problems (review or homework), you are never really sure if you are doing it right. Hard!

Very good professor. He'll go off topic often, but is very good at conveying material. He won't leave you behind if you're having trouble grasping something. Focuses on the fundamentals of a problem, not the particulars. Only a slight bit of accent.
very good prof
Excellent professor, if you are interested in structural engineering take any and all of his courses
No Comments
It was really worth attending the class!
Good teacher. Really cares whether or not you learn and knows how to teach.  Take this guy if you can.

Lusk, in my opinion, is the best professor you will ever have. His passion for physics is present in every lecture, and he has a clear desire to help you understand whatever you may be confused about. He is super approachable and is always happy to answer questions. If you have the opportunity to take a class with him, definitely don't pass it up.
Dr. Lusk is a really friendly person and I learned a lot in I Mech.
He's witty, interesting to listen to, and makes quantum mechanics as clear as it can be made.  He's one of the nicest guys you'll meet.
He was very helpful, and willing to answer any questions we had, no matter how dumb or repetive they were.  Without him, I never would have passed CAE.
One of the best lecturers I have ever see.
No Comments

Gavriil got me a fun date with the girl across the table from me! True story. Anyways, he's an incredibly funny and passionate guy about physics, but sometimes his 1 on 1 explanations were so fast paced and in a thick accent, so they left me more confused. Overall though, a great teacher.
Most passionate man I have ever met, one of my all-time favorite proffs
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I've never met a professor that cares as much as he does. Also he is super funny and a fun guy to have a beer with.

Gavriil is very knowledgeable when it comes to all things physics and is quite entertaining, but he is kind of a weird guy and really prone to tangents or just coming up to you during studio and asking random questions. Ultimately studio is never difficult and you can always ask a TA for help, but Gavriil can be funny but distracting,.
Solid choice for a studio professor. Funny and does a good job helping. Responds to emails quickly

We had him for studio and he is really funny, but not allowed to teach a lecture for a reason. He will go around and either ask you about your day, make a joke about your name, or overexplain a question. Just try to ask the TAs and not him.
Amazing professor. Great lectures. Machine Design is a hard course and he made it manageable and I learned a ton.
Knowledgable, approachable, kind, and knows his stuff.
Really enjoyed lectures and learning from Greg. He is one of my favorites for sure. Lots of energy and good at explaining things.

Greg is an amazing teacher and is full of energy. He cares about student learning and takes the time to clearly explain concepts to students. Greg also has a lot of energy and it is easy to stay awake in class. I will always look for classes he is teaching. I have learned a tremendous amount form his classes.
He really knows the material and can answer questions. I learned a lot from his lectures. He doesn't respond to all emails though.

Homework is usually based off of things youve learned in class, so attendance is key. His teaching style is hard to follow for most. He can come off as rude during in person conversations. He is not very good at answering emails or meeting in person. In my opinion, his TAs help more than he does. His passion for engineering is great though!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Group projects

comment: Professor Zhexuan gong has mastered the art of lectures that are too long and say too little. All of his course material is made in such a way that you will be expected to learn what should be taught over the course of 2 weeks in one day. It is for this reason Zhexuan gong is one of the worst graduate level professors you can possibly take.

Zhexuan gong is very monotone and his lecture notes are almost indecipherable, expect to either read a lot of the textbook or extensively use gpt because he does not explain anything in this class well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This class ruined all interest I had in quantum mechanics. Dr. Gong's explanations are confusing and people often sit in class with their hands up for 10+ minutes before he notices. The homework assignments were repetitive and are the first busy work I have had in a while. His lectures are extremely boring and I found it very hard to stay engaged.

Lectures are very well organized and prepared, it's so clear that Prof. Gong knows the topic extremely well. It is a difficult topic, and the homework and tests are difficult as a result, but Gong is supportive and caring about learning. He will help you to succeed, but it won't be handed to you. Best physics course I've taken here.

Professor Gong's class is built to optimize a student's understanding of the material. This includes great and engaging lectures and personal anecdotes about legends within the field. The class is engaging but dense. The homework is quite difficult, but there is ample time for help during his office hours.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Gong is a great teacher and he explains everything very clearly. It's super easy to ask questions but you have to be engaged. The class is hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: YOU WILL LOVE HER, genuinely passionate and presents the material in a fantastic way.
I would take all my math classes with her if able. She doesn't get bogged down in the proofs of theorems, instead, she spends time ACTUALLY teaching you how to use them with a variety of problems.
Awesome person! She could stay hours and hours after office hours because she cares about each student. She is the model that other Professors should look to it
Calc II is easily the hardest calc at mones but she made the class understandable and she is a good person

Professor Gladkina is amazing! She is very down-to-earth and accessible for her students, and you can tell she really cares about each individual. She is also just great at explaining math, and her notes are *immaculate*. I highly recommend taking her calc class.

Gladkina is one of the best math professors that I've had. She is super funny and caring and she makes going to class fun. She has a ton of resources and classes are super structured. Would take this class again for sure!

I took Calc 1 with Prof. Brown and fell in love with her teaching style. She always find a way to lecture in an easy to digest manner and writes everything you need to know about the class topic on the whiteboard. She is very kind and caring, actively works on getting to know you and is very understanding. Her office hours are the super helpful.

Merry Brown was a great professor. She made every lecture engaging and gave ample time for optional worksheets at the end of each lecture to give students a chance to test their learning and ask questions. The almost daily MLM assignments do start to get annoying after a while as the auto-grading system sucks but that is the fault of the software.

If you're into re-learning reimann sums at the beginning of every. single. lecture. you'll love her. Every single lecture was a review of week one of calc one, because she kept beginning a new concept by starting with the most basic foundations, but never actually managed to get to the real lecture.

Had her for MATH 112, she is incredibly kind and does an excellent job explaining lecture topics. The most challenging part of the class is mostly the homework, but take good notes and you should be fine.

Honestly I could never find the motivation to go to class because the material was not interesting. Everytime I was there she conveyed the material in a good way, just different than what I'm used to. I would not take a math from her again.
Awesome professor. Super nice and very caring of her students. Lectures move very slowly, so they are easy to follow along, and she is always available outside of class. Definitely recommend!

Dr. Mohagheghi is one of the best professors I have had at mines. Dr. Mohaghegi explains all the concepts perfectly, and has created the most in depth resources I have ever seen in any class. We had 2 take home exams which were very similar to the content covered in class and the HW. Only 6 homeworks, and the group project was quite fun.

Salman is a wonderful professor. I learned a lot in his classes 
Extremely knowledgeable

Salman Mohagheghi is a pretty good professor. He explains things pretty clearly and his examples are excellent. His energy definitely dies down towards the end of the semester, so his teaching quality degraded. I still don't understand some of the later content of the class but the fundamentals are there.

The best professor for Feedback by far. Really clear in his teaching, and the averages on the tests are like 80-85(in my class). You know what to expect on the exams, and he is really easy to approach and ask questions, will really help you out.

Excellent lecturer. Even if he does seem stern, he is always willing to help. My only criticism is that we didn't do many worked examples in class. If you understand the homework thoroughly (6 in the whole semester) you will ace the test. He realized many students couldn't access office hours, so did an online session before a test at a better time
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Had 6 assignments for the whole semester, 5 of which were in the second half of the semester.  Explained every concept PERFECTLY, very very intuitive way of explaining things; definitely do not skip lectures. Other students have mentioned a slightly condescending attitude, but I disagree. Extremely helpful when asked, good class involvement.
Worst Math Teacher I ever had
Horrible at teaching the concepts. Made his own worksheets that were very confusing. Not helpful in office hours.
Terrible teacher, when to Blair-Kennedy instead.

I recommend that if math understanding is not easy for you, then do not take a class with Mr. Thompson. He is a nice enough guy, but he has great difficulty communicating ideas and concepts in a useful way and resorts to using hard to understand "math language" in lessons. He tends to do lots in his head as well so it's hard to follow his examples.

It is very obvious that this guy hates his job. He is the kind of instructor that believes in only doing the bare minimum to keep his job. In other words, he has office hours because he has to not because he wants to. If he were my sole source of instruction on Differential Equations I would be completely lost. Avoid taking his class if possible.
easiest teacher ever!

Dr. Garris is a fantastic teacher. Sometimes struggles a bit with explaining her lecture material, but is always willing to help and is a very easy person to talk to. Show up to her lectures and you'll easily pass. Also an easy grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Lots of group work in class, but she is very helpful. Very flexible w/ office hours, always makes herself available. Very good lecturer, explains concepts well. Always give thorough feedback on work. Very friendly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Taught off of a paper more than anything. Didn't always seem to have a good grip on concepts and explained things somewhat poorly. Hyper-focused on working on group projects that no one was really into. Mostly teaches to students who already know everything about calc. Great for those students, terrible for those who don't already grasp it.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very skilled in the lecture environment. Sets your notes up perfectly and is very accessible outside of class. After implicit differentiation I was really struggling and she spent quite a bit of time with me and helped catch me up to the class. Would def. recommend her class. If you need extra help in calc. she's a gem.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Garris is fantastic. She explains concepts extremely well, and is always accessible outside of class in some form. She is very helpful when there is a problem on a homework assignment that you do not understand, and does her best to help your grade. I would take her for every math class if I could. If you have the chance, take her class!

Rebekah is a very nice, approachable teacher. She was willing to answer questions, and she was usually at class early if you wanted to stop in and ask a question outside of office hours. She was very big on working in-class problems in groups, which wasn't my favorite. Other than that, great teacher.

Crocker is a very thoughtful professor with good teaching skills. I took most of his classes. In few classes he mentioned books which he never followed. He is a tough grader but logical and rational. His class is more towards taking notes. He can try giving out those notes in handout and can explain the whole thing like a story teller with diagrams
Great Professor. Will prepare you for the industry. He will encourage you to do research on those topics he teaches in the class and thus you will learn more! Crocker rocks!

Wish I had the experience with Crocker others mention. He has clearly taught this subject too many times and no longer has any interest in teaching this. He copied example problems from the textbook for 50 minutes and wrote quick enough so that when he asked "any questions? No?" everyone was still writing. Tests are dissimilar from class probs/HWs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Joe is my adviser, and I have taken every class I can with him. He's an excellent teacher, his lectures are very engaging, and his graded work all feels purposeful. You will not do or learn something without application. The structure of his classes is very clear cut. His tests are known for being long, but it's never stopped me from decent grades.

I've had Crocker for many classes at Mines (in fact, I have taken nearly everything he's taught). He's a very practical professor, and his courses are incredibly useful in the real world. Very quick to help to students. The most significant difficulty on tests is due to the time pressure -- practice speed and accuracy.
Took for Aikido two semesters. It was really fun never knew an old man could do things like he did

Had Prof Farrell for DiffEq but one of my favorite professors I've had. Cares about his students and knows them by name, really wants everyone to understand the material, join his class discords and watch the videos he makes if you can't make office hours. Made a class I was dreading be one of my favs because his teaching style is so intuitive.

Professor Farrel gives great lectures making math material easy. In his lectures, he often goes over many practice problems, giving step-by-step instructions for each problem. He also has great office hours outside most of the time and is very good at helping students through tough CALC/DIFFEQ problems. I highly recommend him for all math classes.

Professor Farrell is a fun and goofy guy who is really good at teaching calculus (had him for 8am calc 2). I would have taken him again if his calc 3 classes hadn't filled up before my registration timeslot
Sean may be the best professor I've ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and puts hard concepts into understandable terms. Go to his office hours, you won't regret it.

Sean is a great professor. I got stuck with 8am calc 2 and I don't think I would've shown up to half the lectures I did if I didn't have Sean. He is funny and seems to genuinely care about his students. Calc 2 is hard, but he tries to keep things light. He connects with students. He is also very accessible outside of class when you need help.

Farrell was a great teacher and always spoke passionately about the topic he teached. The coursework was difficult of course, it's calculus 2, but through his lectures, Farrell would tell jokes, interact with the students, answer questions, he is just an overall fun guy.

You can tell Dr. Mikucki genuinely loves the subject and is excited to teach. His excitement was a nice change during bad days. He did not hold a lot of office hours but that is because help hours were already a thing. However, he is very kind and understanding in class. Extension policy was strict but made sense and he was nice about it.

Mikucki genuinely cares about your well-being without being a pushover. If you put effort into his class, he will put effort into your grades. He also connects all math concepts together, instead of saying "This is how you do XYZ." He explains it in the context of the natural world and WHY it works. The best professor I've had at Mines.

If I could give him a 6 I would. Its a hard class but he is such an amazing prof, he cares about every student, is funny, is goofy, pushes students to ask questions, and is overall a very supportive and inspirational instructor. 

Bonus points: He tried his best to remember every students name, and got almost all of them!

the Cookster is one of the most amazing profs I've ever had. Linear was a very difficult class for me to understand just because of how differently you have to think from other math classes, but Mikucki made me excited to learn with how passionate and caring he is. I would take any class he offers, so worth the 8am.

Dr. Mikucki is an energetic, effective professor that teaches lin-alg very nicely. Homeworks were hard sometimes, but his office hours and explanations for topics helped out immensely. Exams were graded leniently and were not particularly hard. I think he is one of your best options when considering a lin-alg professor.
Highly energetic and passionate about math, Dr. Mike Mikucki is the best teacher to take Sci Comp (MATH307) from. Highly recommend the course. If you feel lost in the course, just go talk to him.
This class is awful and this professor doesn't seem to care at all.

Worst professor I have ever taken. He took over 2 and a half months to grade half of our work for this class, which there was a lot of. When you do everything on the rubric, that only nets you a C. He posts mini lectures but they were so useless that I didn't watch any after week 1. Take this class with anyone else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I did this class asynchronously, and I must say it was not the best. The few lectures he gave were not very helpful or informative. There was a lot of homework to do and lots of discussions. It is not necessarily a hard class, it is just really time consuming.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The online version of this class has been frustrating. There is no lecture - purely reading (a lot) of the textbook and learning through getting questions wrong. I think this class is just being taught in the wrong way. The class is more self-taught. The proffessor seems to be distant and doesn't teach directly. Maybe he teaches better in-person?
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: AVOID THIS PROFESSOR!! He is awful. I am remote and his class asynchronous. He compensates with a ridiculous amount of homework and projects. It is impossible to get in contact with him and he is super unhelpful. Wish I could give this class a 0/5. Take it at a CC to save $, braincells, and your dignity.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Really great and interesting lectures. Class was more group-work focused than homework (there were only 4 HW the whole semester, two exams, and no final). The group work was really helpful for understanding material in a more hands on way. He also really seems to care about students and is very willing to help.

Sharp is great, and very forgiving of mistakes. He also provides the lectures for you to view outside of class, and attendance is not mandatory. The tests are do-able, but can be dense. A's and B's are easily accessible, but you still feel like you work for them. Do your homework and study for the tests, and you will get a good grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Sharp is fantastic, his lectures are engaging and the coursework is pretty straightforward. Assignments are manageable and there are a couple extra credit opportunities. Quizzes and exams are mostly direct copies of homework questions, so it's worth doing the completion-based homework. 3 exams, generally 3-4 quizzes per unit, two papers.

Dr. Sharp is a great dude and gives great lectures basically every class. It was super easy for me to keep coming to his class since his lectures were actually meaningful and engaging. His quizzes come directly from the homework, and the exams are extensions of the quizzes. It's basically a guaranteed A if you put in a little work.
Overall not too bad and nothing big to complain about. Just make sure you check your homework with the key before you take the quizzes.

Although he may be a good teacher I do not like when he says something is easy or fairly simple because what may be simple for other people is not for some and it makes you feel dumb and not want to try when your one of those people.

Dr. Sharp was one of the few professors that I had that actually took the time to work with me on understanding a concept in the class. He truly wants his students to succeed and is a breath of fresh air in a school where many courses are weed out courses. Even though I am not an environmental engineer, I would take his course anytime.

She was honestly horrible. She was really bad at lecturing, and she was never in the lab to help out. She didn't know what was going on with the labs, which took literally so much time, and you were not given much assistance with them. She misled us about the material that was going to be on the midterm, which was really unfair.

Genuinely awful. Her lecture started taking attendance midway through the semester as attendance had gotten low (for good reason). Very poor orator and does not deliver much important information per lecture--once she spent an hour on Arduino pinouts (one single image). Labs are poorly stocked and she fails to communicate instructions to the TA.

I saw the professor in the lab once. The lab is the bulk of your grade and if your lab TA isn't great, you're in for a bad time. The lectures were poorly constructed and need heavy work. The final included material not covered in the lectures Velocity Profiles to be specific. There was velocity profile in the files, I recommend you read it.

She is very sweet and tries her best to explain the material when students don't understand. She is super approachable inside and outside of class and is concerned with you learning the concepts rather than how to just memorizing different problems. Also, her research is super cool, and sometimes she brings her robots to class for us to play with.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: I had her for Dynamics and I did not find Professor Zhang adequate at teaching and thoroughly explaining the subject material. Poor feedback on grading. Attend Dynamics recitations as much as possible because this is where you will learn. If you can teach yourself out of a book that wouldn't hurt either.
Xaioli was not a good Dynamics teacher. I learned nearly all of the material straight from the textbook. Do whatever you can to avoid her for Dynaimcs

Imagine an 80 year old man who jumps around class before lectures and yells about certain random things. Now imagine that while doing all of these strange crazy things this man (legend rather) is also effectively conveying complex thermodynamics concepts. This man is is the one and only "Rock Doc" Dr. Samuel H. Romberger.

I wouldn't take another class from this guy if my life depended on it. I learned one of (if not, the most) important lesson of my life from this person. I am now indebted 4ever . Far, far different experience than undergrad work at another school.
Romberger's cool.  I hate Thermodynamics, but I didn't hate going to it with Romberger.  This man knows his stuff and is willing to help you as long as you try.  I strongly recommend him for thermo.
A little strange but a nice guy and a good teacher.
He is so strange
Great teacher and provides lot of example problems...a must for Thermo
best teacher at school of mines.  the BEST
best teacher at school of mines.  the BEST
Excellent for Calc II.  The best Calc teacher at Mines.
She is awesome and is a good teacher. She makes calc easy.
Great teacher, agree with comment above
This woman could teach Japanese to a monkey.  Fantastic.

He might be a very smart person however he is not a great teacher. He seemed to go out of his way to be unhelpful as he took down lectures slides before the final. Make sure you download all of the files you need as soon as he posts them because he will not put them back up no matter how many people ask.

Professor Ely makes at least one mistake in every class (in lecture ppt or in hw final solutions), so you cannot rely on anything that he provides you. He is not available outside of the class, so email is probably your only option of contacting him with any questions.

Professor Ely seeks to do the bare minimum. His lectures are mediocre, and he often refuses to meet with students outside of class. The advice he does give is usually ambiguous and unhelpful. The homework and projects are very difficult, and his reluctance to help students makes these assignments extremely frustrating.

You average day looks like this: He talks for 20 minutes about random things. Equations are thrown onto the projector and are often wrong. Example is performed with a significant error that he ignores. Your class is 5 chapters behind the other class. You don't know how to do the homework because of lecture errors. Get slammed with projects.

I had Ely for fluids and he was an awful professor. He is bad at explaining material and the homework was too hard compared to the content we learned in class. He barely does examples on the board, and if he does then he usually gets them wrong. I heard that fluids (CBEN 307) was supposed to be the easiest junior level chem e class. He made it hard
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: James Ely is the worst professor I have had at Mines. Not only is he consistently weeks behind in lecture, he does not adjust the homework or quizzes to accommodate. As a result I have to teach myself fluids with no help. He also does not hold office hours and refuses to meet with students outside of class. If you have the choice, pick anyone else.

Knowledgeable professor, especially helpful in lab. Lecture uses iClicker for attendance and participation, kind of rough to lose points for getting questions wrong that had barely been taught yet. You have to buy the textbook for HW and start early. Intermittent availability via email. Accommodating of excused absences.

Lectures are dense. You need to show up. The slides that are provided give no information. Don't get sick!
Usually end up doing better on the tests than you thought 
Homework is rough and require reading the book. Lectures dont always cover the homework questions. 
Grades participation off i-clicker. Dont be late. Dont get questions wrong either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I had Alex for lab, so I can't speak to how she does in lecture. She is really nice and wants to help us learn. She is definitely knowledgeable in her field. She can be inconsistent with answering emails which is frustrating. She doesn't watch over her TAs when they make mistakes on Canvas.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Wayllace made this class so much harder that it needed to be. No information on canvas. Hardly accessible outside of class. Does not respond to her emails. Homeworks are extremely long and graded harshly. The homeworks are also not always relevant to the tests. She is a nice person but a terrible professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: My only complaint about Wayllace is how slow her lectures are. She has a very monotone voice that is hard to sit through early in the morning. On top of that she goes at the pace of a snail making it even harder to sit through her lectures. She isn't the best during office hours either. However, the content of the class isn't actually that hard.

She gives good examples that are easy to follow. She's a nice professor that will help during office hours and is passionate about what she teaches. The homework she assigns definitely helps out with the exams.
Seems like a nice person but not flexible or understanding, lectures are useless, sends passive aggressive email responses, overall best to avoid.

She has a tone and mannerism that feels like she's teaching a class of 5th graders, which can take away a lot from her lectures. She does, however, clearly enjoy the Computer Science field personally a lot. This passion translates to her lectures.

Relatively easy class, though the homework load can get heavy, especially with 102. LOTS of extra credit is offered, and all assignments are weighted the same, so there are many opportunities to improve your grade if needed. Once you get to know Megan, she is very fun and friendly. She's very clear and helpful during office hours.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: All she does is read off the slides, and she does not know how to explain concepts all that well. I would go to her and ask for help outside of class, and she would just tell me to go back to the slides and review it. It was still an easy class overall and office hours helped me out, but her lectures were a big waste of time.

I came into the class with a bit of programming knowledge. However, Megan still made this content interesting and engaging.She is a very fast lecturer, but would always stop and leave plenty of time for questions.  I am glad that she was my first introduction into the computer science program at Mines. Thank you Megan.

Gets very upset if people are not paying attention, but she just reads slides. Like word for word. Mandatory quiz at the beginning of class, but if you show up for the quiz and then leave she gets very upset as well. Not great, not awful. Won't really affect your grade as the material isn't very hard and she doesn't grade anything anyways
She grades much harsher than other professors for NHV, and has reading quizzes. However, attendance is not mandatory, and the discussions are interesting.
Took advanced science communication. A lot of reading and some writing but not too much. Super kind teacher. Based around giving a talk so really helpful for public speaking skills.

I highly recommend NOT taking HASS 423 with her. She treats it as a grad student class. Very unclear with assignment requirements and nitpicky with grading. She has twice now skimmed my assignments and missed parts that are required and refuses to change the grade when pointed out.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Would not recommend Science Communication over other HASS classes at Mines - especially with Professor Holles. This class was more work than the 400-level HASS I took and Professor Holles was very unwilling to accept and change anything in the course based on student feedback. Her grading also seems inconsistent and nitpicky
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: She was really good at creating a welcoming environment for class discussions. She gave a lot of very helpful feedback on all work. She is also very understanding about late work.

Dr. Holles was great. She cares about her students, gives good feedback on all the papers, and holds balanced and interesting discussions during class. I seriously lucked out in getting her as my teacher; she is a much easier grader than most of the teachers in the department. (and, she bumped my grade up from a B+ to an A-, so that was also nice.)

He is probably the last laziest teacher I've ever seen.  He is Condescending In office hours, impatience masked by fake politeness. He will treat you like you want him to answer your homework, even if your asking conceptual questions. Course work is paltry at best, homework didn't get graded until last week of the semester. 0/10 with rice.

Dr. De Moor has been one of my favorite professors so far in my academic career. He is able to teach a class in great detail while still being able to make sure anyone could understand the material, given they pay attention. The only downside I can give EDM is his punctuality, but it would only be a minute or two at the worst on certain days.

His lectures are easy to understand and he takes his time explaining material so you are able to follow the different formulas and thermodynamic processes. Homework usually had 2 or 3 problems which showed you how to use the different formulas for free energy and how they related to one another. Exams are 35 minutes or so in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: I learned so much about birds and ostriches. This class is a must for bird lovers. Manny is an excellent teacher. Super helpful. Belgium is aewsome.
Solid Professor. Straightforward but involving lectures. Committed to help students in and out of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: De Moor is very straightforward with tests; you'll know exactly what will be on them because he gives participation quizzes beforehand with similar material. He really wants to engage his students and he explains things thoroughly, but his lectures can be pretty boring.
She was a harsh on the handouts. Forced us to do a lot of unnecessary stuff such as an hour and a half hike.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Kroepsch's global studies class was pretty easy. Definitely a nice change of pace from all the STEM classes I have this semester

Great teacher, interesting lectures and pretty easy as global studies classes go: 4 writing quizzes instead of tests (one of which is dropped), and one paper that if you're dissatisfied with the grade you can rewrite. 100% recommend for Global Studies.

I really didn't like environmental global studies with Kroepsch. She is very nit picky, and doesn't clearly lecture on what you can expect on an exam. If you bring your papers to her before the deadline she will give you a lot of good input for a high B/A but the exams are just really dumb and tough to study for.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I took a class with her as an elective. I was not expecting to learn as much as I did. She is a rigorous and diligent professor. She is a consistent grader and makes her expectations known. I found her thoughts and points provoking. Overall, I enjoyed her as a person and respect her as a professional.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: Lots of homework, count on reading 15 pages of scientific journals every night, plus a response to make sure you read the whole thing.  6 HW assignments during the semester about a page each.  Plus a 30 page group project due at the end of the semester.  Dr. K was very knowledgable and passionate, but very strict and with high, unclear standards.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Passionate teacher, great at encouraging students to produce their best creative work. She has high expectations but she makes these expectations clear. Loves to meet with students outside of class! Would recommend highly.
Helpful teacher, but leaves a lot up to the student (length, etc.). She gives a lot of good direction if you come to her with your content beforehand.

Many Mines students don't like that she doesn't give length or content restrictions. She wants people to choose what to write and how much. It's just different than most engineering/technical classes. She's extremely nice and loves to teach!

-She is not very clear about the objective of the essays to write.   she missed 4 classes for the last 2 semesters.  Good luck with her grading for she put on her syllabus that A grades are very rate.
Misses 3 to 4 classes every semester.  Very hard to get an A.  I got an A after re-doing my work 4 times!  good luck with her.
Terrible class and poorly structured.
Poorly designed class, the professor does not teach or offer easy help for students.

LCA is the worst class i've ever taken. She doesn't teach. She relies on premade videos that don't explain. The material is confusing and the software is horrible. She has TA's grade everything but i'm not sure they know what they're doing either. If you email her she emails you back telling you to email everyone, and then they dont respond either.

Life cycle assessment is by far the worst structured, poorly instructed class I have ever taken at Mines. The material can be so confusing and the software that is required never seems to work correctly. Office hours were required for a grade, but they were during very inconvenient times. It was hard to get help as well.

This class and this prof is the absolute worse. She does so little of anything, everything is taught and graded by the TAs. The syllabus is unclear and if you email and ask for clarification she won't even respond. An absolute joke. The easiest class to pass though. Material is not interesting nor is it made to be.

Had her for History of Medicine and it was fantastic. She assigns a lot of reading so just skim the material and look at the journal prompt to focus your efforts (she wants you to). She loves feedback so email her or go to office hours. She is very nice and understanding so just keep her in the loop if something happens and you need an extension.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Prof. Buhrer is quite caring and understanding. NHV has a lot of smaller reading and writing assignments to stay on top of in order to do well, but by far she cares most about in class discussion and participation. She is also very lenient about larger project deadlines. Overall: laid back but fair.
Great professor. She made NHV actually fun and interesting. In stark contrast, both of my roommates hated NHV with their professors.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took this class over the summer. The breakdown was we were assigned 4 books (a lot of readings per class) with quizzes at the beginning of each class, 2 presentations, a heath regimen, and a disease essay. Class participation is expected. But she is lenient as far as profs are as she allowed for time extensions and is really nice about grading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Had her for NHV and I loved her! I didn't come to Mines to write but she made the class enjoyable. The assignments were reasonable and she was willing to change them or accommodate students if it was needed. She gave good feedback on writing and I always felt comfortable in her class.
Cool Professor, reasonable NHV assignments. Liked her a lot.
Taught the material in a great way, super easy to understand. 10/10

He is a great dude, and he is new to teaching, but is already way better than average.He is super caring, views his students as people. More of a him working with us against a problem, not us against him. He gives one extension per student a semester without questions, and knows the material well. hes fun, kind . He also has 9 1/2 fingers. :)

Professor Montgomery is a really nice professor, grad student when I had him. He really understands the material well and explains things in a really clear manner. He writes out a lot of notes on the board and is always welcoming to questions. Really great guy, had a great semester with him.

Dave is one of the most caring professors. His teaching style is very understandable, straight forward, and simplified when needed. He cares about his students in and out of class and wants to see them succeed, not just get a grade. I truly hope he continues to teach here at Mines, or anywhere for that matter.

Dave is a great professor. He takes the time to build a relationship with every student and genuinely cares about his students' well being. Besides his commendable personality, he is a great teacher. He thoroughly explains each concept and provides in-depth solutions to each practice problem he puts on the board. He also a very aproachable person.

I noticed a lot of these reviews are out of date so I thought I would write one. I enjoyed Professor Johnson's class and think she writes probably the best lecture notes out of professor I've taken. They are very clear and make doing assignments easy. I definitely recommend her class.
Awful professor. She does not know the materials well enough to teach.
If you wanna get any knowledge about the topic DO NOT TAKE IT WITH HER. She makes the material uninteresting and boring.
good!

First rate graduate class. She uses blackboard's message board feature to answer questions and she always posts a useful answer within hours (sans middle of the night posts). Tests are fair and cover the key concepts of the course. The final project was structured extremely well with several stages of deliverables to make you start early

Mark Miller is an approachable and genuinely kind professor (unlike most stuck up professors in our PE department). His homework's are tedious and formatting is a must. Get it checked by a TA and you'll be set! Before every midterm, he'll provide you old exams from previous years to study. Expect one tough problem that distinguishes A's from B's.

Although the lectures can be somewhat tedious, that is the nature of the material he teaches.  He is 100% willing to take the time to explain material to you (and with a positive attitude).  I would say he is one of the most caring teachers in the department.
Bad Teacher...Makes test WAY harder than they need to be.
No Comments
Decent teacher, but talks fast and changes overheads too quickly.  He doesn't post any lecture material online or provide handouts, so if you miss something, you're SOL.  Kinda boring too.

He's the best professor i have known or met.Great depth of knowledge,highly helpful...i suggest people who don't understand him rather go and do some reading...coming to class unprepared of-course leaves you clueless about what is being taught.Shiba panda is by far the best proffessor i have learnt from...
Run away far away, worst teacher i've ever had in school. I want my money back for this class
One of the worst teachers I have ever had!  His english isn't very good and his notes are wrong.  STAY AWAY FROM HIS CLASSES!!!
No Comments
Avoid Panda at all costs and take circuits with Ammerman.
Very strict professor.

God awful class. This teacher is very boring, the class is a joke, and sitting in the class for the two hours with this teacher makes you want to kill yourself. I dont think this teacher even knew what she was talking about. Have fun!
If your lucky enough to hear her talk, you next hurdle is not falling asleep. This lady is a joke and one of the worst teachers ever.
Extreme hottie, but whispers like a mouse... better sit close
No Comments

Penguins aside Josh was a great Professor for Data Structures. Knew the language (C++) forward and backward and was able to debug some students' really nasty errors within seconds. Put endless effort into making the assignments quality and beefed the course up so students learned more. Responded to emails within hours. Too bad he's graduating.
Penguins.... enough said
Josh is as cool as a penguin!
Great teacher very helpful. Can take some time to reply to emails though.

Grad students are a hit or miss, Prof Thomas teaches with the skill of a seasoned prof during his 2nd term teaching. Very smart with clear and engaging lectures. His self destructive humor was corny but clever and often hilarious. A bit awkward but super friendly and helpful. Worked hard with students' Q's. Very surprised with this great teacher!
Very entertaining and funny. Does a good job of explaining material and isn't too difficult.
He is awesome
He is pretty easy and explains things well.  I didn't buy the textbook and still got on A in his class just by taking notes in his class.  Even though he is Indian, you can still understand him.
This guy is the man! Foreigner!
Funny Indian...Jokes About her wife and americans

Papers due every week, on top of two exams and a final paper... One of the exams we were given an empty map of China, and were told to fill in ALL of the cities (no word bank or location dots given). I had to buy 3 books, and nothing he said made any sense. SOOOO much work. Not Worth. Take 20th Century World History at Red Rocks instead.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: A generally caring guy but not a great professor. Tests/ class deliverables were worse than those assigned by other profs, would not recommend

If you have a burning love for China, TAKE THIS CLASS! Otherwise, prepare to memorize as much as you can and then regurgitate for the tests. In fairness, he does preface the unit that he has been accused of being a sinophile (true), but I was not interested in memorizing the past leaders of China. That's what google is for.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: As I drudged on through my classes this semester, I couldn't help but think fondly back at my time back in Human Systems with Carl Mitcham. My spirit swelled with affection and despair knowing that I would never have the great privilege of being a student in his class. The class was great though, very easy to grasp and get a good grade in.
Be prepared to put in little work and receive a B-
His tests are straight forward but they can be very hard. He's also a very hard grader. Lectures are long and he explains things well, but outside work does not reflect the exam material.

The tests are worth so much in this class and while he says he gives partial credit, it is not clear what he is looking for in the first place. His lectures are organized, but he does not explain things as well as others do. He does not inspire me to learn the material and rather makes me hate the class more.
Boyes is a great professor. His lectures are very organized and he makes sure that his tests are fair.
Crikey, this class is difficult! Boyes really gave me the D there, but overall he's a great professor.
Gimme the D, Boyes.
Teaches topics in a way that is easily understandable. Definitely one of the better math teachers I have ever had.

Firstly, I hated this class to begin with, since it was "flipped" in that you learn all of the material outside of lecture, on your own time. With that said, PACE did an awful job making use of lecture. He was almost hostile towards questions. He took a REALLY long time to grade things, and I didn't get MML grades until the end of the semester.

Dr. Pace has little instruction during class. He requires you to understand how to do the worksheets given in class with little instruction on the topic. To understand the topic you must watch a video the day before class and the video is not discussed in depth in class. Dr. Pace does not respond to emails and when he does they are short responses.

A solid choice for Calc 2. Certainly cares about how his students perform in the class. He seemed very organized and sent out a weekly email about what was due for the week for a grade. Was more than willing to stay after class and answer any questions about the material.

Pace is disorganized and skipped class with no explanation. He hasnt responded to any of my emails and confuses deadlines. I completely understand that professors are people too, but he makes many errors every single class and seems out of it consistently. He also has a nervous habit of tapping pens. I wish him the best, but dont take him.

Professor Beard is an amazing teacher. Once I told him I was struggling with some of the content he and he provided many opportunities to help me move forward. He dedicates tons of time to his students. I loved his teaching style, he often suggests to "just watch and take in how I do this problem" and then does another with the class. Great teacher
Great teacher, cares and is very helpful

Professor Beard is very methodical and responds to emails really fast. Sometimes, the way he explains things are confusing, but for the most part he is easy to understand, and you can always go to other professors or TAs to ask questions. I don't know if he's the best professor for statics, but being in his section is not a bad thing.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Jeremy was an excellent professor, I found him to be very personable and he always had time to answer questions about the material
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Beard is a good person and the best way for success in his class is to stop him if you have questions so he can explain it. He is also available by email if you need help.
Not very engaging also does not have office hours.
One of the worst professors I've had in recent memory. He truly has no empathy and can't ever be wrong. I suggest taking this course with another professor. Read his reviews..spot on!

Gissler just regurgitates Dr. Shorey's podcasts but often says something incorrectly or if he doesn't know what he is talking about will mumble and move on. He races through about 40 slides per class then will give a pop quiz on something he mentioned once. His tests are short answer and he is very rude when you approach him about almost anything.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Had him for Earth his first semester of teaching it and I really enjoyed the class. He explained everything well and was always willing to help. His tests/quizzes would have free response parts to them, which was different from other professors who teach the class, but they were always very reasonable and I actually preferred it.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The lectures did seem to move fast, but he provided many resources to get a comprehensive understanding of the material. The best way to get a good grade is to do the objectives and make some flash cards.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Garret I'm sure is a lovely person. A GEGN teacher? I don't think so. He loves pop quizzes, so be on the lookout for that. His lectures move extremely fast and you should bring a device to follow along with the slides. Unlike the other GEGN101 professors, Garret likes quizzes and essays. He also likes making free response test. Have fun.
I'm not very good at math personally, but somehow the lecture Dr. Hofkes was really understandable. He's also a really nice dude. Definitely the best diffeq prof by far.
Spends time getting to know his students. You can tell that he cares about the subject he is teaching and passionate about sharing knowledge with others. Lectures are engaging and fun.

Absolutely amazing professor and genuinely good human being. His lectures are very effective, and he makes sure students are following along. His passion for the subject is contagious, and he treats students like human beings. I struggled a lot with calc in the past, but Professor Hofkes has made this semester so much easier. Choose this professor!

Overall he is a super chill dude. Seems like a very relatable guy and his lectures are fun to be in. Working through problems is helpful and if a topic is confusing, he will make sure to address it during another class period.

Hofkes was very motivated to make sure that students understood the content. He would routinely ask if we understood a concept, and would make sure to not move on until we did. He seemed to spend a lot of time outside of class coming up with good ways to make sure our in-class time was as fruitful as possible.

He sometimes moved quickly during lecture, but if you go to office hours, he will solve every problem by hand. He awarded a crazy amount of extra credit on the homework, and a 5% extra credit survey for the final exam. If you are someone who goes to office hours and gets good grades, I would 100% recommend this professor.

I was not a big fan of Morris' lectures, they were very dry and he would often do his example problems by projecting paper and pencil work that I could barely read from the front row. However, to give him credit he was very enthusiastic about the content and always emailed back any questions I had promptly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Extremely quiet and unengaging lecturer. Reads off slides. Long winded, unnecessary example problems at a depth never seen in exams. Dr. Morris definitely knows his stuff, but just isn't the greatest teacher. Fortunately he's not a harsh grader and he is a sweet person. Just expect to self teach yourself most of the content in this class.

Dr. Morris is a wholesome and caring professor. Although his lectures do skip some steps and he does talk quietly, he is always willing to help students outside of class. Even though the lectures and homework are in depth and take some time, he makes the exams easy.

He speaks incredibly quietly and has a tendency to ramble. Answers to questions are often convoluted and leave you feeling more confused. Would always skip steps in his examples even if the example was supposed to be teaching us said steps. He is not good at explaining things even though this is an intro class. Learned mostly from the posted notes.
He says particular way too much...
best of the statics teachers at this point.

He is good at explaining how things work, but if his way is not understandable to you in class you are SOL because he only has one way of teaching it.  Going into his office hours helps.  He will make sure all your questions get fully answered.
Nice person! Bad teacher at that time but improving quickly. Knows material but thinks too high of you. Hard tests.
Super helpful.  You go in for a 30 second question, you get a half hour answer.  Very easy going.

Overall great professor who does a very good job of teaching the hardest class I've ever taken at this school. The class is well run overall and organized. The only thing I would say is sometimes the lectures are confusing (and I feel like they could be less confusing).

For a tough class, like Heat Transfer, he's the best. He could provide more worked out problems; but is great otherwise. Had him for Thermo I, and he wasn't quite as well versed in that as he was Heat Transfer. He is very knowledgeable and cares about the whole class understanding the material (and this is a rarity for the ME department)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Porter administers quizzes every class that are counted towards your grade. I found these quizzes instrumental to learning heat transfer, but if you skip class often, probably not a good choice. Sometimes he was lecture heavy, other times he had good quizzes and example problems. He makes the tests - so at least go to his class before exams.
The best! Around! Nothing's gonna ever keep him down! Seriously, if you have the chance to take him, do it.

Very knowledgeable about Heat Transfer. Logical progression of the material and exams. I really liked getting the exam solutions upon walking out of the exam. Able to answer very deep fundamental questions.
She might mean well but does not provide useful lectures or graduate level advising. If you are interested in structural geology would look for a different prof if possible.
She's a really nice and chill person. However, I'm not sure if it's her or the class that just puts me to sleep.
Yvette might be OK for general structural geology, but she definitely is not a good fit for an applied program like CSM.

She is passionate and wants to engage students. Don't be afraid to ask questions it makes the class more interesting. I had her for an entry-level class and she did sometimes gloss over some material but as the semester progressed she got better. (I was her first time teaching this entry-level class, she normally teaches grads)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Kuiper is a solid choice she knows what she is talking about and tries to keep us engaged. The class is only really graded by three tests, one project, and a few labs. Make sure you study for the lab quizzes and the tests!
Would talk at the class. Lectures were the whole class.

Professor Robert's lectures were so comprehensive and interesting, and she really tries her best to include all perspectives and introduce topics that help us better understand the world through a political lens. She is super caring, and willing to help her students with everything. She is kind, funny and relatable and I really enjoyed her class.

I loved having Katherine as my professor for NHV. She did assign quite a bit of homework but it was easy. My favorite thing about Katherine was her understanding and flexibility about due dates as she knows that Mines students are busy with other classes. You will get an A if you show up and turn in half decent stuff.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Katherine does a really good job at teaching. She also is very understanding of students and is open to moving back due dates and working with students. She was a great professor and I would love to take a class from her again provided the opportunity.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Probably the best professor at Colorado School Of Mines. You willingly want to attend the lectures despite of it being mandatory. The professor is caring, cool, awesome, funny and fun. I recommend everyone to take human systems with her.

Very smart teacher and definitely knows what she's talking about. While a little powerpoint heavy, this class does cover a lot of material. She is straight forward though and communicates clearly. Extremely helpful in office hours, especially when you go in knowing what questions to ask.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Nice person, but worst professor I've ever had in my entire life. Her class is not organized at all, she is terrible at lecturing, she doesn't teach the stuff needed to complete the homeworks. I went to every single lecture and still could not do any of the homeworks and had no idea what I was doing. Take this class with a different professor.

I took her course when COVID hit so everything was online. She did not adapt to online classes very well. Every lecture was 55 minutes of her talking at us. There was no involvement with the students. She would lecture with slides, but she would transition too fast to write anything useful down. It was very difficult to learn anything during class.

Dr. Nelson can be tough to pay attention to for a full 50 minutes if you are not interested in geology. She explains the content pretty well, and as a student interested in geology I find her lectures somewhat entertaining. She curved by exam scores so hard by grade went from a B to an A, so I would definitely recommend taking one of her classes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Nelson is very smart and knows a lot about what she is talking about. However, she lectures a ton so it can sometimes be hard to focus. The exams are also very difficult because there are a bunch of random fact questions that stray away from the course's learning objectives and there are some topics that she hardly touches on in class.

Nicole Ellison is terrible at explaining anything and makes so many errors during examples that the students need to correct her almost every 2 minutes. Going to class makes topics more confusing. The textbook is the only saving grace in this class because it actually makes sense.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Professor Ellison is one of the worst professors I have had in my college career. She had ambiguous assignments that she would assign the day before or day of the due date. Her lectures were all over the place and the exams were information heavy on topics we hadn't discussed in class. Her expectation of us were higher than her quality of teaching.

Overall extremely sporadic teacher. Half of her slides are pictures and she skips through the important stuff that is tested on. Will assign things due the same day and then push them back. No clear grading rubrics on anything. Half of the time we played jeopardy about topics barely relevant to the class. Avoid any of her classes if you can

Professor Ellison might possibly be one of the worst professors I've had. While I hate bashing professors, I would not recommend taking her unless you absolutely have to. Her lectures are vague and unstructured and she's a tough grader. She gives no feedback on how she grades and the questions on her exam aren't even covered in lectures.

Ellison might be the worst teacher/prof I've ever had. She doesn't know how Canvas or Google Drive work and due dates will always get pushed back (usually after you have done the assignment). Design 1 is a bad class, but she makes it way worse than it has to be. However, her class seems easier to get an A in compared to other profs.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Seemed like she did not want to be there often. But at the end of the day, the information was still taught to us.

Tunstall seems to really like the content she is teaching, but the distribution of time spent in lecture makes lecture time pretty unproductive. She takes too long on general concepts, and usually waits for the last 10 minutes of class to start example problems, which are crucial to know if you want any hope of doing the homework.

I loved having Dr. Tunstall. She was very supportive of her students. She was very approachable, and easily accessible outside of class. When she lectures, she writes everything down on the smartboard, meaning that it is easy to take notes and follow along at the pace she teaches. Would definitely take again.

CEEN241 is a lecture-based class - and Prof Tunstall actually got me to enjoy the lectures. Her clear enthusiasm for the topic is abundantly clear, which makes the class less boring and monotonous. She lectures well and clearly, and is very available to help students. In my opinion, she is the best CEEN241 professor.

Prof. Tunstall is great and respectful and values student feedback. Her lectures are great and she helps alot during office hours. Her exam reviews are pretty basic but helpful. As tempting as it is, dont skip lectures and you shouldnt have a tough time w/ statics. Although statics is a bit difficult and time-consuming, prof makes it tolerable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Straight up the worst professor I have ever had. Encouraged students to embrace stereotypes and to use them in everyday life to judge people, designed an activity that said women are unqualified for jobs only because they are women, rewarded incompetence and never admitted he was wrong. His class was a joke, I have never respected anyone less.

Never gave us a rubric or documented description of an assignment. When my class asked him if he could assign due dates on Canvas he told us, "I'm going to be honest with you guys, that is way too much work and I just don't want to." He made several off-handed remarks, one of which caused a student to make a Title Nine report.

Straight up racist, refused to use rubrics or guide the class in any way, and got in a bunch of administrative trouble for his constant racism, stereotyping, and generalization of different cultures. Just not worth it.
do not take his hass200 class

I'm not sure if Professor Bren is still teaching at School of Mines, but if so, take his NHV. He is a very engaging and caring teacher who makes NHV an actually fun and exciting course. The course, as he teaches it, is very interactive, so be prepared to work with other students. He is very open to all viewpoints and encourages discussion well.

All his lectures were good and often times related the abstract concepts to real life and engineering situations. He also gave out useful resources such as annotated equation sheets. There was attendance taken at the end of class through some practice problems. They were useful and he always showed the work so if you didn't get it just copy him.
best professor in math department

One of the best teachers I have ever had. He genuinely cares about each student and takes the time to know and help you. I have emailed him late at night or on weekends, and he has always reached out and helped me. I would take his class any day and know that I have a professor who can help me! Highly recommend!

He is probably the best math teacher I have ever had. He's a little bit quite in class but every now and then he'll either tell a story to relate the content to or tell us a joke that'll liven up the mood. Not only that but outside of class during office hours he's even more helpful. Would definitely recommend to everyone.
He was an amazing professor! He kept the class engaged and his lectures were really helpful. I highly recommend taking your calc classes with him!
He is good at letting us do examples in class and then discussing the answers. He wants to get to know and help his students.

Prof. Leydens does a great job of teaching difficult material to his students, but he assigns a lot of readings for his students. There are not only a lot of readings but also take some time to process. When also paired with the large amount of writing, his class becomes quite difficult. Yet, he is very empathic toward his students which helps.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Truly great professor. Listens to the thoughts of every student, and promotes students to conversate and contribute. Makes students participate, but in a fun way. Fair grader. Really respectable. Would strongly recommend.
My favorite professor! Helped me explore and come to terms with my identity and sexuality in the oppressive hegemony of our current cultural state

Dr. Leyden's IC class was the most useful class I took during my whole time at Mines. This class really opened my mind to new things I never would have considered otherwise. I also learned a lot about myself through reflective writing activities. Dr. Leydens is an amazing teacher who really cares about his students and the world around him.

His class was the most thought provoking class I took at Mines. We had extensive readings for almost every class, and there was deep exploration of the concepts and scenarios during classes.  I had an extremely difficult time in my life outside of school, and he worked with me and understood my situation.
Bad lecture structure, lots of confusing repetition. Very high demands.

Slides are very repetitive. You need to read the book to understand a lot of what is "taught" in class. Asking questions doesn't always help because she usually doesn't answer it in an understandable fashion. She can get flustered if she feels like you are challenging her authority or knowledge and that doesn't work out well for anybody.

This teacher has no comprehension of teaching methods and would be better suited trying to train a monkey. Her class consisted of too many slides with lack of information. The only reason why most people attended class was because of her random pop quizzes that had nothing to do with what she was "trying" to teach.
No Comments
Says "ummmmm" on average around 250 times in 50 minutes.  Rediculous!  Good one on one help but lectures leave a little to be desired.  Great PowerPoints.  Bad presentations
He really loves his students. He is available to answer students' questions.
A true good professor who is loving and knowledgeble.
Coolest guy
No Comments

Batz is laid back and cool enough to take you out to the bar between work and sleep. He has a Valley accent and the beeriodic table of elements adorns his lab. Occationally he'll leave for a week to go "beg for money" in various places. But overall, he's a wonderful professor, as he makes you want to actually go to class.

While she isn't an awful person, her class is quite unpleasant. She is quite inflexible, and often feels like a politician lying through a smile while spouting corporate propaganda. The focus on group work can be trying, and choices around due dates/structure are often inconvenient (such as a final presentation the day after thanksgiving break).

Was part of her first class at Mines. Would never wish this class with her on my worst enemy. Terrible experience which was made worse when classmates with other professors actually enjoyed the class.

Dr. Fischer is a good design teacher, but she can seem intimidating. She's a relatively easy grader, especially on module reports, and gives you plenty of opportunities to improve your grade on reports. Design is a hard class but she gives clear criteria on what you need to do and is always willing to clarify certain things.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Michelle Fisher was by far the worst teacher I have ever had. The criteria was not clear at all, and when I completed assignments with the rubric she would find ways to criticize the hours of work I spent on it. She would tell me that I wouldn't pass the class because I didn't spend enough time as I dedicated 6-10+ hours every week. DO NOT TAKE IT.

This is the worst teacher I have ever had. This teacher says you will only get an A if you go above an beyond the required material on the rubric; she doesn't specify what above and beyond is. She doesn't help you, she leaves you be but criticizes every aspect of your work. You have to spend hours just to get a 90, unlike every other class. SKIP!
Don't know why people have given him bad ratings on here. His class is very easy if you go and pay attention. He grades incredibly easily and it shouldn't be hard to succeed in his class.

The class is really easy, and if you pay attention to the lectures you will do well on the exams, especially since he grades super easy. It is sometimes hard to pay attention, yet if you do there is no need to even read the textbook.

A very poor professor who literally doesn't respond to email or does not try to resolve the issue the students have or pretend to forget about the whole thing afterwards. The tests are much harder than hw problems and aims to specifically challenge you in terms of the hardest part (like deadweight loss). Pretty arrogant and careless in general.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Poor professor. Very limited resources for learning but high expectations for every week. He even attempts to disguise those unit exams as quizzes. Unlike most professors at Mines, he lacks basic trust in student and even opted to use Proctorio. Very oblivious to students' needs and even made the homework due date on the exam day 2 hours earlier.
Good professor, ties the class to current events making it more interesting.
Treated us like children and graded very harshly, definitely go for an easier professor for epics because it's just a ton of busy work
Lauren is so adorable! *_*
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Teaches with detail.  Although very elementary-school style, she uses object lessons to introduce and explain concepts. Her enthusiasm for teaching piqued my interest in the subject and kept me coming to class everyday.

Had her for M.O.M a couple semesters back. It was her first semester teaching but she did well and made the class interesting. Only qualm was the exams were so excruciatingly easy that I felt I didn't really learn much, but w/e she's the perfect teacher for EE's who just need to "get through" this class. Very kind and happy lady.
Great teacher, clear, very understanding.  She cares if you get the material.  Always trying new things to try to help you understand.  Probably my best teacher at Mines so far and I'm a Junior.

She is very very rude and talks down to students. It feels as though she is always looking down on students and gets mad sometimes if you ask questions. I've never had a professor get mad simply for asking a question. Wish she wasn't a prof at mines it seems she has no business being around younger people. Wouldn't recommend it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
