If you're thinking about taking this class for a bioscience elective, DON'T. He gives out 10 quizzes randomly, and the quizzes are on arbitrary information that you're somehow expected to know. The tests are just as bad; you're expected to memorize every little thing on his huge slide decks. Even if you do that, you'll maybe get a 60% on the test.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I would not recommend taking his microbio class. His exams are mainly memorization based, examples: match the pathogen with the disease, know which virus is ds or ss, DNA or RNA, enveloped or not, + or - sense. His lectures are very interesting, however, they cover so much information, and it's said you don't need to know all of it, but you do.

Ive had Trewyn for both Microbio and Biochem and he is a great professor. Really cares about his students and is passionate about what he is teaching. He doesnt give homework so you have to motivate yourself to keep up with the readings for exams and quizzes but I learn a lot from just sitting in class. He also gives hints to what will be tested
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He did not know the material or know how to explain it in a way that was comprehensible. We were given homework on things that we had never learned and graded on it. Questions in tests were worded weirdly so you could not understand what was asked. He was aware of the issues but made it clear that he did not care. Had to get hours of outside help.

Has no idea what is on the slides until it comes up on the screen, will then stumble over the content as he clearly didn't review anything beforehand. Completely oblivious to the online homework, doesn't know the due date, can't seem to do anything when Qs are broken, and TA has to explain things to him daily. Test Qs are ambiguous and contrarian

I don't know if this is just a symptom of the redesign of the class materials, but I don't believe that Adamson was very helpful with teaching the material in this class. There were many cases where material appeared on quizzes that was never mentioned in lectures, or the lecture slides posted online.
Unclear grading policy, weird exam questions

Probably the most impactful of the four core graduate courses in the graduate curriculum.  He teaches the course differently than an ordinary graduate Microeconomics course, treating dynamics and a an advanced/useful view of the short run.  He's a provocative and challenging instructor who wins departmental teaching awards for a reason.

Dr. Graham?s tedious teaching style doesn?t work at CSM.  He has a dry and dull personality of an intelligent man who has chosen to sacrifice what potential he may have once had for a non academic career in Economics, to instead sadomasochisticly force his tedium upon potential students.  The vast majority of students should steer clear.

Professor Oliver is a very tough grader, and very often, the criteria that he uses to grade are unclear. Do not even attempt to ask for an extension on an assignment due to unforeseen circumstances because he will not give you one. Also, personality-wise, he is cocky, self-assured, and narcissistic. Avoid this professor at all costs!
He's a harsh grader and his lectures usually put people to sleep. If you get to know him then you'll be fine but if you don't then let's just say it'll be difficult getting a good grade in the class.

His expectations for assignments were always unclear and he often graded them based off of personal biases rather than the provided rubrics. His actual expectations were for the assignments and they were vastly different from the rubrics given. I received unfair grades despite following of the rubric. Prof: "Not everyone is gonna pass this class".
Lectures are great with this guy. Delivers content well and in a straightforward manner. Tough but fair grader
Best class notes of any class I have ever taken. His lectures were structured in a logical and clear manner.

First off, he has the best Notes out of anyone in CSM's Petroleum Dept.  Other teachers should really take a look at his notes and model after them.  He explains the material well, but his tests are killers.  He will not budge on grades.  Be happy if you passed!
No Comments

Graduate quantum mechanics.  He's a good professor, but a bit too far on the clinical side in class.  His lectures tend to get boring as he follows his RIDICULOUSLY detailed notes to the letter.  The notes are so good that it makes going to class less necessary.  Homeworks can be brutally difficult, but he's extremely lenient about due dates.

I probably learned more physics from Jim Bernard than any other prof at Mines.  He knows his stuff inside and out, and is totally willing to share that knowledge with students (both in class and office hours).  I'd *very* highly recommend any class he teaches.
No Comments
She knows what she's doing, makes the occasional algebraic error, but not bad. I do hear that Ammerman is better.
No Comments

knows the material well but often has a hard time clarifying relevant material! personally witnessed her talking about an off topic subject for more than 20 min! If Ammerman is available choose him...

Greenwood is a great professor. She really cares about her students and is very genuine. She made the class fun and made sure that it wasnt a burden for us. The only thing that really bugged me was she moved the final project up a week two weeks before it was due which was kindve stressful but I managed to get it done.

Maggie, ahem.. I mean, Dr. Greenwood.. is a really great teacher. She's very kind and caring towards her students. She's kind of intimidating though, which fosters an environment of respect and discipline, which I appreciate.

Professor Greenwood's intro to piano was really fun! The class starts from the very very basics so don't worry if you never played an instrument. Every other week is a playing quiz and attendance is a large grade. For your own good please show up to every class and practice! Greenwood isn't a harsh grader and gives amazing advice for playing!
Very reasonable

Good class, actually encouraged me to change majors. Very clear diagrams, though he goes a little quick through lecture sometimes and then we leave five minutes early (leaving early is nice, but I would rather have an extra five minutes of clarity!). Fair exams, you know what to expect. Very available for office hours. Quick on email inquiries!
No Comments
Great lectures, with lecture based exams, yet gives curves.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Schoenzart's lectures are amazing and entertaining, and the work for the class is very reasonable. Your grade is just based on exams, but if you look at the practice exam he gives you and go to lectures the exams are very doable. There is also very little reading and no homework.

Thomas Schoenzart is an engaging professor during lectures. While he seems unorganized and doesn't use online resources, the lectures are easy to follow and entertaining. The exams will go well if you go to lectures since many of the questions on the exams are similar to the ones in class. Exams are not multiple choice and are sometimes curved.
Very inspiring and relatable professor with real world experience. Lesson are concise and only valuable homework is made. Would take anything he teaches.
Robert is a real G. He really cares about students and will put in extra effort to make a lesson more interesting or spend time with you outside of class if you need help.

First, if I had the chance I would take Robert as my professor again for any course I could without a second thought. I can say without a doubt he honestly cared about his students no matter how they were doing in his class. That being said, it was his first time teaching this year so the course itself was a bit rough around the edges.

RUDE! So impatient and rude when asked questions that I went for help once, then never again. Bumped into him out of class and his personality goes even further downhill. Far too vague with questions, near impossible to get full credit for ANY free response question. Seems like he has better things to do. SHOULD NOT BE TEACHING! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Decent professor.  He tries to get students to work things out for themselves, though at times he gives too little information.

Krockee Mate ... Awesome teacher who listens and has superb understanding of geology and outlook on life ... It is worth you time to take a class with him ... it will make you a smarter person in the end

Danny wasn't very clear and with sketching they were very picky. That was mostly his TA though. Sketching isn't very hard to begin with though so if they weren't picky it would have been a joke. They were occasionally inconsistent with grading but were cheerful in class. Both him and his wife are condescending though.
Him and his wife aren't very good teachers/mentors at all. All the assignments seemed the same. Sketching is harder than it should be.

All the directions he gave were very vague. Most assignments seemed the same. Class was boring. He acted very condescending at times. Other times he expected way too much. Hard to figure out exactly what he wanted in assignments.

the material is easy and the exams are as well. The professor is knowledgeable in the material but has a difficult time passing the information on in ways that stick. At times the class seems a bit unorganized.
No Comments

Dr. Ayers is extremely knowledgeable about the aerospace and biotech fields, but his Engineering Materials Systems class was clearly low on his priority list. Additionally, he frequently underestimated the intelligence of our class.
"one does not simply get ready for a Tom Bratton test"
would rate 0 out of 5 if i could.  class average for the first exam was in the 30's,  60's for the make up exam.  glad i dropped it
dude has some serious problems,   run don't walk away from tom bratton

When of the most intelligent men I have ever met and been taught by, he was decisively the single hardest teacher I have ever taken a course from.  He is fairly nice, however at times has difficulty teaching to his students and at times gets distracted by telling interesting albeit unrelated stories.

No interest in class. Usually had no idea what he was talking about. Terrible handwriting & mumbles into the board. Never created a syllabus. His examples are usually useless. He does seem like a nice person though.

He teaches fluids, thermo, advanced fluids and thermo II. His exams are killer but he is always helpful, kind, and wants you to learn and is bull/busy work free. Top three best and most intelligent professors I have had.

Petrella is super cool and has a good grasp on the material. He is great in office hours and will meet with you outside of office hours. I enjoy class and I'm getting an A. Sounds like a fake review but trust me, take him. You will not be disappointed. I am taking an 8am next semester just for him. Can't trust these other Mech E profs these days.
So cool you have to wear gloves to class!

Sometimes mumbles a bit, so it's good to sit near the front. Tries very hard to make sure everyone in the class has a way to understand the material. Gets frustrated with students who sit in the back playing on phones (etc.)

The worst prof I have ever had. Very disorganized lectures. Teaches almost nothing. Blamed the students when the test average was 60%. The homework is nothing like anything covered in class. We had a guest lecturer for 4 lectures, and I learned more in those 4 lectures than the rest of the semester. Take the course when Dr. Porter teaches instead.

Terrible at teaching, provided a test where the average was a 60%, this test in previous semesters averaged an 80%. When he asked for feedback on the test students asked if he thought it was a bit too hard and his response was that we should have studied better.

Robert Kee is easily the worst professor I have ever had at Colorado School of Mines. I'll be brief: His lectures are disorganized and very poorly taught. You would be better off studying heat transfer by burning the money you'll waste on his class. He laughs at you when you ask him questions and doesn't care one bit about his students. STAY AWAY.
Easiest A you'll ever take. Can be very scatter-brained, but everyone gets an A.
Dr. Kuchta is brilliant. Rather scatter-brained though
Not a great teacher.  He reads everything verbatim off of his slides, which are directly out of the course manual, which he got from some book or another.  Gets confused sometimes.  Nice guy though.

Dr. Kapit's class is a study of cutting-edge innovations in Quantum Programming. As a leading expert in the field, he is a wealth of knowledge for students. While his lectures may be a little dense/cryptic and the course is sometimes scattered, his knowledge is second to none. He is also very understanding of the balance between life and study.
The textbook is not enough. The lectures are not enough. Homework very difficult.

Dr. Kapit's lectures were not the greatest online and the homework was quite difficult and required a passing knowledge of Mathematica (or like software). However, he was lenient with due dates and used class time to answer questions. The subject matter is very difficult, but if you are interested in Q-info, you will learn it from this class.

Be prepared to get graded down for disagreeing with him. Rudest professor I've ever had with very little respect for his students. Degrades your ideas and discourages creative thinking despite saying you have to think for yourself to "be an entrepreneur".

Likes to act like his class is the only class that matters. Gives instructions then grades you don't because you did exactly what he told you. Unclear on what you're supposed to do for assignments and he doesn't help clear things up. Grades unnecessarily harshly.
God awful. Grading criteria is a moving target. Counts "participation" by how much he likes you.

Some students were getting help from the other professors because he deemed those students weren't trying hard enough, so, he refused to help them. There have been multiple reports that he told his students to "drop out of Mines" because they aren't smart enough. To put a cherry on top of all this, CSCI442 is not an easy course.

Worst professor I've ever had at Mines. He doesn't care about the students at all, is condescending to everyone. Most times we went into breakout rooms, it just ended with everyone talking about how terrible he is. Doesn't care about anyone's feelings and even when multiple students complained to the department, they won't do anything about him.

Jack is a new professor at Mines and very young. His lectures are dry and content heavy. He has not yet figured out how to engage with students and often treats them condescendingly when asking for help. He is extremely intelligent, but unfortunately that doesn't translate well into being a good professor.

Had him for Solid Mechanics over the covid semester. He showed his professionalism, good sense of humor, and care throughout the semester the best that he could. He had well-delivered lectures but tough homework and tests.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I'm not sure if my poor experience is due to being in the remote section of class, but this professor is mediocre. The whole class is very lecture heavy and reliant on preclass readings. He was often hard to understand online and would work out problems but would skip over sections, making it hard to follow. Be prepared for a lot of outside work.
Tucker is super nice and explains things really well. You wont regret taking him!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: If one were to create an entire list of qualities that make a professor high quality, well-respected, and extremely effective; and then find a person who demonstrates none of those qualities, this professor is that person. There is negative teaching value of this person. His lectures kill brain cells and his inability to help kills them faster.

His lecture is the compliment of the material of the textbook, so for students who never open the book, it might not be a good idea to take his class. The class is very challenging, but will be very helpful.
Worthless Professor Your better off just staying home and reading book

Nice guy, generally wants students to succeed. That being said, he did not change course website (where all our homework was) to reflect his curriculum, so several locations of files were wrong. Included questions on tests not covered in class - but not really an issue, I still got an A in his class. Very hard to understand.
Terrible. Did examples wrong and didn't feel like correcting them.

Impossible to understand do to his thick accent and practically whispering in class. The class started with 50 people in it, and by the 3rd week no more than 10 people ever showed up because they weren't learning anything from his lectures. Super nice guy, but easily the worst prof at Mines. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Just go to class.

Dr. Van Kirk is hilarious and full of useful and entertaining knowledge of the world. He will not spoonfeed knowledge to you. He also will not indulge in students' OCD behaviors and need to know if they're getting an A or a B in the class. Van Kirk teaches to teach, not to hand out grades.

Van Kirk is hilarious.  Even though it's just an elective, everyone should take Intro to Petroleum.  The only deal is that his tests are open book and the questions aren't always in the book... they're from the lecture so it's recommended to always go to class.  Lot's of fun, I learned a lot.

Had a class that conflicted with common hour exams (really? common hour exams for a junior level course with a single class section?) and Dorgan was unwilling to provide a make-up exam until administrators stepped in. Ever after he held a grudge, providing me with make-up exams that were much harder than the original exams. Terrible professor.
Demanding but has a knack for explaining subject matter in different ways. Seems practical and down to earth.

I don't think that I learned anything, but I enjoy his teaching style because he has such a passion for the subjects that he teaches.  I would recommend taking polymer sciences from him if you want an easy class to take.
Great professor! Learned a LOT in this class and I was dreading taking it. Assignments are hard and exams harder (often due to lack of time), but grading is soft. Just keep trying and you'll do fine.
loved by all.  fair, helpful, knows her subject and can teach it to others.

This **** is by far the worste professor I have ever encountered in the entire history of my education, beginning with kindergarten.  I cannot stress how bad of a teacher she is.  I used to think even though she was a bad teacher she was still a nice person, but now I just completely dislike her.  If you can avoid her do it, if not, sorry for you.
Use of slides is too much.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Hoff I must say did an overall good job with the Microcomputers course. His lecture can get long and boring given that at times he just reads off word for word what the slides say. When you come to office hours he is very helpful. Class was easier then expected.

I took Image Processing with Dr. Hoff, it turned out to be one of my favorite classes I have ever taken. Amazing lectures, amazing lecture notes, amazing exercises done in class, well organized, and he is very helpful if you seek him out. I learned a heap of new things and enjoyed doing it. Can't say enough.

He means well but just ends up showing a lot of videos he of robots he thinks are cool. But, the class itself didn't teach me anything. Nothing advanced about the advanced robot control class. Just learnt robotic buzz words which I had to Google later.
Has a lot of knowledge.

Lectures were unrelated to graded work. Most lectures included youtube videos of robots Dr. Steele thought were interesting. Very little technical instruction was given. We learned the terms that we would have to look up later to actually learn. This class was a joke and a waste of time. Avoid Steele and Robotics courses at Colorado School of Mines

He was very ineffective as a prof. I learned everything I needed about code from YouTube. His TA choice is terrible, they grade as they feel necessary rather than having a set grading rubric and give no feedback on exams. They are constantly worried about cheating rather than teaching.
Hard to understand him in lecture but he is a fair grader and prepares you well for exams

- Not easy to understand due to the nature of the topics.  Over 100 students per class.  Not enough teaching assistants for help.  He graded the class based on the fact that an unknown student stole the homework solutions from a teaching assistant. so we were set up for not getting A grades.  Very few A's grades not too many B's and mostly C's.

He's a really nice guy but I really wish we got some sort of actual meaning or application out of it. Personally I get math better if I know what I'm actually doing rather than what feels like arbitrarily moving numbers around.

I had Dr. McKenzie and thought he was a great professor. His lectures and exams are actually full of numerical examples, which is so helpful when compared to professors who only use theorems. Super nice professor and was always willing to stay after class and help whenever you needed it. Had a great time as a student of his. Would recommend.

Always came to class late and unorganized.  Seemed like it's his first time teaching or has never taught before. He grades the hw which are the only assignments very harshly. His exams are somewhat difficult asking questions we haven't even touched much or asking you to think on the spot which doesnt show student's understanding of the content.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He was a great teacher and was always willing to help people outside of class even if they weren't his students. He was funny and did his best to keep the lectures interesting. I was always well prepared for the exams just by studying the notes from class, which always had examples that were very similar to worksheet and test questions. Awesome guy
great teacher, he makes class much more fun. he really understands the material very well and he is very helpful if you go to office hours. I recommend taking any calc class with him

While the book wasn't necessary, he did get ideas from it for the exam. He is very helpful, but tends to go off topic a lot. The class can get really boring, but if you space out there is always the lecture notes online: that's how I did all my homework and take home exams!

The professor came in with a positive attitude everyday and was always excited to lecture even if the subject wasn't particularly interesting. You could either like this or hate this. He was almost always available during office hours for help. Grading for this class: A bit tough in order to compensate for concepts that weren't too hard.

Dick is intelligent and is very helpful if one asks the right questions. The awful part about him, however, is how he grades the lab reports. Focuses on exorbitantly nit-picky things. The rubric does not reflect how he actually grades (seems like he randomly decides if he likes the work or not). Highly suggest finding old work to base new work on.

Professor is entirely useless. Grades based on his own set of grammar rules that he makes up and changes every week. Does not grade based on quality of work, only whether you jump through his set of hoops.
You can really connect with him
JK was very entertaining but occasionally he was just a bit out of it or unclear. He is a PhD student so when he got stressed his teaching suffered. Overall pretty helpful and cheerful.
I liked Dr Celik. He has a pretty good sense of humor and usually explains things about 3 different ways to make it clear. I had him for dynamics and it was a hard class, but I enjoyed it.
Terrible professor. Zero feedback. Not interested in seeing students succeed. Lectures are irrelevant to graded work. Grading is very subjective. Very rude. Avoid at all costs.

Matt is not very involved. He gives very vague requirements and then grades harshly if you fail to follow those vague requirements. Additionally, most of his grading style seems to be based on the writing skill of the student and nothing else. Most class time with him provided no real material and honestly felt like a waste of time.

Matt is a terrible professor. Nothing was explained in class. When something was explained, you would get marked off for doing what they would say. Very forgetful. The worst is that he is VERY RUDE. Does not know the difference between constructive criticism and being flat out rude.

Greg is a solid teacher with solid values that show through to his teaching style. Our class was very well structured, and he made writing our papers feel like a breeze. Obviously invested in his students learning, and promoting of respect in the classroom.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He assigns very few points in the class, so each assignment matters even if there are only 10 points for the assignment. His grading seems random and he seems to grade based on things that aren't on the rubric. Not very organized. Doesn't follow posted online due dates.
He gave us a concert on the last day of class.Also gave us the hardest final ever, but it was fun.

(Thermal Physics) - An OK lecturer but the pace was far behind the HW.  Extremely helpful in office hours -- if you can find him, but that may have just been because he was also dept. head.  Very good at inspiring students to "think outside the box."

Lectures slides were actually pretty good, and are very well laid out and straightforward. The professor sometimes just sort of reads from the slides but the slides are so simple and straightforward that it works out great. Super easy class, I literally did not care all semester and got an A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Discrete math, for me, was an easy class as most of the material can be learned on your own by looking at the lecture slides. Jian sometimes seems like he hasn't looked at the slides before class, but he does understand the material and is entertaining during lectures.

Dr. Herring makes his class interesting and it is a solid elective. Instead of bogging you down with assignments and exams he talks to you about his experience and things that are interesting. I really enjoyed his class.

The actual content of this class (homework/midterm/project) is barely related to lecture content honestly. With that said, Herring is pretty hilarious and the lectures are interesting and "real world" based most of the time. You're on your own for the math but if you're a good independent learner, it's a pretty easy A.
Chem 2 lab was hard and not the most exciting but Dr. Metzger is amazing! She is super responsive to emails and very passionate about chemistry.
metzger's grading is brutal. She will happily punish you for succeeding.

Your entire grade is dictated by 5 short quizzes, which you can drop the lowest. The quizzes aren't too difficult, as they mostly just involve memorizing facts from his lectures. Unfortunately he will give you no resources to study from except the lecture slides, so you're on your own
Dr. Ranville is super helpful and a great lab professor!

Dr Fathian explained high level CV concepts very well. He is very nice and clearly wants everyone to succeed (even gave a huge extra credit project). Dr Fathian runs the class on discord and is very accessible for help outside of class. He has a strict attendance policy so do not plan on skipping. He is also sometimes very vague with homework help.

Computer Vision felt like a class planned last minute. I really disliked that although we didn't have "exams", 4 quizzes with 1 dropped worth 40% of the grade is essentially an exam. However, Kaveh Fathian is such a kind and patient person.
Professor Carroll has great lecture slides. Eventhough the homework is way harder questions, but the quiz question are generally easy to answer.

Professor Carroll is okay. The lectures communicate the material fairly clearly, but the homework is often much more difficult than what we learned in lecture, or it just simply wasn't learned in lecture. She also doesn't really seem to know how to answer a lot of questions on the spot, and frequently makes mistakes during lecture and on exams.
A very kind woman
She is borderline senile and useless.  Make sure you do not have her.
Homework assignments sometimes took over 6 hours, mostly due to confusion in the wording of the problems. His tests are not easy but are fair if you show up and do the work.

Mustoe is the 'theoretical' professor of CAE compared to Dr. Amara. He is slightly condescending in his teaching, but is overall a good professor. Prepare for exams based on topics learned in class but presented in an unconventional way.
Helpful.. Wants students to do well. If you take the effort, she will help.

She talks really fast in lecture. She is more than happy to answer questions in class or during office hours but the lectures are so confusing that I often had no idea what to ask. That said expect homework to take a long time googling, reading the book a lot, and going to tutoring sessions.

Excellent professor. He gives very clear and concise lectures and if you have any questions he is more than willing to help you understand the material. He seems to truly want you to do well in his class, which can't be said for a lot of the engineering professors. Tests are not easy but very fair. Would definitely take him again.

I actually took his class at California State University, Fresno. He is a very experienced engineer. He explains concepts clearly. He will take time to break things down if you ask. This class was fairly easy though because it was in Intro to ECE.
She is so nice to all students and also helpful and she doesn't take hard test

She seems to know what she's talking about, but can't effectively teach anything meaningful. You're better off not listening during lectures and teaching yourself from the book with the time you have.
Paulo is a wonderful professor. He will make sure you understand the material and he tries his best to make Thermo fun.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: He makes sure you understand the topic really well. Doesn't really care about what you turn in in Homework . so always gives you all the credit unless you commit some conceptual mistake. There is one in class exam, one take home exam and two projects. If you are studious, you will definitely get A
He's the best TA I've ever had. If it weren't for him I would've never passed the class.
No Comments

Handorean is by far one of the harder graders in the EDNS department. Follow rubrics clearly, or you will be sure to lose a lot of points on assignments. Unlike other professors for EDNS151, she will make you work for your grade. Very few students walked out with an A. However, she is easily accessible by appointment or during office hours!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Handorean was very helpful, but she did take off some points for things that I thought were very arbitrary. Also expect her to read off of a lot of Powerpoints that aren't terribly helpful. Don't expect to walk out of this class with an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. B is super nice and always available in office hours. But he wasn't super good at teaching this subject, even though he tried his best. I thought his lectures were not very helpful but there are participatory points so I had to go. Overall, I loved his energy, but his class could've been easier if he taught it better.

Dr. Bingham is an absolutely stellar example of a professor who truly cares about his students. Every quiz and exam was always returned with detailed feedback and notes, he was frequently available for help over email and in person, and always had a really positive attitude in class and outside of it. If you're taking LinAlg, take it with Bingham.

Soft spoken, thick accent, and is perpetually disappointed by every student that walks into his room. He will tell you what you did wrong and where, even giving you suggestions on where to improve or reconsider, but his displeasure with you will be apparent. He often repeats himself in lecture and you can barely hear him anyways.
Hates everyone
No structure to the course or his way of teaching.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Expect tons of homework, lectures mostly only consisting of doing practice problems, and difficult exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Not especially captivating but gets the job done.

I would not recommend Professor Alamin for design lab. He is not an engaging or compassionate teacher, and offers little to no resources for his students. I was in quarantine for two weeks this semester, and reached out to him for extra help, and he never replied!
Dr. Clarke is fantastic! The lectures may be a little dull but the class is pretty straightforward and he is flexible. Exams are take-home. I would recommend buying the textbook or finding it online.
Take notes in class, you are required to turn them in electronically. Tests are take home.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment:
Very chill class, test content is similar to practice exams and hw questions. Dr. Voelker is easily accessible outside of class and willing to help students. Plus she always has cat pictures in her lectures.

The lab section was a bit more work but still enjoyable and not at all difficult
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She's wonderful; she's incredibly willing to meet with you and will email you back pretty quickly. There are 4 exams, including the final, and she posts practice problems to prepare. She also assigns homework, which is really helpful for studying. And she shows us photos of her cat and dog!!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Really nice person, the example problems in class are great. Try to memorize the process more than just the answers.

Dr Elsherbeni reads off powerpoint slides that are right out of the textbook. It was very hard to get anything out of lecture. He requires typed equations and gives long take-home exams that aren't based on the homework.

Elsherbeni pastes pictures of a textbook into a powerpoint and reads it to the students for an hour without engaging or even turning around for minutes at a time. He gives take home exams that have problems that don't even have equations given in lecture. He doesn't know how to teach and I would not recommend him to continue as a professor

Mike was a great professor. Pretty understanding if anything came up, and always willing to help clarify or explain something. Design as a class is pretty bad, but I would much rather have Mike be teaching it than many of the other professors

He was personable and was decently lenient in grading. Was not the best at explaining some concepts and requirements and make it a little difficult to know what was expected of us. But he was flexible in his grading and provided good feedback
Very nice guy with a really good teaching technique. He focuses a lot on examples - both real world and textbook. The tests are exactly what he says they will be with no unexpected curveballs.

I cannot recommend Dr. Prado enough. First of all, he's an incredibly nice guy. His lectures are easy to follow and engaging. The class can have pretty difficult homework but you get multiple attempts so it's not that bad and the tests never go over anything that he hasn't gone through at least one example of.

Sent an email like three months ago about struggling with Calc and didn't get a reply. If you wanna leave class early, you can't. I've seen him stop a ton of kids from leaving early so don't even try. I think he's kind of nice though
Wasn't very engaging in class, and the lectures often felt fairly dull. Accessible and willing to help individuals if sought out.
Attendance is Mandatory but is very approachable and gets thru lectures in a good amount of time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Singha is a great lecturer, fun and energetic. She would make every concept used in this course easy to understand, and she's very knowledgeable.
Shes a great teacher. Makes class really fun and makes it easy to pay attention in lecture. Super helpful during office hours.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Geddes is a charismatic dude who is great at teaching material. He spends most of every class doing example problems and asking/answering questions, so going to lecture will almost certainly prepare you for homework. He is always willing to answer any question you ask, even if it's pretty off-topic. If you show up to class you should take this guy.
Professor Geddes is a cool guy who is great at teaching math. I always looked forward to his class and would recommend taking him if you get the chance!
Had a very good time in his class, good lectures, helpful during office hours.

It was his first semester teaching after his postdoc, so I was worried, but he was honestly great. He explains everything well during class, does multiple examples, and will help you with the worksheets during office hours. If you are willing to devote time and effort, pay attention in class and go to office hours, having a good grade isn't hard.

Isn't a bad teacher if you don't mind teaching yourself the material from the textbook and don't ever need a good answer to any question. Luckily, the tests  reflect what he knows so are very easy. If you pay money to be taught the material stay away. If you're looking for a nice letter grade and no work, he's for you!

Dr. Phil was very interesting and brought up many examples and applications of subject material, so much that the class became rather conceptually focused than mathematically focused. Tests were easy if you attended lectures. You can't really take notes so just relax and enjoy his grandfather-esque stories. Dr. Phil was certainly a character!

Great teacher with a ton of actual real world experience outside academia.  Lots of material covered, material is dry at times but teachers ability to tie in with real world experiences makes class much more interesting.
Great class, but a lot of subject matter is covered. You need to keep up with it. The Professor is very knowledgeable and ties current events into the class topics.
Dr. Trujillo provided a good basis for new material in his lectures by giving definitions and doing a lot of example problems.
Professor Trujillo is an awesome professor, we went through the material fast, but he  made it easy to understand.

The skill level of the students was very bifurcated which made it difficult for the class to have cohesion. EE students slept while CS students were clueless. Despite this Candace held up well and did her best to cater to both sects. Graded very liberally and allowed creativity on assignments. She had a warm personality who cared about the individu
Uses bad examples in class, notes are just pdf slides from textbook, can't answer questions, no reason to go to class except for attendance.

No other instructor at Mines has contributed to my learning as much a ol' Chester here has. Helpful with almost every subject, Chester was the difference between graduating with As instead of Cs. CSM is riddled with teachers who just don't care enough to teach or leave the learning entirely up to you (for sake of the school's rep). C.E.C helps all
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Without Chegg, school of mines would have been IMPOSSIBLE! When other professors didn't teach well, or couldn't clearly explain the homework, Chegg was there to go through step by step and teach me other things professors left out either intentionally or unintentionally. Chegg is a lifesaver, and in the top 3 of teaching professors at Mines

I had Areeba for the basic probability course at Mines, and in a class where most of the people do not care about the actual mathematics, Areeba's class led teaching style unfortunately falls flat. She is very passive, and this comes at the detriment of her effort and empathy. Still would recommend as a professor.

As far Linear Algebra at Mines goes, you won't get a better professor than Dr. Ikram. She gives good feedback, clear lectures, and clearly genuinely cares about her students and their success in her class. Highly recommend.

Professor Goncalves is a pretty lenient grader, but he was really unclear, and really strict at the same time, about what things we were supposed to have done and when. He no longer tells students' grades to the whole class, but is a little salty that he's not supposed to.

As far as Design 151 goes professor Gonclaves made it relatively enjoyable. Guidelines for the MANY reports we had to write at times were not the clearest but he was always available to ask questions and quickly responds to emails after hours. He cares about your development and provides good feedback, not to mention he has a great sense of humour.
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: I would not recommend taking Fortran with Larry Johnson. Although he is willing to help students outside of class, he is disorganized, does not teach the material well, and he has a very negative attitude.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Honestly, Larry is one of the funniest professors I have had at this school. He doesn't do a great job teaching but gives lots of partial credit on difficult exam questions. At least one or two of the exams will have a factional question, most likely written the same way each time. I think he only teaches one course but it was fun.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took CBEN 426. The only thing keeping him from a perfect score is that sometimes his slides are information dense and it is not always clear what is the relevant information for exams. But he is a kind grader

Dr. Carreon grades off of a few assignments and doesn't really integrate technology into his classes, but if you are okay with that he is a solid choice. Workload is low and he is a fairly forgiving grader when he grades things himself. I would definitely take him again.
10/10 design professor. Is willing to extend deadlines. Nice, chill guy. Flexible, reliable, funny professor. Check out his YouTube channel.
Dr. Johns provides clear grading criteria and gives helpful feedback.

Cullison is such an awesome professor! Despite attendance being mandatory, I still enjoyed class almost every day. His lectures are so hilarious and informative and he's always willing to help you succeed. There is a lot of busy work and presentations so if that's not your thing, take another hass. But I personally loved hass 324 with Cullison

Cullison is one of the best professors at mines. He uses lots of demos and examples and his teaching style makes it super easy to understand and follow along. Class is fun and he always lets us out early. Attendance is taken but you get 3 free passes. Papers take a long time to write but are graded very leniently. Totally recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Taught a new course like it had been around forever, and was always willing to help out with an issue. He builds time into class to give feedback (and for TAs to help with homework)

Rob was a great professor, CSCI0-128 is a new course this year and he ran it like he had been doing it for years. We were super helpful considering some of the weekly assignments for the course could take well over 12 hours. He is very understanding of personal issues and willing to move deadlines for such reasons.

Follow the writing prompt to a T; he grades very harshly and doesn't give a rubric. He provides a lot of writing feedback on your papers. ABSOLUTELY avoid comma splices with him. He is super nice; however it just was a different experience from Design 1. If you have never had a professor like him it could be super difficult to enjoy the class.

Great professor! Offered a ton of resources and connections within the Design department, and his projects were very engaging. Everything taught felt very applicable to industry, and offered a unique perspective from Cornerstone.

Professor Harris is the best! His clear explanations and genuine interest in student success set him apart. He is always very approachable and gives valuable feedback. Don't miss the chance to learn from Professor Harris and have laugh along the way!

Professor Harris is obviously very 
knowledgeable about data science through his lectures. He is also super kind and is open to helping outside of class!

Gives minimal work and does not take attendance. Gets off track quickly but is generally entertaining and easy to follow. Grades are returned quickly (in relation to other HASS professors). Essays are graded leniently.

Graded the entire course on less than 7 assignments, students who got an A on all major papers and assignments somehow got a B as a final grade, "lectures" are just youtube videos he skips around on while trying to "make a point". Overall, avoid at all costs, seems to be an adjunct the university uses to patch their terrible turnover rate.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Ryan made it clear the class would be difficult, but lectured well and was fair on exams. Read the book and really understand the intuition behind the concepts as the multiple choice questions cover the little nuances. Once you "get" economics the class seems really easy, but if you don't take it seriously it will become a nightmare.

Micro was hard, Ryan was clear about this. You must read the textbook and understand all the little nuances, and review the online examples. It is possible to get an A but not easy. He provided the proper intuition during class, and lectured well. I wish there were more face time so he could explain the entire chapter or review more. He was helpful
Super nice guy.  Whenever I went to his office hours he was really helpful and seemed to genuinely enjoy helping me.  Grades very fair, though is a little unclear in lecture at times.

Terribly long homework every week and doesn't teach for homework. Asks for feedback on the homework, then completely ignores all the feedback and goes his own route to "try" to fix the complaints. Lost my exam that I know for a fact that I turned in with my name on it to the same pile as everyone else. First time an exam of mine as ever been lost.

Tyson is a nice guy and a very good prof. His humor is on point-sarcastic-& he interacts really well w students during class. He'll stay after class 2 help u w anything u didnt understand & he is very clear. Sometimes he gave "get out of class"probs,that was challenging & funny to watch. The only reason I didnt take Calc 2 w him: only 45 pm class

Tyson is a nice guy and a very good prof. His humor is on point-sarcastic-& he interacts really well w students during class. He'll stay after class 2 help u w anything u didnt understand & he is very clear. Sometimes he gave "get out of class"probs,that was challenging & funny to watch. The only reason I didnt take Calc 2  w him-only 45 pm class
very helpful especially with demos and office hours. always makes sure she explains everything thoroughly even through engineering and mechanical standpoint.  really cares for the students.

Would not recommend to a friend- teaches straight out of the book. Difficult to understand, and had to go back and read the book. Not a great prof to have when you're learning the fundamentals of Calculus. Many kids dropped out by the end. Oh, and those socks!

Very tough with grading criteria, but often unclear. On top of that, a good deal of his grammatical "corrections" are straight out wrong. Holds his students accountable for remembering every date or minor detail covered in class, but is again often unclear when giving these details. Constantly assigns homework, but never collects in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very rude. Talks down on his students. Not helpful when asked questions. Doesn't appear to like the subject. Grades very very hard. A lot of assignments that rarely get collected. Would highly recommend taking someone else.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Trujillo does a really good job teaching although can sometimes get side tracked and have to hurry to cover the remaining material at the end of class. He is definitely a very nice guy and is incredibly helpful if you go in during office hours.
Lectures are a little boring, and he usually goes on tangents that don't go very well with the material. He does get all the information needed for the test into the lectures.

Connor is always helpful in clarifying anything discussed in class. The class itself can be frustrating in how it teaches the material. His office hours are more useful than others I've encountered in the CS department. He is definitely the best option to take for this class.

For this class, I think Holmes did an excellent job lecturing. For the class, he would receive lecture slides from the department head and give the class based off of the slides. If the slides were confusing or just vague, he would always clarify the slides if anyone had questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Clayton doesn't control much what's on the tests/projects. Although he's cool and has a good time lecturing 262, you'll want to show up.

One of the best instructors I've had at Mines. I would 100% take another class from him. He is always trying to show the concepts to the best possible ability with live coding examples. He is always great on answering questions for the class and I always felt comfortable going to his office hours.

While she is a kind person, she does not make a good professor. Most of the class consists of lectures with several quizzes (tests) throughout the semester making up most of the class grade. She is also super strict about how you take notes and will take away your phone if you use it. While this may be good in high school, it comes across poorly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You do have to read and do summaries but if you put in the effort, you will be fine. The tests are open note too, so make sure to know what is going on, but she does not try to trick you or anything!
I would probably stay as far away from this professor as possible at Mines. Life is already hard enough, and the other review left here pretty much sums up who this person is. Students beware.

Masochistic ass-hole. Machismo masculinity. This guy thinks he runs the place, and seems like a power-grabbing social-climber academic type. He teaches classes about "social justice" but he, himself, seems to be only interested in power, power, power for his only career. He seems kinda corporate and not teacherly at all. Why is this guy a teacher?
The best

She is a great teacher, and is a very inspirational leader. Anytime I needed help she was always available and enthusiastic to assist. Also, she is hilarious and brightens up my day! We love Ryneika!!

If you want to actually learn fluid mechanics then this is not the class for you. Yin is obviously brilliant but he can't teach to save his life. He's decided to summarize the textbook and writes it on the board. Students can't ask questions because he never turns around. You're better off reading the textbook and watching good profs. on youtube.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Fluid mechanics is fine and manageable. Professor is very detailed in lecture. So its best not to skip lectures a lot. Even though, fluid mechanics exams and hws are doable if you allocate the time. Prof is available during office hours and quickly replies to emails. 100% recommend!!

Darren is an amazing human and an even better professor. He cares about students learning and also about the value of the content he is covering. Plus get him to talk about Game of Thrones and you will have the time of your life.
Super knowledgeable about the practical side of engineering and always around the EE labs to offer help.
by far the coolest teacher ive had, super caring and fun
He's our new Assistant Band Director and works alongside Dr Hinkle for Marching Band and the two of them as a teamwork really well together
Best teacher ever. Very flexible and makes assignments fun.

Dr. Heather Fester has really good lectures. I look forward to each lecture she hosts since it makes for interesting and fun discussions - she creates a good class environment. There is a lot of homework and writing assignments which is annoying, but the lectures is what makes her class enjoyable for me. All in all she's kind and understanding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: They a real doodoo head.

Lectured on material that was assigned out of class which made lectures not only boring but not important. This cuts into the already limited time which is given for in class group work, and our professor added lots of non graded participation work in class.
Her lectures were very boring, and were not very useful as the same topics were covered in the readings. She tried and failed to make students engaged in lecture.

Very tough grader and former Mines student does not really believe in A's.  A's are only for students who FAR EXCEED the requirements, which are hard to even meet. Assignments have boatloads of super specific criteria. She's tough.

EPICS as a class sucks but Tamara makes it much better by being up front and honest about the class and making sure any last minute changes to your project from the department do not impact your grade.
Great teacher for Calc 2. A little dry. Lectures are straight and to the point. Will answer questions if asked. Worksheets along with homework are designed to allow you to do more than well on tests.

Had her for calc II a while ago, explains clearly, lectures are strait and to the point. Turn in all the HW too, she gave a bonus 10pts to everyone who turned everything in on time at the end. That got me an A instead of a B...
awesome

She was my teacher in NHV and was freakin sweet. She was super nice, super understanding, and gave us the easy A which NHV should be. She's is such a nice person and is willing to help any student with any problem. By FAR the best NHV teacher available

She is the second worst teacher at this school. She grades based on if she likes you or not. One person can spend 2 minutes while you spend 3 hours on an essay, but that person gets an A, and you get a C. Her high pitched voice gets annoying too. I basically have nothing good to say about her. LAIS people should NOT be at this school.
She is really tuff in grading,, not so helpful! I would not recommend her to anyone that I love :s

Inspirational and visionary Caroline teaches with the wisdom that can only come from complete mastery of the subject. Lectures are very clear and all equations are comprehensively explained. She tries hard to challenge her students but remains accessible and concise when the material becomes difficult. Highly recommended.

Avoid her like the plaque!! The Class is not bad itself but she is the worst engineering prof. She can not field questions. sit in the front of the class b/c she talks to the white board so it is difficult to hear her. All she does is write her notes on the board and moves very fast without explaining the concepts. She teaches like she doesnt care.
absolute bro. Loved the teacher, hated the class. Textbook reading was a graded assignment for the class which was stupid.
Jordan is not a network guy, but he's still very knowledgeable in all other areas of computer science. He tries hard to give everyone the tools they need to succeed and is a total bro.

Professor Hoff is a good and clear professor. His lectures are pretty straight forward, and he is very willing to help debug your code or assistant in any other issue. Sometimes though he doesn't seem like he writes some of his assignments and slides. However, for the Comp Sci department, Professor Hoff is one of the best.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Good guy. The Software Engineering class is mostly coding with a partner. He gave some good short lectures before class and was helpful during class when you had issues with code.

Zhang is a good professor, friendly, very helpful during office hours, and seems to teach in a way that makes the content very understandable. However, your grade is based on 3 projects and they are incredibly hard!

He really doesn't seem all that interested in teaching. He leaves several classes and all of the assignments to the TA, who, in turn, builds projects that very few people can finish, since "Well I could do it". His lectures barely relate to graded material. Attendance is not mandatory but was "a factor in end of year grade bumps".

Chuan yue does not care about actually teaching his students. The vast majority of your time will not be spent doing anything actually valuable but instead doing discussions and reading research papers.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Professor Yue is very polarizing in his teaching. He cares about his students and is readily available to help them outside of class. However, his lectures are the most dry slideshows that I have ever seen. Also, the lecture material is very tough, which makes understanding the material difficult at times.

If you are in GP dept at Mines you have to take this class with this professor so beware he can be petty sometimes. If you ask a question that he thinks is dumb he will berate you in front of the class. He says attendance isn't mandatory but will be passive-aggressive if people skip. Rarely responds to emails.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Li was difficult to understand because of his accent. During class it is difficult to follow with the explanation because he goes off topic a lot and starts to tell stories. To be honest, with such difficult material I think students get lost along the way and that will lead to bad grades eventually.

Justin's the man, he really cared about my success and was always available for help. I wish he taught more classes honestly, some of the other profs in the department could learn a thing or two from him.

The prof is very energetic in his teaching and you can feel the knowledge come out of him when he speaks. Very entertaining professor that knows how to capture his students. Went to his office hours and he is very helpful, especially with Linux

You have to go to class to turn in hw and for attendance but this class is an easy A if you just go and pay attention. Professor Padilla asks us to repeat back phrases/words and sometimes calls on students to answer a question so you do have to pay attention. However, I have never taken a foreign language class before and got 90+ on all the exams.

Padilla asks questions in Spanish in his lectures very slowly. His teaching style only involves grammar and vocabulary, it is extremely boring if you've taken a language before. Exams are easy and entirely based on class, but every class feels like it takes forever and attendance is mandatory. I do not recommend Padilla.

Dr. Santamaria-Botello seems to know his stuff. The problem is that the lectures are just mere replication of the textbook with heavy emphasis on derivation. Exams are excruciatingly long and cover way too many topics. What he does in review classes bares minimal resemblance with what shows up on the exams, but he seems to be indulgent in his way..
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Professor Santamaria seems like an extremely smart individual, however, this does not translate into his teaching.

The lectures are way to theoretical & confusing with almost zero worked examples. Variables are used without providing definitions, and too much time is spent in derivations. Only did well because of many dropped assignments and PHYS2

It was her first time teaching this course in a while, overall she's a great lecturer & offers a variety of office hours. Lecture pacing varies, sometimes one example problem a lecture and sometimes speeding through. Homeworks are fairly long, 9-12 problems per weekly assignment. 5 quizzes, 1 final. Reasonable grader. Kind & understanding.
Class was fantastic, professor did a great job.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He is great ultimately, the class is pretty straightforward, lots of lectures but simple exams based on only what's lectured on so it simple to find missed material and review. He does do some heafty group projects but is relatively understanding and useful if you reach out.

Professor Thirion did a great job at teaching the content of the course, relating examples from his own experience in the business industry. Had clear grading guidelines and clearly answered any questions regarding the content or the course. He grades fairly and gives great feedback on your projects or assignments. An overall great professor.

Professor made several mistakes on the final and midterm with wrong question and answers. Capriciously changes the syllabus to the point that he asks the class what he told us to do, and when you ask him a question  he tells you to look at the syllabus. No description for assignments on canvas. Overall learned nothing about business comm.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Bellona is a funny guy, and I love his personality. But I could not handle his teaching style. The lecture slides were dense and hard to follow. The homework was supposed to be based on lecture, but it was confusing and had many errors. You would easily have 15-25 people in the TA's office hours every week. I didn't learn as much as I should have.
Great man and professor
Originally uninterested in class, but Eggert made the class interesting and understandable.

Dr Smits was a great instructor. She is very enthusiastic which makes the material very accessible. Dr. Smits also takes the time to explain how the material fits in with actually engineering stuff. I highly recommend taking her Fluid dynamics class if you are a Civil or Environmental major.
He is very helpful, but grades pretty hard.  He is willing to work with students to help them get the most out of the course.

Teacher, though brilliant, was new and did a poor job. Most lectures were him reading out of the book, with some commentary, or class giving presentations. Most of grade was based on 2-3 enormous projects and the two exams. Grades were entered weeks late, giving little feedback about your understanding before the test. Needed more small assignments

Probably one of the worst lecturers at the school. He is a bit condescending, and doesn't really explain the important concepts well. Tends to focus too much on details in lecture. I end up teaching most of the stuff to myself.

He's very easy to listen to, even for a 3-hour lecture. Assignments aren't too difficult. He's a fair grader and works in industry while teaching, and the assignments reflect that. Didn't use the textbook very much.

Dr. Sitchler is a great teacher and lecturer - she's very accessible inside and outside of the classroom and puts in a lot of effort to give students additional learning opportunities. It's not a very difficult class to do well in, but she teaches her students a lot.
Dr. Deml is genuinely there to help her students.  I would definitely recommend her as a professor.

His section of CSCI261 continually had the highest marks on every quiz and test because he did not simply lecture at you or use powerpoint slides, he involved you in active coding. Plus he is hilarious.
Too hectic
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Hilarious.

Great prof., there is not one lecture I left feeling confused as he explained everything pretty well. Though, he had problems with letting us know if we should attend or not because he wasn't present. His homeworks were too tough to understand but I guess it was intentional.

Mona is very chill and down to earth. She is very passionate about teach linux and is really connected to her students. She answers questions well and loves to explore the content, 10/10 great teacher :)

I would not take this class if you do not need to. The professor has poor communication and organization skills, unclear expectations and grading criteria, and the math taught is often blatantly incorrect. The lectures are difficult to follow as the prof has convoluted and unclear notes. I regret taking this class and warn everyone from taking it.

One of the best professors at Mines! The only request I have would be fewer oil and gas examples during lectures, but overall one of the most organized, experienced, and passionate professors I have ever had.

Hammerling is my favorite professor I've ever had, despite the tough competition in the math department at Mines. She truly cares about ensuring her students gain a deep understanding of the material and it shows in her teaching style. I would highly recommend taking an in person class with her given the opportunity.

Gave semester long group projects and when my group dropped the class or didn't show up I was expected to do the work of 4 people on my own with no leniency.never had a rubric for assignment and will grade how she sees fit even if it was stated nowhere and makes not sense.wastes time arguing with students instead of explaining any reasoning.

An insane amount of group presentations that were repetitive, boring, and graded extremely unclearly. Cherry on top was regrading assignments at the end of the year that had already been graded months before in order to drop grades with absolutely no reason or feedback provided. I pray I never have to take a class taught by Professor Lawson again.

He has no time management and will not get your papers back. He cusses constantly and makes everything sound worse and more depressing than it is. He also does not know how to use Canvas so there are no assignments in the correct sections and you have to look at the home page and decipher if an a assignment is due or not.

Cayte Bosler is a phenomenal professor. She takes the time to prepare splendiferous lectures that are engaging and provide a lot for the content learned. The projects for the class were fun, and I was always excited to write the next paper assigned.

Very challenging exams, most of the tests looked completely different than what was taught in class so it was difficult to know what to study. The lectures were highly technical and involved long worked out examples that seemed irrelevant to the course goals. Group project at the end required a lot of writing. I do not recommend Dr Phal.

She tried her best and was pretty funny, however I felt like I learned very little from her. I strictly learned from the textbook. I can tell she was knowledgeable in the class, but the analogies she would use and her way of teaching was ineffective at least for me.

I hate computer science with a burning passion, but Professor Chin was an amazing professor. She cares a lot about you and is a very understanding prof. She also allows for points back on some assignments which is great. I forgot to do the reading and she said “How about you email me asking for points back because it wasn't working lol” She's funny

Lectures were standard CSCI 128 lectures, but I appreciated her added humor. Very approachable after/during class, with good insights into topics both related to the class and computer science broadly.

My goat🐐!! Easily my favorite faculty member at Mines. Incredibly helpful, clearly cares about his students' success, and is super knowledgeable. Highly recommend taking a course with him. Also young enough to remember what it was like to be a student, which comes through in his effective lectures. If at all possible, take a course with him.

Awesome professor. Super clear and to the point, and also fun! Professor Kelly has lots of industry experience in software development and the AGILE methodology, so she really knows what she's talking about. She usually has in class work time at least once a week . Most assignments are done with your partner, so pick a good one.
He is a bad professor.

He knows no one wants to be there and does his best to make it as painless as possible and lets you do whatever you want as long as you're moving. Nice guy, willing to let you miss class if you have a good excuse. I would definitely take his class again.
Terrible professor, can barely speak English and his is completely illegible. Doesn't know the material well and doesn't have the slightest clue how to present it to the class.
I don't recommend her at all ! She is a really tuff grader !
Schultz is one of the few philosophers teaching the course. Makes the course readings harder, but more interesting. Norm is very funny, but a hard grader. Worth the effort.

I had this guy as a TA for EBGN 201 and all I have to say is WOW. He really knows what he's talking about and really wants you to succeed. I highly recommend taking any section he happens to be teaching. Plus, he's a pleasure to look at ;) To sum it up Smart + Helpful + Cute = Matthew Hart       - A.R.K.
Hardest grader I have ever had. He has unrealistic expectations. Constantly changes due dates of assignments and is not at all helpful.
He killed it on the Boosted!
Richard is a really good professor that is extremly profesional yet approachable. Make sure you're ontime to class because he starts AT the start time.

In all fairness, this professor most definitely improved over the course of the semester. This teachers primary faults are his lack of preparation for class and his poor ability to communicate ideas. Upsides: he grades easy, offers multiple extra credit opportunities, and his tests are easy.

Out of all the professors that teach Physics 1, Id recommend Adams. Hes not the best at teaching the subject material, but he makes class fun and most of the learning is done in studio anyway. Hes a funny guy and is pretty easy to talk too.

Professor Wilson is one of the toughest graders I've ever had. I honestly have no clue how I managed an A in her class. She takes forever to grade anything. I realize she has other things to grade, but 4 weeks is a bit excessive, especially right at the end of the semester. If you get her, switch out. You will have a far easier time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: VERY MEAN...
He's a great guy and knows his stuff, albeit he takes a long time to give back scores. A bit harsh on grading, but nothing unachievable. Always willing to help out.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Castendyk is one of my favorite professors I've ever had! He has the most incredible lectures about the environment and has tons of experience in the geological field! Many of his lectures are just personal stories that are engaging AND educational. While his lectures are awesome, his tests can be quite difficult so be sure study!

Pretty easy class, but professor Madden teaches it well. Most of the material is delivered through readings of the textbooks (though she does go over key concepts in class too), so most of the class is spent doing practice problems in groups, with her there to help if need be. It was a format that worked great for me for the material.

Good teacher, communicates content well and has very reasonable homework and quiz expectations. Lectures a bit too quickly but design course in a way to make sure you learn everything that you need to. Very friendly, trustworthy, and dependable.

Wolenski is an industry professional. Since his primary focus is not academia, announcements about graded materials are often overlooked. He sticks to lecture slides and expects students to dig for info. The material is not hard, but the outcomes for each assignment are often not clear. The course feels slapped together and aloof. He's nice tho.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Smith is super caring and keeps class fun. He's always sarcastic and not serious which makes him easy to approach. He is passionate about what he teaches which makes the class more interesting. Although, many of the readings were outdated and way too long even when the content was simple.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Carter is always late, even on exam days. He fields every question (even super dumb ones) and seldomly makes it through all of the slides that he is provided. CSCI having in class exams, this means that the full 50 minutes isn't awarded for the fairly long exams. He doesn't know the material well and only is whatsoever familiar with mac.

I think they mean Chad Brockman. He isn't hard to pass, he grades fairly and really cares about his students. There is a bit of homework weekly but it's manageable and he is very relaxed on due dates. Just show up and talk in lectures and you will be fine.

Matthew was very respectful and helpful. However, he was unavailable outside of class. He encouraged us to reach out but did not email back nor use Ed Discussion (despite encouraging us to use Ed). Overall, he's a chill guy, but I wish he was available outside of class more frequently.
Super funny guy. Makes expectations super clear. Not hard to succeed in his class

Doctor Boyd is almost inhuman. She lacks empathy and critical thinking skills. Talking to her made me realize that not everyone has common sense or the ability to communicate with others. She adheres entirely to whatever guidelines or policies that are in place yet misunderstands them herself. Avoid her for lab if you can.

Great teacher! Had him during his first year at Mines. He did a great job. Truly cares about his students and makes an effort to memorize everyone's names. He is open minded and seems genuinely interested in your opinion. Would recommend to anyone taking NHV.
Down to earth. Wants you to treat him like a normal human being. He feels like a colleague. Easy class for fluids if you put some effort into it.

Had Raja for thermodynamics during his first semester at Mines. He's great! I went to a few of his lectures, but had to start going to a different session due to my work schedule. I'd still email him with questions on homework, especially with questions regarding EES. He responds quickly and provides in-depth answers. He cares!

-Annoying attendance policy (can't miss more than two classes)
-He's still figuring out how to lecture (goes fast, just reads off slides)
-Lets you have cheat sheet for exam, tells you what will be on the exam
-You will struggle more than the other sections, but you'll get an A if you do the work and turn things in on time

Marie is a fantastic teacher who really cares deeply about her students. She offers fantastic feedback on assignments and clearly wants you to succeed. She's easy to access outside of class for extra help. Marie is also not afraid to be honest when she needs to be, especially if her honesty will help you grow. I would highly recommend her!

Overall, this class was very badly organized, the quizzes were ridiculously specific to esoteric facts read in the book, and the deadlines on major projects were so short that you'd have to rush things. As bad as it was, I do have to say that this was the most tolerable of all the LAIS classes offered so far.

It is easy to tell that Professor Gates cares about his students and their learning, and he knows the material well. He does seem quite nervous when teaching sometimes, and often goes through slides too fast for you to take detailed notes. It's okay if you keep the slides open on your own computer though. Overall, a decent professor.

I think Gates is one of the best options for 212. In class workshops are required for the course but he grades solely on participation, not correctness. His office hours were always full because he really cared about you understanding the homework and took time to help you individually. He was very kind and prompt answering emails.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Great prof. Gives amazing notes on board half of class then does practice examples or walks around to help students when working with MatLab. Very interactive with the class. Can be a little soft spoken, sit closer to front. Overall, amazing teacher. 10/10 get him as a prof.

Solid Professor. He will respond to your emails if you need to ask him a question or something. Can be a harsh grader for papers and the sort, but they are mostly fair. NHV at Mines is a frustrating course at times, but Walsh did a good job of teaching it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Great at explaining mathematical concepts to Math majors AND CS majors.

Yang is an absolutely terrible teacher. His English is incomprehensible, lectures and notes are incredibly unorganized, and course work is nonsensical. CSM needs someone else to teach electrochemistry and make Yang a research only professor.
No Comments

I had him for Calc 3. His lectures are organized, and he explains everything very well. He does a lot of examples that are frequently seen on homework and tests. He is very kind and helpful during office hours. Great teacher, overall.

Dr. Yu is hands down the best materials professor at Mines overall. She is still learning exactly how to give an excellent lecture but will bend over backwards to help in office hours. There she explains things clearly and offers useful suggestions. She is also very passionate about the subjects she teaches and is the prettiest professor here!

Taught math bio. Was a good professor, clear expectations for tests, and very caring. Often pushed back deadlines to best accommodate everyone. Only downside to this class is theres a homework and a lab due almost every week. Theyre not very hard though.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is more work than most required masters classes. If you don't come to office hours and collaborate heavily with the other students, you will not pass.
