Expect to spend 8-20 hours on each homework assignment. You MUST know Mathematica before this class. He does not believe in curving, except for his tests, which very few people will pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Adrianne is amazing, I learned a ton from her course without feeling overworked. She is very empathetic and understanding toward students, very passionate about her teaching, and all around a great person. Highly recommend her EJ course.
I took the Fuel Cell and Technology class. O'Hayre teaches the first half of the class. He also wrote the book for the class so he is an expert on the material.
I found cell biology with dr. farnsworth to be a very difficult but it was absolutely worth it. Dr farnsworth is super knowledgeable and was a great professor for this class.

I had Professor Hastings for his first semester at Mines. I also took the class hybrid. (half online, half in-person) If you miss recitation (in-person) you lose a lot of points so make sure to show up to class and do all papers. However, he did not seem to pay as much attention to the online portion so don't spend all your time on the lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: HCDS is an amazing senior design project! You avoid most of the BS of the normal track. Do it if you're thinking about it! Joel Bach is 1/3 profs for the class. He is also a hardass who likes humiliating students publically during showcase presentations and adds additional steps with no warning to projects. Avoid his personally managed projects!
Mr. Florida was a great design teacher. If you're nice and attempt the work youll get a good grade dont stress
He grades easily and is really willing to work with students to help get them better grades.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Heavy homework, lots of quiz and exams, in general low grades at the end. It takes so much time but not useful for job search. GPGN419 Well logging

Horrible professor. Gives people random grades that are always below an A. Wastes time in class talking about things barely related to the course. If you have this professor try to switch to one of the design professors that gives you an A no matter what. You will get a B in this class.

The most nitpicky and insufferable professor by far in my time here. If you're taking design, take it with anyone else. Lectures allow no time to communicate with your group as she just meanders along with the week's given slides.
The lectures were very dry but informative. He's nice and good at explaining things, but does expect answers when he asks questions in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Prof Gabe was a great Thermo professor, he really cared about his students, and was clearly passionate about the subject. His lectures were good and his office hours were very helpful, as long as you put in the work, and it was really nice to have a professor that cared enough to learn your names and to bring your 8am class coffee.

Hands down one of the best lecturers on campus. Dr. Leach is very knowledgeable on applications of the content being taught. He was very kind, understanding, and willing to work with students to relieve stress. The class had difficult content/concepts, but as long as you show up and care, you will be just fine. Overall, a really awesome professor.

Theory of Comp is a really hard class, but it's no match for Luke. He's a great lecturer and awesome at explaining difficult concepts. Luke is also just a great guy and will talk to you during office hours for as long as you need. LGAs mean you have to show up for class and homework assignments are very difficult. Still totally worth it though!

Always gives lecture notes prior to lecture, so lectures are easy to follow. Fairly easy course. No complaints. Concepts aren't difficult, and TAs are extremely helpful. Homework is graded for formatting as well as accuracy, so pay attention to detail.

He is a professor with his feet in many different aspects of experiment.  As a teacher, he is far too unfocused and scatterbrained, which his lectures often feeling like retreads of old material since he doesn't follow a strict schedule.  His explanations are often unclear and lacking practical meaning.  You will learn, but other profs do it better

I had her for Corporate Social Responsibility. She was an excellent teacher with actual experience and she also brought in guest speakers with first hand experience. There wren't too many assignments, an essay, a presentation, 4 mini essay, and a final group project. She is incredibly nice and understanding.
Easiest teacher I've had at Mines, hands down. Super nice and helpful and a good class to have when you have a full load otherwise. If you want a for sure A, take the Dulliens!
Dr. Erickson made this class much more interesting than it could have been. He was humorous during lecture and got rid of slides/sections he didn't feel were very important.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very interesting class. Learned a lot about science.

Biology 1 is not an easy class but Dr. Ryan is a very nice teacher that truly cares about her students and the material. The way the class is formatted is a lot of busy work without a lot of lecture time, but that is true for all the biology 1 classes not just Dr. Ryan.

This guy is possibly the worst teacher and role model I have ever encountered in my life. He has a god complex about him and constantly reminds you that you are nothing without his wisdom and guidance. He doesn't know the equipment and always blamed us for inconsistent data, when it ended up being the fault of bad equipment 100% of the time.
he's my fav
She explains the concepts well and made manufacturing seem interesting. I would definitely take another class from her.

Professor Li is extremely helpful during office hours. I haven't really found the lectures to be as productive for my learning (8 AM) but I really have made a lot of progress in the office hours. Also I would wholeheartedly recommend purchasing the Zybooks text. It's not required, but it has helped me immensely with understanding + practice.
Shannon was great. As a class, Statics naturally has a ton of homework, but she was great and helps you through every step of the way.

Nick is a younger professor at Mines, so he can definitely relate to students and at least in my experience made lecture much more entertaining. He has a passion for what he teaches and always came to class with prepared notes - the style may not be right for everyone, but I found his way of explaining numerical analysis crystal clear.

Todd is a great guy, very approachable and more than willing to help you with statistics labs or homework during his office hours. Overall, taking stats with him was fairly easy, and it is not super difficult to do well on the common exams as long as you do the homework and practice quizzes.

Loved her!! Although attendance isn't mandatory, you won't really get anything out of the course without showing up. Outcomes based testing is very very hit or miss depending on you as a person but I really liked it. Dr. Nukala really supported me and was very willing to spend time outside of class and office hours to work with me.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Although Graham is very knowledgeable in his field, he can be quite intense and has some peculiar teaching methods. Rather than exploring various different means of teaching and doing practice lectures, we read one man's perspective on teaching the entire semester. Very passionate about teaching as a whole!

I took yoga and it was the easiest class I've ever taken. the only 'homework' is a google form once a week that asked if you did the exercise that week and if it helped. Dana is a ray of sunshine and she just wants to help you be happy and healthy. 10/10 Would take again

Lectures are long and uninteresting and tend to not contain information needed to do well on the papers and exams. However this is balanced by the fact that assignments were graded fairly easily as long as some sort of effort was shown. Easy to talk to and get extensions from but was unhelpful explaining guidelines or helping with the papers.

Economics is a notoriously bad class at Mines, but Dr. Perry made it manageable. There is a lot of out of class work, but if you finish the work and pay attention to the rubric, it is pretty easy to get the grade you want. The in-class activities that she did were really helpful and paying attention in class gets you a long way.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: My guy did an amazing job in teaching the class when it came to linked lists, arrays, search algorithms, etc. I ended up with a 94%. Would take him again 10/10
Good humored professor that teaches what you need to know. Made late in the day classes bearable and easy to learn and absorb information.

Amazing culinary arts Prof!! Often did surprise pop quizzes online which was super helpful. I often didn't pass, which shows a lack of skill on my part. Super fun, I learned nothing in his lectures. I hope all students at Mines can take classes with him. Also tutors chem, pretty good at that but an even better cook! Let him cook, I say! 
Easiest A
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Regardless of what you do in this class, you will not do well. If you go to every single lecture and office hour you will still not do well unless you have advanced knowledge of coding. You will have a much better time if you just take the free coding courses through Harvard.

I believe this was Greg's first time teaching, and he did a great job! Working with someone else's course material isn't as easy as it sounds, but he made it work by diving into examples and providing extra resources if he felt the material wasn't explained well enough. Clearly loves teaching, cares about students, very reasonable about grading :)

Gabe Walton is one of the best professors I've had at Mines. He knows exactly what he's talking about and can answer any question you have or explain any topic in a way that is helpful and understanding. He is very fair with grading and assigning work. His class is very well organized. He is also a chill guy and won't treat you like you're stupid.

Benson was severely lacking as teacher: not supportive, ignored email, incompetent in teaching technology, sloppy with careless errors on provided datasets and egregious lecture slide typos especially in math equations, slow to grade HW, few HWs to gage your understanding of material, very challenging material with limited professor support.

I really enjoyed taking EENG 470 with Dr. Beik. His lecture slides are very in depth and often very similar to the homework. The class grading was based entiirely on homework which we were given plenty of time to complete. The MatLab simulations were quite interesting and I learned a ton about Power Electronics.

5/5 Would Recommend Dr. Beik

Dr. Suiter, was a pretty good professor for Futures. The class content was fairly good: not too much work, fairly useful, and understandable. However, Dr. Suiter does frequently take himself off topic on tangents which meant we often didn't get the day's work fully done and had to make it up on subsequent days.

Senior Design: Decent feedback and easy to meet with/ schedule. He sticks to the rubric so make sure you follow it. Realistic expectations for such a complex class. Ask questions and don't make things up, he will drill you to make sure you actually know it.  Better than average grader.

Natural Gas Hydrates: The leader in this field, she wrote the textbook for the class. Two group projects and presentations about chapters. Super easy and fun. The homework is about the software she teaches in class and is a cakewalk. Take the 580 version if you want some easy master's credit.

Ed is exactly what's wrong with the MinEc MS. Loves abstract theory but can't tie it to practical knowledge. When asked for a concrete example, he spent a whole class going through lines of esoteric code.  Worst professor I've had. No pedagogy, just writes down equations (sans notes) and calls it a day. Please at least use your (3) textbooks!
I enjoyed having Tatangelo for Calc 2. It is clear she cares about students success, and will give extensions on quizzes and worksheets if you have a reason.
Good professor, relies heavily on slides, but the content is there. Tests are rigorous, but fair. Does well keeping 3 hour lectures relatively entertaining with stories and anecdotes.

I dreaded showing up to volleyball every week. It was clear she did not want to be there. She exuded a "I don't care, because I have to be here" vibe. Didn't really teach us volleyball. Don't speak to her unless you have to because she will make you feel small. Yells at you for making dumb mistakes or for not doing things exactly th way she wants.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Belviranli is incredibly knowledgeable and presents the material clearly. He fosters a supportive learning environment and consistently helps students succeed. The projects and assignments are thoughtfully designed and incredibly helpful for understanding the material. If you want an instructor who truly cares, this is the one!

Mehmet obviously cares a lot about teaching his class and how well his students learn the material, but he was too obsessed with the students paying attention. Much time was wasted during the class because he would complain about students looking at their laptops, or wait for someone to have a question, or doing a "Tik Tok Contest" (don't ask).

Mehmet is an awesome teacher that I highly recommend. You can tell he cares abut his teaching and makes sure his students understand. He is very accommodating and pushed back a few deadlines to help the class understand the content better. Furthermore, he is engaging and I looked forward to his class every time.
Her voice is captivating.

Kasra is amazing, 6/5 stars if I could. Class is very difficult but his lectures are very clear and he obviously cares about our learning. Said he was "losing sleep" over how well we did/did not understand material which shows how much he cares. Homework and Exams are fair but hard, office hours are helpful.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Terrible communicator. Just wants to talk about how he ran his own business.

Professor Micnhimer is an amazing teacher, and really has the students and their in mind. He makes many real world connections that help you learn, and offers numerous office hours and is accessible readily by email.

I took his CSCI 101 class in fall 2021. He is kind and knowledgeable while overall being average. However, he teaches off another profs slides so they arent really his style which leads to a less interesting lecture. Not sure if it was just my class, but kids were on their phones and very few took notes which made it hard to focus.
Doesn't know what she's teaching

Brennecka is a great lecturer and professor for ceramics. The main goal of his course is to have you grow and show your learning. Grades can be concerning before the end of the semester, but everyone gets pretty good grades so long as you try. Very communicative, always willing to talk and clarify information/questions when needed.

Professor Parker is an incredible professor who encourages discussion. Class time is spent discussing ethical issues that were introduced as pre-class work. She is very understanding and encouraging. If you want an A in the course she clearly lays out the assignments requirements and will work with you to get your writing to that level.
I love autumn mix
Super chill down to earth guy. Wants students to do well in the course and it is quite apparent. Very open to questions being asked in his lectures. Highly recommend taking Modern with him.

Paul is pretty cool. The grade was mostly based on weekly assignments, the midterm, and the final. Assignments were reasonable and graded fairly and the office hours are helpful. Exams were open note and fairly easy if you have the lecture notes. Prof Zink is agreeable and knowledgeable overall and makes sure students understand the concepts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Anderson was very willing to help students, responsive to email. I enjoyed Watershed Systems Modeling. You do a wide range of things from Matlab to ArcGIS, nice balance of lecture and classwork. One big group project but otherwise you could work alone. He's very kind/approachable, explains very well. Easy grader but the hw is hard.

Professor Anderson is a really nice person and easy to talk to. He seems to really care about the students and understands the content well. His lectures can be a little boring sometimes and he doesn't always give enough examples during class. But the exams are very do-able, and the homework is almost identical to what we practice in class.

Basically a participation class. She doesn't have a lot of bs stuff in her class, which I respect. No matter how hard you try on the final design project, she'll work with you and it won't jeopardize your grade. I didn't like design, but don't hold that against professor youmans.
